Lovely sights. Love this walk. Get to see opera house and bridge from great angle. Highly recommend to anyone. Approx 30 minutes min to complete. But you could take as long as you wanted. Gardens are lovely.

A Great Walk With Stunning Views. A most Relaxing and Picturesque Walk from the Sydney Opera House to the Botanic Gardens. I recommend you take a camera & take lovely photos of the Gardens, the Opera House and Sydney Harbour. After having toured the Botanic Gardens keep walking uphill to the point called Lady Macquarie's Chair, where you can enjoy stunning views of the Opera House, Sydney Harbour and beyond... Enjoy!
Leisurely walk form the Opera house to the Botanic Gardens. A lovely walk beside the water. The views are stunning. The walkway is clean and spacious and I felt very safe on my own.

A perfect walk in the park. The Royal Botanic Garden is an amazing public resource, a relaxing and beautiful green space adjacent to the downtown business area. Plants and trees are (sometimes) labeled but it is mostly a great place for strolling and admiring the beautiful landscape and harbor views. Distances are shorter than they look on a map, the slope is gentle, and there are frequent well-marked signs noting the distance and walking time to the next point. The garden shop at the center is very nice, and there is a cafe too. Lots of local birds, unusual tropical plants, and huge interesting trees make this a must-do walk. It is well-used by local residents with babies in prams, lying on the lawn in the sun, or taking wedding photos in the Herb Garden. Do this one.
A tourist MUST!. The Opera House is beautiful from any angle, take the time to walk around, have a drink or lunch at an adjacent bar with a harbor view. Time well spent!
Pretty walk. Lovely views, great spot to take photos and lie on the grass in the sun and shade with friends. Take proper walking shoes

A must do in Sydney (and good for the budget!). This is a must do in Sydney. Get to the Opera house and walk around from there into the Botanic Gardens. Lovely views of the Harbour, Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. The Gardens are lovely, well maintained and a real asset to the city. If you're on a budget take a picnic as its the best way to experience the gardens.

Absolutely a MUST!. We were fortunate to be staying in Potts Point and walked all three days through the Botanic Gardens to get to Circular Quay and Citi-Center. The Gardens are breathtaking and unbelievable that they are in the middle of the city and right at the Opera House!

Relaxing. This is a lovely walk the gardens are beautifuland you get great views of the harbour and opera house,it was just nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of Sydney and sit and watch the world go by at a slow pace on the water.
Best place in Sydney!. Great place to unwind after a long day... Choose shady tree and grab good book and - say hello to heaven!

Don't miss this walk!. When you are visiting the harbour bridge and Opera House, do not miss to go for this walk, behind the Opera House. Beautiful greenery is maintained and after walking a bit you can capture both the bridge and opera house in one frame!

A Romantic Walk in the Park. My love and I were attending a Concert at The Sydney Opera House, staying at Woolloomooloo. It was lovely on a hot Summer evening to walk hand in hand through the Botanic Gardens and along the Harbour, up to the Opera House. There are many restaurants around the Quay, so this would be a nice walk to stimulate your appetite or have a slow stroll after a hearty lunch.Unfortunately the Gardens close at Dusk, so we were unable to walk back through to Woolloomooloo.

Watch out for runners!. It's just a fine walk. Quite hot in the middle of the day (I had to rest in the shade twice). We were very lucky that the opera was setting up for Turandot on the harbor, so we got to see the dragon and backstage work fairy close up. Many opportunities for photo ops.
What an icon.. Top the list of things in Sydney with this one - great building from the out and in ,then next to it is the gardens. It's all on the harbour front so views fantastic.
Lovely views. The Botanical Gardens offers a lovely walk through gardens and offers fabulous views of the bustling harbour.
Excellent. You can walk, you can picnic but remember, you can not feed birds. In February very very hot. You have great view with the Opera House as well.

Beautiful walk with spectacular views. It is breath taking on a nice summers day to walk from the opera house to the botanic gardens. You can stop at Mrs Macquarie's chair and soak up the view. Well worth doing.

Beautiful walk. Sydney Harbour, lush gardens and the Opera House what a combination, so beautiful. Who would believe that you are in a busy city?The walk is easy and comfortable especially if you have children you can just follow walk straight to the Opera House for a short walk or for a bit more you can meander through the Royal Botanical Gardens. We made a day of it as we continued our walk towards Circular Quay and had lunch at one of the many cafes.Beautiful scenery, fantastic location an absolute must.
Great walk. this place well once you are here you can see the harbour and the opera house and the gardens are not far also. lots of cafes and food places,

A beautiful walk along the harbour. Only pouring rain, which does not happen very often, would spoil this iconic walk along Sydney Harbour.Starting at the Opera House you have outstanding views of Circular Quay, The Sydney Harbour Bridge and Luna Park.You should walk all the way to Mrs Macquarie's Chair before turning back to make you way through the Botanic Gardens stopping for a coffee of lunch at the cafe there.When you have had you fill of the gardens you can make your way back to Circular Quay which has a number of transport options, Trains,Ferries and buses.

Lovely. I always liked this walk, perfectly tended, ideal for pic-nick or for just a walk in the nature.If you decide to have lunch there better bring something with you, the bar is pretty expensive.There is also a little store where you can buy some of the plants you see in the botanic garden.
stunning. great views across Sydney Harbour the best in the world.beautiful flowers and gardens. great scenic walk
Lovely walk. Really enjoyed the walk. Beautiful to see the opera house from a different angle. The Botanical gardens are great too.

A view to remember .. What more could you want harbour views with the Opera house as well as one of the most beautiful gardens , Not only that take a walk through the gardens sit in the shade of grand old trees . When I was a child I looked forward to a visit to the gardens and still do . December when all the shoppers swarmed the city I relaxed with my husband and watched the world pass by .It is worth a visit and the children love it .Not from the Opera house you can find eateries to suit most .It is a good way to finish your walk.

Fresh and Alive. The gardens, plants, paths all put you at ease and you feel like your in another world and not in the middle of the city. Take a blanket and a good book and relax in the sun surrounded by the amazing gardens. Have a picnic, the kids loved the trees and ran around and loved it. An absolute must if in town. We always go in when in town.

An absolute must do. No visit to Sydney is complete without a visit to the Opera House and a walk around the nearby Botanical Gardens. The harbour views are simply stunning, the Opera House is an architectural wonder, and make sure you get to Mrs Macquarie's chair where the best photo opportunity angle for the Opera House with the Harbour Bridge in the back ground is foundDon't miss it

Botanical Gardens to the Opera House.. It's a good idea to start from the southern end of the gardens (top of the hill) so that you're walking downhill through the gardens. Helpful especially if you're pushing prams or wheelchairs. It's great for all ages. Allow 2-3hrs for an easy stroll and photographs, or more for picnics. Gates close later in summer.Make your way along Macquarie St, and head towards the State Library. Enter the large gates to the Botanical Gardens via the western side opposite the State Library or alternatively via the eastern side not far from the Domain and NSW Art Gallery.Pick up a map of the gardens and choose your path for your walk. Enjoy the rose gardens, cacti gardens, native trees, little bridges, ponds and several sculptures/statues throughout the gardens. Find the story behind the Wishing Tree and relax at various places as you meander down the paths. It's a good idea to pack lots of water and perhaps a picnic lunch or you can visit the cafe/tea house.Continue to make your way down towards the harbour taking advantage of all the photo opportunities of the gardens, trees, sculptures, cityscapes and harbour.Don't forget to visit Government House and it's gardens too while you're there.You can head down towards Mrs Macquarie's Chair and walk back along the harbour waterside or take the shorter western path (steps involved) behind Government House to wind your way down to the Opera House. Look out for the sculpture on the slope opposite the Opera House called Earth Mother. You could combine your visit to the Botanical Gardens with a trip to the NSW Art Gallery or the State Library. All are free entry. Visit all three in one day.

you have to go.... on my opinion its the best thing that you can do in sydney. walk around the gardens during the midday have a pick nick or a coffee and relax on the grass. you can walk from the one side all the way around towards the opera house during the afternoon and enjoy a beer to the bars between the opera and the bridge during the sunset. i spent my last day walking around the park and the opera and it was the best thing i did there...

An Eyeful of Sydney Harbour. Great pleasant walk then a sit and relax at Lady Macquaries Chair for a full view of what Sydney Harbour has to offer then head back through the Opera House and have a drink and an eat at the Opera Bar or Opera Kitchen under the boardwalk

a great place to reflect on your travel experiences. Where ever l travel l always try to find a park or in this case the Botanical Gardens, to reflect on my travels and a place to come together with the natural environment. The walk through the BotanicL Gardens is perfect for this. If it is a really hot day there are lots of large shady trees to rest under, lots of interesting flower lined paths to follow, water features to meditate by and bird life to watch. At the end of the path is Farm Cove looking over Sydney Harbour and when you are ready to re-enter civilisation you can stroll along the path towards the Opera House where you are gently immersed. A must while travelling.

My favourite place to bring visitors. Sydney is a great city, and it's at it's glorious best on a a sunny day walking around the Botanic Gardens. Lots of spots to sit and enjoy the view, plenty of people watching, it's free (!) and you get endless views of lovely Sydney Harbour.You can make a bit more of a day of it if you like to walk by arriving in The Rocks, wandering there, walking all the way around to the Opera House then up to the Botanic Gardens. If you have the energy and you time it right the best photographs of the Harbour, the Opera House and the Bridge are from Mrs Macquarie's Chair, just a bit further around. If you can be there around sunset you can get truly postcard-worthy snaps.

A Saturday morning walk to enjoy Sydney at its best. A wonderful way to enjoy Sydney Harbour. Walk from the Opera House to The Botanical Gardens. No crowds to hinder your progress. Take your time and absorb the beauty of Sydney that surrounds you.
lovely view and not too busy. The view is amazing and the path doesn't get to busy. There is lots of room to overtake slower groups and it is a nice flat walk.

"Time out". I love this walk. So close to city and yet you can have time to yourself or with friends and just enjoy the view. If you are into beautiful gardens then it is here you can wander and relax. There is often a special exhibitions which is a bonus. Close to art gallery. So all worthwhile and great on a sunny day.

The Opera House to Botanic Gardens Walk. There is no better way to walk around this part of Sydney Harbour, especially if you may have a problem walking. It's relatively flat, there are plenty of places to sit for a spell while enjoying the view and taking in the surroundings. Walkways are wide enough to feel comfortable without having to worry about others wanting to pass you. Take your lunch and at the end of your walk (On the Botanic Gardens side) sit on the grass under a lovely tree and feel the joy of a beautiful place.

Spectacular!. I caught a Sydney ferry across to Kirribilli, then back to Circular Quay on a spectacular February day. I walked from the Quay, around to the Opera House and then through the Botanic Gardens. Being a hot day, the garden offered shady respite and gorgeous vantage points to stop and drink in the view. There are beautiful sculptures throughout the gardens and my personal favourite was the bronze horse and foal. Allow a couple of hours to truly soak up the atmosphere and views. The café in the heart of the gardens is like an oasis - a great place to stop for a coffee.

Million dollar views for free. Walking through the Botanic Gardens from the Opera House is a delight ... You can walk along the sea wall, on a wide, level pathway, all the way around Farm Cove, with beautiful views of the harbour bridge and Opera House. It's very popular with joggers, photographers, little kids and wedding parties, so you may need to walk around some of them, but the wideness of the path leaves plenty of room for all. Wander off the path to enjoy the delights of the garden, full of Victorian era statues, bandstands, a rose garden, a herb garden, the site of Australia's first farm, a rainforest walk... There is so much more, you'll want to return to enjoy it again.

A (semi)regular Sunday walk for some of us lucky ones!. I live in nearby Potts Point and quite often take this walk on a sunny Sunday afternoon from my home to the city via the Domain and the Botanic Gardens. You can start in Woolloomooloo Bay and walk around several headlands past a great swimming pool (stop for a swim if it's summer), public art works, stands of native vegetation, verdant lawns, ornamental plants of every variety - all with breathtaking vistas of our world-famous harbour at every turn. After 20 to 40 minutes (depending on whether you're power-walking or strolling with stops to look at stuff) you arrive at the incredible Opera House. Being a Sydneysider by birth and upbringing but having spent virtually all of my adult life away I count myself as fortunate to have returned to the city of my birth and to be able to appreciate its beauty. It's always very gratifying on my perambulations to see so many of our overseas visitors also enjoying the sights!

A peaceful paradise. After exploring Sydney's many attractions, why not look over the Opera house & have a coffee & then continue to a natural paradise which offers peace, beauty & wonderful views of our gorgeous harbour.You will find examples of Australia's glorious flora & trees as well as seasonal plants & flowers. There are plenty of opportunities so just sit & enjoy your surroundings.There is also a lot of history around our botanical gardens so why don't you devote at least a few hours to unwind among natures wonderland on the edge of a great city.

an iconic Sydney walk. This is a walk that is not to be missed. There are beautiful vistas in every direction. I prefer to walk down from the NSW Art Gallery through the many paths of the Botanic Gardens to the lower pathway that is beside the water and takes you to the Opera House. You have lots of things to see whether on the water or in the gardens. There is a lovely café in the middle gardens as well as some great options on the lower boardwalk looking towards the Overseas passenger terminal. Definitely a walk to be enjoyed at least once, and preferably more often

A lovely stroll. Have done this walk many times. Head around from the ferries to the Opera House then keep walking to Farm Cove and the Botanic Gardens. You then have a choice (or do both) either walk on to Mrs Macquarie's Chair or walk up through the gardens to the café for a nice, casual lunch. Good food at very reasonable prices.

Great view of city skyline and Opera House.. One of the best views of the city skyline can be had walking from Mrs Macquaries Point to the Opera House. Also take some time to visit the Botanic Gardens.

Touch and see. The Best thing to do after being enthralled by the Opera House and surrounds it to visit the Botanic Gardens - the welcoming sign saing 'please walk ON the grass' says it all. Touch it all and be touched for the better physically. emotionally and spiritually. The more recent in its history in both areas of the aboriginal history puts the white man's time in perspective.

Sydney Opera House to Botanic Gardens. From the iconic Sydney Opera House it is a short walk to the harbour side Botanic Gardens. Overlooking the glorious Sydney harbour you can look at thousands of plants and trees and despite being so close to the city you feel a million miles from care. Inspect the plants, sunbake, exercise, take in the passing boats - it's a location hard to beat.

Gateway to much enjoyment. This was a true highlight of our first visit to Sydney. Here, we find two man made creations that stun the eyes and emotions. The Opera House is spectacular as a place maker and icon for Sydney. The Opera House stuns us with its architectural strength and exhuberance, But, the Botanical Gardens quietly enriches our experience of Sydney in its natural beauty. The Gardens create a serene, soft and quiet experience so close to all the vibrant metropolis nearby. Its a can't miss relationship.
Lovely walk with amazing views. One of the best "free" things to do in Sydney- its a substantial walk and a place you can take a picnic lunch and just watch the world go by..

Inner Peace. I went there alone. It was 20 mins walk from my hostel. You can reach the inner peace while you're walking through the Botanic Garden to the Opera House. People were nice to each other, and the green grass & the blue sky & the colorful flowers just combined a wonderful picture in front of you.
Lovely walk. Enjoyed the walk through the gardens looking at the different plants and trees ..nice views ...places to sit ..interesting
Magical!. This is a magical fascinating area of Sydney harbour, great for people watching. There also seems to be something interesting going on to look at or just gaze at the Opera house!
Relaxing City Walk. We were surprised just how close to the city centre the Botanic Gardens are, and just a short and open walk along from the Opera House on the point

Amazing walk!. We did this walk in reverse going from botanic gardens to the opera house and we loved it! The walk is very beautiful and once we got to the opera house it was just such an awesome sight!
Great views. Great walk with amazing views to the Opera House, Bridge and Harbour. The gardens are an oasis in a busy city

Iconic Opera House & Beautiful Botanic Gardens. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed walking around the Opera House on a warm and sunny day. We moved into the gardens and found the gardens quiet and relaxing. They are well kept with a number of interesting features. They are well worth a walk round!

Wonderful walk!. The Botanical Garden is a must see and perfect for morning/afternoon walks. Close down towards the Opera House you get great views of the harbor and OH.Excellentand historical "watering holes" are nearby in The Rocks
One of the best. Regardless of the direction you take, this walk is worth the time. The gardens are some of the best in the world. The variety and design are worth the time.
Great Walk. We did this walk each way every day back and forth to our hotel. Beautiful gardens and very pleasant walk around the bay
Lovely walk. Just take yourself out of the city and relax for a while and take a walk around the harbour. It's flat and so easy with a bit of shade to help
A must-do. Beautiful gardens just steps away from the Opera House with additional views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.
A must do. This walk is really beautiful ,you can do it from gardens to opera house which is also spectacular walk ,lovely views of opera house

make the affort - 'tis a glorious walk. we did this in reverse direction and was magnificent. Wandering the gardens then down amongst the foreshore. We (coincidently) timed it so we had the Opera House in view as the sun started setting. Highly recommended.

Best harbour in the world. Took some Canadian friends on a walk around the fire shores of the harbour including our fabulous Opera House and beautiful gardens. They loved the different species of Australian plants but we're disappointed there weren't any koalas sleeping in the trees. I think we'll try the zoo for that.

A must see in Sydney.. Everyone should try to see the Opera House and the Botanical Gardens while in Sydney. The many open air restaurants are wonderful too. Shopping, hotels, and other sites are in the area as well.

My Favorite Walk. I love this walk and I do it often, I find it so relaxing, breathtaking and blown away by the beautiful views.
A must if you are visiting Sydney :)

What a beautiful place in the city. We walked the gardens from the Opera house to Mrs Macquarie's char at least 4 times during our stay. Each time we found different paths and sections of the garden to explore. Well maintained great for either a quiet walk or and exercise.

Iconic, a must see if you visit Australia. I am visiting Brisbane but I had to drive to Sydney to see this and I did not regret doing it.
you can't ever tell the size of things by just looking at a photo

Favourite Walk!. I can highly recommend the walk from Circular Quay to the Opera House, past the basking seal, around the Botanical Gardens and over to Mrs Macquarie's Chair. On the way back you can stop off for a glass off Fizz from the Opera Bar and enjoy the view! We did this walk most days we were in Sydney.
Such a Beautiful Structure. Going to the Opera House is beautiful. But you can also walk to the attached Botanic Garden that is so lovely. A great walk

Great place for a short walk!. The most popular sightseeing area in Sydney. You could walk from The Opera House to the Botanic Garden along the sea and enjoy the fantastic view especially in the early morning or in the late afternoon. There are lots of trees which lives there for hundreds years, so huge! Lots of people relax during weekend in the garden.

I love the Botanic Gardens its great on a hot day to sit under a tree and have a brea from city life. So close to the city and so beautiful i can spend all day there yet usual only take a quick walk though as i make time to pass via this great place its close to the train stops so take you time out and sit under a tree and have a rest stopper 10 minutes

Best walk in & around Sydney Harbour. One of the best walk/exercise/jogging route along the Sydney Harbour. Very popular with the Sydney CBD crowd. Can be a bit busy in late afternoons & lunch time with the fitness buffs jogging. But whether you're a fitness fanatic or a casual walker; a Sydney old timer or a first time visitor, you will love walking along from the Sydney Opera House thru the Royal Sydney Botanical Gardens and onto Mrs Mcquarie's Chair. You can also walk from Hyde Park towards the NSW Art Gallery onto the Botanical Garden.
Just enchanting.. We had the perfect weather for this walk and the colours just burst into your eyes. The trees and flowers just take your breath away and the wildlife is such a treat to see.

Perfect location for a stroll. This is a great place to take a gentle stroll and view Sydney's stunning botanical gardens with the Opera House and Harbour Bridge in the back drop. Allow 1-2 hours. Make sure to bring your camera.

Lovely. An easy walk with great views and plenty of photo opportunities. Take frequent stops just to appreciate all the various activities going on around the harbour and then stroll into the botanic gardens. Well worth the time.
Stunning views during this beautiful walk. This walk is simplely amazing! It is so simple but it is such a wonderful attraction! Highly suggest this walk!
A lovely walk!. This walk is truly special! The opera house looks simply amazing! And the walk its self is very scenic and relaxing! Highly recommend it

A good way to spend a few hours. . Sydney is all about being outdoors and it seems to accommodate every outdoorsy type. Beautiful scenery gorgeous plants and happy friendly people. What more could you want.
ENJOY.

Beautiful walk with stunning views. I did this walk in the opposite direction, originating at Hyde Park where I was staying and it is a must do! Don't take public transportation past one of the most beautiful walks in Sydney! Make sure you allow yourself ample time to stroll through the gardens at your leisure (maybe even have a picnic?) and of course to visit the opera house. Would absolutely recommend!
Very scenic walk!. Either way you do it, it is a quite impressive view. The gardens are beautiful, the harbor is beautiful, and so is the Opera House. And the walk is not very far, maybe 15 minutes.
One of a kind!. No matter which side of the Opera House you view, it is unique and special to see. One of the best views is from the harbor.

A great view amongst the plants. Walk along the harbour edge with the gardens behind you. Amazing! The views both in front and behind are stunning.Rest on the luxurious green lawns and marvel at the runners whizzing by.
Pleasant area to walk around. All the area from the bridge past the harbour via the opera house to the dotanical gardens, just a pleasure to walk around and a pleasant way to spend a few hours
a must see. You can't go to Sydney and not see the Opera House. It's a great place to take pictures. Then walk the gardens. It very relaxing. The gardens extend into many other scenic attraction
pleasant walk to the Royal Botanic gardens. nice walk on the paved roads upto Mrs. Macquaries Chair. the royal Botanic Gardens are very scenic and must not be missed, a highly recommended visit.

Tour of Sydney Opera House - very informative, excellent. We did the Opera house tour and found it very informative and interesting, you see much more inside and learn about all the history of the Opera House and upcoming events. We also did the Tasting Platter as a meal afterwards, but this was poor and was taken in the main restaurant, not in the Opera House itself.
Lovely walk along the water's edge. Beautiful gardens, lovely harbour with the Opera House back drop. If you are tired, you can catch the people mover (train) to take you around.
A very pleasant walk.. We walked through Botanic Gardens, past Opera House to Circular Quay where we had a delicious breakfast at City Extra.

best to visit for sunset drinks. highly recommended to visit at sunset for drinks, you can then have both the daylight and night-time view.
dont go if it's raining, the rain can kill the whole thing.

Good for photography. Visited this place yesterday... This long stretched walk has lot of beautiful sight seeing which is perfect location for photography... And many popular places around... Charm of sydney!! Must visit!
Symbol of Beauty!. Masterpiece of late modern architecture. It is admired internationally and proudly treasured by the people of Australia.
Wlkers delight. great 4 k walk, with tea stops and good views of opera house as well as a well planned garden and rock wall. Next to water all the time , lot to keep little ones amused.

even better than it looks in the pictures. an amazing building that should be seen by everyone.
a building that marks and defines a city; what other city can say that? Not to be missed

Lots of things to see and nice walk. I like to walk around the opera house and into the botanical gardens once in the gardens there are different paths to take you can go to Mrs McQuaries chair and see the changing water views and the history of the area or walk through the path to the botanical garden plant nursery or keep walking and end up at the war memorial at the end of the park.

Pretty walk in the edge of the harbor. A worthwhile walk on the edge of the harbor with the botanic gardens on one end, and the stunning Sydney Opera House on the other.It is good exercise, and lots of picture opportunities of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House.

Can you find the Mission Impossible final scene. A lovely walk and worth doing as part of your visit to the Botanical Gardens. A friend of ours spend ages find the Mission Impossible final scene that was filmed here. But also great for those who want good views of the Opera House and Bridge!

A beautiful walk in nature in the city. Check out the Sydney botanics. This large area of open space is open to the public free of chrage during day light hours, and the gardens and other exhibits are worth spending time over - even as a direct line between A and B. The waters of the Harbour come right up to the sea wall that delineates the botanics - and outside the gardens there are other public open spaces including 'Mrs MacQuarries' Chair'. The gardens are also adjacent to the Operan House and only a short walk from Circular Quay and the cruise terminal.
A walk that's awesome. Great atmosphere great gardens surrounded by shadows of an great city skyscrapersWith the blue of the harbourWhat more could u ask for

Sydney's Icon. A trip to the opera House and adjoining botanical gardens can't be missed as its smack bang in the middle of the harbour. The history behind the building is worth reading about and very political. The view to the Sydney harbour bridge from the opera house is uninterrupted panoramic views, especially at night when the bridge is lit up. It certainly is the hub of Sydney with the ferry boats going past periodically. While your enjoying a drink on the promenade why not book in to see a concert or a ballet, the acoustic is brilliant.

New year visit 2015/16. Did the City tour by open top bus.Well worth it got to see all the sites.Great weather Great City,Friendly people.great pubs.Used the number 55 free bus which does the rounds of the city were you can hop on and off all day.The Rocks Market is very nice but way to expensive obviosly for the Japanese Tourist.Great Irish pub with good food.Pity the flight is so long or we would be there more often.

An unmissable experience. I love this walk. It's what puts Sydney right up there at the top of my favourite cities. The views and the variety of the botanic gardens. We walked over to the Museum of NSW which is another gem. The cockatoos are abundant and hilarious.

A great way to spend an afternoon. If you have a spare two hours just walk from the Opera House through the botanic gardens. Is peaceful and tranquil and has spectacular views of the Opera House in front of the Harbour Bridge!

Great walk on a sunny day. Lots of shade and relaxing, beautiful views.. First time ever going to the 200 year old Botanical Gardens, just around the corner from the Opera House on Sydney Harbour. Free. Cafe, gardens and gorgeous photo opps along the waterfront path to Mrs. Macquarie's chair. Large shady trees and grassy areas to sit and enjoy the serenity. A must see while in Sydney. Take a picnic lunch, or if lucky, go to the St George outdoor cinema on the harbourfront.
Beautiful walk. These botanic gardens are wonderful, if you like walking do the full walk around to Mrs Macquarie's Chair. Just wow!
The most scenic area of Sydney. . The walk from opera house to the botanical gardens follows the edge of Sydney Harbour. It's gorgeous.

Tranquility by the Harbour. The Botanic Gardens sprawl down to the Harbour with an abundance of native and imported plants and trees, open grassed areas, a large pond with ducks and the occasional statue to get you away from it all. The statue of Captain Arthur Phillip near Macquarie Street reminds of Nelson in Trafalgar Square. Phillip was the first British Governor who brought the mostly convict settlers to Australia in 1788 and the rest is history. What the displaced inhabitants thought of this invasion at the the time as not known. Farm cove on the Harbour is so called as the first farms were established here to support the colony.
beautiful. February is a great month to visit Sydney. great weather, great views. blue sunny skies every day. come see what you are missing!

East access from Opera House to the Botanic Gardens. A visit to the Sydney Opera House is a must. While you are there continue round and enter the Botanic Gardens. We spent a lazy day there, wandering at will, admiring the magnificent trees, that were well detailed. Views over Farm Bay, ponds with eels and big fish (perch?) And lots of busy birds. Take a picnic, bring your friends and family. Relax and enjoy.
Lovely walk....enjoyed it.. We walked along from the opera house to the gardens and there are loads of places to eat or drink. Got some great photos and really enjoyed our day

Beautiful area. This area of Sydney is just beautiful. We loved the gardens. The diversity of scenery and the atmosphere were amazing. Wanted to spend more time looking around. We will be back to explore more as soon as we get the chance.
Great walk. A very relaxing walk! Lots of nice paths and green space to sit and people watch! Enjoy and take in the green grass

Lovely walk with incredible photo spots!. It is a relatively easy walk between Sydney Harbour and the Botanic Gardens. Make sure you walk around the whole Opera House. At the back there is a great view over the harbour.Get a photo on the front steps of the Opera House! Follow it around and into the Botanic Gardens. The gardens are a lovely place to sit with a picnic or just stroll through & enjoy the scenery. Not the best Botanic Gardens in Australia.... but still beautiful. Enjoy this special and well loved part of Sydney :)

Sydney Monument! Must visit.. After visiting the zoo, the beaches, enjoying the laid back life of an Aussie, a beautiful stroll by the botanic gardens and a glass of fine wine looking over the Opera House is the best way to end a trip in Sydney.

valintine. we walked to the gardens from opera house which is a 5 minute walk and because time wasn't on my side we hopped on a little train which goes around the whole gardens which was $10 and we where told the history about the place and all the bird life as well as the plants

No bikes allowed!. And why?Because you could hit a pedestrian.Please don't follow this logic, it will soon spiral into visible face twitches.What a shame, because this stretch is great, and Sydney has recently spent 20 million on bike lanes... all we need is a bit of common sense and respect.So, if you are afraid of bikes, this is the place for you. Walk in complete safety, remember the black history of the area, marvel at the array of botanical diversity, and give a dirty look to any law breaking cyclists. It's the law.
Great for Walking or Cycling. Peaceful, Nice View and Breezy for walking or cycling! A lot of opportunity for taking photos of Opera House with Sydney Harbour Bridge in the back ground.
A good walk. Close to my hotel a great place to sit walk and see wild life .The flowers & river ideal for taking pictures of the wild life of Sidney
Very nice. I especially appreciate the ease of maneuvering around the Botanic Gardens. Also there was a very relaxed and friendly atmosphere. Nature seem to put everybody in a good mood.

Beautiful Gardens. Well cared for and a feast for the eyes.. We spent two days enjoying the Botanical Gardens.It is beautifully manicured. The fragrances are incredible. I was stunned to see the largest Stephanotis I've ever seen in my life. The tree was huge. Give yourself the gift of a leisurely stroll to enjoy the beauty and read the signs. Very nice sculptures as well as opportunities to view the harbor.
Two sites in one.. When you visit the gardens to learn about the local plants ,it's just next door to the wonderful Opera House , take the tour is good.
Lovely walk.. We had a nice time walking through the Botanic Gardens and even stopped for a drink at the garden cafe. Easy walk and nicely shaded so we could keep out of the harsh Australian sun.
Beautiful walk through the gardens and straight to the Opera House.. The Gardens are beautiful and well kept. Very much worth the time to take a leisurely walk through and enjoy the birds and plants.

Walk On The Wild Side!!!!. Meander along Macquarie Street and admire the gorgeous architecture when you leave the Opera House. Gaze at The Conservatorium of Music once planned as stables!!!! Enter the Botanical Gardens and feast on the array of plants, trees, shrubs and flowers and marvel at the pathways and the clever little nooks and crannies where you may sit and ponder your next Sydney visit. It's really paradise on earth.
A beautiful walk!. A very relaxing and scenic walk! Highly suggest going on this walk, it doesn't take long and the view is simple breathtaking.

A beautiful stroll in around the opera house and gardens. We recently did the trip to the city and took a scenic walk around the opera house near circular quay.we stopped to browse in the little shops along the way and there are lots of little Cafes around the opera house where you can have coffee,finish your stroll past the opera house into the botanical gardens it's beautiful,you can walk around further and discover all little nooks by the ocean.A must do if your in the city.....happy travels

Enjoy a Glass of wine in the Botanic Gardens!. Beautiful walks through the Botanic gardens and stopped for a glass of wine at the cafe. Bliss. There happened to be a wonderful performance of Wind in the Willows for children too. (Apparently, this is an annual event held in the gardens). Magical!

Relaxing morning walks. Whenever I am staying in Sydney I always include a walk from the Opera House through the Botanical Gardens. Usually I tie in a quick visit to the general admission of the National Art Gallery of NSW. The Botanical Gardens have easy footpaths to follow in different directions to do a few loop around walks, You can then cut back through the city or back the way you came. If you go early enough the walk is quiet and you can get some great shots of the Opera House like you are the only one there!

Take a walk!!. While in Sydney go for a walk from the Opera House to the Botanic gardens as it will be easy even with small children that can run everywhere in the gardens and if you are lucky you might see one of the many weddings that are celebrated in front of the bay. The trees are huge and the flowers amazing ,but the views are unbeatable !

Best garden and city walk. I love the forshore bar area on the side of the Opera house looking in towards Circular Quay and then crossing east to the Botanical gardens and going for a coffee in the restaurant cafe.

The best things in life are free. Starting from the Opera House you quickly find yourself inside the Botanic Gardens. Inside the gardens you have a choice of walking along the harbour shoreline or winding your way through the gardens. Whichever you choose, the choice will be spectacular. There are an enormous amount of photo opportunities. As you wander through the gardens you take in some of Sydney's beautiful sights. If you are really keen the gardens will take you to the Art Gallery of NSW, The Domain & The State Library. All in all this is a great day trip & it is a very inexpensive way to enjoy Sydney.

One of the great walks of Sydney. If you are a visitor, or if you live in Sydney, you must do this walk at least once. You can start anywhere around the Sydney Opera House and walk through the ornate metal gates into the Botanic Gardens. The paved path takes you literally around the waterfront, all the way to Mrs Macquarie’s’ chair (sometimes erroneously called Lady Macquarie’s Chair) then along opposite Garden Island, past the Boy Charlton Olympic sized pool and up to the NSW Art Gallery. Ou may either return the way you came, or through the city last many historic buildings if they are of interest.You can walk the Harbourside path for half an hour and back again, or go to the Art Gallery taking about an hour each way. With delightful views across Sydney Harbour on one side, and a world-class collection of trees and plants on the other side, this is a piece of Australia which everybody should see and enjoy.

Magnificent harbour walk with iconic buildings and gardens. Hard to beat this walk from the historic Opera House along the Sydney foreshore. With the green grasses for romping about and huge mature trees like the Moreton Bay fig you will have the best of both worlds. There is a cafe/toilets in the gardens, a little train for non walkers and lots of different aspects to discover like the Chinese garden , food garden and cactus and native areas. There is also an ancient Wollemi pine which is one of the oldest species recently discovered. Take a picnic and sit on the gress or benches provided. Government house in the gardens opened on Sundays for tours.
Best Sydney Harbour walk. What an incredible view of beautiful Sydney Harbour and our wonderful Botanic Gardens which are full of native and flowing plants. Great tea/coffee spots too!

Must do. These are are a must do when you come to Sydney.See the Sydney Opera House, a unique building designed by a Dane, J.Utzon. That's probably why it doesn't have tin roof. Fantastic view onto Sydney Harbor, also has restaurants and shops. So after you have had you fill of the glorious sights(hopefully on a sunny day) walk into the Botanic Gardens, if your a gardener you'll enjoy the Rose and Herb Gardens as well as plants from all over the world. Has a fruit bat colony which is interesting but smelly, the Aborigines used to eat them so they probably taste better when cooked but heard they carry disease. Also a Restaurant in the gardens but don't think they serve fruit bat but nice location for a meal.I can spend all day there just looking at the various plants and trees, usually bring my own lunch find a nice piece of lawn and relax in the sun. Some homeless people sleep in the park at night and I guess if I was homeless I couldn't find a better place to wake in the morning. Well I can but I haven't met her yet. Have been going there for the last 50 years and still love it.

Amazine sights.. One hears so much about the Opera House but to stand inside it has a fantastic feeling. The gardens are just breathtaking, the colours and smell of different flowers is fantastic and it is worth the walk around the gardens.

Must do !. Have done this many times, last time was Australia day and it is just magnificent any time of the year. We took our lunch and sat in the gardens and just marvelled at the harbour and everything on it ! Whenever we have visitors we always try to do this. Suitable for everyone !
Rossini's f. Good food, good value & very attentive staff, as well as being convenient to the Opera House.Have eaten there on a few occasions and found it very consistent, with a good menu.

Beautiful Easy stroll. This is a lovely stroll around the beautiful Sydney Harbour. It is a very lovely flat walk that is easy on the legs. The path is wide and safe and a must do for visitors to this fabulous city - Do it!
Very clean gardens. The gardens around the Opera house were immaculate. It was a very nice walk from the Museum down to the Opera house, through the gardens. There are wild parrots in the trees.

Fantastic Opera House. A guided tour it is a must here once you are in Sydney and have an hour or so to spare, the tour guide we had, took us from the basement to the main theater, we saw every show room, with very good information on construction, design, history and stories .
Magnificent building. Always kept this building in mind as a place to visit and finally did. It is all that it sets the expectations to be. The structure is magnificent!

Pristine Gardens with beautiful views. If you get chance walk into the gardens at the side of the Opera House nd take a leisurely stroll around the bay. This could take you hours as you will be stopping to admire the gardens and the harbour.

So many beautiful flowers + great harbor views!. I loved this walk - I only wish we'd had more time to stop and enjoy more of the flowers. It's about a mile from the Opera House to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair. It's paved the whole way with the harbor on one side and the botanic gardens on the other.

Fantastic.. Yes....must do this walk.
Lots to see. Stroll, pace or jog. The scenery is a delight. Huge big trees. Huge Harbour to gaze at. You'll love this walk.

The best views in Sydney. We have the best Harbour in the world. Nothing beats the site of landing at the airport than the view over our opera house and harbour bridge. Walking around these iconic sites gives Australians a sense of pride. There is so much to see on the water and on land as well. This area is accessible to all with views back over Sydney that are breathtaking,

This is an amazing walk for both the gardens and the harbour.. This is a walk that everyone can enjoy easily, and it's free, all you need is the time and the reward is well worth the effort. It is an easy flat walk with lots of points of interest all along the way and of course there are good food and other amenities at the Botanic Gardens which all go to make for a very relaxing and enjoyable experience.
trademark of Sydney. The opera house is the number one thing you think about when you hear Sydney. The garden is really nice as well, it's a must visit.

Classic Sydney. Beautiful fall day in Sydney, sunny skies, cool temperature, and a wonderful walk along the harbor. Views of bay, gardens, skyline, governor's house and of course the Opera house. No visit to Sydney is complete without taking this stroll.

excellent. My wife and I had couple of days in Sydney harbor. We caught our flight from our vacation in Bali, and took the route SYD-LAX. Having a couple of days here was a fantastic way to end our Asian visit. Our walk from our hotel to the Opera House to the Botanic Garden was well worth it strain in our tired and aching feet... i definitely recommend this area, most specially when you only have a few days to visit the city.

Stunning walk. The sydney botanical gardens is so beautiful and the scenery is unreal. This is our favourite place to just hang out and relax. Its great with my 1 year old daughter and we love lying on the grass and having a picnic. The coffee in the cafe is also great.

Beautiful. This is a beautiful gardens where you could follow the many paths and explore for hours. After catching a 2:00 AM flight from Tahiti and getting to the hotel at 1:00 PM, this was a perfect way to stretch our legs and take in the best of nature.
A pleasant walk. Much of the walk is along the waterfront so you get a good view of the activity in the harbour. However, I think there are better walks in Sydney.
Stunning. This is a fantastic way to spend a few hours walking around the wonderful gardens and then having a drink in the cafe.

A lovely walk and easy way to get around. We spent a day exploring the city. The ability to get around without the need for a taxi was one of the things we really loved about Sydney. There are great walking paths and gardens to check out while bouncing around. This was one of them. We strolled along the water taking in the views between the Opera House and Botanic Gardens. Who needs to take a taxi when you can enjoy such a lovely walk?It is an easy walk. Everything is paved with wide sidewalks.
Beautiful Walk on a Beautiful Day. Exceptional Views of our amazing harbor!Take the walk as slowly as you wish and watch the world go by.There were families, elderly, joggers etc A real delight!
Nice walk in a beautifully maintained area. Lovely walk alongside the busy river and the botanical gardens, a well used path that affords lovely views across the gardens, and over to the opera house

early morning run. My best friend and I decided we would go for a early morning run while the guys were at golf on the second day of our trip. We ran to the opera house, up and down the steps then round to Mrs Macqueries seat for a few pictures. We then had breakfast in the little tea-shop which was very tasty needed!

Great Walk. Yes, this was what I did on my free Sunday during a business trip, simply wandered from the Opera House to the stunning Botanical Gardens, lovely walk and wow what a treasure the gardens are when you get there, wonderful

A Beautiful and Scenic Walk. The walk from the Opera house along the harbour is wonderful. this year they were celebrating 200 years of the botanical garden and special arrangements were made for the celebrations.One can walk along this path (about 1.5 km) and go to the other side of the harbour to get a perfect view of the opera house.

Great place for a run. If you are in central Sydney, we did a daily run through Hyde park, the botanic garden and passing the Opera house. The Opera house made for some great views and a few stops for pictures.

Lovely spot . I took this walk several times while I was in Sydney. If you're looking for a place to Ryan this is a good option and very popular with the locals for the same purpose. You get spectacular views of the opera house with the harbour bridge as a background. The gardens themselves are very pretty and a great escape from the crowds within the Harbour itself.

Morning or sunset stroll.... If walking around the Opera House wasn't enough, you'll end up at the gates of the Royal Botanical Gardens (which closes at sunset). Once inside, it's truly a garden to get lost in. You even forget there's a large busy city nearby.
Amazing Opera House. We were blown away by the styling of the Sydney Opera House, it was everything we imagined. From every angle the Sydney Opera House called us.

A surprising success . Taking teenagers for a walk around a botanical garden is always going to be a risk, unless you have the type of children who love looking at flowers and trees! The surprise here is the diversity is just enough to keep them interested! Teenagers aside, this is a beautiful excursion around well kept and diverse gardens, maximum appeal to all ages.

wow what a building. the opera house is a must see in Sydney you can walk right round the building and go up the 100 or so steps to the building its self or to the botanic gardens that is just at the bottom of the steps which is celebrating 200 yrs this year. there were people handing out flyers as to what is on at the opera house during the month and you can also get tours around the inside which I would have liked to do but did not have enough time to do it in.

From busy to peaceful. I went to Circular Quay first and boy was the scene really busy! As a first time Sydney visitor I wanted to see the Opera House, of course. But after a while I wanted to rest a bit and so I found myself walking inside the Botanical Gardens and it's so lovely! The gardens were very well-maintained, and just being inside, walking at a leisurely place, already gave me the rest I wanted (despite not really sitting down anywhere).

Lovely walk along the promenade. The Opera House is great but so is a walk all around the promenade and onto the Botanic Gardens with magnificent views of the Harbour and some really interesting trees and walks.
Wonderful. Its a beautiful walk around the harbour as you get views of different sites. Be careful of the joggers though some of them dont intend to move when they see you

Makes my day. I recent picked up work in the Opwra house I have the luxury of walking to work through the gardensIt is amazing ever day no matter the weather It puts a smile on my face that lasts a good 12 hour shiftGetting the chance to see it often makes me love it more each dayGosh they do a great job in looking afte it !!

Beautiful walk through the gardens to the opera house. We were here in the spring and walked through the botanical gardens and surrounding areas taking in all the sites and ended at the opera house.The opera house is not to be missed try to take a guided tour it is worth doing.
Beautiful. Great walk. Scenery is beautiful and it's centrally located, close to CBD. It took us about 2 hours including walking around the Botanical gardens.

Nothing special but nice on a breezy day. It was nice to learn that we could walk from the opera house to the botanical garden (free entrance). It was the 20th anniversary of the garden, so they had a cute installation of "200" made up of flowers and shrubs.

Iconic . The opera house is anout as iconic as you get for buildings in Sydney. Along with the harbour bridge it is what everyone sees when they see photos of Sydney. The building itself is amazing and the bars all around the opera house make it a great location to grab a few drinks and enjoy the harbour views

Just the best view. My favourite thing to do when I take new people to Sydney is walk or do a run from Woolloomooloo round the botanical gardens up to Mrs Macquarie's Chair and round to the Opera house. When people see the view for the first time they are always stunned!
famous places in sydney.. Botanic garden is quite close to opera house and you can visit all the places ( opera house, sydney harbour bridge and botanic garden) at the same time.

Beautiful, excellent place to visit. This was a great part of Sydney that shouldn't be missed, fantastic sights to see, the opera house is amazing, very unique mans is at thrip of th entrance into the harbour.

Beautiful walk on a summers day. Took parents and sisters on a walk starting from the Opera House. Nice views of the bridge. Beautiful clean parks beside the water. Nice on a warm day. Relaxing. Good for picnics.

Love it . The opera house timeless design looks stunning any day under any light, it's surreal and breathtaking and the botanical gardens is one of my fav parks in the world having the best views of the harbour, stunning vegetation and flowers and great grass stretches to lay on and read or relax

Our Favorite Walk. We did a portion of this walk several times during our stay in Sydney. It was pretty, peaceful, interesting...I can't say enough about this. The trees were amazing. Wish we could have brought all this home with us.

Relaxing and so impressive . There are just too many things too see on this walk, it is a condensate of the best things to see and do in Sydney. If you do it in the mourning start from the gardens, in the afternoon start from the opera.

Good. Is a must, a did it with my boyfriend and was magical. Love it every minute.
The architecture of the opera house is outstanding and is bigger that I Imagined.
Some place to eat and enjoy the place a little crowed if very sunny, but worth the trouble
Beautiful Walk. The gardens here are just gorgeous and they are kept so clean. Just walking from the Opera House to the Gardens is beautiful. It's a nice easy walk that shouldn't be missed.
Stumbled across the walk without trying.. This walk is one of the prettiest if not magical walks you will ever experience anywhere!! Treat yourself to a whole day to enjoy this wonderful walk !
Wonderful walk. What a wonderful walk. absolutely beautiful, the walk path was perfectly clean which gave it all a really fantastic feel.
Bring young and old, all can do part or all of the walk. A great walk that is stainless form the Opera House and gives great glimpses of the harbour and the Governor Gens residence
Surprise garden!. On the way walk back to our hotel, there are royal botanic garden which surprise with with smell of roses... very relaxing and calm garden.

perfect day. we caught the ferry into circular quay and strolled round to the opera house and botanical gardens its a very pleasant walk pram and wheel chair friendly as well and the scenery all way round is just beautiful the gardens a very well maintained. Taking a light picnic lunch is a good ideas sitting in the gardens enjoying the harbour view is just so tranquil away from the hustle and bustle of the city plus the cafeteria on site is very expensive and unfortunately very, very slow staff.
King and I. I think we had the best seats in the house! The performances on this day were absolutely spot on. Thanks again!!!
DO IT!. This is a wonderful scenic walk. I must say the best walk in a park we have ever done. Absolutely lovely. Well manicured beautiful serene place. You literally can spend all day here.
very busy. The walk itself is beautiful, but as being so interesting it is very busy and not really relaxing. But still worthwhile.

You can get married, have a picnic, walk and do so much more!. I love these gardens. I am not just saying that because I got married there, but because I have enjoyed doing so many activities including running and swimming! A must see.

Do it in reverse!. Because of the location of our hotel, the Governor's Gate at the Gardens was close so we walked downhill and did the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House. Most of the walk along the Harbour is flat but I did appreciate not having to walk uphill through the gardens.

Lovely for an afternoon walk . Lovely walk through the gardens which are well maintained. Great for nature lovers as you can see lots of cockatoos and ibis and I even saw a sleepy possum up a tree! The gardens offer great views and photo opportunities of Woolloomooloo, the harbour and the opera house so take your camera

You have to see The Opera House. Sydney does not just have an opera house.It has THE Opera House.It's architecture is totally unique and it's location cannot be beaten for beauty.The New Year's Eve we spent there was in forgettable for the sheer beauty of the location

A good walk and view of the opera house and harbour bridge. This walk will give you a different view the opera house and the bridge. I walk all the way to Mrs. Macquarie Chair to get a good view of the cove. Quite a distance but if you have the time, its definitely worth it.

Easy .....own pace...no rush. Take time, strolling along soak up the views and atmosphere. Even the wettest of days this is a nice walk. Everything beautifully kept and clean..we actually did this walk in reverse starting with breakfast in the Botanical Gardens restaurant. Excellant
Fantastic View. After taking a nice photo of Sydney Harbour bridge,if you're looking for another amazing structure within darling harbour. this is it.
Take you camera. A pleasant way of spending an hour or two, views of the Opera House and the city with the option to view the harbour as well
Beautiful walk on a sunny day. Don't miss the walk around the Opera House, for views of the bridge and harbour. The Botanic Gardens are lovely.
recommended.. relaxing way to spend an hour or so. beautiful gardens and views of the harbour. A cafe is available for refreshments. totally recommended and it is all free.
Nice. A nice walk with some great views of the harbour. Take some food and have a picnic or just go for a stroll and enjoy the views
Pretty little walk.... This is a short but pretty walk. Great for pics of the Opera House over the water, and nice way to get to Botanical Gardens (which are well worth seeing as well). Have fun.

Harbour-side Views, Monuments and Historic Gardens. You will probably start your walk from Circular Quay, which is one of the main transport hubs of Sydney, connecting harbor ferries, trains and buses to all other parts of this modern metropolis.You can see the Opera House from Circular Quay so just follow your nose and walk around the Harbour to the end of the Opera House site, which is known as Bennelong Point. Pause to admire the harbor, the foreshores and the yachts that constantly sail this magnificent waterway. Continue down the other side of the Opera House and you will come to Man o'War Jetty.Keep on the harbourside waterline to your left and you will come to Farm Cove, which was the site of the colony's earliest efforts to feed itself back in the 18th Century.From there it is only a short walk to the Botanic Gardens, where you can wander to your heart's content for as many hours as you wish.If you want to extend your walk keep following the harbor shore line and you will come to an area known as The Domain, and beyond that to the famous Mrs Macquarie's Chair. Mrs Macquarie was the wife of an early governor of New South Wales and it is said that this spot was one of her favourite spots to sit and contemplate the beauty of Sydney Harbour. You can do the same today, but your view will take in the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Sydney Opera House, and the modern city of Sydney that Mrs Macquarie and her husband could only have dreamed of.The Opera House to Botanic Gardens walk is about 3 km. The extended walk I have mentioned here is about 5 km.

A pleasant way to spend an afternoon strolling. After wandering around the Opera House and maybe take in a tour, continue to walk leisurely around and through the Botanical Gardens. There are easy walkways for the disabled.

Great experience. A calm refreshing walk while hearing/looking at the waves splashing onto the concrete wall. Enough room for everyone, plenty to see. We started in the garden and ended our walk at the Opera House: great way to finish our walk.

Take A Stroll along to the Botanic Gardens. A leisurely stroll to the Botanic Gardens is a nice relaxing way to spend an hour or so, away from the hustle and bustle of the harbour. Nice views across the bay and beautifully set out. A change from city sightseeing for a change.

so relaxing. so relaxing walking awesome sydney harbour million dollar view botani gardens gardens like paradise escape the city rat race ly under a tree feed the bird see awesome trees a great picnic area or a romantic honeymoon spot for lovers or let the children run free

A lovely walk. A really lovely walk with fabulous views all the way. Try and get to the point at Mrs Macquarie's seat. A flat walk along the shore line path and you can then explore the Botanic Gardens too which are lovely.
Lovely walk. Nice walk to gardens after visiting opera house. Plenty to see, friendly people on the way, tourists a d locals.
City centre oasis . Best place to relax and escape the hustle and bustle of the city. If just to lie on the grass. Do your daily exercise. Have a picnic or read a book this is the place for you.
no rain. After 3 days of rain, it stopped!' Walked 22km in 4 hrs around this, always a different event going on here

Amazing walk, loads to see!. I did this walk on my way to the Hyde Park Barracks Museum, and thoroughly enjoyed it, even though was absolutely pouring down with rain! I can guarantee that it will be even more enjoyable in the sunshine...

Beautifully serene walk right in the middle of City with stunning Harbour side views. A must to do walk/exploration if you are in Sydney, right in the back drop of CBD, we have been here countless times and are always awed by the experience, it is better if you have some time on hands as along with the walk the entire exploration of Royal Botanic Garden, Opera House, Circular quay and surroundings can take time. It has one of the BEST views of Harbour Bridge and Opera House with the Sydney Skyline in the background, and is one of the perfect romantic outing that doesn't cost anything.
Great Walk. The walk along the Botanic Garden provides a fantastic view of the Opera House, the Harbour and the grand bridge.Its a lovely place to walk.
Scenic Walk. We took the train to St James and walked through the gardens past the Opera House and all the way to Circular Quay. This is a beautiful walk that is mostly level.

Underwhelming . Look, there's nothing wrong with this little jaunt. But it isn't special in any regards. If you visiting for a decent length of time, you'll probably end up doing it, if only as a matter of convenience. But if you're only in town for a couple of days, devote your time elsewhere

The Opera House to the Botanic Gardens Walk. This walk has beautiful sights along the way and something new to see all the time.the opera house is an amazing structure and you can spend hours and hours in the gardens studying all the beautiful plants from around the world. I loved this place.

Must do picturesque run. Are you a runner? This is should on the top of your list if you're visiting Sydney. Make it a little further, and even more memorable, by continuing around Circular Quay, through the Rocks and over the Sydney Harbour Bridge! Go early morning or evening to avoid taking out other tourists who are enjoying the view at a slower pace.
Nice walk. Great walk providing superb views on the Bridge, the Harbor, the Opera House, and downtown Sydney. Lovely place for a stroll.

lovely walk to get a feel for Sydney. We did this walk the other way round - from Botanic Gardens to the Opera house on our first day in Sydney and it was so relaxing and odd to think we were in a major city.

Hours of free beauty!. I walked around the trails for three hours waiting for my friend to finish work, and I was stunned at the fauna and beauty. If you're not from Australia, there are so many flowers that can only be found down under! There are many placards describing history, and beautiful statues, as well. It's beautiful for a solitary walk or perfect for family bonding! And it's all free!

Lovely walk if you are fit. This walk has beautiful sights along the way and something new to see all the time.the opera house is an amazing structure and you can spend hours and hours in the gardens studying all the beautiful plants from around the world. I loved this place.

Potts Point to Opera House walk. We walked from Potts Point to Macquarie's Chair through the Botanic Gardens then to the Opera House and finally the Rocks. I'd highly recommend this walk to anyone. We took our time and enjoyed looking out on the Harbour.
Scenic walks. A walk or jog from Potts Point through the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House is breathtaking. A great way to keep fit whilst visiting an exciting city.
Short easy walk. Short easy walk taking you from one of the worlds most famous landmarks to beautiful botanical gardens. It is a must do on a summers day.

Pretty, Interesting and Easy Walk. This walk is flat and easy. The views are incredible as you meander along the waterfront towards the Botanical Gardens. We stopped and watched a yacht race on the Harbour as we walked to the gardens. The gardens themselves were very nice with some slight hill work which you can choose to walk or take an alternative walk. Great photo opportunities along the way with the Harbour Bridge, The Opera House, the Harbour and Cruise Liners in the background. There are also street performers along the harbourside along with many cafes, restaurants and gelato shops.
Visiting from Wisconsin. Shared a wonderful day sightseeing with my daughters to Sydney Opera House...beautiful architecture! Awesome lights at night!

Quiet and Peaceful. The walk from the Opera house through the Botanic Gardens was pleasant and peaceful. Quite different from the noise and chaos of the people around the opera house, the harbor and circular quay. The Gardens are a nice oasis, but I wouldn't say the Gardens were stunning.
Great View. Ana amazing walk, nil difficulty as no hills to worry about, plenty of seats, and vantage points to take postcard style pictures. A must see.
Must do! . This road combines two of the most popular attractions in sydney or even in Australia.. This is a must do for everyone. Very beautiful and unforgettable... Thanks for the great experience!

Great Walk..... This is an easy walk and it gets you out of the hustle and the bustle of the city. W made this walk several times while in Sydney and I never tired of seeing the wonderful flora and fauna the abounds in the gardens....check out the very large eels in the pond near the Japanese garden...

Limited on time but need fresh air. If you are on the tourist loop rthe opera house has to be on your list. Walk a bit further around and find yourself in the royal botanic gardens, walk around the courier and you will get to mrs macquaries chair which is the best vantage point I see Sydney harbour. Take a picnic, or keep walking to boy Charlton pool where there is a fantastic cafe hidden away with a great view.

Harbour Views!!!!!. I actually recommend walking through the Botanical Gardend to Mrs Mc Quaries Chair and then walk along the harbour to the Opera Hose. you will get stunning vistas of the CBD, Botanical Gardens, Opera Houseand the Harbour Bridge this way. there is also stunning Sydney sandstone cliffs along this route.
The ultimate Sydney walk. If you only have a short time in Sydney, this walk is a must to get those iconic views of the bridge and harbor, and enjoy the lovely Botanic Gardens.

Been There and Done That. This is one way of spending time enjoying a part of Sydney that is truly beautiful on a sunny day. It is best enjoyed with a companion but, if solitude is what you need, you can find it here. There are places where you sit and take in the beauty around you. If you meditate, you can do so in tranquillity.
Just walk and enjoy. Just take a walk and see all the beautiful and big trees! Enjoy the view on the Opera house and the bridge!! Walk to the opera house and have a coffee on the quay side.

Nice discovery. What a beautiful garden. So many species you just won'T see anywhere else in the world. The gardens are beautiful and bordering the harbour. It is well landscaped and yousee locals taking a nap or having lunch there. So it's not just a tourist trap. It's actually maintained for everyone to enjoy. Loved it!

I used this way to get my photos and it was spectacular!. I entered the Botanical Gardens and was able to use the directional signs to guide me to the Opera House for my photos. It was beautiful and more than I could have even thought of. Foliage is labeled throughout the park with sculptures and rest areas along the paths.Crews were busy everywhere doing maintenance and everyone I talked with was willing to answer questions.Families enjoying picnics and professionals seeking refuge from the office were all in the Gardens too.

Pack a Picnic and make a day of it. One of the most enjoyable activities you can do in Sydney City is take the stroll from the Opera House to Botanical Gardens and beyond. Stop off at the park for a picnic and enjoy the outlook (Sydney Harbour), continue to Woolloomooloo and have a meat pie at the famous Harry's.

Can't beat the view. I must admit I am biased when it comes to my home town but it is one of the best cities in the world and the attractions are remarkably unique in their own way. The Opera House and Botanic Gardens are a must see for any traveller.

Lovely strolling experience. Strolling from Circular Quay via the Opera House and through the Botanic Gardens is a very interesting and pleasant way to spend a few hours. There are great harbour views and fascinating horticultural attractions at every turn. If it is hot there are plenty of shady spots and if you are up to it I would recommend carrying on through the Domain to visit the Art Gallery of New South Wales
A must for every visitor. Nice area around the opera, with shops and restaurants. Wonderful view on harbor bridge. A nice place for dinner.
Very pleasant walk. Very interesting with lots of things to see eg. art gallery, government house, views of the bay, etc.
A superb place for a relaxing after flight stroll. A great place with excellent harbour views Very relaxing and the Choo Choo train was well worth the modest ticket price.
Great for walkers. Spend a couple of hours walking around the Opera House then Botanical Gardens and enjoy exquisite scenery.

The Opera House to the Botanic Gardens Walk. The Opera House to the Botanic Gardens Walk  One of many wonderful walks enjoyed on a recent trip to Sydney. The Botanical Gardens are easy access from the Opera House and start from Opera House ends. If one walk along with the water's edge, here is some fantastic views from the Bridge and Opera House if you do this in the morning when the sun is behind you.It is a nice and good walk place and also good for photography of the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House

Nice walk. This walk is just marvelous. Start it from the front of the opera, walk along and behind it, when you're back in the front climb up the stairs, enjoy the view and go back down (good exercise!), then proceed towards the Gardens and walk along the water on that sort of semi circle path. Enjoy the nature around you and don't forget to breath in deeply to benefit from the fresh marine air!

Great place.. Best way to enjoy this place is to enter the Botanic Gardens from the city, then wend your way downhill through the gardens to the seawall. Follow the wall around to the Opera House and during this time you'll have the gardens on one side and the sea and ships on the other. I've done this many times and it never palls. Then if you have the time have a look round the Opera House, perhaps take a few photos of the Harbour Bridge, stroll around Circular Quay and perhaps enjoy a bit of lunch at Circular Quay. Guarantee you'll enjoy it.

One of the highlights of Sydney. Beautiful green stretch of land next to the Opera House. A relaxing walk from the Opera House (there is a gate opposite the opera house entering into the Botanic Gardens) upto Macquarie Chair, about 1.3 kms walking (where you get the BEST views of the Opera House and the Bridge together in a single photoshot).
Fantastic stroll. This is an easy and beautiful walk along a stunning waterfront that never fails to surprise and delight

Best view of Opera House and Harbor. Best view of the two landmarks at the same time! We did have a festival being broken down that caused some obstruction. Pretty gardens and walks throughout the gardens
A Beautiful Area for Sightseeing. With views across the habour this is a great spot to sit or wander around. There are shady spots around the gardens so you can get out of the steering summer sun.

Lovely. One of many wonderful walks enjoyed on a recent trip to Sydney. The Botanical Gardens begin just beyond the Opera House so they are easily accessible. If one follows the walk along the water's edge, there are some fantastic views back over the Bridge and Opera House - do this in the morning when the sun is behind you for the best pics, or at sunset. The Gardens themselves provide a refreshing 'green' space within the bustle of the City. They are worth exploring in their own right.

Nice walk, other alternatives. This is a nice walk and a good place to take pictures of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House but you can just walk around the west side of the park via Tarpeian Way and get to Government house where there is a nice garden also and a nice tour. Then you can slide back down the hill towards Circular Cay and catch a Ferry that will give you better views of the harbor. So, you have a choice. If you like gardens, take the longer path and enjoy.

Lovely walk to see highlights of Sydney. We enjoyed wandering along this walk on a beautifully sunny afternoon, great opportunities for photos of classic icons such as the bridge, the opera house and parts of the botanical gardens

One of our favourite gardens. If you are in Sydney take time to stroll through the Botanic Gardens. Lots of wonderful big old trees, great views of the harbour and an enjoyable walk to the Opera House. Plenty of spots for peace and tranquility.

A snapshot of everything good about Sydney. A wonderful walk with so much diversity from the manmade Opera House to the beautifully maintained gardens, so many aspects to this walk. With the CBD in the background, wonderful views across the harbour. In one walk, you get a snapshot of everything that makes Sydney wonderful.

Sydney icons. I had limited time and I did not go inside but the Opera House is a stunning piece of architecture that dominates Sydney Harbour, at Circular Quay. The Botanic Gardens are nearby, I saw them while on the hop on hop off bus and they look beautiful.

Beautiful place to get out and walk.. Gorgeous, well marked trees, plants, and flowers. Beautiful walk around the water to Sydney Opera House to Naval museum There are interesting ponds, an abundance of different birds, pretty sculptures plus a restaurant and smaller cafe. Japanese gardens, rose gardens, gift shop and more.

Take good walking shoe and swimmers. Do the Opera house and botanical gardens in one walk , it will take most of the day. Walk down Bayswater Rd towards Kings Cross, , then down to the Finger Wharf area , look around then enter the gardens from this end ,it save walking back across already travelled walk area, Some good foodie places at this end .If it s hot have a swim at the Boy Charlton pool to refresh before continuing on towards the Opera House, A few drink and ice cream vendors sometimes at Lady Macquarie Chair area and a restaurant near the art gallery. Then around the bay to the Opera House. Look around this area before heading back towards buses and trains , lot of eateries , a full day with quiet a lot of attractions.

Both beauties in their own right.. The Opera house of 6 theatre's that performances are done from is a wonderful visit and the restaurant there is nice. If you have time and there is a play on, we would suggest you go and see it. As for the Botanic Garden, give yourself plenty of time to wonder around taking in the many plants and trees and even pack yourself a picnic lunch while there and enjoy the beauty that surrounds you. We enjoyed our time there.
Nice place. Botanic gardens are so beautiful and the place is huge. Walking all the way took us a lot of time, but it was worth it! Gorgeous views!
Easy walk. 5-10 walk on flat no need for any transport. Some very good photo opportunities and all for free too. Keep hold of your bags as puck pockets operate in these areas.

Sydney's best. It allows you to see 4 of the best sights Sydney has to offer. The Botanic Gardens, The Opera House, The Harbour Bridge and the harbour. The short walk allows you to see so much easily.Well worth the walk.Easy to get to by public transport.

Very nice walk. from the sea shore in just five minutes walk you get to this luxurious troopical garden very well kept. I was there at the end of spring, so there were plenty of colorful flowers and the jacaranda tree had violet leaves! I came to know it is quite common in the Sydney area, but to me it was just enchanting!
Easy walk, beautiful scenery. The ocean on one side, the gardens on the other, the opera house behind you - what a great walk! If you get down to the harbour make sure to do this short walk.
Nice, short walk, with good views. A nice, simple walk and if you walk through the well maintained and elegant Royal Botanical gardens then you won't be disappointed.
Sightseeing at the opera house and gardens. Took the little train around the botanic gardens and it tells you a lot about the plants and buildings

Beautiful Walk, Great Views. What a wonderful thing to do on a sunny day. The views over the botanical park, opera house and harbour are just superb.
We walked from the Opera House to Lady Macquarie's Chair. We watched the huge maxi yachts racing on the harbour. It was lovely seeing so many people enjoying the area.
away from the hustle and bustle. What a beautiful sanctuary walk wonderful old trees beautiful buildings and amazing smells and colurful! !
