Lovely part of town. This is a nice stroll through one of the most beautiful parts of a beautiful city. Just be sure to do it on a nice day to take advantage of the lovely scenery!

Stayed at Intercontinental Hotel on Macquarie St on Friday 11th Dec for a night.. Walk along water front and into gardens was excellent on a Friday night as so many things going on. A mad Hatters tea party, small pop up picnics and people playing games. Walking along the water front we saw all the boat traffic and around at Mrs Macquarie's chair we even waited to see a cruise ship leave the harbour. Had dinner at Meaty and Wine Co which was excellent then next day with late check out did Christmas shopping at David Jones Elizabeth St which was an easy walk from hotel.

Opera House Weddings. While visiting the ever popular Opera House with it's stunning and exclusive design I came upon a number of Bride's and their Groom's having their photo's taken with this iconic building as the backdrop. Surprisingly the public were all very accomodating.
An amazing little stroll.... A great little walk through some lovely smelling flowers. If you like smelling flowers and walking - oh boy, are you in for a treat!

An Iconic building leads to nature's wonders. Walking through the forecourt or around the most Iconic edifice in the southern hemisphere is a thrill in itself, but then going into the magnificently well kept and varied plant life of the botanic gardens is an experience that I never tire of, nor will you. There are many routes to take through the gardens, and even after dozens of treks, there is always something to be seen for the first time. Trees from every continent, flowers of every variety and colour, built along a foreshore of a beautiful harbour, will capture your senses and soothe your soul. Keep your eyes moving and you will see several varieties of birds, living in harmony with nature!

Glorious Sydney. If you're a local or a visitor to Sydney, this walk is gorgeous along the harbour stone wall. You can wind your way through the Botanic Gardens where the trees and flowers and shrubs are labelled. It's fascinating! If you continue along the harbour you end up at a stone outcrop called Lady Macquarie's Chair (referencing the wife of an early colonial governor.) The view from here across the Opera House to The Harbour Bridge is spectacular, especially if you see it at sunset. It is suitable for everybody from solo to families to teens (in the list below you can only tick one!)

This is the way to welcome the sunrise! . On advice of the check in clerk at the Intercontinental I spent the early morning on this walk - glad I did!I walked down from Macquarie street to avoid staring directly into the sun - starting near the Music Conservatory. First stop Opera House for pictures of the Harbor, then a quick trip pat the wharf and on over to Pitt and George to find a takeaway breakfast place that was open so early (ended up at The Wood Roaster ). Then back to this walk, and on into the now open (7am) Botanical Gardens for the view and my meal, then back to the hotel.Be aware that the Botanical Gardens are behind a gate and the Opera House and wharf is not; so if you are an early bird start at that end. Also the crowds began to reach the Opera House around 7 so start early for quiet and crowded photos.
Beautiful walk along the harbour. Wide walk ways, stunning views and happy people. This view is a great way to access the opera house.

A lovely Gentle Walk. A stroll around the Opera House & through to the Botanical Gardens is a real treat. The views of the bridge & Opera House are dramatic & the harbour ,as always, is splendid.Do look out for the joggers at lunchtime as they seem to think they own the area.

Simply stunning!. Beautiful stroll for views of the water and the Opera House, beautiful trees and flowers. Take in as little or as much as you wish. Icing on the cake are the well preserved old government buildings just outside and around the entrance to the botanic gardens. The area is a treat for the eyes.

once you've done the quay, this is the best bit of sydney. lovely walk along the water. eat at the quay, then take this walk. the botanicals are nice (like any other), but very nicely located. opera house is ok, but best viewed from the outside.

Nice walk. You could spend as much or as little time as you would like in the area between thre Sydney Opera House and the Botanical Gardens. If you want to walk the perimeter od the opera house, taking photos, and then stroll through the entire Botanical Gardens, it could easily consume two to three hours. Another option is to take the small tram/cart that start from the opera house entrance to the gardens, and ride lady the various points of entrance in the gardens ( about 20, if you stay on the cart), or hop off and spend time at just the specific point which interest you the most. The tram runs every 39 minutes so, you might have a wait, depending on how long you stay at the rose garden or other stop.

Great, but can be very warm at summertime. I love to repeat this walk now and then, but my last one was not so comfortable because of the 40º C heat. If you're just spending some days at Sydney, I absolutely recommend you to spend some time on this walk - and finish it with a visit to the Art Gallery of NSW, which is free and have air conditioning and a great cafe (and loads of fine arts, of course).
walkabout. awesome views of the opera house and the bridge very clean and a must see if your there shops and food around the area are expensive

Spectacular views with an easy walk. Its a beautiful easy walk along the edge of the harbour with iconic views of the harbour bridge, the quay, the opera house and the harbour of course. The botanic gardens are in the CBD right next to the harbour and the gardens are well worth a wander around also.
WOW.... Walk on the grass, hug a tree, smell the flowers and have the WOW feeling while walking to the Opera house.

This is a must do walk, from the Opera House to the Gardens.. Start at the Opera House and walk through to the gardens.(The entrance to the botanic garden is right next to the opera house), The gardens have beautiful plants trees and flowers but the best part are the wonderful views of the harbour. Spend some time walking around take a picnic and sit on the grass it is lovely at all times of the year

One of the best views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge together. Such a relaxing walk. You can stop at anytime and relax on the grass or on one of the bench chairs, smell the salt in the air and look across Sydney Harbour. On a sunny day this spot is magical and you can keep walking around to Mrs Macquarie's Chair for the perfect view over the harbour and city of Sydney.

Wonderful walk. The Botanical gardens are beautiful and the cafe a nice rest stop. We walked around from The rocks to Mrs Macquaries chair and back through the gardens it was lovely plenty of rest stops well worth the effort.

A must do whwn visiting Sydney. This is an easy walk with the most spectacular views in the world. Opera House and Harbour Bridge in one photo - photographers dream photo. Rest spots and dozens of photo opportunities. I have travelled globally and this walk is superb, right in the Sydney City.

Great way to see Farm Cove. Take a hat and some sun cream and enjoy one of the best views of Farm Cove. The walking is easy and The Gardens beautiful. Call in to the cafe in the gardens and you could be anywhere in the world

Nice walk. The entrance to the botanic garden is right next to the opera house, so the park is easy to fit into your opera house visit. The garden has beautiful plant life but also features nice views of the harbor. We walked along the path to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair, which is a bench cut into the sandstone in 1810 for Governor Maquarie's wife. The walk from the Opera House to the chair was about 20 minutes. Even though the garden is beautiful and the chair is interesting, I personally would not say this is a must-see in Sydney. If you have the time, great, but if you're on a tight schedule, there are so many other interesting things to do around Sydney.
Plain Entrance. A bit plain on the entrance , I wouldnt have notice it if its not for some other people whom I saw walking inside.

great views, beautiful gardens. I took the walk from the opera house around the gardens, through the Domain and back into the city. Great experience. The huge fig trees in the gardens are amazing (beware of falling limbs)
Beautiful walk. Well worth the effort and it's not that far. We continued on past the botanical gardens and up through Hyde park to the Anzac memorial.Great walk and plenty to see.

A great walk in the sunshine. We walked from the Sydney Opera House through the Botanic Gardens to Garden Island. It is all flat and the stroll overlooking the gardens and the harbour is one you will cherish and not regret.
A beautiful walk. We spent one cloudy afternoon at the Botanic Gardens, then walked back to the Opera House and past that. An easy walk with several places to sit and rest. Highly reocmmended.
Very short stroll. We did this walk after we'd been to the Botanical Gardens. Very nice short stroll between two iconic Sydney landmarks.

Great walk in one of the worlds most scenic port. This is a wonderful walk, views over the port, bridge and Opera House. We went on a sunny day and people watching even made it more scenic. All flat, stroll, walk, jog, or run, all work.

Self explanatory..... What else can be said about this iconic tourist attraction. Well, you have to touch it to appreciate the reality. Although not all of the interior is accessible what you do see is awe inspiring. There are optional tours available which were not available at the time of my visit. However, all is not lost of you take advantage of the surrounding botanic gardens. In all my visit was pleasant, made possible by the maintenance of order from crowds by staff members.

safety pin. It is like going to Puerto Iguazu, but will not see the falls on both sides. It is a place that has its own charm as Big Ben, the Statue of Liberty or the Eiffel Tower. That if to reach the theater half an hour are needed maybe walking, starting from the old bridge and the old barracks there. Is by far and as walking, hidden but on arrival is stunning as for the tourist is an icon, if you can enter AUD 40 and let him in on a tour, the front is a city park with trees, plants utilities, few gardens in the port for boat trips give tours to nearby places

A great run!. I ran from the Pullman Quay hotel, around the Opera House, through the Royal Botanic Gardens and the Domain and back. It's so beautiful I could've run forever. I walked it all the day before with my husband and there is always something new to see around the corner. A must-do while in Sydney.

Beautiful and peaceful place to walk. The Botanical Garden is a beautiful place to walk. Spacious, quiet, and peaceful - right in the city and on the bay. People were sitting and reading, or eating lunch in various places. A group of school children walked through. This park is lovingly used and a friendly place to stroll.

The summit of a dream to be in Autralia. The operas house is not only a magnificent realisation in architecture point of view but also a good place to have a glass of wine, or dinner. It a real well known chef working. Would had been pleasant to be able to assist to an opera there.
Love the walk!. Enjoy the stroll and take a lot of pictures since I'm a tourist anyway.. I enjoy my walk and enjoy the view..
A great walk!. Enjoy theOpera House and the gardens! You have to pay for a tour to see the inside workings...or book an event. Wonderful walk!

Photo shoot. For us it was just about seeing the Opera House up close and to take photos. We were not interested in taking part in the tour so do not know any information on this.Great photos to be taken. Did not go to the botanical gardens so sorry cannot review this.
Lovely walk!. We walked from the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House and the views are awesome! Gardens are well maintained and various wildlife are present. Great views of the harbour also!

Awell worth the walk an beautiful to see. We walked around the gardens saw the fabulous views. Well cared for gardens and everywhere clean and tidy. Interesting trees labelled explaining how old and name
A Gorgeous way to see Sydney Harbour. An easy walk along a flat path with all of Sydney's attraction on your doorstep. A nice way to spend an early morning.
Botanic Garden Walk.. Lovely Gardens with Governor House, magnificent views across Harbour, Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Interesting Aboriginal sculpture. Little train can take you arround.

Beautiful Walk from Opera House to Gardens. Walking from Circular Quay ferry docks/train station:It is an easy 5 minute walk from CQ fery docks/train station to The Opera House .And a 15 minute walk from the Opera House along a paved path to Mrs. Macquarie's chair in the Royal Botanic Gardens.The best photo of both the Opera House and the SYD Harbor Bridge is from an area near Mrs. Macquaries Chair in the Gardens.Also good photos along the paved walkway from the Opera House leading to the Gardens.

Spectacular!. Few cities can boast a harbour as beautiful as Sydney (any?) let alone a Botanic Garden that hugs the shore. A largely flat walk with some of the best views of Sydney taking in the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. This walk is not to be missed by any visitor to Sydney.

Wonderful vistas from an historic, gorgeous park. My wife and I spent the better part of a day here because it was so beautiful and relaxing. I thought we would have been done in a couple of hours but the park itself is gorgeous with flower beds, huge trees and interesting plants. The views from the park are incredible, and there are strategically located benches for just watching the world go by too.
Amazing!. Perfect place to visit and take pictures. One of the most popular turistic atraction of Sydney. Simple amazing!
Must do if you go to Sydney--astonishingly beautiful harbour. Clean water--stunning trees---incredible architecture, no need for 100 characters for sure--great walk
Must do if you go to Sydney--astonishingly beautiful harbour. Clean water--stunning trees---incredible architecture, no need for 100 characters for sure--great walk

Enjoyed this walk. Having visited the Art Gallery we crossed the road and entered the Royal Botanical Gardens which are a shady haven on a very warm afternoon in March. It's a beautiful, well maintained Park that runs to the water's edge at Farm Cove. Loads of benches to sit and watch boats on the harbour. There are facilities, cafe, and shop in a central area, well sign- posted. We were lucky to attend the opening night of Aida performed on a stage built on the waters edge - a truly memorable evening and a stunning performance.

A wonderful must do!. A beautiful area - hard to believe that we are in the middle of a busy city. So much to see and of interest. Next time we will take the little train that goes around - such good value for $10

A beautiful walk. Just keep walking past the Opera House and the gardens just keep expanding. It is a huge park and just about to celebrate its bicentennial, so it is looking especially pretty right now.

The best part of Sydney!. Best public Botanical gardens I have ever seen in a city! The amount of different flora and fauna you can see here is amazing. The garden is very lovely and safe and you could happily spend all day exploring it all, or just a few hours walking through. I've been twice and still having seen everything. Watch out for the wildlife! The ibis birds stole a whole croissant right off my friends plate while we were both right there! A local lady told me she's seen them take whole breakfasts nearly plate and all.The Opera House is a no brainer must see. I'd recommend taking a harbour ferry too (to circular quay), then you can see the Opera House from the water.
Great scenic walk. Visit the Art Gallery of NSW then walk through and explore the world famous Botanic gardens then proceed to Sydney Opera House

A nice walk. A nice walk along the shores to enjoy the sights of Sydney and to get to the Botanic gardens. The paved walkway is flanked on one side by grassy knoll and the bay on the other. Protect yourself from the sun...

Pleasant walk in heart of the city. This is a great walk whether you are a tourist, city worker in need of a lunch time break, or just out for a weekend jaunt. With amazing harbour views on one side and peaceful gardens on the side, you can't do much better. The Botanic gardens are beautifully laid out with so many wonderfully large old trees providing much needed shade on a hot day. My favourites are the dragon trees with their branches stretching out in maze-like growth, and the massive Morton bay figs, with their intricate roots reaching down to the ground.
I love Sydney. Wonderful place to be. The circular quay area is very romantic. The walk is enjoyable especially in the afternoon - evening time. There are a lot of restaurants and bars to enjoy too

Lovely. Lovely walk from the opera house along the harbour. Lots of beautiful large trees to sit in the shade of and enjoy the great harbour views. An enjoyable walk to get from the opera house to the Art Gallery.

An easy, enjoyable and scenic stroll. Want to escape the tourist mob taking selfies at the Opera House?
Take a stroll over to and through the Botanic Gardens. Picture post card scenic, quiet, and relaxing. Stretch out on the lawn for a picnic. Or a nap. And it's free!

Awesome walk!. Strolled around the Royal Botanical Garden to Mrs. Macquarie point was very pleasing and soothing too to enjoy the cool breeze and beautiful garden landscape along the way. Once I arrived at the Mrs. Macquarie point, it was BIG WOW! to be able to see the panoramic view of Sydney CBD, the Harbour Bridge and the fame Opera House. A must visit spot in Sydney and there are many benches available to simply sit back and enjoy the great view while watching the sunset behind the skyscrapers. A very memorable walk indeed!

Best of both Worlds. After eating our picnic lunch with a friendly Kookaburra under the shade of a tree inside the Gardens we walked along the path towards the Opera House. Stunning green gardens to the left, the majesty of the harbour to the right. perfect blend of both world to walk along in between.
Sydney in Spring is a delight to the eyes!. My mom loved the Botanic Gardens and the scenic walk around the Harbor. Views were outstanding and it helped that it was a beautiful Spring day!

Just enjoying the moment. Many people doing exercise alongside. The garden is so pretty and green, while also you can enjoy the city view. We continue our walk to a museum and a big church with a famous garden i think.
Green lung since 1816. Now celebrating its bi centennial these garden's are a must see for anyone visiting Sydney. The views of the Opera House and harbour bridge are stunning. Don't miss it or them
Great walk. This is a lovely scenic walk and the Jacaranda tree inter Botanical Garden is in full Blume in November when we were there

Special location. If you walk nowhere else in Sydney walk here. It is just near Kirrabily house and it's is a very beautiful part of Sydney. There are plenty of eats and drinks at the opera house to reward yourself after your walk

Brilliant. What a fabulous way to spend some time doing this walk from the Opera house to the Botanical gardens where else would you have these views and such tranquility ? a perfect way to see the sights of Sydney !
Lovely location. I never get tired of the fantastic views across Sydney harbour towards the bridge. This is a wonderful place to unwind and to appreciate what an exciting place the city of Sydney is.

Lovely walk. We walked the other way around from Hyde Park to the Botanical Gardens to the Opera House. It was a beautiful sunny day, the Botanical Gardens are beautiful and I could have spent hours here. The walk to the Opera House is fine, great views, popular with runners.

Great Scenery - Perfect First Day Activity When You are Jet-Lagged. We arrived in Sydney in the morning after a long flight from the U.S. Our first task after checking into hotel was to visit the harbor and stroll around the Opera House and the adjacent Botanic Gardens. It's free and beautiful. The fresh air and walk helped perk us up for the balance of our day. The gardens are huge with a lot of open space. You can walk, sit, take a nap, stop for a refreshment. Very relaxing. I was also pleasantly surprised that they had plenty of public restrooms around the harbor and park areas.

The Opera House to Botanic Gardens Walk. This is extremely a popular area and even the international movie and dramas used this location. You will be able to view both Opera House and Harbour Bridge. You can also have a rest and coffee at the Botanical Garden. We recommend this walk, it only takes less than 1 hour at normal pace. They used the Botanical Garden for wedding events and wedding photos as well.

Fantastic. Probably one of the most beautiful walks in the world. But you should start from the garden (at Macquarie Point). Then you can see city, bridge an Opera House from many different perspectives...
Afternoon walks. Quiet. Extremely well kept. A place to walk around and relax. A place to sit quietly and think it all thru.

Great views of both The Opera House and the Bridge together.. A great way to view both the opera house and bridge together. You also see Mrs Macquaries chair and soak up the sights and smells of the botanical gardens. The gum trees are amazing1

Sydney Icons. I live in Sydney. This is the place where I will take my overseas visitors, always. I will start from Mrs Macquarie's Chair, take a few photos from there. You can cover the 2 major icons in Sydney from just this one photograph. Then take a slow walk in the botanical gardens, not quite a Kew Garden setting and size, but lovely especially at this time of the year when flowers are blooming furiously. Have a coffee and continue walking towards Opera House. Stroll around the OH, enjoy a concert or show if you have the time otherwise continue walking towards Circular Quay. Take a ferry ride to Manly or Darling Harbour. This will be the subject of another review. Incidentally from Circular Quay you can take a train to anywhere within Sydney. There is nothing like Sydney Harbour. Million dollar view. If you have not visited the Quay or the Opera House with full view of the Harbour Bridge, then you have wasted coming to this beautiful City.

Beutiful Walk. Absolutley stunning walk through a beautiful garden...only reminder that you are in a huge bustling city is the skyscrapers. Its like a paradise in the city. Definately a must do especially on your way to the opera house.

Beautiful walk to the Opera House. Start off in the botanical garden and arriving at the Opera house is to me to beauty of Sydney, feeling the nature around, but so close to the city.I have made a recommendation of the top 10 activities in Sydney ! Check them out on my page or youtube at /watch?v=7WTDvASldcYLet me know if you have any question !
Nice walk thru the gardens. We walked from the Opera house thru the Botanic Gardens, what a beautiful walk the gardens were beautiful from the rose garden thru to the herb and vege garden.

A 'Must see walk'.. From the 'close up' walk around the Opera House, along the foreshore, through the Royal Botanic Gardens to Mrs Macquarie's Chair, the views are beautiful. Mrs Macquarie's Chair is the perfect spot to take a photo of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. On a sunny day the water sparkles. There is also a great little restaurant in the gardens.

A must do Sydney walk. This is an easy, must do Sydney harbour walk. Mostly flat except for some steps at the end or if you wish to walk up through the gardens to the Art Gallery of NSW. The gardens are also lovely so take a picnic and relax with the best view ever or you can eat in the gardens at a couple of places.

Another stunning day!. I(t was the first time I had been up close to the Opera House and loved seeing it all and to feel the tiles. The architecture is outstanding. Walked from there to the Botanical Gardens and it was lovely to see all the different plants from other countries and the giant ficus trees.

Best view aboard AO Cruises. Exciting Cruise By the Sydney HarbourBest place to catch the sunset, watche NYE fireworks and celebrate party. With wide array of majestic boats and tour package to choose from, you'll surely enjoy the cruise.

Must visit in Sydney. If you do holiday in here, this place is a must, if you have much time here. You can enjoy the weather, enjoy the icon of Sydney and relax in Royal Botani Garden, you can do a little walk to see Opera House and Harbour Bridge from another side. The garden is very huge, located in the city, You can reach here by bus or by train.

A beautiful walk to see the sights and enjoy the harbour. I love this walk, the opera house in its full glory and the walkway along the harbour. I also love that it is wheelchair accessible and able to be enjoyed by all.

Refreshing. Opera House to the botanic gardens walk is refreshing as it not only provides good views of the harbour bridge, opera house, city sky scrapers but also the greenery in botanic gardens makes you feel that you are in another world
An excellent outing. One of my favourites; the Gardens are beautiful the trees are magic. The birds are a joy. The city sparkles across the water. It is truly enjoyable.

On your 'must do' agenda for Sydney. By taking this easy, level stroll from the Sydney Opera House you will have some pleasant views of the harbour as well as a verdant peaceful setting. I have not seen panhandlers or any hawkers on the times I have walked it. Sometimes you can park (metered) on the street at Mrs Maquaries chair, it used to be free!

Sydney Harbour at its best. I live in Sydney so haven't "travelled" here. A visit to the Sydney Opera House is easy to achieve as there are multiple public transport options (buses, trains, ferries) to Circular Quay and the walk from there to the Sydney Opera House is level. Plan a tour of the Opera House to see inside it and then continue your walk past it on the Botanic Gardens Walk towards the historic Lady Macquarie's Chair. Pack a picnic for an alfresco lunch with million dollar views and either continue on to the NSW Art Gallery or meander back towards the Circular Quay/ Rocks area afterwards. A lovely, restful and stunning part of Sydney.
so peaceful. I did this walk with my boy Nd it was very nice and peaceful. Good chance to enjoy the surroundings while hanging out. Even stopped to have a picnic lunch.

I Enjoyed The Flat Walk To Botanic Gardens. You know as they say the best things in life are least expected and this walk unleashed a treasure house of great views. While I have been to the Opera House separately, the walk along this stretch will let you catch up views of Milsons Point and Kirribilli House from acrossOpera House. I also found couples and families out for a picnic at this point.Full Marks For-The clean stretchFresh ambiance.
Classic. Do it. Amazing and postcard views, lovely strolling, mostly level on good tracks / roads and superb vibe and views andy time of day or night (when gardens are open)
A nice walk with stunning view. Not to missed when you are already at Sydney Opera House. They have a special walking path to the nice botanic garden with stunning view of a view Sydney Icons.
Most Go. Walking along the Botanic Garden in beautiful days is highly recommended. fresh and aromatic.take your water bottle.

Fantastic Walk. Not much more to say, very nice walk from the ferry harbor...great views and well maintained. I will say I walked around the opera house from the harbor, and it was a bit confusing to figure out what level to be on...but not that hard

The best of Sydney at your fingertips . A short walk but one of the most breathtaking views of Sydney. Starting at the opera house you can see one of Sydney's other great icons - the harbour bridge. It's a relatively flat walk depending which part of the gardens you take but you'll be able to see over to Milsons Point (and Luna Park) and Kirribilli (and Kiribilli House) from the Opera House. As you walk around you'll get spectacular views of the harbour. A great spot also to stop for a picnic.
Peaceful place. People picnic on the lawn, run, and take leisurely stroll along this walk between the Opera House and the Royal Botaic Gardens.
Stunning. We went the other way, Botanic Gardens to the Opera house so we were looking at the Opera house and the Harbour bridge as we were walking.
Great walking experience. The walk around the opera house and through the botanic gardens is a must do experience while in Sydney.

worth seeing. The opera house is very unusual and is worth seeing. the botanic gardens are a must. they are included in most walking tours of Sydney. If not it is worth an hour to walk around and see the pretty flowers
A pleasant walk.. It's a short pleasant walk from the Opera house to the botanical gardens and offers nice views of all the activity in the harbour. The gardens are worthy of a visit on their own.

Spectacular Gardens in the Heart of Sydney. After you snap your pics of the Opera House, take a walk through the spectacular Botanical Gardens who will be 200 years old next year. Beautiful flowers, gigantic trees and lovely fountains are sprinkled throughout the gardens. Make sure and walk all the way to the end and then stop in to see the Library. Continue on to the NSW Art Museum and then on to St Mary's Cathedral . Take a stroll across the park and then stop in at the Queen Victoria Mall to admire the beautiful building and do some window shopping . Wear your comfortable shoes...this walk will exceed 5 miles
Nice place for a walk. Had a picnic lunch under the trees. But watch out, the ibises are very brave and there is a sad crow who cries sadly to get you to share your lunch

Glorious vistas. I may be biased being a Sydneysider, however you cannot beat the views of the Opera House and surrounds. I have seen many harbours but they cannot match Sydney. The stroll around the Opera House and then into the Botanical Gardens and down to Mrs Macquarie's chair is a lovely way to spend a few hours. Just sit and take in the views of the harbour traffic and the Sydneysiders going by or go for a jog around the gardens.

Botanical Gardens are stunning. We just loved the Botanical Gardens and paired that up with the Opera House. Our big suggestion is to take the train through the park twice if you have the time. The first time you can get a good lay of the land and the second time you can get on and off where you want to further explore.

Very peaceful. This walk, mainly through the Botanic Gardens is lovely and very peaceful. With the beauty of Sydney Harbour on one side and the Botanic Gardens on the other side this is one aspect of Sydney which should not be missed. Light rain was falling when w.e did this walk, but it didn't detract from our enjoyment at all.

Lovely walk after Opera House tour. After several hours touring the Opera House, it was great to head outside into the Botanic Gardens. Fortunately, it's close -- only a few minutes from the Opera House stairs to the entrance to the Botanic Gardens. Definitely plan to see the two sights sequentially!

Beautiful in early spring. We walked throughout this area early October. The gardens are very pretty for photos. There are people all around...I'm sure its lovely in the summer...this whole area would take a few hours to spend time in..if you took your time. And enjoyed the different flower gardens....
Great way to have a good view and enjoy nature!. Good walk - not to far - awesome views! And the gardens are lovely.. very serene, beautifull plants and flowers!

Great walk on a hot day. Wow what a great park, huge trees and beautiful birds flying around, people running and others relaxing in the shade with a book and your right in the CBD. So lucky to have this much room in a busy city
Nice day out. Lot's to do here, pack a picnic lunch and sit back and enjoy the day. Take some oatmeal and feed the birds.
Good walk. What a beautiful place to walk and relax got a small train that goes around the gardens a place to east and drink.

One of my Faves.... This is one of my favorite walks in Sydney at any time of the year. I particularly like it first thing in the morning, but it can get busy with joggers and cyclists alike. The grounds of the botanic gardens are stunning. The natural beauty of the water and waves and the fact that you can't hear the noise of the city leaves you thinking you could be a million miles form anywhere. It's not a long walk, and you can do it at your own pace.Do it at least once. You'll love it and want to do it again.

A beautiful way to spend a morning. We actually walked around the Opera House and into various parts of the Gardens a few times during our recent stay in Sydney, and were never disappointed. The scenery was magnificent.

One of the best walks you can do in Sydney CBD. I have to travel to Sydney CBD often for business and don't find the central business area of Sydney very attractive. There seems to be permanent renovation or construction going on with bits of the streets being pulled up. This beautiful walk however, will take you away from all that. I love doing it first thing in the morning around 7.30am when the gardens are peaceful. It is still quite a busy time as it is very popular with runners or joggers exercising. However, this is a very accessible walk - just keep walking along from the Opera House toward the entrance to the Royal Botanical Gardens and you'll see the pathway going alongside the habour. Walk as long as you like and take in the fresh air and stunning scenery, just breath and relax.
Nice Garden and walkway.. This place is good for the health conscious, joggers , walkers etc. Its breezy and the pathway is wide enough for a lot of people walking together.

Sydney's very famous landmark is the Opera House. Everytime I come to Sydney, I never miss going to see the grandeur of the Opera house, have a selfie and show friends that the Opera House is a must place where ones photo should be taken. It's a must and I never get tired looking at it. The architecture is truly a work of art and it's a must see place when you're here in Sydney. From the Opera House it is a beautiful walk always to the Botanical Garden, historic and a truly relaxing place, where one can see the endemic trees of Australia, beautiful rose garden and more.

Walk around the harbour. Head down to the harbour from the Art Gallery & walk to the Opera House. Leisurely walk seeing all the activity on the water & in the glorious gardens. Coffee, etc along the way.
Nice walk. Just walking or jogging on that nice way around the opera house and the botanic garden gives you good mood for the day. The views are just incredibles
Scenic for a long stroll along the harbour. I just love it taking a stroll over here. The view that you see while strolling is just so relaxing. Stress free...

Bit of peace in a very busy & hectic city. Start at the Opera House & the fantastic views then walk along the water to the Botanical Gardens. You could spend hours in here it is very peaceful & even though you might see others in there & I am sure you will, it is big enough to give you that space to yourself. Lots of different paths to walk along, areas to sit & have a picnic plus a cafe. There are maps placed fairly regularly so you can see where you are, go & enjoy.

Nice walk with spectacular views. Nice walk, which I usually do from Botanic Gardens to the Opera House, as you get great views from the botanic gardens across the harbour, and from the right spot, can get a photo of the opera house and the Harbour Bridge in the 1 photo.It doesn't take long to walk from the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens and is a nice way to stretch the legs with some great views.

Short walk . Another must do when you are in Sydney. It's a short hike and it's a good introduction to the city. Walking through the green botanical towards the architectural masterpiece is really fun.

A beautiful walk with interest and views at every point. Starting at the Opera House you can follow the harbour edge around to the botanical gardens. There are beautiful views at every turn and it is worth taking your time. If you have the energy I would continue round to Mrs Macquarie's Chair, where you will be rewarded with stunning views of the opera house, the harbour bridge and the city skyline.

Beautiful and relaxing walk. This is an excellent relaxing walk to the Botanical Garden with harbour view of the Opera House. The area is clean, manicured and well maintained. Try to be there before sunset with your love one for a romantic and unforgettable stroll.

Opera House to Mrs Macquarie's Chair. The Opera house walk is another great walk in Sydney along with the Bondi to Coogee walk. The walk borders the botanical gardens. We walked along the water to Mrs Macquarie's Chair and returned via the gardens. It has great views of the harbor bridge and the opera house.

Very beautiful garden with flowers blooming everywhere and amazing views of opera house. We spend a little more than half day in the botanical garden as it was very beautiful. It has spectacular views of opera house sydney harbour bridge. It also houses some amazing strangely shaped huge trees which are worth taking pictures. It also has a beatiful garden of friends which had flowers blooming everywhere. However it doesnt have a herb garden as good as Melbourne Botanical Park has .The whole garden is made such that you would love to take pictures.

A fascinating self guided walking tour.. This area offers a range of levels from a leisurely stroll along Circular Quay, to a longer stroll to include the Botanical Gardens, a paid, guided Tour of the Sydney Opera House or a more strenuous walk for those wishing to see more.The Guided Tours of the Sydney Opera House is amazing and I would suggest that, if you have time, this should be a must. A cafe on site is available, and restaurants close by.The Botanical Gardens is likewise well worth an extended visit. A Cafe/restaurant is located within the grounds.

Wonderful. Fascinating tour of the Opera house, the guide was excellent, great idea with the headphones too. Learned such a lot. Quite a lot of stairs to climb which was the only downfall, really enjoyed it.Paid a visit to the Botanic Gardens, we took the small train round the park as it was huge, lots of joggers, children and workers having lunch, again lots of information was given, beautifu.
Lovely walk. Take a leisurely stroll or if you are into fitness, what a great place to to a serious run or jog. Not many places are better. Duck into the Opera House for a tour and a spot of lunch.

Hot Hot Hot. This is a stunning garden but not enough shelter from the midday sun but don't let that deter you a great photographic & Photogenic location with stunning views of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour And Bridge
great walk with excellent views. A truly remarkable walk going from the opera house to the botanical gardens looking at the wonderful plants not to mention the great harbour views

Take a slow stroll before sunset.. One of my favourite spots to watch the sun set is at Mrs Macquaries Chair. Be sure to get there a little early and secure yourself a seat along the wall, sit back and watch the sun set behind Sydney's most iconic buildings.

Nice way to spend a few hours.. A nice leisurely walk from the culture of Opera to the flora and fauna of the Botanical Gardens. Takes a few hours but a great variety of trees and shrubs from tropical and temperate zone climates. Very picturesque.

Beautiful . This has to be one of the highlights of my trip. I was surprised to see tour groups being led this way - I can't see why a guide would be necessary. To me, the best thing about the walk is the view, combined with my own thoughts. If only I lived nearer!

Great short walk for a family with young kids. The Sydney Opera House to Botanical Gardens walk is a great scenic walk for the family. The kids took their scooters and started at the Opera House and we walked along the sea wall path to the Botanical Gardens. There's a coin operated telescope about half way along the path which the kids looked through to check out the boats in the harbour and Fort Dennison. There are plenty of smooth paths within the Botanical Gardens for kids to scoot around on.
Beautiful walk. Gardens have already started celebrating their 200th anniversary - imagine that - and are looking great
Beautiful Hideaway, lots to see.. There is a beautiful hideaway in the Botanic Gardens near the Opera House, look for the glass structure. With a beautiful cool garden on a hot day.
What a wonderful walk.. Beautiful setting-lovely park with the best views. Everyone will love this! There is a train ride for those who cannot walk. otherwise great day out for everyone

Tranquil city refuge. Get out of the city & discover the gardens!
An easy, peaceful, photogenic walk along the harbour edge, from the Opera House to Lady Macquaries Chair. Cafes and beautiful lawns in the gardens to enjoy a truly relaxing day

Panoramic harbour views in an inner city refuge.. You can forget you are in Australia's greatest city when walking around the Botanic Gardens, and the views over the harbour just ask to be photographed.I recommend a morning walk with the sun shining on the Opera House and Harbour Bridge, with ferries frequently passing by.The Gardens themselves are beautifully maintained and wandering is easy along the foreshore paths, passing Mrs. Maquarie's Chair around to Woolloomooloo Bay.
Tranquil spot to get away from the crowds. A beautiful walk around to Lady Macquaries chair and onto the finger wharf. Water bubblers along the way for hot days
Amazing views. The view from the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House is amazing. And the gardens are so beautifully kept and relaxed in the same time. Beautiful old trees.
Spectacular photo opportunities. Spectacular photo opportunities of nature and human construction! And if its raining there are massive trees to shelter you!
couples getaway. Take the little train it is a fun little hour of information. The guide was very knowledgeable and you can get off and on so it would be great with kids.

Add this to your Opera House visit. As long as you're at the Opera House (and you will be) consider adding this relaxing and beautiful walk to your itinerary. You can just stroll along the harbour and back or you can head off into the beautiful botanical gardens and escape the city for a while.The main path is accessible for people with mobility issues and provides some great photo opportunities for glorious shots of the Opera House, framed my greenery.

Quiet Oasis. A great area for quiet after the bustle of Circular Quay. The gardens are beautiful, the more so as they are in the centre of a big city. There are an good number of paths to take and the trees are varied and attractive.

interesting even for non gardeners. This is a very large area and has amazing plants and great views of Sydney. Many areas such as the place where the Queen first stepped onto Australian soil are clearly defined adding further interest

Must do when in Circular Quay. Beautiful views and interesting things to look at. The Botanical Gardens are amazing and I could easily spend a whole day wandering around. Walking from the Opera House is a nice way to make the most of the experience.

Really unbeliveable. Omg,is that heaven...it sure looks like!!!!I recommend it to you all!!!!
I am so sorry that I gave my camera to be fixed so I do not have photos to show!!

Yes, take the walk! Or, take the run!. One can readily walk from the Sydney Opera House through the gardens, now 200 years old, and down through Hyde park to the ANZAC memorial. Then jump on the subway at Museum to return to Circular Quay. This walk can take an hour or a day but we actually made a couple of passes as we waited for tours to begin and before our return flight. The garden has a nice collection and there are numerous birds resident as well. If you are a jogger you will find heaven starting at Circular Quay running out around the Opera House and then back through any of a variety of paths to the St. James or Museum rail stops. Its all good.

An odd name, given it's about 10m to walk from the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens!. From other reviews, it seems it's actually talking about a walk THROUGH the Botanic Gardens. That's much more recommended than the walk TO the Botanic Gardens!Very scenic, great views, although it is in the open most of the way, so not such a great idea in the rain. But in good weather, it's a nice wide path and with great scenery so a big crowd pleaser.Please note, the Botanic Gardens closes at Sunset. So you can certainly take the walk from the Opera House to the gardens after dark - but not the walk through the gardens being talked about.

Lovely area. This is a lovely area to walk around and take in the sights and sounds of what Sydney has to offer..Take a picnic lunch and sit on any of the benches or grassed areas. There alwYs seems to be friendly people around and someone to chat to when you want to find some information out.
Great for couples, family, friends, kids, tourists!. A pleasant walk and the botanical gardens is a must to stop for a coffee or lunch and just get away from it all. ..
Strolling with the loved one - on a sunny day (tick!). If you need a place and time to walk along, discuss your lifes plans and next great adventure - this is the route to take!

nice way to spend an afternoon. this was my first day activity in Sydney because it takes virtually no planning. I walked around the opera house and the gardens and it was very relaxing and a nice way to get to know Sydney a little bit.

Opera at its best in Sydney. Best to book an opera house tour and then a performance to really appreciate the quality of the artists who perform here. Have been to opera around the world, but none beats what one can see here. It's phenomenal.
Relaxing space for a walk or run. It's a great area to go for a run in the morning or a walk, with great views of the water, harbour, and the Opera House while being surrounded by nature.

Glorious gardens. The gardens just seem to keep going and going. Every bend brings a new garden. You can take the water edge walk around to Mrs Macarthurs chair or stroll through the gardens and take in all the varieties.
Great views. Great views and a refreshing break from the busy Circular Quay/The Rocks area. Only wished we had more time to explore.

Botanical gardens. A really worthwhile walk, the views gorgeous. Having come to Sydney in springtime there were so many plants and flowers in bloom which we had not previously seen. It's a big garden, but well worth the effort. We especially loved the native garden. Enjoy Enjoy.
Magical walk on a sunny day. A stroll around from Circular Quay, to the Opera House and through the Botanical Gardens gives you a magical experience on Sydney Harbour....and all for free.
Beautiful view and grounds. A great place for a nice walk or stroll, the grounds are beautiful. A nice train ride thru the park in nice as well, you can stop and get on and off at points.
Opera House to Botanic Gardens walk. Sydney Opera house and the botanic gardens were equally as impressive as each other. The walk between them is beautiful

Great day out.. What a great photo stop for tourists. We took the little train around the Botanic Gardens, which were looking absolutely lovely. The train driver was great and gave us lots of information about the area and the different trees and plants.
A must see. Love these places and go when in Sydney .A show at the Opera house a must . The botanic gardens lovely and good for exercise.
Large gardens. Pretty gardens with a nice walk along the side of harbour from the opera house. Lots of walking to get around the gardens.

Best views of the Opera House. The Botanic Gardens are well cared for and neat, although not the most inspiring I've seen across the world. The walk from them to the Opera house is stunning though and leads to the best views from land of the great building.

Great walk with beautiful views!. A very pleasant walk that allows you to take in sweeping views of the city and its most iconic monuments as well as the quiet beauty of the botanical gardens. Definitely a great way to spend an hour or so!

Nice and cozy. Very centralized, just next to the Sydney Opera House. A huge garden with a beautiful scenery. You can find tranquility walking around the area. Definitely one of my favorite location. There's a lot of friendly animals as well, you can simply have a picnic, bring a book and relax there for the whole day. It might be a good destination for families as well, children would really love to run around and play in this garden.

great walk. recommend to join the free guided tour of the botanical garden, then after all the photo takings of the beautiful flowers, stroll to the sydney opera house. it is a relaxing and very enjoyable walk.

A magnifiscent building and beautiful gardens within a comfortable stroll from each other.. To rally appreciate the Opera House, it's best to have a guided tour. You get to see behind the scenes and learn more about how this amazing building was constructed.
Great Walk!. Highly recommend this walk to anyone who doesn't mind walking. Can get some great photos and soak up the atmosphere on a day with nice weather.

Opera House and Botanic Gardens - Simply Breath Taking!. The Opera House and Botanic Gardens are just so beautiful and so magnificent. Both being right on the harbour foreshore the scenery is breath taking and both attractions are best in the world standard, they are simply that good.

Free amazing walk. Get lost in the middle of the garden, enjoy the view and appreciate the smell, then go to Macquarie's chair to see the beautiful harbour view.It is an excellent walk to do before going to opera house and sydney harbour, where you can eat something

Scenic Walk along Opera House. Walk along the Opera House and Royal Botanic Gardens, Long Walk with excellent view of city and shore ... Dont miss out this place in your itinerary.. Spend more than 3 hours for the same.

Lovely place for a stroll. Lovely walk on a sunny day. Recommend going from botanical gardens to Opera House if you want to avoid walking uphill. Great views although the gardens themselves were a little unremarkable & currently undergoing a redevelopment.

Spring time special. The gardens are lovely most of the year, but especially in spring when the flowering plants are in bloom. It's an easy walk along from the Opera House past Farm Cove then up into the gardens. There is also a cute cafe and a gift shop selling an array of garden related stuff

botanic gardens. Well worth a visit. The gardens are beautiful and the view of Sydney harbour is not to be missed. The path at the end of the gardens leads you straight to Sydney Opera House, prepare to be amazed

Lovely views of boats on the river.. A lovely walk along the river. Look in the pond in the gardens and you may spot the huge eels. We watched several brides getting wed. Interesting species of trees and huge Ibis !
stunning view. Wonderful walk and the view from Mrs Macquarie's Chair is breathtaking. I could sit there for hours..

Why, wait? Just do this. Easy, breezy, free!. Lovely walk along the water, past the Opera House and through the tranquil gardens beyond. Lots to lOk at, plenty of water side cafe and bars to stop for a coffee or glass of wine while you people watch or stare at the water. Take the time to do this!

On the way to the Opera House. The way to the Opera House offers a walk through the Botanical Garden. This is a wonderful way to reach the Opera House, if you have time and aren't in a hurry. In other words it allows you time to stop and smell tbe roses.

Wonderful walk. The most and best place to go for a quite walk in the city with a good view is here where you can free go for a very good walk, the place have very much where you can learn about trees, and full nature from Australia. There is very much kilometers to walk in this garden when you have enough of the traffic in the city.

???. I am writing this quick review to let everyone know that the Opera House and Botanical Gardens are pretty much next to each other. You can go for a walk at the botanical gardens or a walk around the Opera House, but the is no walk from Opera House to Botanical Gardens.

Beautiful places. Excellent time to spend here.Starting at Opera House and ending to Botanic Gardens or vice versa. Amazing views, the Royal Botanic Gardens are great, with a lot of sort of trees, flowers and great place to relax and contemplate the city.
Refreshing and quiet. A lovely refreshing walk along this quieter side of the harbour. The flora and fauna is interesting to view along the way. The walking is flat and easy.
Great to do in reverse !. I did it in reverse, from the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House. Loved seeing the opera house come into view and walking up to it. Great experience.

Never miss this place when you're visiting Sydney. I love this place especially during Spring time. Good walk with beautiful view. Good place for anyone who's into fitness, reading, quiet time, photography and many more.
Lovely place. One of my favourite places is the Botanic Gardens in sydney, can get lost for hours in there. Has some great events on too during the year.
Hangout. Nice place to hangout. Beautiful gardens and I loved most is the view and the surroundings. A place to visit . Nice botanical gardeb
Essential. If you don't do anything else go here. The Botanic gardens are wonderful and the walk through them to the Opera House by the water is very special
Amazing parkland. Wonderful place to visit, amazing views. Does have a noddy train that you have to pay for BUT not very comfortable definitely not recommended for people with bad backs.

Lazy afternoon. We had beautiful weather so really enjoyed our lovely walk around the beautifully kept Botanic gardens. Not a weed in sight and many things named so it really made for an interesting relaxing walk. Amazing views all the time.
Nice photo spot. Love the view from botanical garden. Best photo spot for city cbd, harbor bridge and opera house. The other side of the road, you will see Wooloomooloo and the navy ships too.
Beautiful, and great picture spot!. The gardens are beautiful. Definitely should spend time walking through them. So well maintained, and a great respite from the hustle of the city.

It's a good walk. It's a fine walk - although there is a land train from the Opera House through the gardens too. The walk takes you a different route on that takes you on the water front, a little, and that is unexpectedly good. Near that part they run the outdoor cinema with a screen erected on the water. When I saw that I resolved to go to a showing and it was truly a wonderful experience. So, I'd seen the gardens on a few occasions and appreciated them greatly.

Beautiful relaxing walk. What a relaxing walk for people of all ages. The view as you turn back on yourself after leaving the Opera HOuse is just stunning. The gardens are well maintained and you cant help but feel at peace in there.

2 places not to miss on a visit to Sydney.. The Opera House and the Botanical Gardens in Sydney are a must see when visiting… I live in Sydney but never get sick of visiting both. The Opera House is an icon on the harbour, it's design still breath taking and if you visit when the Vivid Light Show is on you will see it lit up at night with fabulous images and colours. Take a show in one of its concert halls, music or ballet there is something always on. As for the Botanical Gardens, they are amazing, the have extensive gardens as you would expect along with galleries and the location of Sydney's original farm trial areas for crop types. You can sit on the lawn and take the views in of the harbour, its a great place for a picnic.
Perfect Sunday afternoon walk. I done this walk alone and it was lovely! Definitely one of the top things to do it Sydney city center if you enjoy walking and it's also free!

Green heart of a busy city. The botanic gardens with all the green areas are a great place to relax and just let time pass. The view of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge is spectacular from Mrs Macquarie's Chair.

Beautiful walk in my backyard. This is a beautiful area of the city. Well worth the walk around from the Opera House and thought the gardens. I live in the city so the Botanic Gardens are my back yard, they are beautiful. Every time I walk through them I see something new, that I haven't noticed last time.

Beautiful gardens with a gorgeous view of the harbour. Beautiful place.. lush and colourful with floral displays. Great for a leisurely walk around the gardens. The views of the harbour are gorgeous and if you're tried from all the walking around, there are plenty of benches around to sit down and rest. Or sprawl on the grass! It was lovely watching the sailboats on the waters from this area.

Perfect place to stroll on Sydney Harbour. This short walk is suitable for all ages and abilities. The gardens are restful and beautifully presented, and the walk provides a range of iconic vistas of the harbour and the Opera House. A great addition to any Sydney city itinerary

Beautiful place to stroll and take in the atmosphere. It's a lovely walk, with views of the boats and ferries going back and forth. The gardens are large, and you'll find plenty of open grass to picnic in, or areas of shade under the trees. There is a little train which gives a tour while taking you from one end to the other, however we gave it a miss as the weather was great and we wanted to walk off all that delicious Sydney food!
Well worth a walk round. The walk through the gardens were spectacular. All flowers were in bloom and the weather was great. A good way to get to the Opera House
Short but Stunning. A short walk with remarkably stunning view, just minutes from the heat and noise of the CBD. I like they way it takes you away from the day to,day

Sanctum in the City. This is a great inner-city walk which I think many tourists miss - which is a shame. Great views of the Harbour and then into the beautiful relaxation of the Botanic Gardens - with the city skyline rising above the giant trees. A great place to have a picnic or just sit and read the paper (or check your Facebook posts for those who are so inclined)

Amazing Walk Sydney. Beautiful beautiful beautiful once round the opera house slow walk through the botanical gardens. If you have the energy go see the Sydney art gallery and then finish by going through the Domain - fun on Sundays - and have a look at the St Mary's Cathedral. Enjoy☺☺

One of the best walks in Sydney. One side of the walk was the green plants and beautiful flowers, the other side of the walk was Sydney harbour. Walking in the middle of the green mountain and blue ocean water was just fantastic, impressive and pleasant

Excellent romantic stroll. Lovely opportunity to walk straight forward and not worry about falling of a bridge (an opportunity of a lifetime). This casual walk is all about beauty and the sights around. From the moment you walk from Opera House through the harbor side and to the gardens you realize you have seen it all !

Walks to Sydney Botanic Gardens. This is a nice walk in good weather, but there are more picturesque ones around this vast Harbour. There are lovely grassy areas near the Botanic Gardens to relax on a sunny day.
Sydney Opera House & Botanical Gardens. We came upon the Botanical gardens by accident & spent an absolutely beautiful wandering through the lovely gardens!

Great way to walk off breakfast. Great walk around the harbor from Wooloomoolo Finger wharf to the Opera House. Fantastic views of the harbor and interesting trees and plants in the botanic gardens. Coming up to the Opera House is spectacular.
Opera house tour. Tour very good and cost most reasonable Guide was very knowledgeable and friendly and took us to very special parts of the opera house
Lovely. Sydney is a great city to walk around, everything easily reached, Everywhere is ver picturesque. While away a couple of hours strolling around
Great place for picnic. One of my favorite place in Sydney ! you can see and enjoy all the stunning view just right there. great place for relaxing and picnic !!

a pearl. Relaxing promenade in the green and silence, enjoying the trees, the grass, the flowers. It is very close to Sydney CBD, so it can be taken for a walk in alternative to the sidewalks of downtown. At the same time it is a place where take a rest, read a book, practice sport. It deserves a stop.

Beautiful place to rest . We took a walk through the Gardens after walking around the Circular Quay/Sydney Opera House. There are many benches to rest our feet while enjoying the sight of beautiful flowers and cool breaze from the harbour. Very relaxing and recharging.

The green walk. Walked through the gardens which are stunning. Down by Macquarie Point and then along the harbour side path to the Opera House. The landscape, the plants and the birds, all very attractive. Nice to see this relaxing walk in the city. Everywhere should have something like this. Definitely go.
Stroll along harbour edge to the Botanic Gardens. Easy, level walk from the iconic Opera House to the serene Botanic Gardens is a wonderful way to view the harbour.

A great way to spend a peaceful day.. Take good shoes, a bottle of water, and maybe some sandwitches, and be prepared for an easy walk with a great view.
The walk is very easy, and you can get back in many ways in case you're too tired.
The view is stunning, and there are many places for sitting and relaxing during the trip.

So worth a walk around. A beautiful walk through the gardens which are huge and some lovely views around the harbour etc while walking through, places to eat and drink while going around also good if you want to take a picnic of your own, very clean pretty, so worth it. Also carry on into Hyde Park another pretty place to walk through to

Great Walk. This was a great walk, undertaken mostly to get to Mrs Macquarie's Chair. This is supposed to be the best view in Sydney, but I think there are better. We enjoyed our walk through the gardens, viewing the Sydney skyline in the distance, which is what keeps you from getting lost in there. This is a walk that has to be done on a good day.

Very quiet early morning. A good place for early morning run. I'd run to end of the point with good view of the Opera House & than back to my hotel. I've Ben there other times of the year & times & a very nice place to walk & view the gardens.

Drinks. Went along the the Opera house for a visit and a drink in the Bar there. It gets really busy in the weekend with families having a work/life balance ethos..But great fun and interesting to sit and watch the world go by.
Beautiful Walk along the Harbour Foreshore. Well worth walking along the harbor foreshore - easy and pleasant stroll with the se on one side and the botanic gardens on the other.

One of the world's most beautiful harbours meets a spectacular botanic gardens. This is a grand walk if you are visiting Sydney. You can start at Circular Quay, walk via the wondrous Sydney Opera House and then around the sea wall where Sydney's gorgeous harbour meets the Royal Botanic Gardens, Sydney (the oldest scientific institution in Australia dating from 1816). As a lovely afternoon sea breeze brushes your face, walk to Mrs Macquarie's Chair on the point. This is the place to view and photograph the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. If you can wait until dark, you will be rewarded with sparkling jewels as the city lights take over. Under the bridge, the supercilious grin of Luna Park adds to the fabulous fabric of Sydney's most visited place. The best bit? It is all free!!!
relaxing evening walk with great views.. nice walk in the evening with great views of the harbour bridge and the opera house. Low demand and investment on the walk

The best view in Sydney, so relaxing!. We are local, I always take my children to Botanic Gardens every school holiday for picnic, we see plants, birds, sleeping bats and beautiful Sydney harbour view, nice weather is a bonus, why not take a walk and enjoy this beautiful nature.

Great views. If you want to get away from the urban atmosphere this is the way to get to the opera house. The paths are paved and signage is very good. you get to see interesting trees and plants. Walk along the harbor with no crosswalks or vehicles bothering you
Breathtaking!. It cost nothing take an hour or two out of your day and just stroll round. Worth ever minute! The sights on a clear day are just breathtaking!
Enjoy yourself in Sydney!. A very pleasing walk to spend some time and relax during your stay in Sydney. Not exhausting at all, and to be recommended!

How to unwind and relax in the CBD. Great views and a bit of history. The Opera House is worth a visit and the gardens are rich in exotic vegetation, colorful flowers and wild animals :the ibis, the flying foxes and the seagull. If the day is not very hot, sit on a bench and relax.

CIRCULAR QUAY TO MRS MACQUARIE'S CHAIR, THEN BOTANICAL GARDENS. Even though I'm a local I love to take the ferry from Manly in to the city and walk around Circular Quay past the Opera House to Mrs Macquarie's Chair. Then it's a picturesque stroll up though the Botanical Gardens (good restaurant there as well as a cafe) to the Art Gallery of New South Wales. A bus from the Gallery takes me back to the QVB Building.
Harbor Gardens. Well you made it tot he Opera house so keep walking and experience the beautiful gardens. great relaxing walk any day of the year for any occasion

Spot the lorikeets chirping and playing in the trees. A wonderful place to stroll or picnic or use as a walking route from Opera House to the Art Gallery, East Sydney, Woollloomoollo or Potts Point. Enjoy a picnic in the grounds or go to the cafe.The Boy Charlton pool is there too with a cafe.
Best at sunset. Lovely gardens, they shut just after sunset but you get a fantastic view of the bridge/opera house and skyline, just get a wiggle on after or you'll get in trouble!

Plan your day around this walk!. Depending on where you stay, you can walk to the Opera House, take photos of all the spectacular architecture, turn towards the RBC (Royal Botanic Gardens), and wander to your heart's content through the lush greenery and amazing huge trees. There's a tour to see the insides of the Opera House (one hour), but it was our last day and no cash to spare, so can't comment. The Botanic Gardens are huge, though, so you can take an hour or a day to tour through them, and there's no charge.
Sensational. Sensational views of the best harbor in the world walking through lovely gardens. take a picnic or in summer your swimmers for a dip in Boy Charlton pool.

SERENE SCENIC ENVIRONMENT. A must place to visit to see the more slow, serene. scenic side of Sydney with those nice walkways , trees and gardens makes your walk more relaxing and refreshing and the different aromas the flower garden emits makes you want to sit and unwind under a tree forgetting about the bustling city environment 15 minutes walk away

Near by Harbor worth checking out for photo opt. Nice and easy stroll from the harbor, check timing as the garden closes around 6pm. You don't need to check the entire garden, simple walk along the edge of the water for some amazing view back to the Opera house and harbor. Runner, this would be an excellent morning or even jog.
Extraordinary trees. Very nice garden with extraordinary trees, a perfect way to get to the Opera house, a well spend time.

Don't skip this scenic walk. After finding the Opera House tours weren't running over the weekend, we took advantage of the sunny day and headed down the stairs to the Botanic Gardens. Wow, despite is still being winter here in Sydney, flowers were in bloom everywhere. We also lucked out and got some great photos of rainbow lorikeets, cockatoos, and the Australian ibis up close. And there were so many vantage points to get a great view photo of the city, Opera House, Harbour Bridge, the harbour itself, and the ships. There are many different paths to take and all were an easy walk - mostly flat and paved. Facilities are available if you need a restroom, something to eat, or would like a gift shop memento (they have very nice items for sale). We didn't find the paths overly crowded and the park was very clean. Would take this walk regularly if I lived here!

You can never tire of this !. This was and still remains one of the most relaxing, obligatory photo taking, enjoyable and free activities, in what can be an expensive city. In winter sunshine the walk defines why The Harbour is the best in the world. A great way to see a perspective of Sydney before development creeps over the treeline. Take it as slow or as fast as you like. It is free to eat your lunch and stretch out under the trees
Nice walk. Lovely walk with fascinating trees. Well worth doing with great views of Opera House and coastline. Great for jogging or cycling also. Be careful though it is locked at night.
Aussie Vacation. A place to visit in Sydney Australia, the restaurants along the water front are very expensive. The wife and I had Fish & Chips with 2 bottle waters $75.00

Iconic. The building is a marvel of engineering and fortitude.the gardens are a green space in a congested area. There is a tram worth taking for about $10 Aus,if you're short of energy or time. Otherwise, it's free...rare in a very expensive city.
It was amazing. Such a beautiful place. Always great for picture and a romantic stroll, i highly recommend you visit.

See the Opera House from a different perspective. A beautiful walk in more ways that one. The Opera House is magnificent. The views along the way to/through the botanical gardens are incredible. Well worth the time and effort.

Love this walk. Even though you are in the heart of the city you feel you are in the middle of nowhere. Such a nice place to wind down away from the hustle and bustle of a mad city. You can get some nice shots of the city skyline from this direction and the early sites of the city such as Mrs macquiries steps.
nice walk under nice weather . This is a route everyone visiting Sydney must try. Plenty photo taking -blue water/sky in one side , green in the other. Up to you to walk slow or fast

An iconic landmark. What can I say about the Opera House, which has not already been said? You cant come to Sydney, with out walking around the Opera House and just enjoying the view, and standing next to this Iconic landmark, taking photos and enjoying the time with friends and family
A must do. Amazing views, a Must do activity. The Botanic Gardens are beautiful and there are many opportunities for photos. An easy walk but absolutely worthwhile.

Views views and more views. We walked around the Opera House then onto the Botanical Gardens. Fauna, flora a must for everyone. Fantastic flowers, trees, wildlife - birds, aromas. Views, views and more views.

Walk off last nights dinner and get stunning views. We always do this walk in the morning. Regardless of where in the CBD we stay we'll always get up early and walk to the Opera house and then along the water-line into the gardens. A beautiful walk and you're rewarded with some great photo ops of the Opera House, Bridge, harbour and city-scape. And you burn off some calories!

My home town opera house. I've been to the opera house about ten times before with friends and family. Always love attending an Opera here. My last experience attending (Turandot) was not up to expectation. My advice is to skip the tour and attend a show or an opera to enjoy the theatre and the orchestra..the roof and the acqastic
lovely!. do not forget to take water with you! Great walk, great scenery, always a pleasure. Kids always love it!
Average garden but nice walk. Average garden, but the walk is superb on a clear day. Take note of the sun direction to get quality photos

Beautiful. Beautiful, Stunning and Magnificent comes to mind. This was very pretty and well worth the walk.
It is a must when in Sydney

Garden Walk. The gardens are nice, and you will enjoy the walk if the weather is good and its not very hot.
Take a train till Circular Quay and walk around the opera house and harbour bridge, it becomes quite happening in the evening and over the weekends. Then can take a walk from Opera house to Botanical Garden
A nice place to walk and take lovely snaps. This is a great walk and gives amazing views to click lot of pictures. Weather was nice so we had an amazing time.
Nice path for an evening walk. A nice path to stroll, to jog or to cycle on. Offers a great view of the Bridge, The Opera House, also the skyline of Sydney
Easy and managable walk even with toddlers.. Good and easy walk, very scenic.Enjoy two landmark at the same time. And offer choice of long walk or short walk. Suitable for all age group.
Beautiful Gardens. Beautifully laid out. The gardens are conveniently located to all the other sights and fall conveniently on the tourist circuit
Touristy things to do. Just two attractions at this wonderful location. If youre tired you can even take the choo choo train tour of the botanical gardens. Have lunch at the opera house café .

My sisters fresh eyes took it all in. We did the walk as a first experience for my sister, who was amazed at everything we encountered. The Opera House area was very crowded late afternoon and was abuzz with young, energetic people enjoying life and socializing on the harbourfront. The walk through the Gardens was a stark contrast, with historical interludes, making for a relaxing aftermath.

Run or Walk around the harbour. Ran at lunchtime (its a racetrack at this time of day with all the keep fit office workers coming out to run) and walked in afternoon returning through the park. Fantastic views of harbour, harbour bridge, opera house and gardens. Great way to walk off a great lunch

Iconic Sydney Harbour stroll.. Enjoy this level walk along the water through the Botanic Gardens. Perfect Sydney experience from the World Heritage listed Opera House through the well-maintained Botanic Gardens. Don't miss the palm tree gully with its bat colony, and the heritage garden beds that were first planted in 1788 - the first farming venture on the continent. They soon learnt that the rocky headland wouldn't grow good crops, and set out to find rich alluvial soil elsewhere.
locals. Love the botanic gardens and up to the art gallery of nsw where lady Macquarie chair still sits and the game can swim in harbour but don't recommend more than a dip as shark infested on floor

Bring your running shoes. Perfect views of the harbour as you walk from opera house to Mrs macquaries chair. Beware it is a more deceptively long walk than it seems though so a pair of sturdy shoes is a must.

Spring Walk and so it up!. A visit to the Sydney Opera House is of course a must for any tourist to Sydney, but be sure to also walk from there into the Botanic gardens. The botanic Gardens are to Sydney what Central Park is to New York. Grab some nice food, and walk into the gardens and sit on the beautiful lawns and enjoy a great view and the sunshine!

Gorgeous walk and a must do in sydney. Its a great way to reach the Opera House as you stroll through all the greenery. Very peaceful and refreshing and the view is amazing. I got some great shots for my instagram and folsk asked me where I took it from as it was a different and unique view with the harbour on one side, park and city on the other. Another great way to have a picnic and a glass of wine before heading to the opera house..
Awesome harbour views. Our family enjoyed the walk from Circular Quay to the Opera House and through the Botanic Gardens. Kicking the leaves under the trees and wandering amongst the bamboo.
Walking around the gardens. The garden walk is excellent but it closes relatively early in the evening and then you need to walk all around the outside of the garden to get to the opera house.
Great on a sunny day!. Watch out for the joggers and cyclists but this is such a nice part of Sydney that all visitors should see.
Iconic. One of the iconic Sydney strolls. Brilliant on a warm evening too. Keep going along the east side to the pool.

Get away from it all.. Entering from Macquarie Street walk across towards the café, Most of the trees and plants have name and information plaques. There are many birds in and around. The enclosed ponds hold a good head of fish along with large eels. Periodically the eels are removed but reappear several days later. There are large weathered rocks boarding the flower beds. Walk around the harbour side to find Mrs Macquarie's Chair, up the steps nearby is a small café, a great place to sit with an ice cream to watch the world go by.

A garden oasis in the middle of Sydney City. A fabulous walk with spectacular views, especially on a warm sunny day. We enjoyed sitting on the grass and watching the world go by. The grounds are very well kept and a popular place for locals and tourists alike to visit.

Enjoyable walk to the Opera House. Very pleasant stroll to the Opera House. Botanic Gardens are well kept and offer great views. Easy access to the Opera House from the city as well. Recommend if looking for a walk to the Opera House.

A must do in Sydney. The walk is amazing and suitable for everyone of all ages. The view is amazing, the harbour on one side and the park & city on the other. You may get to see a passing cruise ship, traditional tall ship or luxury yacht.
I recommend stopping for a picnic in the park!
It put Sydney on the world map!. I was a teenager when they started to build it and although it took 16 years to finish, it's now a world famous icon, and deservedly so.

just a great part of the city to explore -. the gardens offer an oasis in the city and great views across the water to the opera house and bridge. Just lovely with a great café and good photo opportunities

Good way of exploring the city minus the hustle and bustle of the busy city.. It was a good walk from The Opera House to the Botanic Gardens. Nice way of exploring the place. We enjoyed the interacting with the cockatoos in the garden.
Paceful walk. A wonderful place to walk at your own pace, beautiful flowers and trees, also a few birds around. I even saw an "ombu" which is a typical tree found in the Pampas of Argentina.

Amazing sunset view !. The opera house to botanic garden walk is highly recommended as it gives you an amazing view of the opera house and the Harbor bridge. Make sure you go towards the evening to catch a glimpse of these icons silhouetted against the sunset.

A wonderful part of Sydney. A wonderful contrast to the beauty of the harbour and the man made interest of the Opera House, this gives you a variety of views with such natural beauty and bird and wildlife.

Nice walk. A nice way to talk in all the sights along the bay, if you walk from Mrs macquire's chair towards the botanic garden you get a nice view of the opera house with the harbour bridge in the back ground
