Garden walks.. a beautiful walk taken in early spring.. My wife and I were surprised at the stunning views and the laid back approach to the area. A wonderful way to spend the morning.. Opera House and gardens. A great mix..Great views of Circular Quay and the Bridge.

Views of the Harbour, bird and plant life. An easy flat walk to do which follows the Coast. You can detour into the Botanical Gardens and the Art Galleries too or stop for a swim at the pools.
Definitely worth doing
The Great Walk in the Park. A place for you to capture as well if you are in Sydney. Walk along the park and enjoy the scenery...
Best walk. Not only do you get to enjoy the beautiful gardens but you get the best views of the harbor, its bridge and the Opera House, all for FREE!

YOU MUST COMPLETE THIS WALK!. Whether you are alone; as a couple or part of a larger group, this walk is a must-complete actiivity when visiting Sydney. The views are amazing; the flora and fauna spectacular and well, there is no other part or walk like it anywhere else in the World!

Gorgeous. If you het as far as the Opera House, you must check out the Botanic Gardens! Even in winter it's a splendid and amazing place. If only to see the amazing birds that live there. Check it out for sure.
Have a wonder, you can kill an hour or so. very nice, very iconic, not as white as you think it is, more like an off white (british teeth). Worth a visit

Good walk late afternoon. Good way to see the sights without being on a tour. This walk can take as long as you like. There are plenty of photo opportunities. Visit Mrs Macquarie's chair and enjoy the views. Fort Dennison can be easily seen along the way along with all the activities on the harbour. Stay until the sun goes down with good sunset photos behind the opera house & harbour bridge. You can do this as a return walk from the opera house or come in from the gardens and loop back to the opera house. Enjoy an expensive glass of wine at the opera house bar overlooking the harbour or join an opera house tour. We did both.

Great way to get introduced to Sydney. A great walk if you have limited time as you get great views of the bridge, opera house and harbour and a feel for the vibe of the area. Lovely on a nice day. Fantastic views of the big sights.

wonderful walk. First of all ,have proper walking shoes , and water with you, from circular quay,walk rightalong the promenade on the Left you will see the Sydney harbour bridge, then you will bein the front of the opera house steps, now continue L till the end of the opera house view the harbour, there is an island, where convicts were kept, walk back to the opera steps walk right it has a low wall and a walking path which leads you to the botanical gardens, spend some time in the garden,the path leads towards the Macqarie's Chair,before walking towards the end there are steps leading you to the top, walk to the top and walk Left to the end there is landing for all the photographs, for touristand wedding parties, you can view the bridge and the opera house from here. Now you can do this at night it has a different view ,as the opera house is lighted up,Enjoy

Great walk. We strolled through the botanical gardens from Circular Quay via the Opera House. In a very short distance you get to experience the hustle and bustle of the quay, the splendour of the Opera House and the beauty and peacefulness of the botanic gardens.There aren't meant places in the world to compare.

Beautiful walk/ stroll. Combine a couple of must do's and take this walk from The Opera House along the waterfront to the Botanical Gardens, take your time on a lovely day, it's beautiful. Or start from the Botanical Gardens & walk towards The Opera House and then grab a bite to eat or coffee or wet your whistle with a beer at the many places along the pier from Circular Quay

Amazing building and beautiful gardens. The architecture of the Opera House is known throughout the works and the stroll through the Botanic Gardens is a beautiful experience whether your a tired old Sydneyite or a visitor to his great city

Beautiful (but short) walk along the harbour. If you are visiting Sydney, chances are you will be visiting Circular Quay, the Opera House or the Botanic Gardens at some point. If you find yourself at any of these sites, do yourself a favour and carry on walking along the water...you'll be treated to great views of the area. It isn't the longest walk, but if you combine it with any of the other sites mentioned above, you certainly won't be going out of your way.

Cool Place to Relax. Botanic gardens is a nice place to walk around. The garden is maintained quite well. They also have a electric train to go around the garden which is good for families and senior travellers. One should visit this place while visiting the famous Sydney Opera house.
Sydney at its best. Another great walk going from the Opera House into the Botanic Gardens. If you are in the city you should attempt it.

Relaxation in the Botanic Garden !. From Opera House you can over look across the Botanic Garden ! You can walk there from Opera House . Most of the wedding couple with their family and friends go there to take photo for their wedding Memories photos. there are so many different trees in different spices ! I use to have nice walk for relaxation there and then also have a BBQ there with the family and over look the Sydney Opera House ! Beautiful environment and lovely fresh air from the ocean ! I am sure you will see wedding couples group there as well !

Experiencing sydney. We did this popular easy walk with views of Sydney harbour. The walk is short with bites of information to enhance your interpretation of early sydney life. The gardens are lovely to walk through. We found the Sydney museum from this walk which is worth the tour.
Great, and free.. It's already been said, but this is a great walk. You will see a great cityscape, the trees and plants are excellent, and it doesn't cost a penny.

Stunning views. This is a must in Sydney, we did a tour of the Opera house prior to us seeing the Marriage of Figaro the following day. The tour guide was brilliant very enthusiastic and friendly. The free botanical gardens have great views of the opera house and harbour bridge and are very beautiful we say some great plants and birds including Ibis.

Walk around the city, not though.. Tired of crossing streets and dodging traffic, then walk to the botanic gardens on one of many paths. The walk is level for the most part. You can take stairs at the start of the walk, or at the end of your walk.
Great. Gorgeous trip...easy walk/bicycle ride and with iconic views and easy to take great pictures...and free.

Flat easy and leisurely. Beautiful day what better area of Sydney to explore. Great views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Lovely areas to sit and watch the world go by all the way along the walk. There are benches and seating at Lady Macquarie's Chair and there is also parking up there if you don't want to walk. But seriously, why would you not?

Just.walk.talk.stop.sit.breathe.get.up.and.walk.again.. Conversations just get longer and longer while taking a slow walk with friends which I think is one of the most memorable walk in the park for me. Must do: just sit down on the green patch of grass and take in everything that's happening around you.
Nice walk. I walk from the Rocks to the Museum of NSW going thought the Botanic Garden, pass the Circular Quay and the Opera ...nice walk
Nice quit walk. It is nice quit walk around the sea on the right side of the Opera House. The Botanic garden is on a hillock with many old trees.

Foreshore area from opera house to botanical gardens to Domain swimming pool. Lovely walk any time of the year , you won't be disappointed, plenty of opportunities for selfies, beautiful scenery to share with others not so fortunate , can be busy on weekends if you continue walking around the point you will come to public swimming pool called BOY CHARLTon pool named after the famous swimmer
Beautiful Area to spend some time.. A peaceful haven in this large city. Every turn affords different views. You get fantastic views of the Opera House and bridge. Well worth a visit.
The views!. Start at Mrs Macquarie's chair and walk around the gardens. Wonder around an enjoy the peacefully walk while enjoying the natural harbour

Botanic Garden Walk. Although the weather was cold, I walked for almost 2 hours or more as I was very much entralled by the scenic view and the people who were enjoying themselves doing various activities. I also grabbed a sandwitch and cafe latte along the way.

Walk and you will see how good it is to do!. I do this walk every year in the last 22 years from Royal Botanical Garden to The Opera House. So many views, so many taken pictures, and a very nice easy walk.

Nice walk on a sunny day. This is a nice walk to take on a sunny day. It was a bit cool the day we went with a fairly stiff breeze coming off the water. Nicely groomed walks and plants clearly labeled. The small lake with small islands were nice with nesting birds, eels can be seen in the lake as well. A number of bird spices including cockatoo's in the palm tree's. This is a free park and there we a number of families picknicking on the lawns.

Take in the beautiful Sydney Harbour. A beautiful view and relaxing walk along the foreshore through to the Royal Botanic Gardens can be done any day and entry is free. Take a picnic lunch or eat at Circular Quay or the Opera House before starting the walk.
Must do for anyone coming to Sydney. Absolute must do for anyone coming to Sydney. Amazing views, educational and such a tranquil environment right in the middle of Sydney

Love this walk. An easy walk from Opera House to the Botanical Gardens with the most fabulous views. For the young and young at heart there is a train that takes you on a tour of the Botanical Gardens. Take fabulous photos from Mrs Macquarie's Chair.
MUST SEE. Others must. You feel happy, you feel healthy because you are doing a bit of walk or jogging. You feel Sydney is special straight away as you see the Opera House there..just over the sea

Beautiful, scenic coastal walk. My wife and I took a lovely, scenic walk from Kent Street through the Botanic Gardens, then viewed the Mrs Macquerie Chair (underwhelming) followed by the coastal walk to the Opera House.With the sea breeze gently brushing against your face, the embrace of the warm sunshine, & the beautiful iconic view of thee SOH and the Sydney Bridge in your sight, everything was perfect.Worth the visit.

Relaxing, nice gardens, huge!. When visiting the Sydney Opera House, just a short walk from the steps of the opera house is the entrance to the Royal Botanic Gardens. Inside the main gates, walking tracks take you right around the edge of Fern Cove or into the centre of the gardens alongside Government House, the residence of the New South Wales Governor.Taking a leisurely walk and choosing the walking pathways as you go, you will come across beautiful sculptured plants and hedges, statues, and beautiful views of the opera house from different angles, and the city skyline.Open daily from 6.30am until sunset, if walking these huge grounds is to much, jump on the hop on hop off train, for a fee this will take you throughout the gardens with convenient stops. Free entry into the gardens.The 30 hectares of gardens and grounds right alongside the CBD is a peaceful way to escape the busy city life and enjoy the atmosphere.Guided walks are on daily from 10.30am at the Garden Shop.Botanic Gardens Restaurant is open from 8.30am - 4pm with Australian cuisine, breakfasts and lunches, served on picturesque verandahs with garden views.The walk took me right around to Macquarie Street, where there is another entrance to the gardens, and the walk back towards Circular Quay is downhill. Passing the Conservatorium Of Music and seeing the expressway and tunnel.The Sydney Tower Eye can also be seen from the gardens, with wildlife and plants and sitting areas positioned throughout the grounds to stop and rest.You can walk as much or as little,but you can be surprised how far you walk with all the sights and views to take in.Government House is also open from Friday to Sunday from 10.30am to 3pm, a look at the Governors residence is allowed, free entry and a highlight of a walk around the gardens.The views across Sydney Harbour to the Harbour Bridge and Opera House are breathtaking, and walking alongside the Government House path, you get the most spectacular views of the harbour, opera house, harbour bridge, and when a passenger cruise ship is in port, adds to the amazing views from this viewing point.The views are elevated so that you can look down towards the steps of the opera house and take in all the ferry and boating activity on the harbour.My visit was recent during a cool winters day, but while it was sunny, it was perfect weather for walking, and totally recommended.Access from the gardens onto Macquarie Street then Bridge Street back to the centre of the city.A must for all visitors to Sydney's Circular Quay.If you are keen to go further, follow the roadway that will take you into Sydney Domain, and Hyde Park. Quite an adventurous walk, take a bottle of water and do the walk at a leisurely pace.I've visited Sydney many times, and always missed out the gardens, it was well worth it and enjoyed it more than I'd imagined! Great photo opportunities of Sydney's main icons and the gardens.
Lovely thing to do on a nice day and s central. Great to do and love the gardens and yet so central. The breeze can be cold though but nice way to chill out.

A lovely Harbour edge stroll. I love this leisurely stroll along the foreshore with its views. On a sunny day the harbour just glistens and the gardens are lush and inviting. Complete the stroll by visiting the Art Gallery and St. Mary's Cathedral, then a wander through Hyde Park which will bring you into the main shopping and café district. Sydney at its best.

ANOTHER MUST DO IN SYDNEY. This is a must do walk for anyone visiting Sydney. It covers magnificent views of the Harbour including getting as close to Fort Dennison as you can without leaving the shore. You will also get to see some of Australia's unique flora if you venture into the gardens and maybe just enjoy some time out sitting on the magnificent lawns. The path on the Harbourside is flat and wheelchair or stroller friendy and there is a small tourist train if you don't wanttp, or can't, walk the distance.

A beautiful and scenic view of Sydney. Of course a visit to the Iconic Opera House is a must for any visitor to Sydney. You can spend a lovely time enjoying the Harbour Views including the manigficient Harbour Bridge whilst enjoying a drink or a meal on the forecourt of the Opera House. Or you can just walk right around the Opera House and even book in for a tour of the building.From there you can continue walking directly into the beautiful Botanic Gardens which have an extensive walkway right around the waterfront to the famous Lady Macquarie's chair and continue on to the Art Gallery, or just stay in the Botanic Gardens and enjoy a snack or simply enjoy the gardens themselves. Well worth a visit and close to many other attractiions or even town if you want to shop.
a must do tour of opera house. the opera house tour is a must but don't expect to much from the botanic gardens this is certainly not Kew Gardens very simple but nice walk
walking or runnning. Nice wide path, with nice views in both directions, a good place for a jog or a walk. Fairly flat too.

Beautiful walk! Stunning at sunset. Definitely worth taking the time to wander / meander slowly along this boardwalk and even go into the gardens if you have time. It is relaxing and has stunning views. I recommend going near sunset as you can see the sun set behind the harbor bridge and everything just looks better in this type of light anyway.

Symbolic. I walked from the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House, and it was very pleasant. The gardens are extremely beautiful and peaceful, very clean and tidy, and the walk near the sea is suggestive. Advice: is always windy there, so be ready if it's winter!
a pleasant stroll. A wonderful walk from the opera house into the gardens where there are so many unusual plants to see.

A Nice Stroll.... The trail its nice and amicable, easy to walk and wouldn't take you more than an hour. The place its well maintain and from the opposite side of the gardens you can take really nice pictures of the Opera House with the Bridge as a backdrop. Usually a peaceful place, with the current construction all over the area, it gets a little crowded and noisy. Still, a nice thing to do around Sydney....

Picturesque. Took this trail along with another solo traveler, "Prom". The weather was good and we could see dark clouds in the corner. A wedding reception was underway in the middle of the Botanic Garden. Quite picturesque
Always a stunning view available. I have walked this path many times when visiting Sydney and it constantly changes and never fails to surprise.

Experience is corrupted by the construction. What would normally be a pleasant walk is overshadowed by the current construction going on to upgrade the area(s) around the Opera House. I would still definitely recommend this walk to Sydney newcomers but would urge a wait until the upgrade is finished.

Pleasant Sunday afternoon walk.. Great walk! We used to do it on Sunday after church at st. Mary's cathedral. We went down to the harbour crossing the botanic garden. It allows you an opera house and bridge view from the sea line shore before you get close.
Top Ten in the World, not joking.... Has to be one of the world's best views and surroundings. Even in the rain... Doesn't get much better.
Relax and enjoy the view.. Whether going to a concert or just visiting the Opera House there are lots of restaurants and bars close by just to relax and enjoy the atmosphere.

A beautiful place from which to view the panorama of Sydney. Viewing the Opera House was wonderful and the view of the bridge and harbor is quite spectacular. The Botanic Gardens are stunning in both beauty an immensity. Myriad birds, plants, flowers, and herbs and more of those iconic views of Sydney Harbor. So lucky that our hotel was across the street from the gardens. I was able to treat them like my front yard and enjoy several strolls along the paths in the quiet of the morning.

Beautiful walk. Very scenic and picturesque walk. It is an easy 20 minute walk from the Opera House to Mrs Macquaries chair along the beautiful Botanic Gardens. The views of the city, opera house and harbour bridge are well worth the reward at the end. Highly recommended.
relaxing enjoying nature and the view. The opera house is worth a programme :) at the gardens I took the small train first and then walk a bit, very relaxing, the view is amazing...

Hold your breath, its a breath taking site. A performing arts centre and a UNESCO World heritage site, the Sydney Opera House designed by Danish architect Jørn Utzon, and formally opened on 20 October 1973, is indeed a breath taking site. A tour of the Opera House is a must. Wonder why its not Wonder of the World!

2 to go - Sydney Royal Botanic Garden and Opera House. We took the route from Botanical Garden (starting from Macquarie's chair) to Opera House (thinking of leaving the best for the last) but turned out that there are both equally great. We went there in the morning, hence enjoyed the fresh air on top of the amazing view. Do take time to enjoy the garden, the pond, and the great collection of plants & trees, while strolling to the Opera House along with the garden landscape. One of the minor thing happened was to locate the rest-room.
打算像我一路用走的朋友最好吃饱了才出发哦！. Royal Botanic Garden 让我失望了。比起Adelaide的它逊色多了。就只是大而已咯，没啥看。有空的朋友可以去走走悠闲散步，赶时间的可以把它跳过。但是从这里沿着走可到达Art Gallery NSW，The Domain, St Mary Church，The Australian Museum和 Hyde Park。
Beautiful views as you walk. We loved this walk...it goes right along side the busy Sydney Harbour. Lots to look at...just very pretty!
amazing. The botanical gardens are so good and free I was amazed by the beautty of the gardens and the size. The restaurant is also good.
Unique !. The gardens are fabulous. Have a coffee or lunch in the little restaurant in the gardens great quality and value.

Go early to enjoy a quiet stroll in this area. Best enjoyed earlier than later. There are bars and cafes to enjoy the views around this harbour area, plus Opera House. Watch out for those tourists! It's a popular venue.
Lovely views of Sydney. Easy stroll for any ability; scootable for young kids. Great views, grand old Morton bay fig trees, and picturesque gardens to laze on the grass and watch the world go by.

Morning walk . Walk these gardens with my wife,beautiful surroundings and views over the bay
Very peaceful and relaxing
If you think its all Big City, Think Botanical!. Wow. We stumbled upon the gardens. What a lovely way to relax with your jet lag and walk without crowds! A Central Park for Sydney. Really lovely.

Change of Perspective. Seeing the Opera House from a different angle gives it a completely different perspective. This was the first view I had of the Opera House, without the hustle and bustle of the Harbour or the iconic bridge, it's a clean cut view of the breathtaking Opera House. Plus, the walk through the Botanic Gardens is incredibly pleasant!

Impressive views. A beautiful walk through some spectacular scenery. The view of the harbour is wonderful. The Botanic gardens were beautiful. Hard to believe you are so close to a huge city. A "Must do".

Relaxing and interesting walk. Relaxing and interesting walk through nature. Some of the trees in the Botanical Gardens are centuries old. Some interesting and exciting views of the Opera House from different angles can be found here. Good to do this walk on a cloudy/rainy day.

Beautiful winters day walk. I took the train to Circular Quay and it was a short walk to the Botanical Gardens. The paths are well marked with names and walk times. Great walk and beautiful views of the bridge bad Oprah house as one walk toward Mrs Macquaries seat. This point attracts a lot of visitors but is worth the walk. From the seat walk back towards the opera house. Make sure to stop and view all the named trees and plants they are wonderful. I then walked back past the opera house and caught the train again from Circular Quay after a tasty glass of wine in the sunshine. This walk is a must for the views and the gardens

Jog in the morning and enjoy the view. Million dollar view with posh garden, sea and city backdrops while doing your cold morning run. One of the most beautiful place in the world perfectly maintained. It does not feels like it try to be beautiful but it is, simply elegant. Singapore garden by the bay can learn things or two from sydney

Chill Out. Lovely walk with great views back to the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.......we did it both ways and on the return the sun was setting, creating spectacular photo opportunities and memories to last a life time.
A nice walk.. .A really pleasant walk along the river. Great views and places to picnic or just sit and enjoy the views.

Lovely Morning Walk. We did this walk fairly early on a Sunday - started at the Opera House around 8am. The walk had absolutely gorgeous views out over the harbour and then from Macquaries Point back across the harbour to the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. While there were quite a few people out walking/running the walk never felt crowded. To wrap it up nicely, walk back through the Gardens to one of the cafes (we went to the Pavilion and the breakfast was delicious!)
worth the effort. the Botanic gardens are beautiful, set against the backdrop of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge, you cannot go wrong.

Picturesque. the walk from opera house to the botanical gardens along with the harbour side walk inside the garden are a treat for your eyes. the view of the harbour bridge, the north sydney skyline, the waves and the cool breeze blowing across your face can make your day!
Beautiful walk. Gorgeous scenery, a fabulous oasis in the city, allows you to pause and take it all in. Even if you just cut through the gardens to get to Macquarie street, it's worth the diversion.
Gorgeous and Surreal. What a lovely waterfront manicured area! We really enjoyed this walk and ended up doing it a few times. It was so nice to see how much the city cares for its public spaces.

excellent walk and views. You can easily spend a couple of days walking around in downtown Sydney and around the harbor. The Botanic Gardens are beautiful and tranquil. The Opera House is not to be missed.
scenic walk. A wonderful walk for locals and visitors alike. Spectacular view of harbour bridge and opera house. Start at Mrs Macquaries chair and walk around to the Opera house.

See Sydney at it's best for free. Just walking and taking time to smell the roses is a lovely way to see Sydney. Even though you are minutes away from the CBD you can escape the hustle and bustle and take time out to revive your soul. Lay under a tree, practice yoga, have coffee, explore and recharge in this peace of paradise in a busy dynamic city.

Beautiful scenic walk.. We went here for a walk at 7 am of July 6th. The atmosphere was cold but refreshing. The gardens are beautiful and the walkway is very well maintained. The views of Sydney harbour bridge and of the Opera house are stunning , especially if you reach upto the Mrs. Macquaire's chair viewpoint.

Great views in fresh air. Visited this area twice. Once running (Sydney is a great city for running) and once walking with my wife. The Opera House is impressive and the gardens are a delight. They have great variety and interesting nooks. Walking along the seaside to Mrs McQuarrie's (?) Chair is wonderful way to experience the harbor.
great walk. So was to get around this city and it was nice to walk from one attraction to another all in one day. And, you're surrounded by a gorgeous harbor!
Beautiful park. Enjoyed a lovely walk through park, lovely display of flowers, shrubs and trees. Well maintained and very pleasant. Lots of routes each one lovely. Well worth a stroll through.

Enjoyable way to enjoy the harbour.. There is always plenty to see and experience along this very popular walking track. Many overseas visitors can be seen taking in the views and enjoying the open spaces around the harbour. Allow lots of time for people watching and relaxing on the grass.

Amazing Views. Worth the scenic walk around as the views are great especially on a sunny day and very relaxing, not a hard walk and doesn't take too long with plenty of open space just to sit down and relax
Peaceful Walk. The Opera House is a nice visit, but the walk down the Botanic Gardens is a nice & peaceful place to walk about and hangout.
Harbourside views. A great way to take in the foreshore of Sydney harbour is to walk from the Opera House to Lady Macquarie's Chair in the Botanic Gardens.

Best views of the harbour . Nice atmosphere while walking for around 25 minutes through the gardens. Lots of people enjoy running and sports or just sit down at a bench to watch the opera house and the harbour bridge.
Beautiful walk. Enjoyed the walk even in the cold. Gardens were lovely and seem to be changing constantly. Nice for friends or families. Lots of children around. Great to finish with a cup of coffee

It's a Nice Walk. There isn't much to it but it's a pleasant walk with nice views of the Harbor and Botanic Gardens. You're walking right along the water. I wouldn't tell someone that they just have to do this but it was nice and pleasant and pretty and not long at all.
stunning. if you like nature or flowers or parks or animals or sunshine, then I recommend this, as this walk is a plethora of all of these things!!
Great walking/running route.. Early morning run around here is one of the best things I did when I visited Sydney. Tough to beat catching a breather at Mrs. McQuarie's chair, and take in the view.

Relaxing still with views of the Opera House. The Botanical Gardens are one of my vaforite places to still in Sydney. I usually start out there and work my way towards the Opera house. There are some fabulous views from the Gardens towards the Opera house with the Bay Bridge in the back. Best in the morning when the sun illuminates the Opera house. Sometimes in the evening one can catch a sunset over the Opera house.

Beautiful, relaxing Botanic Gardens. This is one of my favorite places in Sydney. In the heart of the city you can experience so much of nature. The views of the harbour are magnificent. On a sunny day the water shimmers and you can take seat under a shady tree and absorb the tranquility. An easy stroll through the park or catch the little train - great fun for the littlies! So much to enjoy... And it's FREE!

Recommend. You do not necessarily need the Opera house in order to enjoy it. You can see the building from outside, from all angles and everything that surrounds it. Eventually, you can easily shift to the Botanical Gardens where you will not easily get lost. Tight all!

An easy walk with dramatic views of the Harbour.. Sydney Harbour never fails to impress. This short walk is a great way to savour the changing views of Opera House and Bridge. The gardens themselves are a great place for a stroll and to reach the Art Gallery.

Natural glory. Who knew that in the thick of Ozzie winter the Botanic garden could be so lovely! Fabulous views, huge green spaces, ancient trees and so much great information on local vegetation! Definitely a must do!! Doesn't take longer than an hour or two and is a good way to use the time between booking a tour of the opera house( incredibly busy and often booked out) and the actual tour! Had a great lunch on the quayside at Portobello too!! Great food! And the lorikeets are everywhere! Open a sachet of sugar and pour some into your hand and they come sit on your finger and scarf it down!! Fun!
Beautiful walk. Lots of walking and running tracks. Lovely on a sunny day. A visit the mrs macquarie's chair is a must. Crystal clear water and great views of the bridge and the opera house.

Peaceful. It was a peaceful walk. I enjoyed the views of the city and the opera house. The happiness from the walk was partly due to the excitement of getting to the Botanic Gardens at the end....but the walk in itself is enjoyable as well.
An oasis of calm an coolness. beautiful gardens, well worth a visit hosting plants from all over Australia. A very good coffee shop too.

A nice way to spend the afternoon. The Botanical gardens are right next to the Opera House, so it is easy to walk over there after you have admired the Opera house from all sides. The walk is free, and it offers nice views of the bay and different plants and trees.

Nice Walk, prefer taking it in the evening. Even though we went to Australia in winters, then also i felt that this walk was best taken during evening when is about to set.You see Opera house from all sides (if you happen to cover the same). Beautiful building and then Royal botanic gardens, lush green gardens. Its really good to see so much greenery inside the main city.Then heading to McQuaire's chair. Walk is easy and smooth. You will be soaked with the views it had to offer.
Beauty. Beautiful walk, weather was amazing and it was nice to take a slow pace in a fast moving city around you.
Walk. The gardens and the walk are lovely ... lucky to have decent weather when in Sydney ... a beautiful city and one day I would love to go back

Botanical Gardens. Visited in mid June 2015 so although it was the Aussie winter we still thought these gardens were stunning and was especially thrilled with the Cockatoos, Rainbow Lorikeets and Storks to name but a few of the birds we saw. Awonderful setting with amazing views of the Opera House and Bridge. Well worth a visit and it's free. Suggest a visit to the Cafe and shop.
Spectacular Walk.. This walk along the harbor is one of the best to do while you are in Sydney. The view of Opera house and Sydney Harbor bridge along the walk is priceless.
Great easy walk. It really is a must do if you are visiting Sydney! Great views, easy walk and a little bit of history
So much to see. We walked it on a Sunday so you had a great mix of locals aswell as tourists. Watched one of the liners pulling out of the Harbour,certainly a sight to see!

This is an iconic scenery walk. I done this on a glorious day without a cloud in the sky. The Botanic's is a beautiful place for an afternoon, walk,picnic you name it!!! Great for photos of the Opera house and bridge :)
Great walk. Have loved spending my time walking around this city. I felt safe I enjoyed all that we could see on this walk
Beautiful area. Amazing spot and soooo relaxing!! Worth the stroll around the opera house and gardens with the views across the Harbour to the bridge and Luna Park

Iconic views. A short, level walk with breath-taking views all around. Free. A must-do in Sydney. A wonderful garden, visit the cafe for a snack, relax on verdant lawns as you view the glorious harbour.

A relaxing stroll in the Botanic Gardens. With the city on one side & the harbour on the other it is the perfect place to spend your lunch time or a few hours. Walk down to the harbour and you can wander around the Opera House, buy some refreshments before you catch a ferry or train.

Quiet peaceful walk. I really enjoyed the gardens. Beautifully kept, plenty of people around, without any riff-raff. I could have spent more time there that I did but chose to leave before it got dark.
Wonderful sites to see.. Great walk around the Opera House and the Botanical Gardens, but make sure you have good walking shoes on.
walk to the pera house then the gardens is a delite. walk is a great walk through the city and the opera house is breathtaking and the gardens are simply beautiful
Fantastic Botanic Gardens. Interesting to see the Opera House close up. The Botanic Gardens are wonderful, with a very good café.

Opera House. What can I say, the Opera House never disappoints you. A true Icon for not only Sydney and for Australia. Its a must to see, even if you dont take a tour it just lovely to sit and gaze at the people, the Opera House and the setting. Always lots of people around, nice cafes and even little goodies to buy to remind you of your visit.

Icon. Have been to the opera house a few times and find it a really relaxing part of my walk around Sydney. Was surprised the first visit to Sydney by how close it was to the bridge. Looks better in real life compared to the pictures I thought.

Great Way to Spend A Few ours. The botanic gardens are a real treasure, you can roam through shady fern houses or roll around on perfect lawns or visit the NSW Gallery. It's a great place to relax and do very little.

Extend the walk for great views. I suggest you continue the walk around Farm Cove through the Yurong Gate around to Mrs Macquaries Chair. The best photo options of the City Skyline and SOA/SHB are available from here.
A true highlight of your trip to Sydney.
Gardens were beautiful and free. Beautiful and free but we wanted to ride the train and they would not accept credit card. Very large and opened late like 10 am was first tour so plan accordingly.

Pleasant way to spend a day. The walk from the Opera House to Lady Macquarie's chair is a nice stroll or run if so inclined.
Great opportunities for photographing the harbor and Harbor Bridge, you could also visit the Botanical Gardens, they are good to see and in the Spring, great photography opportunities.

nice scenic walk. really pleasant scenic walk from the iconic opera house at wonderful circular quay to the relaxing and beautiful botanic gardens , The walk along the shore with the harbour on one side and the gardens on the other is beautiful

A walk with hystory and nature. I have been to the walk with my wife and kid. We all enjoyed the walk. It has ocean at one side and really nice royal botanical garden at other side. Very pleasant view. Recommended for everyone of all ages with friends and family.

Wonderful must see. We went to the opera house it was a lovely historic building and then we had a picnic lunch in the gardens it was a lovely flat walk with a pram in the park such wonderful plants and gardens and lots of historic things along the way

Not to be missed. This is a glorious walk and well worth carrying on from the Opera House to enjoy. The views of the harbour are glorious. The gardens are beautiful and a breather from the city. There is pleasant cafe in the centre of the garden with a Resturant upstairs. Water points are available. Highly recommend it
Senic walk. Nice flat walk around the harbour from the Opera House to Mrs. MacQuarrie's Chair. Lovely views especially watching the sunset behind the Harbour bridge. Best of all, it's free!

Classic route. Two must do sights in one event. Really it MUST be done, the Opera House is iconic whilst the Botanic gardens is a haven for plants, trees, birds and flying foxes (roosting) all of which offer great vistas, and with the cafe tucked away will make an excellent event.

Huge park being in the heart of CBD. We live in Melbourne. Victoria is known as the garden state in Australia. Apparently there are many garden named as "Botanic Garden" in Australia. I can name a few in Melbourne. Sorry that's irrelevant.Visitors to Sydney usually plan to visit the Harbour Bridge > Opera House > Mrs Macquarie's Chair. If you do the same thing, you will likely walk along the Botanic Gardens Walk.It is decent exercise if you do a return walk. Remember to bring your bottle. Plan for at least 30 mins (one way) and hope it is not a rainy day.

Beautiful, peaceful and inspiring gardens. This a beautiful free thing to do, and the Botanic gardens in particular were simply amazing, well kept and a lovely way to walk into the city. Highly recommended, especially for those who appreciate the beauty in nature at its best!

A peaceful walk and beautiful gardens too. To walk over and around the Opera House is well worth the walk and is also a good photo point. The Botannic Gardens are also a beautiful well kept area to walk through and also to have lunch with friends.

Loved this walk. Perfect place to get your photo with the Opera house and the Harbour Bridge in the background. I really enjoyed this walk. It's suprisingly relaxing for such a big busy city. The botanic gardens has lots of lovely places to sit down and rest your legs for a while too. A must do.
My backyard garden. one of the best walks in the world. The gardens next to the opera house, next to a harbour, next to a bridge, next to a world class city.

Green Is Good. Very relaxing walk. Easy. Walk along the Harbour from the OH, then up into the gardens. Sometimes a jungle. Bats hanging from trees, good aromas from the flowers. It is quite nice, an oasis in the middle of the city. Cafe right in the center to stop for a coffee or cool drink and a snack. Do it!
Beautiful Walk. A leisure walk through botanical gardens to view monuments, structures, animals, plants and more. Plenty of places to grab a bite to eat or rest on a bench. allow plenty of time.

One of Best Views in the World. A most unique and wonderful place to wander around. Enjoy a stroll or a sit on the grass taking in the view of the Opera House and Harbour. A truly magnificent part of Sydney and the world. Best on a sunny day, but not too hot. Easy, relaxing, child-friendly. Walk through the Botanic Gardens.

Great to do anytime of year. I love going for a walk through the Botanic Gardens, whether I'm heading somewhere such as the AGNSW, or spending the afternoon there. Don't miss walking all the way along the foreshore to Mrs Macquarie's Chair (the next point along). There are great views of the Opera House from there.I used to love running this route as part of one of my old running routes when training for a half-marathon, it's a great, flat, scenic run! For all the runners out there, there is a bubbler half-way along on the gardens side near the pond.
Awesome!. This is a fantastic walk with great views of the Opera House! The Botanic Gardens are gorgeous, and the signs are very clear as to how to get from the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens.

The path less-traveled. Walking past the opera house and through the gardens is a great treat even in the winter. If you're going to do it make sure you walk all the way to Mrs Macqarie's Chair. You get a great view of the harbor from there without having to take a ferry.Great spots to just sit and chill in a harbor-front park setting. It's really more relaxed than the quay proper.

All in one place!. What a walk from the Opera House to Lady Macquarie's Chair via the Botanic Gardens....stunning view of the CBD on one side and the sea on the other....and people jogging in the afternoon....one of the rare spots wherein you have everything - sea, gardens, tall buildings, architectural landmarks - in one place!
Getting your bearings.. Walking from CBD to botanical gardens to Opera House was. great way to get our bearings and get some great views of the Opera house and bridge. Nice easy stroll.

A sydney must!. a great relaxing walk that has amazing water views of the harbour and the city. an easy stroll for all to enjoy a free thing to do in sydney. starting at the opera house will end you at the art gallery of nsw which is also a great place to go into or you can walk around to lady acquires chair that also has a spectacular view of the harbour and you can read about the spot and its history.

Beautiful peaceful walk. If you're looking for a quick break away from the hustle and bustle of the city, I found this short walk to be just the thing for me. Wish majestic views of the bridge, opera house and the gardens it's hard not to relax and feel at piece.

This is a must-do in Sydney!. I used this as part of a run I did one morning.. WOW! The views were spectacular! It was incredibly breathtaking to run through the Botanic Gardens and then the path leading to the Opera House can't be beat. Make sure to walk out to Mrs. Macquire's Chair-- best view of the Opera House and Harbor Bridge!
One of Sydney's secrets. Loved it. Take a bottle of chilled SSB, a picnic and a good book and watch the harbour traffic pass you by as you doze on the lawns. Brilliant, and for nothing !
nice walk. its a nice walk, great place for pictures, enjoy a coffee or an ice cream, the view of the best harbor in the world

Don't miss!. If you don't see anything else in Sydney, be sure to visit the Botanical Gardens. The garden is vast and awesome. Very different than gardens in my state of Calif. The walk to the Opera house was filled with beautiful views on the water. Great area for happy hour and oysters.

Nice. It was nice to have a walk along the Botanic Garden, I went here early in the morning and it was really quiet. For me it was just ok, because the beautiful is in the end when you can see the Opera House in the end. Good for relax

Breathtaking. Its one of the best views you will ever see...breathtaking...i used to work at 45th fl Gov Philip tower building. i will bring my lunch and walk from The Opera House to the Botanical Gardens and stop to have lunch and admire the view....couldn't get better ...soo amazing....
Wow. It was the best walk I hd taken in years, the sights, the air, the nature around and then the garden: perfect combination for a perfect family walk, discovering one of the main places in Sydney.
The Best Spot on Sydney Harbour. Great views of the Bridge during the day and night, worth the walk around the foreshore and into the Rocks

Short walk with great views. This is a pleasant walk around the harbour's edge, giving excellent photo opportunity views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. From this walk you can walk into the Gardens, there's a lot to see, and also go around the point to sit on Mrs Macquarie's chair.

Everyone should do this walk at least once. Even as a born and bred Sydneysider, I'd never really done this walk properly until recently. It's a great activity for a sunny weekend and reminds you of just how beautiful our harbour really is.
Need to be there. Nice place to walk in Sydney. Have a great view about Harbour Bridge. I recommend go there to watch the sunset.

A different side to the city. When travelling to the city, we're so used to the buildings and concrete.
It was a nice change of pace and scenery to be able to walk through the gardens and enjoy the flora and fauna which is so close to to hustle and bustle of the city.

Beautiful Walk. This makes for a most beautiful walk along the harbour. The views are magnificent no matter what time of day you are there. If you are into landscape photography this is the place to capture really amazing photo shots.

beautiful and relaxing. walking the opera house is something to give you joy, then continue to the botanical gardens that are simply grand beautiful and so well look after,, enjoy a picnic, little sleep in the sun and then continue to Mrs Macquarie's Chair and enjoy the harbour
A must do in Sydney. As a tourist or a local this is an iconic walk everyone must do. An easy walk taking in some of the best scenery that Sydney has to offer and its free.

tranquility in the city. Need a break from the city? Then wander into the gardens and you will find yourself surrounded by beauty. Natural beauty of plants, the natural beauty of the view, and the beauty of many art works. You could spend a whole day in the gardens and not see everything. Take a picnic and relax. Then wander back to the Opera House and see more wonders the beautiful Opera House, the Harbour Bridge and the harbour. You won't be disappointed.

Kinda boring. I always found it a little bit boring! there are not that many cool plants. although it is very nice, it's still crowded but you can find quieter spaces. visit the rose gardens, it s very nice
Out of the rush and bustle. Lovely walk on a sunny day..Quite long for children, but very scenic. The parks and gardens are interesting and there is some history along the way.
Watch out for ther Cockatoos!. Lovely walk but the cockatoos are overwhelming. They actually dive bomb unsuspecting walkers and they have sharp beaks.

Gorgeous views. Nothing can compare to the views obtained from the Opera House or just walking through the Botanic Gardens.The gardens are pristine and beautifully preserved. Perfect for that romantic walk with someone very special.
Beautiful Area. Nice place to visit to walk through :)Great place for a photo stop or to have lunch in the gardens.
Pleasant an beautiful landmarks. Worth the walk, the opera house is something everyone should see when they come to Sydney and the walk into the picturesque gardens tops it off nicely.

The best view in Australia. If you walk around to Lady Macquarie's chair you can get the absolutely amazing view of the opera house in front of the harbour bridge. This is one of my favourite spots in Sydney!
Nice walk along water. If you have spare time, this is nice walk, best from Gardens, whn you walk along water and suddenly behing the trees appear Opera house.

Iconic Views, if you only have few hrs in Sydney, do this.. Really, this is Sydney in live postcard. The gardens, sandstone, the opera house sails and the boats and ferry all pass by as you walk a large semi circle. Parking is almost non existent so get train to Quay Station and walk back via Art Gallery to Hyde Park station. Sadly no great cafes exist so take you best picnic and coffee and sit on the rocky outcrops and enjoy.

great food. beautiful place I wish I had a place like this in the states near me.I love everything.Beautiful setting and the food was so fresh,Like I picked it myself and put it on my plate.Every wine is awesome. The deserts where wonderful thanks If and when I return I know I will go there.
Great view. Very nice ocean view and great gardens, a must-go place in Sydney. Missed government house tour which looks like great too. Excellent for photos

A spectacular walk, with great ocean and park views, and lovely rolling greens in the park.. I saw this was highly rated on tripadvisor, and decided to do this the morning of my last day in Syndney.I wish I had gone earlier, and spent more time just strolling around the gardens!A spectacular walk, with great ocean and park views, and lovely rolling greens in the park.

Opera House and Botanic Gardens. It is so fun to walk around the Opera House, go inside, get a few gifts, use the facilities then walk into the botanic gardens (it's free) and stroll along the harbor while enjoying the spectacular views of the Opera House and Bridge. It's a great place to sit on a lovely patch of grass and soak in the view.

A respite of tranquility in a hectic city.. Every time through, you'd think I was visiting a different park. It's massive and especially if you're staying in the area, you'd do well to make it part of your walking or jogging route whenever you're headed out.

Secret Spot!. Beside the beautifull gardens and several weddings celebrated on it, reach the end spot to see the best views of Sydney. We went on sunset and get to see the opera house, boats going in and out the harbor... It was incredible. Many professional photographers go there to take time la sea

perfect view of the opera house with the harbour bridge background. this is where i had a perfect view of the opera house with the harbour bridge background...aside from walking, you can stroll the area via a choo choo express and you'll have a totally different kind of fun...lovely place for everyone.

A photographer's delight. Started off at the steps of the Opera House on Saturday morning and wandered around the path and through these pristine gardens. What beautiful scenery and so many photos to take. A great way to enjoy the morning

That magnet, Sydney Harbour ..... is right with you as you walk from the SOH into the Botanic Gardens. If you are lucky you will see the flock of sulphur-crested cockatoos within the gardens, flying from tree to tree. It is enjoyable to take the little train ride right where the SOH starts into the garden, if you don't feel like walking. Do walk out to Mrs Macquarie's chair, though. Enjoy.
A pretty place. The walk is a pretty place to walk and to relax, either on the benches, or on the green grass, with a nice view over the harbour.

What is not to like. You get to walk along the water. The sidewalks are wide. The scenery is nice no matter where you look. The gardens are beautiful and interesting. This is something that you can do throughout all the seasons.

A Walk Thru the Gardens. If you like to walk, do not miss the Botanic Gardens, you could spend the better part of a day there, it's a wondrous place. If you love the open air and lots of greenery, you'll love this Garden. After you walk through, be sure to visit the World Famous Sydney Opera House.

Pretty. It was so beautiful! There are fabulous places to take pictures! It did not take very long, unless you stop to take a ton of photos. There aren't enough words to describe how beautiful it was.

A little underwhelmed to be honest :/. Although it was great to go and see the Opera house and get a picture, I really didn't see what the fuss was about! It's just an odd looking building up close! I did the tour, which I wish I could get my money back for as it wasn't great. The best thing about it was when it was the vivid light festival and the whole thing was lit up with a light projection. The gardens were actually nice, got some great pictures had a walk around with some friends and chilled out so all in all was ok! Overall don't go on the Opera House tour unless you like stuff like that as it is a waste of money in my opinion, but get a few pictures or the outside to say you've seen it! Gardens are worth a look!
A stroll with your camera. Early morning walk to the Opera House was enlightened by the walk around the gardens, Do not rush to get to the destination, enjoy this journey

a must see!. The Sydney Opera house was spectacular. We got to see the symphony practising in the concert hall and it was so beautiful. It was very emotional.The Botanical gardens we did a little bit everyday and it was amazing. It makes us as humans seem so small and insignificant.Well done Sydney!

Simply Beautiful. A very calm and easy walk surrounded by nature, you have the harbour on one side with the opera house and then this amazing park on the other. The park itself is wonderful, full of weird plants and twisting trees. Defiantly a great way to see the sights.

Lovely gardens with stunning views. I love gardens and this one did not disappoint. The views are stunning and the grounds well kept with interesting trees and plants. We also saw lots of white macaws.

A Relaxing Stroll. A relaxed and quiet walk with the Harbour (Farm Cove) on one side and the Botanic Gardens on the other. A pleasant stroll in either direction with a wealth of early Australian history surrounding you.From the Opera House it is worth the additional walk to Mrs Macquarie's Chair which, besides its historical context, affords wonderful views of Sydney Harbour.Not a long walk and certainly worth your time, because of the views.
Nice view!. Recommendable for a walk in the early morning or evening time. Was amazed by the lovely view of the harbor bridge, the harbor and the Opera House.
best part of sydney.. beautiful walk! a lot of jogger and backpackers around. you can view the harbour, the bridge and opera house.
Ok. Nothing to add, Its just a walking area, nothing specific to add, Can be skipped if on tight timelines

tea house fun. good solid walk with a nice breeze most of the time. start at the house, do a hike up the stairs and finish at the botanic gardens..which is a fun little wander in itself. the tea house within is a good experience too.
Botanical garden. best to go in the middle of the week, great place to be away from the traffic, even to go for a run while staying in any of the Harbour hotels.

Walking to botanical garden. It is very near to opera house . Excellent location for travelers very good collection of trees and birds , we enjoiour walk through botanical garden and it has exit to main road from where taxi are easily available
Serenity. It's hard to believe the botanic garden is in the city. It's so peaceful in the garden. Lots of beautiful grass to sit on and stunning views of the water.
Pleasant way to spend an afternoon. Enjoyable walk, perfect way to spend an afternoon in Sydney. Lots of space for little ones to run around and climb, excellent sidewalks for prams and easy walking.
Lovely Walk. Many things to see and experience on this walk, all the different types of trees, many species birds and many joggers at all times during the day!!

This is a must!. On a beautiful sunny winters day there is nothing like a walk through the Sydney Botanic Gardens, along the Harbour wall and a visit to the Opera House. You can take a guided tour or go to an event in the many theaters in the "House". Wonderful!
Good wine. Good view with good food n wine. Need to be there once with some friends and enjoy the time.Good ambiance and music too. Service is also good. Good time is winters

Beautiful views and scenery. Walking around the botanical gardens provides some of the most stunning views across the harbor and to the Opera House. The restaurant in the middle of the gardens has a small but excellent menu to allow for a lazy and relaxing lunch as you travel round. I highly recommend the gardens as a way to unwind!
Botanic Garden. I was very lucky to take time. The beautiful weather helped me enjoy the visit. I liked the design and also the view of the garden.

Perfect start to the morning or finish to a day. The transition from city to garden is so gradual you barely notice it until you are well into the Botanic garden that you start to second guess whether the hustle and bustle of the city really is only mins away.

Recommend. If you can walk down to the Opera House through the gardens it's a peaceful lush walk.
Lot's of lovely trees and flowers along with birds around. Along with many people enjoying the peace of the gardens.
Great start to exploring Sydney down to the harbour

Must visit. This facility has the best Acoustics I have been in save Red Rock amphitheater in Morrison Colorado. They have wonderful programs going on all the time. We were thoughly entertained by a flute player for 90 minutes. There is a beautiful park with Fascinating plant life and fox bats near by.
Beautiful view. The lighting show during the week was excellent...the view from the botanic garden are beautiful..walk through the harbour is excellent...the lighting show is worth to see...

easy peasy. There are plenty of places to sit, lovely views, plants and fauna. You will enjoy wonderful views of the harbour and have plenty of informative signs regarding the flora. The gardens offer a very pleasant eatery and of course the ubiquitous gift shop. The walk is certainly not strenuous and generally only part of a larger exploration of Sydney's waterfront.

Take it all in because it is the experience of a lifetime.. This walk is not only about being overawed at the grandeur of the spectacular architecture of the Opera House and the beauty of the beautifully manicured botanic gardens and its array of the worlds flora, but it is more about the beauty of the Sydney Harbour that provides a backdrop to both and is never out of your sight during your whole walk. The pristine colours of water, natural bush and man's ingenious design combine to create an artists dream. You can experience this for a whole day and even at dawn or twilight so allow hours and hours to get the full benefit. It is truly the experience of a lifetime and one has to literally 'pinch' to know you are not in Alice's Wonderland dream.

let the breeze wipe your face. in a summer evening what more could you want if you are traveling with young adult to walk a garden with acres and acres of green and a lovely restaurant to take a snack break and a gift store to add and buy some memories i bought honey:))

Lovely haven from the bustle of the city. A great hour spent walking through the park, seeing a variety of different trees and bird life as well as the fruit bats and some great views of iconic buildings such as the opera house.

A must. The Botanic Gardens are really attractive. Not only is there a very interesting spread of plants but the location is stupendous. The views back across the harbour mean you must do this walk if you are in Sydney. It's photos not to be missed.

Simply wonderful. Simply wonderful. If you're a plant lover and you're not familiar with the plant species of this part of the world this is the place to visit, stroll, relax, picnic and/or take pictures.

One of the highlights of Sydney. I enjoyed the old British feel combined with native plants emerging onto the Harbour. The "chair" was great and the walk into the Opera House was special. I recommend as a way to approach the harbour.
a really nice walk. love this walk along the harbour. On a nice sunny day especially. The gardens are always well taken care off and there is plenty to see
Perfect walk. Lots to see, can be a leisurely walk or hard core. Lovely spot. Try the train too very informative and can get on and off.

Beautiful.. Amazing walk. Nothing better on a summers day and when you reach botanic gardens just lay in the sun and relax and take in the scenery.
Not a hard walk mostly flat, suitable for all ages.
Beautiful Walk. Unfortunately we were there in Sydney's winter time so the botanic garden was not in full bloom. I would still recommend a stroll thru it because it was beautiful.

Enjoyable walk aweay from the crowds. This is a nice leisurely walk after the crowds at Circular Quay. There are joggers and a tourist train but enough room for you to enjoy the view towards Mrs Macquarie's Chair. The plants and trees are beautifully kept with plaques explaining a little about them. Plenty wild life to see, too.You will get some fantastic views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House together and also the CBD. Handy to use the panorama function on your camera to get them together. Near the end of the walk it gets quite busy as there are places to park buses of tourists. However, on the way there you can hear the water lapping against the rocks and enjoy some time to think.

a wonderful walk amongst tall and lush trees. Sydney is one of the world's greenest city with a beautiful bay, beaches and parks.You can walk between Hyde Park - the Botanic Garden and the Opera House in the middle of a quiet and beautiful park.

Best Bit Of Sydney. The Botanical gardens are free to go to & wonderful. They have a little train that goes round with a guide who is very informative. This was brilliant as I am disabled, so I managed to see more of the gardens.
Pleasant walk. Nice pleasant walk, lots to look at, nice gardens and plants. A cool place to get some fresh air on a warm day, and to escape the hustle and bustle of business district

Wear a pair of comfy walking shoes and enjoy. Everytime I do this walk, I have to pinch myself to take in the splendour of the Opera House and walk along this lovely harbour walk to the Botanic Gardens. When you get to the Gardens, look out for the black Eels in the ponds - kids love them! Glorious!
Enjoyable Walking. A great city to walk around and this is a nice flat walk with lots of lovely scenery with all the flowers and birds and of course the flying foxes in the Botanic Gardens.

Take a camera. The Opera House is most recognisable building in Sydney and an icon of Australia's. The design of the building, has been acclaimed worldwide as an architectural icon of the 20th century. It is worth it.
Great Place to Visit. Just a beautiful place to walk thru and admire. We were fortunate to have great weather the day we visited.
first class. Excellent walk from sydney opera house to macquaries chair for terrific views.great gardens to walk through in a couple of hours

Take a walk on the "soft" side. Starting at the opera house, dead centre on Sydney harbour...experience the bridge, overseas ships if you are lucky....a ferries, tourists, food, and a champagne.....now it's time to follow up with a strol thru the beautiful song gardens, with plants unique to Australian, ponds, sandstone walls, the harbour just to your side the whole way... ..the cafe for lunch or coffee..lay on the grass, bask in the sun...you will love it !!

Building up the suspense. We walked trough the gardens towards the Opera House. Walking this way it will build up the suspense of actually getting there. Along the way you get some pretty nice views of the house and a lot of picture opportunities. The Gardens are more than nice enough to spent a lot of time in. Once you get to the Opera house, it does not let you down. It is absolutely amazing. I would absolutely recommend this walk
Stunning views. The iconic Sydney Harbour on a sunny day plus the magnificent Botanic Gardens. Nothing is better worldwide.

A morning walk~. If you have more time to walk around, can walk from Opera House to Botanic Gardens. I was there in April, i feel fresh when i reach Botanic Gardens. It was a fantastic garden that you would not want to miss it out. Pay a visit if you have some time in Sdyney.
Fantastic. Harbour walks do not get much better than this folks. Fantastic views of the gorgeous Sydney Harbour AND agreeably flat and easy.
ICONIC. As with Sydney Harbour and The Rocks the Opera House is in walking proximity and a must see if visiting Sydney. Plenty of restaurants and sights.

Great walk. Easy casual walk through the Botanic Garden provides a lovely way to travel while alternating between harbour and city views.
One could easily spend hours in the park without walking along the same path.

easy walk around a lovely green space. this is an easy walk for all ages..watch out if starting from opera house with building works currently. park in Art Gallery road and walk to/from Opera House. detour in Botanic Gardens to see the convict stone wall and the gardens enclosed there - especially in spring with wisteria etc.

A Pleasant Waterside Stroll. It's easy to get to Circular Quay and the Sydney Opera House.Once at the Opera House, make your way across the square in front, keeping the water to your left and you will find a footpath that goes in to the Botanical Gardens.I suggest an early start if it's a fine day, it can get pretty crowded along the path.Once in the Gardens, there are a variety of plants of course, and some special areas.I particularly like Palm Grove, the Succulents Garden, the Glass Pyramid and the Medicinal Herbs.When you need lunch or a snack, head for the Restaurant/Kiosk in the middle of the Gardens for a pie, hot dog or fries or else to the restaurant above for a more luxurious meal.If you love nature but can't go bush, take a blanket and your own food then do a picnic in the shade of the huge spreading Oak trees.You will enjoy your day!

Beutiful Iconic Landmark!. My second time visiting Sydney and the Iconic Opera House, and it wont be my last! We were here this year for the light festival and saw the Opera House all lit up at night! It is a MUST see, and all the pictures and brochures do NOT do it justice!
Awesome. Beautiful walk - wonderful way to encounter the Operal House. Great place to take pictures. Clean and well kept

Short, but nice walk. This was my daily walk to work and can't really complain about it. The Botanic Garden is really nice and the people hive a lot of effort to keep it clean and tidy. Perfect on a sunny day. Watch out the opening times for the Garde. Might close sooner than you thin :)

Enjoyable walks and sights!. We walked from the Government House along the river to the Opera House, catching views of McQuarrie's seat across the water and enjoying the views of the Opera House and the Sydney Bridge grow larger and larger. The gardens are quite 'naturalized' which is a welcome change from the urbanized setting.
fantastic. nice views and birds eveywhere;;;also a nice walk to continue to go to the backpackers hostel the Elephant
Lovely!. This city uses its water to the fullest. Everything around the harbor is lovely! Take the time to enjoy the walk.

Great walk amidst serene surroundings. The botanic gardens nestle into the side of the Opera House and are definitely worth a look. If time does not permit then at least the walk along the foreshore is worth it. It gives a very different perspective of both the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.Instead of being buildings amonst a city-scape they now are surrounded by the greenery of beautiful parks and gardens. Certainly a perspetive you do not want to miss.
Beautiful Vista. It was a lovely overcast day. Ideal for walking and the trees and plants were I feel at their best. Enjoyable stroll to the Opera House. Just perfect!

Pretty Gardens. I done a tour of the opera house which i really enjoyed, so interesting. Beautiful building! shame I didn't manage to see a performance but there is always next time i guess! gardens are beautiful!
Beauty in the city. Loved the walk from the Opera House to the Botanical Gardens and then down to Chinatown for a fabulous feed!

One of the nicest Botantical Gardens in this part of the World. Thoroughly enjoyed a two hour tour of the gardens and our short tour of the opera house. Would love to come back for a performance. The gardens are huge and highlight just about every plant and tree grown in Australia. Lots blooming in Janauary and this is an absolute must vist when in Sydney ething 3 s
Lovely View. yes i like it it was amazing.Sight seen of Opera house from the Botanic Garden was awesom.Greenery and scenuic view of water was great.Really want to go again
Fantastic walk. Whenever I stay in Sydney I try to do this walk. It has amazing views and scenery. You cannot help but relax on the walk.
Botanic gardens. Easy walking and very peaceful when we stopped to have our picnic. Enjoyed identifying the plants and marvelling at the semi tropical plants.

opera house. the opera house is a great site to behold and the botanic gardens right next to it is sublime and peaceful and of course you have the ocean and harbour try going out in a yacht its something eles

very nice walk. The botanical garden is very nice for families with kids, as the kids enjoy running and playing, moreover the trees are full with colorful birds and parrots which makes it very interesting to everyone. Also, it is an amazing location for photo shooting with both the water and the Sydney opera at the background.

The Opera House to Botanic Gardens. A beautiful walk from the Opera House and into the Botanic Gardens. A flat walk with Sydney Harbour on one side and the beautiful gardens on the other. A chance to see private yachts and ferries and the magnificent trees and the flowers in the gardens. A good place to relax.
Stunning. Would recommend this to experience the many sights, smells and sounds Sydney has to offer. Adored the Botanic Gardens-a delight!

Beautiful Setting, Helpful Staff. This is such a peaceful place in the middle of a busy city. The manicured lawns coupled with the variety of Australian and exotic plants and trees is just delightful, and when it is all placed on the shore of the magnificent Sydney Harbour, the stress just flows away. I love the formal Herb garden, and with the various places to sit and relax the day could pass you by in no time.

Beautiful Gardens and Harbour Views. The walk starts just east of the opera house and winds around through the botanical gardens offering magnificent views of Sydney Harbour, the Opera House itself, the downtown skyline and most of all the botanical gardens themselves.It's a pleasant easy and refreshing walk and there is no admission fee.

Great relaxing walk. This place an amazing tranquil feeling just mingling with the crowd and strolling along looking at the boats on the harbour, ferries coming and going continually, places to eat along the boardwalk, or just enjoy the stroll through the gardens.

Views of Sydney. Did this walk after the Botanical Gardens tour so started from Macquarie's point and walked back to the Opera House. Flat walk with views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. A relaxing way to enjoy some of Sydney's famous landmarks

Wonderful structure and amazing gardens.. The Opera House was amazing - looking over the Harbour and organised tours are available. The Botanic Gardens are fantastic walking around them with views of the beautiful harbour and so much to see, very well planned.
Spectacular harbour. The walk, which is easy, starts with the beautiful harbour and ends in the gardens which are well signposted and lead onto the Domain and the Art gallery.
Flat walk, accessible to all. Keep left and watch out for the joggers but it is flat and the path is wide so you have plenty of space. Great views across the harbour.

An oasis from the busy centre. The walk around the Opera house to the Botanic garden walk is a beautiful escape from the city centre. It has paths through and around with beautiful trees, plants and wild life and skirts the harbour where you can take the most fantastic shots of the Sydney harbour bridge and Opera House. I spent a lot of my time walking and taking in the atmosphere here whilst waiting for my husband's meetings to end over three days. There is a small restaurant and cafe in the centre where I enjoyed to sit outside and enjoy the wildlife mooching around.
Opera House. A must in Sydney . We took the one hour tour , which we found pricey at A$37 each but very informative .

Picturesque. Very relaxing park with so many species of the fauna and flora.Kiosks with snacks available.Government House interesting,Conservatorium of Music close by and walking distance to Martin Pl.for shopping.

Sydney-siders do it, why don't you?. Sydney-siders are fortunate to have beautiful parks easy walking distance in their city-- Hyde Park and the Royal Botanical Gardens as the largest--and they make use of them for weddings, bridal pix, family get-togethers, sun-bathing (in season). The parks themselves are beautiful - but it's also fun just people-watching and engaging the wonderful Aussies in conversation (which they love to do). This walk shows off the Botanical Gardens, the harbor area and gives a special view of the Opera House from Mrs. McQuarie's Chair. Not strenuous, just enjoyable.

Scenic walk. The Opera House to Botanic Gardens Walk is breathtaking as one sees the beautiful Sydney Harbour and also gets a good view (photo shot) of Harbour Bridge. The walk is non strenous and pleasant and best down late afternoon or early evening to be able to watch the sunset

Beautiful and tranquil. It is a very easy walk from the Opera House steps around the botanical gardens. In addition, visits the tropical gardens in the centre as you walk through. Lots of interesting paths to follow with great views of the Sydney harbour. Lots of seating, toilet facilities and a couple of small coffee shops.

Nice walk on a nice day.. Lots to see out on the Harbour or in the gardens themselves, throw a picnic blanket down and just relax or walk all the way to Woolloomooloo and the great pubs and restaurants around the finger wharf.

Lovely relaxing walk away from the crowds. We started from Hyde Park, past the Art Gallery and Mrs MacQuaries Chair and on to Circular Quay. A lovely walk on a sunny day, and an escape from the crowds.

Gardens, harbour views, lunch and a ferry ride. Ferry from Manly. A walk around the Opera House. A stroll to Mrs Macquarie's Chair. Lunch in the Botanical Gardens Cafe(or you might like a picnic). A walk through the gardens and return to Circular quay via Government House. Sydney Harbour surrounds this venue and the views are magnificent. . Other attractions near by Nsw Art Gallery,Mitchell Library.
Beautiful Sydney. Stunning views of the harbour and Opera House, peaceful easy walk through the gardens. Early morning is stunning and best of all it's free!
Spectacular views all along the walkway. Short walk or long walk - perfect to sightsee, photograph the sights or exercise. You see so much on foot and this is the perfect place to do it.

worth it!. Nice views, relaxing atmosphere, stress free!!. yiu can take amazing pictures from every corner, ontop of that the gardens are really nices and there are some birds around that are quite funny and cute (ducks and the like)

I love it. Take the tour by walking, jogging or using the small train when it is available. If you choose walking be sure to take with you food and beverages because the distance to the nearest restaurant will be an hour or so.
Best walk. In the sun it is fabulous. Great views and very relaxing. Lots to take in and enjoy. One of the best things to do if a visitor to Sydney
Lovely experience. I've run this route many times and despite the pain, have managed to enjoy the sunshine on my back, the water alongside and the scenery.

Beautiful!. I was staying close by the Opera House and ventured along the sea wall for the walk, and it was lovely! So many beautiful plants and statues, and great for bird watching. It rained the whole walk but it was still so worth it! Stunning views of the garden and harbor.
Botanic Gardens were beautiful. You will need a couple of hours to walk the Gardens and take in all they have to offer. Spring time (Sept, Oct, Nov) is best!
Great tour. We had the great opportunity to see 2 practices while visiting the Opera house. What luck! The tour guide was helpful and friendly
Beautiful. Peaceful walk close to the city. Walk to the Opera House via the shops and return home via the Botanic Gardens Walk with water views of Sydney Harbour and Mrs Macquarie's chair.
Don't get mown down!. Lovely walk but you may get mown down by the hords of joggers keeping fit on the pathway! Go anyway for some great views.

Beautiful. Lovely first day in Sydney and what better than to have a pleasant stroll through these beautiful gardens. Very well kept, lots of well -p-placed seats to enjoy the view over to the Opera House and beyond. Idyllic.
A bit overhyped. Much better botanic gardens in Brisbane and Melbourne. I did the walk through the grounds, was pretty underwhelmed really.
Lovely Garden. Loved the garden, plants, flowers and birds and a few spiders as well. The weather was in Sydney was perfect, There was a wedding in a gazebo in the garden. It was just beautiful.

picturesque. Loved the fresh air, varieties of flowers and plants, and the train ride around the gardens. Lots of people between the Opera House and the Gardens. There is a fee to the gardens, however.
Unique. I love the unique arquitectural design, the outside bar is an excellent idea and I loved the atmosphere

Just great as Sydney is😊. +City Center
+Waterfront with beautiful view on the bay and City skyscrapers
+Green and peacefull
+Perfect to get some rest
+Its for free
-Bikes are not welcome in the cove
Must see. If you are visiting Sydney make sure you dedicate a day to walk around the opera house and the botanic gardens. cafe are nearby and a short walk from the train station

Beautiful walk through amazing gardens!. We were just stunned with the beauty of the Botanic Gardens. I'm not always crazy about garden walks but this was beautiful. Sprawling greens with wild cockatoos screeching! Loved it!
NICE AND VERY SCENIC. The walk is very nice and scenic. You will feel very relaxed and will enjoy the walk. The view of the harbour bridge is very nice and the water looks very blue and nice .....

Best of the City, the Harbor, and the Gardens. First off, the gardens are huge. Don't expect a quick spin. There are the typical botanic study areas. And, when we visited, there was a display of botanic illustrations. Continue through the park to Mrs. McQuarrie's bench (really a carved rock) for great views of the harbor. Then continue toward the Opera House for the best views of the Opera, the Harbor Bridge, and Circular Quay.

Amazing view. We started our walk from Opera house to Mrs. Macquarie's chair. The view of the harbour is magneficient and the garden itself is amazing especially on a bright sunny day. Flora lovers gonna love this place. We took our time strolling forth and back to the Sydney Opera House, spent almost 4 hours in the Garden
Great walk. Fun and relaxing walk through a beautiful setting. Botanical garden is beautiful and serene. Recommended

Relaxing and peaceful walk. The view was amazing. I visited the Botanic Garden first. End of the garden was the Mrs Macquarine Point, offered best view of Opera House. It's really peaceful and relaxing

Lovely walk making you feel miles from the city. I do this walk as often as possible as it is a great way to get out of the city (even though you are only minutes away). Lovely to walk along the harbour and see the ducks who enjoy paddling around Farm Cove, enjoy the Botancial Gardens.Get your heart pumping and do the stairs at Mrs Maquaries Chair a couple of times.From here I often walk down to Woolloomooloo along the wharfs, check out all the amazing boats and yachts moored there and do the other set of stairs (Stairs of Death-112 stairs) into Potts Point.

Green space in downtown Sydney. The Opera House is an architectural masterpiece but it sure looks dirty up close. The Botanic Gardens next door is another of Sydney's magnificent green spaces and well worth admiring in itself.
