However weekday lunchtimes it becomes overrun (pun intended) with joggers and wannabe runners from the city who believe they have a divine right to barge through anyone who has the nerve to be in their way in true Aussie macho fashion.Other than that - recommended.

Great After a Long Flight. This was one of the best things we did in Sydney. After a long flight from Florida it was great to just go out side and get fresh air. We stayed at the Shangri La and it was in an excellent location. Walking distance to everything.We started with the harbour down to the Opera House. Once you are done viewing the Opera house the botanical gardens are at the base. It is unbelievable how many different types of exotic birds you will see along this walk. The grounds of the Botanical gardens are absolutely beautiful. I am not much of a city person wo this was perfect plus you are by the ocean though out the walk as well.

Better as a run.. Something done by locals (ie running) and tourists (usually walking).If you like your exercise and are staying in the city, make sure you include it in your itinerary. If you also like swimming, keep on going from Lady Macquarie's chair and have a swim a Boy Charlton pool.Total loop of Opera House to Lady Macquarie's Chair then past NSW Art Gallery to Macquarie Street then down to Opera House is about 7km

Takes you away. Walking through Sydney Botanical Gardens from the top of Macquarie Street takes one away to another world . There is a cafe in the midst heading down towards the water but make sure you get there before 3.30 - 4-00 pm as it closes early {Sadly} ! I particularly like the Rose Garden especially if it is in bloom . You need walking shoes and take drinking water . Like all public gardens it is divided into sections so read a little about the layout to assist you in viewing the parts that you might be interested in . One cannot go wrong w parkland open skies and The Sydney Opera House .

easy walk. It was a great walk and enjoyed the scenery. There was a lot of people traffic so you just had to watch where you are going but thats what being a tourist is all about. The people were friendy enough and were willing to take photos of us when we needed a couple photo.

Wonderful harbour, pity about the cafe in the botanic gardens. There is no view like the Opera House, Harbour bridge and the foreshore of Kirribilli and Cremorne across the water. Sail boats, sunshine and ferries make a busy backdrop to the short but enjoyable walk to the Botanic gardens. Until recently, the gardens were home to thousands of bats, amazing to see, but sometimes the huge numbers could be unnerving. In their wisdom, the park authorities have chased them away leaving the gardens more peaceful and possibly more hygienic but less entertaining. Pity they can't do something about the café. Apparently, if you can afford the classy restaurant that shares the same area, you are free from the predations of the local fauna but, if you sit outside to eat the rather mundane offerings of the café then beware birds of every size that will eat your food, defecate on your table and generally make what could be an enjoyable experience something of a nightmare. Food left on table by customers is slow to be cleared allowing the birds a messy field day - it's a big turn off and the area feels decidedly unloved.
Best way to see the Opera House. Best way to see the Opera House:take your BYO beer to the Botanic Gardens, pick a spot and watch the sun pass by the Opera House.

Relaxing after a long flight. Coming from winter in Canada this was definitely a relaxing and enjoyable walk after a long flight. The path runs along the water front to the Botanic gardens which are lovely and full of colour. We stopped for a coffee there before our stroll back to the Opera house and main harbour area.
Lovely Gardens. The botanical gardens are beautiful with lots to see but the sight of the Harbour Bridge behind the Opera House from the water edge must be among the best you will see.

Peace and Tranquility. The Opera House is stunning but very busy until you reach the other side and start walking towards Botanic Gardens. Something for everyone here - stunning plants, magnificent trees, flowers, stunning cacti and succulent gardens, colourful birds, excellent facilites (kiosks, loos etc), clean and well cared for.
Botanic Garden walk. Beautiful garden and numerous variety of plants and trees. Nicely plan and enough amenities to public.

I first saw the Opera House from the Garden walk, a WOW moment!. When I first spotted the Opera house I was just amazed at how large and beautiful this structure was as well as it's magnificent location. I was not expecting to see it from the garden, but how nice a majestic garden then this wonderful landmark. Thank you Sydney.
Fabulous. Enjoy some of the best scenery you can find. You can use this walk to get from the Opera House to the Art Gallery. I can't think of a better way to get between the two,

Simply stunning views. We started our walk at the Opera House, which is just a magnet for photographers, but eventually dragged ourselves away and set off through the park. It covers quite a large area but is well signposted and there are lots of places where you can stop, grab a seat and just take in the views whether scenic or the flora on display. During our walk we encountered a wedding party, lots of families having picnics, some beautiful trees & shrubs and we also stumbled over an outdoor cinema which the locals tell us is famous for being rained on!We elected to follow the coastal path round to Mrs Macquarie's chair which was apparently carved in 1810 for the then governor's wife to sit on to view the harbour, and then headed inland to the Art Gallery of NSW which is well worth a visit. The walk took us about an hour but that includes stops to take photos and rest in the shade from the fierce sun. it was a lovely peaceful interlude in what is a busy, bustling city.

The best walk in Sydney. It is the best walk that you can do in Sydney, you enjoy Botanic Gardens, where you can sit down, see the sea, the harbour, the bridge and the Opera, relax on the grass. It is highly recommended!Moreover, when we went there a sailing competition there was, it was so interesting, too!
Lovely relaxing walk. Nice break away from all of the touristy spots. A gentle stroll around the gardens with some fantastic trees and shrubs and also many species of birds.

Secret sydney walk. The opera house in an imposing features and aside from the fantastic architecture there is an internationally standars choice of symphonys, opera, drama and ballet all year round. Then walking through the botanic gardens from the opera house you wander past the Governor Generals house and through the many sections of the gardens to choose from, tropical plants, desert plants, formal gardens and australian native plants and trees. A great place to take a picnic or sandwich and sit on the grass for lunch and watch the people and birds. The marvel is that it is all free.

Easy walk. Love this walk even though walking isn't easy for me! You can move at your own pace, plenty to see around you and the outlook is stunning. Lots of seating on the way, which is so important for so many of us.
Nice Walk, Good Location. The walk was very pretty. You get a good view of the bridge when you enter and the gardens are lovely. Its rather quiet inside, which is great for a Botanic Gardens Walk.

A Lovely Walk through the gardens. If you are heading to the Sydney Opera House, get there by walking through the Botanical Gardens. The entrance is free. The paths are paved and the signage is excellent. They have a lovely cafe for lunch or there are plenty of benches along the water where you can enjoy a picnic lunch.

Relax, learn, enjoy. What better way to learn about our flora than an outing to the Botanic Gardens and it is FREE. Great fun for children during the school holidays. Lots of activities, the train ride is especially good for the less mobile.
Easy but interesting. The trees are interesting, not difficult, views of harbour nice. I liked the trees, the ease of walking and the views
A great little Walk.. Perfect for all ages & just a few steps away from the hustle & bustle of the city. A must do experience as it encompasses so much of all that is worth seeing in Sydney.
Close to everything. Grab takeaway and sit with others in park. Fabulous views of opera house, bridge, you can even get a photo of both if you wander five minutes along the pathway

A favourite of mine. Love strolling around the surrounds of the Opera house and taking in the atmosphere. You can get great photos. Clean, fresh air, green grass and beautiful gardens. The Opera house itself is one of a kind and shouldn't be missed. An elegant place to see great shows. There is parking under the opra house surrounds. Also circular key where the ferries are is within walking distance as are lots of cafes and restaurants.
A memorable experience!. An easy walk for most with the backdrop of the stunning harbour, Opera House and gardens. All beautifully looked after and clean with no litter!

royal botanical garden. the garden is well maintained with several species of plants , ferns, water plants etc.from botanical garden you do get view of several sky scrapers, Sydney harbor,Opera house.The small train ride is also pleasant.

A liitle bit of heaven. Iconic Opera House is a must, but just around the corner are the Botanic Gardens, away from the madding crowd and an oasis of peace and tranquility. Spectacular variety of plants and birds of all colours and sizes. Would quite happily let it be my final resting place!

Peace with little people. Boats, running around the opera house steps and the the train through the Botanic "please walk on the gass" Garden. Wats not Tolbert? Rainy cold dat? Duck into the Greenhouuses and the the asstae a
Ibarra - toilets, cafe, history and some fine exhibits. Good gift shop, too.

Fancy a walk in the park ??. Then this is the perfect plz e to do it......with Sydney harbour as your back drop, what more do you need?So many beautiful flowers & birds to see, fantastic food & coffee or sit in the sun watching the world go by, your choice really. It's somewhere that is soo totally relaxing you can escape from the day to day, even just for a little shoe :))

Opera House to Botanic Gardens Walk. Like tourists - you will see plenty on this walk. Would have to be one of the top tourist walks in Sydney. Fabulously easy - your 101 year old grandmother could do this before breakfast. Flat as a tack with plenty of rest spots. And right on the water. The further you walk the more of the Gardens you see. The Gardens offer guided tours in a train or similar. Haven't tried this but would recommend if you want to find out something about the Gardens.

gorgeous location. A simply beautiful walk on a sunny day along the harbour edge. Take a good look at the lovely plants in the gardens. Walk to Mrs Macquaries chair on the point and enjoy a picnic looking at harbour. This is so close to the business district and tourist attractions and doesn't take long to enjoy properly. If you have more time walk to Art gallery.

DON'T STOP AT THE OPERA HOUSE!. After you have had a look at the Opera House and the excellent view of the Harbour Bridge, continue walking around the foreshore to Mrs Macquarie's Chair (small headland) then follow the road up to the NSW Art Gallery (free, except for special exhibitions). Bus available from Art Gallery back to Queen Victoria Building in central CBD.

Must do. I have done this many times, and my enthusiasm is undiminished. Although the surrounds of the Opera House are being refurbished/upgraded, there is little impediment to walkers. The Botanic Gardens are lovely - and so close to the CBD. Views from just about anywhere along this walk are magnificent (one can descend into cliches to describe them).

The walk from one fantastic place to another. I liked everything. There is nothing to dislike. The Opera House is a wonderful work of art with endless entertainment and the Botanic Gardens are beautiful with flowers all the year round.

A lovely way to entertain your visitors.. The Opera house visit is very Historic with it's construction, uniqueness and beauty. Ofcourse you want to follow up with a concert and that gorgeous purple carpet. It is so romantic against the shimmering water at night.The serenity of the Botanical Gardens which has a railway and duck pond top off a day visit to the Opera house and is cheap. Very important when you want to see 'everything'.

Opera House Tour is a must!. The opera house tour was one of the highlights of our trip. It is a spectacular building just to view but it becomes more interesting when you realize the history behind the building. Of interest as well is the concerts and activities that are held in this building. This tour is unforgettable!

A Perfect Stroll. Unfortunately, there was some construction work going on when we were there but even so, the views from this iconic spot are wonderful. The gardens are at once busy with locals and visitors and peaceful, being surrounded by nature.
Highly recommend it. Really relaxing and make sure you hop on the mobile train that takes you all around Botanic Gardens.

Walk in gardens. Took a friend to see the Opera House then walked through the Botanic Gardens to have lunch in their cafe. Beautiful gardens with lots of wildlife to see and so quiet it's hard to believe you are in the centre of Sydney CBD.
Opera house walk. Something to do with time to enjoy. The gardens are beautiful and the opera house is so grand. I do the walk every few months as I love it so much.
Lovely. A rewarding walk, with outstanding views and beautiful lush surroundings. Quite easy and can be made more hilly if you wish
Must for any visitors. in about half hour you'll see the best part of Sydney, add another half hour for the Rock and that is it, move on to Bondi/Manly for a beach escapade

A very nice picnic & stroll park. I have lived in Sydney for 15 years however never bothered to go inside the park until 2014 as I thought yeah yeah yeah .. All parks are the same ... I was so wrong ... This is a beautiful paradise ... Pack a lunch .. Take with you for atleast half a day or there is a very nice cafe in there which is not expensive. There is also a hop on hop off mini train in the park which is fun for kids and adults likewise.Definitely worth a visit .. Well done to the management and the Gardners
Walk in the sunshine. Iconic. Could not be bettered. This is an easy walk for all and has stupendous views. The gardens are glorious too.

Beautiful. Beautiful walk with stunning views. Walk in by the opera house and then into the beautiful botanic gardens. Lots of lovely colourful flowers and trees and you may see the cockatoos and lorikeets. The cockatoos are likely to come quite close and want to get friendly if you offer them food. If you walk right around you will get a great view back to the bridge and opera house. This a great vantage point for the NYE fireworks,

This walk is Stunning. A really great way to take in the Sydney Bridge and get in touch with a piece of Sydney Nature while still in the big city really nice day , took about 2 hours to walk stopped and had a picnic
Beautiful City Views. The park is a wonderful first look at the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House. Lovely grounds, nice places to sit.

Live the city. The Sydney Opera house is one of the worlds most stunning buildings, in side it seems a lot bigger than it really is. The Royal Botanic Gardens is absolutely beautiful and well maintained and there are many secrets throughout the gardens as it is also a centre for horticulural rsearch.
Beautiful walk. Of course don't miss the opera house in Sydney. It is gorgeous. The botanical gardens are lovely and a quieter way to return to the city without all the crowds.

Great Walk Best views. The Botanic Gardens are a lovely walk and a must if in Sydney, not only are the gardens beautiful but the view of the Harbour and the Sydney Opera House from within the Gardens is a must.

Lovely walk. We did this walk one night at sunset and it was brilliant. The scenery of the Botanic Gardens on the right and the ocean on the left can't be beat. We walked all the way through to Mrs. Macquerie's Chair and that is definitely the best place to get great views of the Opera House and Bridge with the city skyline off to the left! It took about a half an hour walking at a brisk pace to get to Mrs. Macquerie's Chair. To get the best light for pictures it would be best in their summer months (December etc) to go before midday at sunset or the glare back will be too great for pics.

Beautiful walk amongst magnificent scenery. Walk past the striking opera house and along the sea wall all the way to Lady Maquarie's Chairbb. Spectacular views of the Harbour and passing boats. You will often see a yacht race. The gardens are beautifully kept and are a fabulous place to take a picnic or you can buy food there at the restaurant or the more casual cafe. Icecreams and drinks are available. There are several ponds where children can feed the ducks. A great place to take a blanket and relax in the shade and take in the beauty of the park and its gardens. A must when in Sydney. And it's free. Easy walk with a pram.
Gorgeous gardens. We loved the beautiful lush flowers in the garden and were impressed with the huge, perfectly shaped fig trees that were hundreds of years old.

Birds, birds and more. The walk around here is offered some of the best bird viewing of the whole time we were in Sydney . We came across a woman who evidently feeds the Sulphur-crested Cockatoo every night. They landed right on her shoulders. What a surprise. Need to find the trees in the park they frequent, cannot tell you exactly where they are. Have fun!!

Botanic gardens. This is a lovely walk after viewing the Opera House. You can also visit Government House at no charge as it is set into the grounds but check opening times first. The trees and sculptures in the park are lovely and the view is well worth it.
One of the most speculator views in Sydney. The gardens are nice but also offer a great view of the harbour. It's a nice walk from here to the city.
Great stroll. Look at the pictures, and you'll see what they saw. Did this as our first walk in Sydney and would highly recommend it.

Great views of the opera house. The garden was lovely and peaceful but check opening times of the House as they are not the same as advertised in the garden. Great walk all the way round to the Dock and to Kings Cross area too.

Beautiful gardens - befriend the cockatoos!. My partner and I stayed in Sydney for 8 nights in February 2014, just outside the Botanic Gardens. We did a lot of walking around the harbour and up into the Botanic Gardens, and it's a lovely way to relax in the city. The walk from the world-famous Opera House up into the gardens winds around the coast past Mrs Macquarie's Chair (a carved rock on the point of the peninsula offering great views over the harbour). The point itself can get a bit busy with tourists, but the gardens are so expansive that you will find plenty of breathing space. It's also a very popular spot for joggers.You'll spot loads of wildlife on your walk - everything from rainbow lorikeets, cockatoos and kookaburras down to creepier species like life-curler and orbweaver spiders. The route is well sign-posted, and the signs have approximate walking times to other places of interest particularly within the gardens (we found that the times were generous, and at a comfortable walking pace we normally arrived a bit earlier than the estimate). You can also befriend the cockatoos if you have any bits of sandwich or bread on you - although caution is advised as the birds are gregarious with no fear of humans, so you may be swarmed if you start feeding them (and cockatoos have huge beaks, claws and mites!). You are openly encouraged to "enjoy" the grass of the gardens, which is very refreshing when so many parks these days order you to keep off the grass.Great way to enjoy some of the beautiful scenery around the busy harbour.

Balance nature and architecture.... Enjoy the opera house, hordes of people, dining & shopping at the quay.Walk around the bend and thru the gates...Enjoy the serene oasis of the Royal Botanic Garden.Walk without a purpose. Go ahead-- just wander around. Or take a seat: in the sun or under a tree, lots of grass, lots of benches.Take off the head phones. Listen and look. I think you're gonna like it.
Great views of the harbour and gardens. A lovely short walk from the Opera House through the botanic gardens. Great views of the harbour. Nice views of north shore too.

Pleasant walk...... The best place to take a photo of both the bridge and the Opera House . Great view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge from the Botanical Gardens. All the trees, plants and flowers are absolutely beautiful ....WE took the little train that goes around the botanical gardens. You can hop on and hop off the train and it's a perfect place to spend a day...
breath taking. Great up close,spectacular inside,fantastic views,great little bar and restaurant on site so you can look out over the water

Amazing walk. This is one of the best walk you can do in CBD. The walk easily take anywhere btw 30-45 mins and if you can walk all the way to Macquarie seat from where you can get the best view of Opera house and Sydney Bridge.

Wonderful walk. When in Sydney I always include a walk from the Opera House across to the Botanic Gardens. Wonderful scenery set off by the myriads of spectacular plants and trees to be visited on the way. Sometimes I just walk around the harbour to Wooloomooloo to sample one of Harry's pies at the Café de Wheels and then head back across the Botanic Gardens. There is an excellent cafe and restaurant in the centre of the gardens. Don't miss this excellent walk.

A must do Sydney event. Spend an afternoon doing this walk. The gardens are beautiful (though it's a shame they got rid of the bats) and the walk around this area for 2-3 hours is a must while in Sydney.
awesome. beautiful and the food was awesome.Beautiful day before our cruise.Ate at the resteraunt in the park and the food is all grown fresh on the property

Be prepared to fall in love with nature. From the iconic Opera House, you walk around the side and tada, you are in the Royal Botanic Gardens. The plantings are beautiful no matter the season and some of the tree specimens are the most unusual ones I have seen. There are also sculptures and a choo-choo for the little ones - its just quaint and carefree.

lovely cafe and beautiful garden. it is a family day out place.once you reach the opera house you will get tempted by the fragrance of coffee and cafes close by.we then walked down to the botanical gardens which was so uplifting for the soul.as it was so beautiful and well maintained -and such a wide variety of plants that we had not seen before.people were jogging,cycling.i think it is a good place for you to be a serious walker.was a very long walk but we took our time .worth a trip

Iconic Opera House, Botanic Gardens tranquil oasis. The Opera House is dramatic and much bigger than you think but I am a garden freak and adored the beautiful, vast, very well maintained Botanical Gardens

Breathtaking walk. This is a lovely walk. I walked from the Four Seasons Hotel to Mrs. McQuarries point and returned through the Botanic Gardens. Lots to see. Lovely wildlife, fabulous marine vistas and a very special walk. Highly recommended. Not hilly - quite flat, but not a short walk. I enjoyed it and the different perspective of Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. What a wonderful place to be.
Perfect walk to the Opera. We did this walk in reverse on the way to a night at the Opera. Perfect way to start the evening! Highly recommend it.

Beautiful Walk in Sydney. This was the most beautiful area of Sydney to me! Perfect area for a morning walk to leave the corporate and bug city environment behind....very clean, well landscaped and many photo opportunities.

Beautiful Sydney Harbour. Completes one the worlds most beautiful harbours with a great view of the harbour bridge. Then you can go for a walk through the botanical gardens to finish off a perfect day.
Opera house. The Opera house was beautiful. There was not a bad seat in the place. The view from there of the bridge a harbor is such a nice place to get some pictures.

Awesome gardens with great Opera House picture opportunities. We stayed in the Rocks area and went to the Gardens first to walk it and look at all it has to offer. Other days we jogged in the morning as did many other people. The Opera House is on the edge of the Gardens and as you get closer there are great pictures you can take for the "refrigerator" back home. You can tour the Opera House and/ or go to a show. We went to a show that was very good and the price reasonable. You must go here while in Sydney.

Lovely walk. We started from the Domain & walked through the Botanic Gardens to Mrs McQuairies Chair & back along the edge of the gardens to the Opera House. The Botanic Gardens are large & lovely, plenty of specimen trees & well labelled plants. Very relaxing area & worth a visit - or two

Stunning gardens and peaceful relaxing spot. Spent a very pleasant afternoon wandering and admiring the Botanic gardens. Saw lots of people relaxing on the lovely lawns. Such a beautiful peaceful spot so close to the Opera house.
Lovely walk. We walked this and the gardens in one day and you can certainly cover some miles! Well kept and well signposted this is a lovely way to see the area. The gardens are closed at 8pm.

Beautiful.... I have seen better gardens but with the juxtaposition of intense green grass, trees and planting against the ultra modern gleaming glass city scape is quite dazzling. When you reach the end of the headland you are met with the perfect view point of the bridge with all its passing traffic. Well worth picking up a picnic before entering.

A lovely walk but also perfect for a picnic!. Go for a walk and enjoy the views but also take the picnic blanket and some cheese and wine and plonk down for awhile and soak up the atmosphere and people watch
Great Place. Just a must. We walked through the Botanic gardens, through to Mrs Macquarie's chair, and then on to the Opera house.Have a beer at the Opera Bar.

Impressive To See. I really enjoyed having the opportunity to visit such an iconic place. The Opera House is fascinating to see. The Botanic Gardens are so clean, peaceful and beautiful. I spent a full day walking the area during a hot summer day. It was well worth it.

relaxing afternoon. The walk around after the visit to the Opera house was relaxing and the floral abundance was nice to the eye. It's a quiet oasis in Sydney and if you have an hour or two to spare worth the walk

bucket list,. Not sure where to start, The Sidney opera house, OMG, it's been on my bucket list for years, Then Here I am, standing on the steps WOO, tears running down my face, MY thoughts are , IM really here, in shock, what a magnificent building, (paint work looking a little tired) but who cares, From any view it's so beautiful, There are many theaters within the building, different shows going on, to fit every price point, Only small thing we didn't like was, when waiting to get into your show, everyone stands outside the theater doors, you can purchase a drink, on our show there was no assigned seating, so first come, But we were near the front of the line so got great seats,  Now the Botanic Gardens, What a wonderful time to spend a afternoon, The trees, flowers, buildings, nice eating areas, coffee shop with shop, we brought a couple of cool books within the gardens, Now the wild life there, The birds flying all around and don't care you are there, get up close. looking forward to going again, not sure when BUT I will,

Nice walk...not to be missed. The Botanic Gardens is a nice oasis in the big city and well worth a visit. The trees, flowers, etc. are very nice and the paths are very well kept. The old Government House is a nice detour, and when you end up at the end - a gorgeous view to the Opera is offered with nice photo option. Explore the whole area in a part of an afternoon.
A Must Do. Fabulous walk, plenty to see in the garden and along the coast overlooking the harbour to Mrs Macquerrie's seat
Great walk!. The walk has great vies and many spots to sit down and have a relaxing cup of coffee surrounded by city life. My friends and I loved it!

Beautiful. Both locations were gorgeous. I love the herb gardens and the government house. The grounds were amazing. The Opera House was gorgeous! We are going back to the Opera House for a private tour and champagne. Can't wait!

OK for a stroll. The opera house is cool and a must see. However they want a ridiculous amount for a 1 hour guided tour of the inside, The gardens are not the best in Australia or even Sydney for that matter but they are a nice walk.
Beautiful but had expected more.. I love the geometrics of the Opera House and it was so beautiful but the Botanic Garden was a dissapointment for me.

Botanical Gardens. Great view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge from the Botanical Gardens. There is a lot to see and do. You can jog, do yoga, have a picnic or just lie there and get some sun. It is also a great place to have wedding photos of the bridge and opera house. The Garden is very well maintained. All the trees, plants and flowers are absolutely beautiful. So tranquil.

Visit to the Opera House. Easy walk to Opera House - didn't go inside but we didn't feel we needed to. It was nice just to walk up the stairs and look at the harbour, the Botanical gardens, shops, buskers and people selling their goods around the area. There was a huge cruise ship in so it was very busy and also Austraila Day weekend.
Really good way to explore Sydney. Go from the iconic to an enjoyable stroll through the park, especially if you want to escape the main roads and shops of the city.

Beautiful walk. We did the Garden Walk to the Opera House. A very beautiful walk and some very interesting wildlife along the way, especially we're from the UK. We got recommended this walk because we were told its the best place to take a photo of both the bridge and the Opera House. They were right!.
Beautiful. An easy walk, gardens are beautiful, very well kept and viewpoints are exceptional, would highly recommend this walk

Must See. Definitely a must in Sydney. Lovely walk to the Opera House and a perfect place to have lunch is on the Opera House patio. Then continue around the Opera House and take the little train that goes around the botanical gardens. You can hop on and hop off the train and it's a perfect place to spend a day. The views of the harbour are wonderful.
The views........ A lovely walk - giving so iconic images of Sydney Opera House over the gardens. Gardens just past their best - but at the height of summer must be spectacular.

See the Opera House from Another Angle. Everyone knows the iconic view of the opera house from the harbor. We loved walking around the backside and heading to the botanical garden for a new view as well. You can see different details as it gets farther away and the trail winds towards the gardens.

Gentle stroll with water on one side and beautiful gardens (plus birds) on the other. I was amazed by the number of different birds in the gardens just 'strolling' around and not particularly bothered by people walking around. People are asked not to feed them so they clearly aren't waiting for food ...they just seem relaxed in 'their' park. It's a beautiful place to stroll around.There's a large pond in one area with small islands in the middle with various birds in the trees and quite large fish swimming around in the pond.Apart from the gardens, the whole area around the opera house is relaxing and the view of Sydney Harbour Bridge and the harbour itself is quite beautiful. At the weekends there is a street market in the streets nearby and this can be an added attraction ... storeholders were always happy to answer questions but not at all pushy.I can thoroughly recommend the walk and the street market.
For the views for sure. Great views and a very easy walk. This is the walk to take to get your snaps of the Opera house in the background. Gardens are pretty.

What a beautiful area to explore!. Definitely head over to the Opera House and Botanic Gardens area and do some exploring. The views are stunning. Get up close and personal with the famous Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge. These are iconic locations and cannot be missed. There is a great little bar, where you can have a drink and a bite to eat and take it all in. Not to be missed!!
Beautiful. We noticed people picking bananas and leaves from different plant species. I would say to all tourists leave the Australian fauna alone in the Botanical Gardens.

Beautiful walk. We enjoyed city walking and city Gardens. This was a beautiful walk. I was amazed at the number of bats in the trees.How lovely that such a major city has a beautiful garden area. We absolutely had a wonderful time

Breathtaking. The Opera House is a world known Australian landmark. However, visit to Sydney would not be complete without visiting beautiful Botanic Gardens; walking from the Opera House through well maintained lawns and garden with a breathtaking views. Don't miss it!

The best way to see the opera house. If you never have visited the opera house before and have seen it just by pictures, I really recommend you to do the botanic gardens walk towards the opera house, is amazing to end with the great opera house having seen the amazing nature of the botanic gardens.
amazing. Great walk, we did it on bikes. Not sure why you have to walk your bike for a long stretch. There were other places where you could ride that were much narrower and more congested.
nice walk. lovely walk along the harbour taking in the views, gardens were stunning, take a coffee in the café in the gardens

Best jet lagged experience ever. coming from the USA you will wake up early. Walk around the Circular Quay to the Opera House (you'll have it all to yourself) then continue into the Botanic Gardens. Don't be afraid of the wild Cockatoos, the Lorikeets or the Flying Foxes coming home to roost. Just enjoy the beauty. It's perhaps the most beautiful urban setting I've ever seen.
Fantastic spot in the heart of the city. Beautiful gardens. A wonderful place to spend an hour or a whole day. Little tip, walk through the gardens to get to the star art gallery.

Very picturesque.. Even for an Australian, I can see the hype with this little walk. The distance between the Opera House and the Botanical Gardens is not that far. The scenery is spectacular. There are always ferries and other water craft to look at, plus the gardens themselves.
Tranquil. Beautiful gardens. Well marked paths. Friendly people. Gets crowded after morning especially with cruise passengers.

Relaxing. Amazing to be able to enjoy this - Combine the Iconic Opera House, the Harbour and the beautiful Botanic Gardens all in ONE relaxing walk. It doesn't get much better than this - Very relaxing- the perfect Trifecta.

An afternoon in Sydney. We were staying near Darling harbour so we took the ferry under Sydney harbour bridge and then walked around the Opera House and through the Botanical Gardens.The gardens are very spacious and on a nice afternoon I cannot think of doing anything better.

Words Cannot Describe. We could have spent a whole day here and come back for more. The views across the water and the gardens fantastic then the Opera House, the explanation of it`s beginning to today, just too much fantastic

Go from Opera House to Botanic Gardens!. Worth it in every way, The opera house itself is stunning from every viewpoint, but the Botanic Gardens are a thing of sheer beauty, tranquil, serene, and flawless.
relaxing and breathtaking. excellent strall, relaxing and amazing view. Clean sky, very green and cosmopolitan surprise at the end

Spectacular. I have visited the gardens on a numerous amount of occasions and have wondered into something different each time. With an amazing variety of plants, shrubs and flowers to catch your eye, also embask in the local wildlife which roams the landscape. It has a mixture of good sunspots, ideal for sunbathing and cooler, shadier areas such as the cafe' area.The tourism point was also informative with the staff being very pleasant, informative and welcoming.The Botanical gardens is ideal and suited for all visitors as you can take a romantic stroll through to the Opera house or have a picnic with friends and family on the way. It also provides access to other areas such as Kings Cross.

Always great. The beauty of the harbour, the awesome views from the steps of the famous opera house and the lovely fresh botanical gardens. very relaxed full of beauty with harbour, bridge and city views. Whats not to like.
Beautiful walk. The gardens are beautiful and the walk is gradual and easy, so that all can do it, and with the Opera House as the backdrop there is most definitely the wow factor.
Great walk, very scenic. Loved this walk (see Royal Botanical Gardens review); we did it as part of visiting the Botanical Gardens and the Opera House and Circle Quay. All very enjoyable.

Don't Miss This. The Botanic Gardens are a beautiful place to walk, wind down from the busy Quay, have a picnic. We liked that the trees were labeled (we know nothing about trees, but it made it fun). Beautiful view of Harbour also. Do yourself a favor and put this on your list of things to do.

great walk for a day out. We walked here during one of our free day here in Sydney, you come through the beautiful gardens with all of the beautiful plants and flowers and trees. Great walk if you enjoy your photography like I do!

What a great walk or run. This is one of the most amazing places to walk or run I have found both at a break in a work day or a weekend. Fun for visitors especially but always worthwhile for locals and parking is not too bad considering

Windy walk. When we went for our walk it was very windy - well that's definitely not the mistake of the gardens but it influenced of course our perception.We have not been impressed by the gardens - the once in Melbourne were definitely nicer (not only because of the weather).The opera house is worth a visit and if you do not know what to do and want to avoid another shopping tour - just do the walk. It's nice

Beauty in the city!. We didn’t know what to expect as we walked from the Opera House to the Botanical Gardens. We were pleasantly surprised by the beauty of the landscape along with the wonderful views of the city. At one point, we were lost – looking at a map trying to find out how to get to “the chair” (which isn’t really a chair). A young woman (later explained she was a new employee) stopped us and helped us navigate our way. The people in Sydney are so nice!You should definitely check this out if you’re here. Pack your camera. We only wish it would have been opened early/later.

Again, must be done. You cannot go to Sydney and avoid the Opera House or Botanic Gardens. Such beautiful views. I'd plan to spend about 1/2 day walking between the bridge, the opera house, and the gardens. Get lunch either at the Opera Bar or at the Botanic Garden and take your time on a gorgeous summer day.

Must do. One of my favourite places in Sydney, no matter how many times I've visited! Has some of the best restaurants I've been to in Sydney, all ranging from high end to simple cafes. A visit to the Opera House is always a fun time.

Views, views, views.. This is an easy walk that could take you along the water or up through the Garden. It is a beautiful, leisurely walk that provides great opportunities for photos and relaxing. The Gardens are well maintained and just lovely. If you walk all the way to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair you will get great views of the Bridge and Opera House.

A beautiful walk full of variety. This walk takes you from the Opera House around Farm Cove and up to the Art Gallery. A walk around the foreshore provides views of the harbor and all its activities. Detours into the Botanical Gardens provide interesting views of rare and exotic plants situated among landscaped gardens. The walk is mostly flat and it is possible to walk for 3-4 km along the forefront and then up through the gardens to do a circular walk back to the Opera House.

If you do nothing else in Sydney, do this.. If you want to take in the wonderful views of Sydney harbour without crowds this is the one to do.We did this walk three times in four days and loved it.Photo stops every couple of minutes, just stop and click away. When you get tired of walking just crash on the grass and drink in the views.Don't just race round as it's to good for that!

Beautiful Park❤️. If you love nature, you would enjoy this. If not, just think of it as a shortcut from Potts Point to CBDMy walk started from the wharf point, and finished at the Opera House.I think with all the photo stops, scenery and all the botanical appreciation, took me and the fam around 1.5h!I honestly could spend a whole day at the garden ( if without all my other family member). I believe the garden is a great spot to read a book and unwind. It's just soooo calming! Or maybe I am a sucker for great clean Parks/Gardens❤️❤️

Just beautiful - glorious setting. The walk and gardens along the harbour are just beautiful, and made only the more glorious with the great weather Sydney usually enjoys.If you want to stroll leisurely and take in the wonderful sights and sounds of the gardens and harbour then this is the walk for you.

An Iconic walk, and take a picnic to enjoy in the Botanic Gardens.. This is a must do in Sydney. An easy flat walk (one of very few that are flat in Sydney), that winds around from the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens. Take a picnic and enjoy the view. It has to be one of the nicest walks in Sydney.

The best place. Other than in a helicopter ride to see the glory of the Opera House.
The gardens are beutiful and safe on all times.really worth a visit

Glorious sunshine, glorious views.. Easy walk with glorious sites at every point. The view of the Opera House against the Harbour Bridge is the classic photo shot! Mostly in the bright sunshine if you walk during the day, so do take a hat and sun lotion and water.
Beautiful gardens. Well worth walking round the Botanic Gardens they are excellent lots of seats if you want to stop for a rest & lots of shady areas if you take a picnic.

Excellent Visit and Walk. We went to a performance of the Snail and the Whale in the Opera house and thoroughly enjoyed this kiddies performance, had drinks outside with kiddies sandpit which they loved, and walked through the Botanic gardens to Hyde Park, Gardens are beautiful with interesting sculptures, a lovely day.

VERY PRETTY - CONFUSING GOVERNORS MANSION. This a lovely walk from the Opera House. Well kept gardens, nice ocean views and a hive of activity with joggers etc. At the centre is the splendid Governors Mansion which reminds me of a Scottish Castle. Here the directional signs are confusing for visitors and the opening hours are more restrictive than they should be given the high numbers of casual callers. Well worth a visit to this huge green area right in the City.

A walk to remember. This place is full of wonders round every corner! There are many interesting people that you will meet in this park along with many interesting animals also!Take a good amount of time to study this park!

A Wonderful Walk Especially From Botanical Gardens to Opera House. The botanical gardens and nearby Hyde Park offer a range of walks which match any city walks in the world. We fell in love with the whole area.We would strongly suggest not starting at the Opera House. Start in Hyde Park or the Gardens and make the Opera House your end point. Coming round the shore to see the Opera House framed by the Bridge has a real wow factor.

Great Walk, Beautiful scenery, a must do. My wife & I are 63. Maybe the kids will not enjoy this as much as we did but we took a long stroll from the Marriott hotel, to the gardens, to St. Mary's Cathedral, back through the gardens and then on to the Opera House. Very enjoyable.There are birds of an Aussie nature everywhere, park benches to rest, the botanical items were all labeled, a perfect set up. Walking from the gardens to the Opera House, we walked along the water for a bit and the house came into view. Perfect spot to take a selfie or have someone take your photo with the Opera House in the background.We walked completely around the Opera House and then, hit the crowds so the last 1/4 mile... sorry 400 meters, was hot and crowded. It was a weekend I believe. No matter, so well worth the walk.I suggest going in the morning before the Sydney sun has a chance to heat everything up.
A great walk with great views. Great views over to the opera house and the harbour bridge, a Sydney must do, and plenty to see in the gardens too
Absolutely Beautiful. We are Sydney siders and very often picnic on a beautiful afternoon with antipasto and wine. Find a shady tree, stretch out, read or nap.
Opera house, harbour and beautiful gardens. This is a beautiful walk and spectacular for views of the opera house, harbour bridge, boats in the harbour and the bay in general.

Lovely walk with the most stunning views. Beautiful scenery, lovely breeze. Walk right round to Mrs Macquarie's Chair and on up to AGNSW and back down to Circular Quay. Lots of photo opportunities. Several museums/galleries en route.

Perfect place to walk. It's very enjoyable to walk around with the spectacular view of the Opera house , nice breeze and upon arrival to the garden, what, a big relief. The lush greens , trees, plants and flowers , all very impressive. The best time to walk is first thing in the morning while the sun is not very strong . For tourist and overseas visitors if you're staying in Intercontinental hotel or Four Seasons hotel , then it's not very far to walk to the gardens. Lots and lots of food shops , coffee shops that offer the best coffee in town. Wear a comfy walking shoes, and don't forget your HD camera or GoPro to capture beautiful scenery of your visit.

A lovely walk for all.. We walked very slowly through the gardens from Hyde Park and had a meal on the way through at the cafe. We don't walk long distances normally but this was an interesting walk with different areas to walk through and ended up by the water and the opera house
excellent. An excellent escape from the hustle of the city yet still in the middle of Sydney. The gardens are at the foot of the opera house.

Great atmosphere!. By the time I arrived at the Botanic Gardens, it was late afternoon yet the atmosphere as I walked through the garden was very peaceful and inviting. There were birds bustling about and many trees, plants and flowers to see. I notice that there were couples strolling through the garden, making it a perfect place to have a good chat on a walk. I arrived at the other end of the garden and was greeted by the spectacular sight of the Opera House. The sun was setting and the Opera House became golden, making it a perfect opportunity for a photo. The sea breeze made me feel at ease as the summer heat soon disappeared. I haven't seen the Opera House from this side of Sydney before and I enjoyed the scenery and the landscape of buildings and water afar.
AWSOME opera house and gardens!. Both venues are convenient to one another and worth taking the time to visit. Loved the beauty of both.
Opera House and Botanical Gardens. A truly spectacular view walking along the sea path, beware of the lunchtime joggers though they out number the walkers !
A Must!. Its just one of the things you must do while in Sydney. Wonderful views of the Opera House and harbour, quiet, well kept gardens. Simply lovely.
refreshing!. I loved the walk and everything that has to do with it, it is refreshing with new views of the city and beautiful landscapes..:)

Walk Only-no Bikes. I know this is titled "walk" but there is so much more opportunity to ride around Sydney these days. I am actually surprised there isn't an option to ride on a shared path. We had ridden to the Opera House, trying to follow bike paths to get there-signage is hopeless to be frank! We had to carry our bikes down a huge lot of stairs, then try to find a bike park. In a tourist oriented place, why are signs also few and far between? Ok, so bike locked, off for a walk to see the Botanic Gardens. Nice views across the water, manicured gardens, but nothing special really. Free water fountain to refill water bottle was a plus as it was quite warm. Would I go again? No.

Beautiful Gardens - Photographer's Paradise. It is a beautiful walk after seeing the spectacular view of Opera house. As you enter the Botanic Gardens, you will find a great place to enjoy the greenery and see the unique trees and plants. You can walk or take a ride in a small train. You will get very good views of Opera house also. It is a photographer's paradise.
Spectacular Harbor Views. The walk is all along the harbor and new views are revealed at every turn. Our goal was to see Mrs. Macquaerie's chair and the walk made it fun.

The opera House and gardens. Its amazing to see the lovely shape of the Opera house, where its located for every one to see, the bars and different activities, people cultures its all happening around the water front. The gardens were beautiful with many different varities of trees plants etc.

From the Art Gallery to The Rocks - a lovely introduction to views of the city. After a morning at the NSW Art Gallery, I did this walk based on a suggestion from a family member, as a way to get to The Rocks for the afternoon. Really glad I did it! Was a lovely sunny Sunday. Lots of people out having picnics on the grass. Lots of shady opportunities for those who need a break from the sun. (Take your sunscreen with you though!) Lots of food and drink options around the Opera House and beyond as an end of walk break.
fab walk. do the walk through all the gardens first then onto Mrs Mcquarries point to get the views and lots of photo opportunities as you approach the opera house!

Nice and steady. We started our walk across the road from the cathedral, you can pick up a guide but we tended to just meander , if you can get up to mrs macquaries chair it's well worth the effort, you get a fantastic view , great for photo taking.

Just beautiful. I really enjoyed this walk, and actually I jogged through the Botanical Gardens a few times - the best runs I ever did. Given the beautifully manicured lawns and the variety of vegetation, in addition to the excellent views of the boats on the water - it is a first class experience. One of the best attractions in Sydney.
Sydney Getaway. Iconic Sydney Feature. Good walk and have a drink at the Harbour Bar. Plenty to see and eat and drink.

building site. sadly in November 2014 there was a building site in between the opera house and botanical gardens so it was hard to cross over and the view from the opera house wasnt so nice. the other side with the Harbour Bridge was stunning!

Loved the gardens. The Opera House is fun to see because it is so distinctive. There isn't much to do there other than walk around or attempt to get tickets to a show. The real gem is the Botanic Gardens Walk. You can spend hours and hours in the gardens, or walking out to the point. There is a small train that gives rides and a tour of the gardens for those with smaller kids who can't walk it. Bring a camera with lots of battery life. We took so many pictures we ran out.
BEAUTIFUL GARDENS.. The gardens were absolutely beautiful! The walk was scenic and had nice benches to sit and enjoy nature
lovely walk. It was a lovely walk with plenty to see and all very well sign posted.The gardens are very well cared for.Wish I was back there

Scenic walk. The walk is nice along the harbour. We visited the Opera House and then walked to the Botanic Gardens. The walk was not that long and you get nice views of the harbour and looking back at the Opera House and Bridge. It's worth doing.
Fantastic walk. We loved the Botanical Hardens and the beautiful Harbour views. The Opera House is stunning. We walked around to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair for more stunning Harbour views.

A place to revive yourself. Perfect place for families, couple, or alone to do any activities, such as jogging, running, picnic, etc. Go here when you stressed out from all the works, assignments, anything.. good for your health.Cheers,MT

This is a must if you are visiting Sydney. The Opera House and Botanic Gardens are right on the Harbour. Walking from the Opera House to the Gardens you can take in the beautiful view of the sparkling water and watch the ferries and sailboats go by.
peaceful walks. a beautiful walk the the gardens to wander through the old treesand the gardens beside the harbour. A must to vist Lady Macquarie's chair
Gorgeous!. A beautiful walk! It makes you feel like you're in another world, even though you're only minutes from the Opera House!
Beautiful views. From the busy tourist filled Opera house to the quite walk around the Botanic gardens, looking back to the harbour bridge. all in all very pleasant and worth the visit.
Nature in the heart of the City. The botanical gardens are beautiful with jungle plants and flowers. It is immense and well worth the visit.

1 of Sydney's great free attractions. Beautifully laid out extensive gardens. For those with limited time in Oz check out the rainforest walk and tropical gardens to get an idea of what is further north. The st george open air cinema has a view that must be hard to beat anywhere
Nice walk. Lovely walk but quiet long.Best place to get picture of both Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House together.

Enjoyable family friendly & free day out. Although a slightly rainy winters day, we took our 3 year old on this walk through the gardens. It was great fun seeing the park through the eyes of a 3 yr old. It helped us to slow down and enjoy all the statues, different plants, grounds and themes of the botanical gardens. There was lovely grassed areas for our child to run around, he marvelled at the massive Morton Bay fig trees. A fun free day out!
Romantic Walk. A great place to walk and view the sunset. Hint: afternoon walk from the botanic gardens to the Opera house Time it just right and you end up with a sunset on the harbour *swoon* ^^

Great Walk in the Heart of Sydney. Easily accessible from Circular Quay, this walk includes the Opera House and Botanical Gardens. Taken all the way around, we also visited the beautiful St. Mary's Cathedral and Hyde Park.

A relaxing stroll. Having had a 24 hour flight, we decided to hot the floor running. Visited Sydney opera house to collect our pre-booked tickets and strolled through the botanic gardens on a beautiful sunny day. Very relaxing to walk by the sea wall after the beautiful botanic gardens . Highly recommended
Invitation for a pic nic in the garden. Nice botânicas garden. Nice grass área by the bay to play or for a pic nic. Beautiful colection of plants. Do not miss the Walk to the opera house

Such a lovely way to enjoy nature. A stroll through the botanic gardens is a wonderful way to spend some time in the beautiful outdoors. It's impeccably-maintained, there's a large variety of plants, there are birds hopping and flying about, it's just beautiful. Add in the great views of the harbor and bridge and there's no reason to not go here on a trip to Sydney.

Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful.. So Beautiful. I wonder what it is that makes the Sydney Opera House so stunning. Its somewhat like the Taj Mahal, breathtaking in its design and structure. Just looking, seeing and taking in the beauty of the botanic gardens and Opera House is uplifting!!
Australian holiday. I loved the whole experiance we travelled to Port Douglas, Cairns Adelaide then SydneyThe travelling is the only down side as Australia is so vast, would have liked more time.,

Nice Easy Walk. This is a nice and easy walk. There are benches along the way if you need to rest. Several birds are in the area that make for good photos. I did not see any restrooms but there was an ice cream vendor on the path.

Beautiful vistas and history. Do the guided tour for the opera house and read up or get a guide for the Gardens. If you don't, you will get the beautiful views , but not the stories and history of these areas. I wish that we had seen a performance at The Opera House. One of my misses on this trip.

Beautiful Walk. The Sydney Botanical Gardens walk is a beautiful park along the harbor right next to the picturesque Opera house. My wife and I went there twice to enjoy the atmosphere and the city. Definitely a great walk to kill some time before a show at the Opera.

Excellent great tour and the concert was fabulous. We booked a tour and were pleasantly surprised how interesting it was and the lady was so sweet and knowledgable. We were 9 and after the tour my husband and we decided to see if we could attend the Beetles symphony concert the last performance was due to present that night. We did go and so enjoyed it. Acoustics is amazing and the orchestra was brilliant. a great end to our stay in Sydney.
Good relaxing walk. Nothing beats having to end the day with a casual stroll with the sunset and the opera house in view. Good ace for a picnic too.

Don't walk it .... run it!. A magnificent run if you get the opportunity. I never tire of doing this run. You can run from your hotel/office past the Opera House Icon, along the botanical gardens, round Mrs Macquarie's chair and up to the art gallery or even to the Cathedral. Return the same way or run through the domain to get back to the CBD.

Amazing!!!. We had a guided tour to the opera house. Our guide (unfortunately I can't remember her name.) was very knowledgeable and was passionate about her work. We were lucky enough to see a rehearsal of a up coming event. At the end of the tour we got a 50% discount for a show happening on that day. It was really awesome!! Life time chance and don't miss it.

Another of the must do walks in Sydney. A must do walk in Sydney, casually walking around the shore of the harbour is so relaxing, botanical gardens are also worth walking around, Sydney is such a beautiful city
Great free walk. As long as the weather is nice, spend a few minutes and check out the views from different angles. Great way to spend some time between activities.
Great Walk - Need Good Walking Shoes. Lovely day in the summer to do this. Although it gets really sunny in the arvo, it's a dream to walk along the water line.

Nice and romantic walk. Near the opera house was crowded but once you enter the botanic garden it's calm and nice!
I recommend a walk in the botanic garden. from then you can visit the art gallery of Sydney.
Awesemo. A must-see if you visit Sydney! There are expensive tours that go inside the Opera House, but just walking around is fantastic

Lovely walk. Very beautiful harbour views, not many people to intrude in your calm. The botanical gardens are gorgeous & there are options for lunch or healthy snacks. I highly recommend you visit the herb gardens. At around 2.30pm you can sit on the higher areas & feed the cockatoo's - an awesome experience - bring peanuts & sunflower seeds!Well worth the parking issues (took us over 30mins to find a parking spot). The Domain carpark has parking on weekend evenings (after 6pm) for $10.

Relaxing stroll. We did this on a breezy afternoon and find it very relaxing. I saw joggers, mothers pushing strollers, tourists (of course), etc. It is a must do if you have time. Great views to take pictures!
Good run. Ran this from the tocks to the chair and back to the rocks. Was a pretty and cheap way to exercise. I hate the 100 character minimum. If you like to walk snd look st things this is for you.

Definitely worth the time. This is a great walk - gardens are gorgeous, also some very interesting trees and birds. If you like nature, this is not to be missed. It is a great attraction that you can do on your own pace, even stopping for a quick nap under a tree if you feel like it. Great views of the city and ocean.

Great Walk. It is just 2 minutes walk from the Sydney Opera House to the Royal Botanic Gardens. It's lovely to walk along the shoreline with the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge on the horizon. It will take about 30 minutes to walk to Mrs Macquaries Point and Mrs Macquaries Chair. There is also a nice cafe in the middle of the gardens where you could take a rest and have a snack or meal.
Doesn`t disappoint. The Opera House is what you go to Sydney for and it is wonderful.Shame no photos allowed in the Main Auditorium.
Superlative. This is a beautiful walk between the Opera House and the botanic gardens. So elegant, adjacent to the harbor. Grounds are impeccably maintained and such a historic setting.

Best thing to do on a nice day. The walk offers the best view of Sydney where you can see the harbour and also the beautiful plants inside the Botanic Gardens. Take a picnic basket with you and you can sit inside the garden to spend a good relaxing afternoon after the walk.

Not what I've expected. Beautiful heavily altered garden with a lot of tourists and nice view on the Opera House. Nothing overwhelming in particular. What I've noticed is that as for Sydney in general there's limited availability of public toilets and drinking water fountains. Just a standard tourist attraction.

Easy walking. Free opportunity to see the sights of the harbour, the parklands and even the arts. The walk around the harbour is an easy stroll and it is easy to forget that you are in Australia's largest city.

Its amazing. We walk from town hall station to harbour and its amazing to been sydney harbour opera house , botanical garden and circular quay station all is here at sydney harbour . The must visit place in sydney. And dont forget fish lovers to have fish n chips with F&B beer at harbour. Cheers and enjoy sydney harbour.

Picturesque Walk on the Waters Edge. Walking from the Opera House to the Botanical Gardens was a very pleasant break from the city.Although there was lots of activity,getting ready for New Years Eve, there was still plenty to see. Lots of local trees and bushes, many flowering, some fruiting and most of which you won't have seen before except in a book or on the 'telly'.I was particularly fascinated by the trees shedding their bark to reveal a silky smooth surface which I hadn't seen anywhere before. At the end of the walk, a small cafe to allow the weary walkers a chance to rest and recuperate.

A gentle walk all tourists should do. Visit the Botanic Gardens by approaching them through the Entrance opposite the State Library, then complete the visit by this walk to the iconic Sydney Opera House. Along the walk you will link into the Sydney Sculpture Walk with some wonderful site specific sculptures by leading Australian artists. Mrs Macquaries Chair is the must take photo moment before a gentle work along the harbour's edge where you will see pleasure boats and commuter ferries as well as Fort Denison.
Delightful walk. Very easy to go between with amazing harbor and garden views. Lots of people running and walking and numerous photo-ops

Great walk!. Beautiful walk for some of the iconic Sydney attractions... Opera house, Lady Macquarie's Chair, Art Gallery of NSW, Sydney Harbour and the Botanical Gardens... short walks to St Mary's Cathedral and the Sydney Museum.

Nice view, average botanic garden, lots of construction around the waterfront. The botanic garden is manicured, and there are some huge old trees there, but overall my wife noted it was not as beautiful as the Chinese garden. Too many of the exotic flora were not marked so I didn't know what I was looking at. And lots of construction marring the view and access along the garden and harbour walk.

Enjoyable. One of the quietest areas just a turn from the buzzling Opera House.. You won't feel like you are in Sydney. You can keep walking for as long as you like and be in the company of grandfather trees and monuments

Must see.... One of the most enjoyable aspects of our visit to Sydney was staying downtown near the botanical gardens. Not only was it wonderful to walk through the gardens on the way to and from the harbor, it was great to see the locals enjoying the gardens, too. Runners, walkers, all out to enjoy a bit of nature so close to the city.

Good walk. Sydney's botanic gardens are not as beautiful as Adelaide's but the views to the Opera House are unbeatable. Make sure you go to Macquarie's point to take the perfect picture of it. Oh, if you go at dusk, look up and watch lots of flying foxes!

Beautiful walks in stunning scenery. Anyone visiting Sydney must take a walk from The Sydney Opra House to the Botanical Gardens. It is a beautiful walk with stunning scenery over the harbour. The walk will take around an hour to 90 minutes but it will be one you will never forget.

Stunning short walk. Walked from The Rocks to Mrs MacQuaries Chair. Stunning scenery and beautiful plants and trees. Well cared for gardens and so well laid out. Easy walk as very wide path and all level. The Sydney Harbour one side and beautiful gardens the other.

Great sunday stroll. walked from our hotel at the Park Hyatt, past Opera House, through botanic gardens, down into Woolloomooloo. great walk with tremendous views. most walking is level and there's places to stop and get refreshments (opera house area expensive), Dave's pool, trailer in botanic gardens and bars or restaurants in Woolloomooloo. we continued down into Kings Cross area and then back along Liverpool Street and George Street to hotel. good half day but great way to see city

Best of Sydney NSW. All year round, this is a very beautiful part of Sydney and is an absolute "must" visit. Beautifully manicured well preserved and maintained gardens with some spectacular trees, harbour views and beautiful picnic and walking areas. This is the best "Free" experience Sydney has to offer.
harbor views. this is a slow easy walk offering excellent harbor views. when you end up in the peaceful gardens the look back to the opera house is like so many postcards you see.

Perfect way to unwind in Sydney. Strolling around the Opera House and taking in a concert was lovely, but topped off by wandering around the beautiful Botanical Gardens was spectacular. The Botanical Gardens always have something on display and the sounds of birds and smell of flowers and trees make you forget you are in the middle of a major city. The gardens are located on the shores of Sydney Harbour, so watching the ferries and yachts bobbing along the harbour is an added bonus.

Serenity in the middle of a bustling modern day city!. We had to walk from the CBD to Opera house to get our car from the car park, and BIL said, why don't we walk through the botanic gardens to it, which was a good idea. Beautifully manicured plants, information tags about each of them, pathways, signposts to follow. I felt as if i was transported to another place altogether, and was not in Sydney anymore. Its amazing how nature, the gentle wind rustling leaves on umbrella like trees, fresh aromas from blossomed flowers, birds pecking at insects, water features makes you connect with Earth and disconnect from the mob.A must do, if you aren't in Sydney, just for the Boxing day madness, and pleasure for you doesn't mean that you beat the teeming millions to it!!
Opera House walk to Botanical Gardens. Some of the best views of the Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge and the waterfront. A pleasant short walk between the Opera House and the Botanical Gardens
great walk. Great walk! Great scenery. Enjoyed this very much. Do this while you are in town, it's worth it for sure!
beautiful views. a short "walk" - the botanic gardens is adjacent to the Opera House. A tranquil setting in the middle of the city.

Lovely scenic walk with history. Learning about the different trees and beautiful canopies the provided.
The Opera house is very different close up, it's a must, even if you just walk around the outside
Ok. Tends to be packed with people, will be better once the renovations around the opera house have been finished, it still looks a lot like a construction site.
A Beautiful Walk. This walk is so close to the city that it should be taken when visiting. It gives excellent views of the harbour, the bridge and the opera House.
energetic walk. Locals all run during lunch hour so be aware on footpaths but beautiful scenery and a lovely breeze loved it. Lots of bences so you can sit and watch the world

Botanic Garden just beautiful you must see it in your eyes. Truly one of the best Botanic Garden we ever visit in the world, very beautiful !
No peddler sell water or soda anywhere, bring your own drinks, no WIFI anywhere, you need a pair of good walking shoes, it is really too much place you want to walk and see !

Opera House and Botanic Gardens for kids. We were able to see Baby Proms with our grandchildren on December 20th, so if you are planning to be here at Christmastime one year, be sure to check the Opera House website and reserve tickets for the shows there. We will be bringing the grandchildren to see The Tiger who came to tea, tomorrow. The tickets aren't cheap, but how often would we be in Sydney over this festive season?We were able to walk through the Gardens after the show, a splendid garden filled with many unusual flowering plants, and a wedding in progress completed the picture.We were blessed with good weather, during our visit, but the Opera House would be fine in the rain, and the gardens just as pretty.

Beautiful Botanics. Sydney Opera House is of course one of the most iconic sights in the world. Being able to enjoy it from a variety of locations adds to the enjoyment, from the water, from close proximity and on the walk along the foreshore in the Botanic Gardens. The path is paved all along its length so it's easy for wheelchairs, buggies and those with limited mobility. Watch out for the joggers though! There are plenty of seats so you can rest whenever you feel like it - check for ants enjoying the seat too! The foreshore walk is flat closest to the Opera House and slopes slightly towards the opposite end. A brilliant place to watch the sunset, watch the reflections and ever changing light on the water of the Harbour and just to reflect. There are many specimen trees and flower beds in close proximity to the walk all helpfully labelled. The views across to Sydney Harbour Bridge are terrific too. If you want to explore more of the Botanic Gardens there is a land train that sets off from the gate near the opera House every 30 minutes. A great experience.

Disappointed. We took the walk from the Opera House to the Botanic garden. Maybe it was the time of the year, but I was not impressed. The Botanic Garden is very large, but not very much to see, There were places to have picnics or a good nap, but that isn't what we were looking for,

Ohhh Yes!!!. Lovely walk, and on a sunny day just a perfect place to also get together with friends and have a little pique nique!Take a small detour into the Garden and enjoy the view of some nice trees, funny colorfull birds and some fish in the ponds. The highlight for all you non aussis: watch the skies during the sunset to see the mega big flying bats coming to the trees of the park to search for food, no its not a plane, no its not an eagle!! its a giant bat :-)Wait until the sunset for a breathtaking view of the skyline, the bridge and the opera house and hey, right next to Macquaries chair, there is also this little hotdog stand selling also some good pies and rolls. Dont have to do it all on an empty belly!!!

The view says it all. This is one walk to take,lovely gardens immaculately kept with stunning views across the harbour.Stroll around for hours we never got tired of it one of the few places in the world that matches up to your expectations.
Awesome walk!. My husband and I visited the botanic gardens after our opera house tour. It's a really walk especially on a nice summer day.
Go.. Liked; You don't have to like gardens etc, it's simply a really nice place to have a nice relaxing wander around and take a break from the city.Disliked; Nothing to dislike.
24 Hours in Sydney. Gorgeous way to enjoy the outdoors side of Sydney! Many photo opportunities both with in the gardens as well as the adjacent high rise buildings.
Iconic sights. Amazing sights, you can't come to Sydney & not do this. Bring a picnic for lazing in Botanic Gardens after....

Disappointed. I don't know why but all the hype I've ever heard about the Opera House just didn't do it for me. Our visit here coincided with much work being carried out around the grounds and the Opera House looked like it needed a good refurb
spectacular gardens. Loved the plant and wildlife great place to wander round immaculately kept great place to visit. Bit steep in places though so not suitable if you have pushchairs/wheelchairs
Beautiful Walk!. The very calm and relaxing walk from the Opera House to the Botanic Garden is very beautiful! The walk is about 3 minutes long and is a very nice compliance to the Botanic Garden.

Away from it all. Walking through the Botanic Gardens you can almost forget that you are only yards away from busy McQuairie Street and Circular Quay. The tree barks and textures are as interesting as the flowers.
Beautiful gardens. I walked my father round the gardens .They were lovely just a few hills to negotiate with a wheel chair. Nice coffe shop in the middle

Big park. Ok but on a hot day it is just a big park you want to get from one end to the next..
More scenic than the busy streets with cars and people.

friends visiting from the USA. Absolutely beautiful ~ there are some species there I never even knew existed! A must for families, adults and children alike will love as there is a Disney Fairies walk on at the moment.
Lovely day out. The gardens are well kept, with lots of diversity. The weather was excellent at this time of year (September). It is great for couples or families
Great morning walk. A must do and well worth the effort. Walk around to the Opera House then over to the Rocks. Have a coffee and you will have had a great half day.

Lovely stroll through Botanic Gardens. We walked from our hotel to Mrs MacQuaries point to watch the Extreme 40s sailing regatta through the botanic gardens. Only a 10-15mins walk. although hot days it was lovely strolling through the park.

A must do activity.. Plan a day to do both of these tours. The opera house is an architectural feat and well worth a time spent taking the guided tour. The botanical gardens are beautiful and relaxing.
Stunning!. There are gorgeous views the entire way, and the walk is extremely relaxing and enjoyable. The gardens themselves are also lovely!
Scenic walk. A scenic walk with excellent views across the harbour and the city skyline. Can be a hard walk when it's hot.

One of the best. One of the best walks around. Following the bays on the outskirts of the gardens. We had fantastic weather and the extreme sailing was being held in cockle bay which provided entertainment for a few hours we didn't anticipate. Relax and take the walk.
Definitely worth doing. Liked the lovely, relaxing walk with incredible views and ambiance. Fairly flat so good for all. Interesting plants too, of course.

Sydneys Opera House and Botanical Gardens a lovely evening. A fun date was enjoyed here. A show at the Opera House about Antarctica, it was not what we expected but still interesting and fun. Then a walk through the Botanical Gardens at dusk, bird life and furry creatures going crazy. The views were spectacular
Under repair. This part of the walk is currently subject to a great deal of work at the front of the Opera House - hopefully it will be finished shortly and the walk fully restored

Iconic. As a foreigner, I spent my younger years watching the iconic scenery of Australia on TV and hoped and prayed that one day I'd get to go there. Well here I am, living in one of the most beautiful places in the world and this walk is the one that makes me say to myself...."ahhh I made it- I'm here!!" Stunning!
So quiet yet so much going on.. Given this is one of the most iconic areas in the world we found the walk and all of the features spectacular but peaceful.

Beautiful walk. On a lovely Saturday afternoon, we enjoyed the walk through the gardens and the many photo opportunities of the harbour and Opera House. The gardens were peaking with their spring blooms. Recommend planning your walk so you do not double back too many times.

Great place to walk. Make sure to walk all the way around the Opera House to water's edge.In general, I love going to botanic gardens when I travel, and Sydney was no exception. Really nice, relaxing place to walk.
For the lovers of gardens. The Botanic garden is a peaceful area full of interesting trees. The opera house is spectacular and fascinating architecture which deserves its reputation
Botanic gardens by the bay. Beautifully manicured gardens with a super cool breeze. We used this as a short cut to get to Woolloomooloo where our hotel was located.

Best panoramic view of Opera House. Best view of the Opera House is from the Botanic Gardens. Walk to Mrs MacQuaries' chair. Take great pictures from there with the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge both in the background.

A walk in the park. The gardens are huge - many points to start from. A very popular starting point is the Opera House - if you stand on the steps of the Opera House, you get an overview of the gardens. You can stand just after the Opera House and just be next to the river - just a wall between you and the water. Lots of gorgeous old trees that provide cool shade. And you can reach in about 10 - 15 mins from the start point of the Sydney Opera House to Mrs McQuarie's Chair which is another great vantage point. You can see Wooloomooloo from here and there is the (free) Museum of Art just closeby. Lots of hanging bats if you look up to the trees. I love walks in the parks because it is just so relaxing and this is one nice huge relaxing park.
Lovely walk. Really enjoyed the very short walk to the gardens and then hoped on the little red train and toured around the gardens. Learnt and saw lots.
Relaxing walk. Botanic Gardens are great, you can spend a whole day there, and the Opera House. It looks bogger on postcards :) but still its really worth seeing

Symphony opera. Sydney Opera is a unique architectural structure. We visited on the steps of the Opera House were unlucky could not see it from inside the auditorium. Botanic Gardens developed @ Opera House is worth experiencing and it is unique. Some further developmental work is in progress.

Best free walking tour in Aus!. In the heart of the Sydney City a walk to stimulate the most sedenetary traveller. You can easily take a couple of hours wandering between the two spots, better eoen to have a little picnic with you to pause and view the fabulous Sydney skyline, the Harbour Bridge, and the activities on the harbour. Historical note for wine lovers - this was actaully where the fist vines were planted 200+ years ago, the cuttings jhaving been picked up in Brazil.
