Go see a show at the Opera!. I went for a comedy show at the Opera (Comedy of Errors) and I loved it ! Loved the fact that I not only got to see this famous building from outside but I got to enjoy it from inside as well !
Great for a break from city. The walk from Opera House round to Botanical gardens and then Art Gallery is gorgeous and provides a great break from shopping. You have the plants and view of harbour.

Stunning!. There are many wonderful city walks but few can compare with the luxuriant plant life in the Sydney Botanical Gardens. Absolutely beautiful. Then, the architectural wonder! Leave the gardens behind and there over a hill, the gorgeous 'shells' of the Opera House. Stunning!
Water views take your breath away. Take this stroll in the early evening and enjoy the sun setting to the west and the warm shades of twilight reflecting off the Opera house.
Great place to relax and see city sights, too. Never thought I'd be a big fan of botanical gardens, but this one is really special -- and right next to the CBD.
Very pretty. Nice walk around ,admiring trees ,plants etc,especially on a nice day. great views of parts of the harbour and photo opportunities.

Well worth a visit. It is free to walk down and look all round the Opera House for no charge lots happening around the whole Quay area with tall ships, boats and lots of tourists. The botanical gardens are great to relax and look around again free of charge. The whole view looking back across to Sydney harbour Bridge is great.

Fabulous. Next to each other...a whole days visit to see both...well worth it...the gardens are gorgous overlooking the Harbour and often see weddings in the Rose Garden,take a picnic as Cafe expensive of course,but a great free day out...look up into the trees..caught site of 3 Kookaburras together.
Beautiful view. This was a magic walk, romantic and place of peace. Is a great and beautiful view around botanic gardem and arrive at opera house. My advice is go around sunset time.

Beautiful place. It's a beautiful and relaxing walk with great views across the harbour. Don't forget to look up when you're standing outside the Visitors Centre as there are fruit bats in the trees above you - great!

Unique. This is the walk we take our overseas visitors to all the time. Nice walk good length level ground. Normally if 2 of us there, one will drop at the photo spot at the end for the group to walk towards opera house and pick up at circular quay. This is the sight unique to Sydney. Looking at the Harbour bridge, the city and the opera house. And Opera House and Harbour Bridge together in the photo, you can't be too close.
Beautiful. A haven nestled within the hustle and bustle of Sydney. A must do to escape into the peace and quiet of a beautiful garden amongst the native flora and fauna and bird life of Australia.
Reminded me of London. This walk reminded me of Regency Park in London ...It was lovely....Views are stunning. Loved it. I would love to get back and explore more.

Beautiful trails. Another beautiful walk around the Sydney area and the best photo spot for the Opera House and bridge in the same shot. Try and stay clear of the paths around lunch time...they are very busy with joggers.

Beautiful views. An easy walk along the harbour in the gardens. Majestic old trees and sweeping gardens and lawns. Do as much or as little as you like. Starting and finishing at the Opera House is a great way to do it.
Peacefull Walk. On a nice day, this is a a great way to spend a couple of hours enjoying the scenery and location. The gardens are fairly peaceful and the view is one of the best in Sydney.

Must go!!!. We stayed in Potts Point in our recent visit to Sydney and made several times the walk through the Botanic Garden to Sydney CBD and Opera House. If you are a hike lover like us just go and see for yourself. It's awesome.

An easy walk. This is a gentle walk and does have some lovely views of the harbour. We took a detour from the Gardens to the hospital etc. and it was full of interest. We walked it slowly and it took less than 2 hours.

Stretch your legs. Take as stroll on the harbours edge from the iconic Sydney Opera house to the Botanical gardens and then beyond to Mrs Macquaries Chair - a point with the best view for photographs in Sydney.
The best things in life are Free.
As good as the Opera House. Well after seeing the Opera House the walk and rest inside the Botanic Gardens is a must-do. Be at one with nature in this splendid park!

A Wow!. Took the 7 AM "Behind the Scenes" tour - wonderful. A professional docent and a small group plus beautiful made a great experience. The "Aussie" breakfast in the "green room" was over the top!
The botanical gardens were beautiful (despite the drought). Besides the flora, there were very attractive birds, butterflies, and dragon flies.
a must do. free and wonderful: walk from circular quay after admiring the famous opera house to the beautiful shady gardens.

Glorious views over the Harbour. The Governer's House grounds and the Botanic Gardens are beautifully planted up and have wonderful views out over the Harbour. The Opera House has to be seen to be believed. All that we expected it to be.

Beautiful gardens. The botanic gardens were beautiful, really enjoyed walking through them to get to the Opera House, which was very impressive from the outside, but not that impressed with inside, you couldn't walk through much of it and the restaurant was closed at lunch time, but the staff were having thiers!
Sore feet walked so much!. Great walk and some very different views of the opera house and bridge. Interesting plants and birds to watch.

Found the Walk by Accident & Loved it. Only downfall of this walk are all the joggers.They seem to feel they have the right of way and you are constantly dodging them.The walk itself is lovely.The gardens are immaculately maintained and some great views of the harbour.Worth the stroll
beautiful. a really lovely walk that can be as long or as short as u like. the gardens are a lovely place to just sit and watch the boats go by or to soak up the sun
Very pleasant place.... Nice and pleasant place to take a walk with nice breeze coming from the ocean. Best place to take a walk at evenings and for morning jogging...

An easy walk for a sunny Sunday afternoon. Relaxing walk to check off a few of the must see sights.Make sure weather is right then saunter through the gardens ending up at the Opera House bar .Perfect
birds and trees. the birds and the trees and every thing was beautiful it was so quiet even though it was in the middle of the city
Really enjoyable. have been to Sydney many times and not done this walk.was a beautiful day,the views were great and a couple of nice cafe's at the end

Central location - easy to reach and enjoy. The Opera House is an iconic building in Sydney designed by Danish architect. Amazing and interesting venue and a must to see. Besides the Opera House are the beautiful botanic gardens, with wonderful flowers and trees. A visit to Government House is free and highly recommended. Minature railway tour is most enjoyable giving an overview of this pretty park

A MUST Do in Sydney. If you do nothing else, hard to imagine in Sydney, an Opera House tour is mandatory. It will be a most enjoyable hour spent exploring this magnificent edifice.One does not realize just how wonderful this place is until one tours it inside..
Rather tame walk, even less as a run.. The Gardens are superb but if you want some real exercise run from them over to Rushcutter Bay and back via Potts Point. Mixed scenary but great.
Easy walk in both directions. Flat terrain around the harbour from Mrs Macquarie's Chair to the Opera House makes this a pleasant walk at any time of year.

Must do short walk in Sydney. Don't leave Sydney without doing this short and easy walk. Fantastic views right on the harbour's edge. Any time of year. Easy grade. Grab an ice-cream as your reward at Lady's MacQuarie's chair.
Morning Walk. Always the best way to start the day. Grab a take away coffee and a Portuguese Custard tart and off you go

Wonderful old trees. The walk from the Opera House to Government house passes through beautiful gardens and historic trees. See old fig trees more than 150 years old and huge. You will need at least 2 hours to cover the whole garden layout. take the walk up to Government house which is open for guided inside tours on Fridays ,Saturdays and Sundays from !0.30am
SYDNEY HARBOR WALK. I didn't get the time to do this walk this trip, but I have done it many times and I can only say it is a must walk around the harbor and gardens

On a great day this is Not to be missed. honestly one of the best parts of Sydney is to just walk this route - the views are spectacular. you will need good walking shoes, and then consider a ferry to one of the islands
The Botanical Gardens. It isa great walk to do through the gardens and you are paid off with a fabulous view of the bridge and the opera house.
Must visit in Sydney. Walking tour was informative. It's a must see if you are visiting Sydney. View from the opera house to Sydney bridge is nice.
Botanic Gardens Sydney. such a lovely place to stroll about and so peaceful and quiet, clean and tidy with good well placed signageGreat views of the Opera House
Botanic Gardens Walk. Spacious beautiful garden. Wish i have more to time to hangout here. great point to take photo of opera and the bridge. lovely place to picnic or wedding photos

Great morning run. My favorite start to a day in Sydney is to jog down to Circular Quay from my hotel, around the Opera House with the Bridge to your left, and then around to the Gardens, Lady Macquarie's chair and past Boy Charlton pool before cutting back to the CBD. This is an easy 5km run to brush off the cobwebs, watch the ferries and other people, or it can be just as good in the evening.
botanical gardens. Just a wonderful place to wander about take in the plants and all the birds - check out the cockatoos and the huge water lillies.A very pretty place

Rewarding View. We did the reverse - Botanic Gardens Walk to the Opera House. From the gardens, we were rewarded with a clear view of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge - a beautiful backdrop for your pictures. Many picnic points along the route too.
Sydney Opera House Majestic and iconic. Against the back drop of a blue sky its sails stand out like the Tall Ships of Sydney Harbour . An amazing piece of architecture and a fabulous venue
Wonderful spot. Very scenic location minutes away from the CBD. Walk to via the Opera House. Lovely gardens and wonderful views of the harbour.Guided walks very informative.
Fantastic views. Would recommend to anyone - tourist or local. Perfect for a Sunday stroll with beautiful greenery and magnificent views.
Botanic Gardens Walk. Great walk with many types of flowers, trees, and birds. A quiet sanctuary in the middle of Sydney. Lots of benches to sit in to rest, places to eat. A must do while in Sydney.

What Views!. The Opera House is a must see and you must touch one of the tiles that make it up for good luck! walk through to the Botanic Gardens or go the opposite way to see the most Beautiful and amazing Flora and Sculptures placed around the gardens, Just Gorgeous.

The Iconic view!. Several big liners in the port which gave interest and also The proximity of bars and eateries everywhere.The Botanic Garden is totally world class and in my opinion one of Sydney's best attractions.
Views and sounds. Well seeing the beautiful trees and plants and the birds and hearing their beautiful chirps. real variety of a walk with a lot of variety to be taken in.

all times favourite. Brilliant walk. Not crowded, fantastic scenic views, just very pleasant and charming
perfect for jogging or walking
Fun in rain. The rain didn't deter me from taking a walk to the botanic garden and I'm glad I did it. Botanical garden is very nice and have a great cafe

Historic walk. This walk not only takes you through beautiful harbour side gardens, but is the area first settled by the original convicts who were transported from England and had to set up their own farm to survive.

Oasis in the city. We had parked at Woolloomooloo (Secure Car Park) and then proceeded to walk back to Circular Quay and the Opera House. The gardens are an oasis in the middle of Sydney! The pathways in the Botanic Gardens are well maintained with plenty of signage and seats to have a rest. There is a café within the gardens and we also...


More

My favorite part of the trip. Botanic gardens can be, well, a bit forced, but this one is just the best. It is spacious, with great views of the harbor and the opera house, so it is a combo walk-in-the-park on a nice day and botanic garden experience. Plants and trees are reasonably well-marked, and the cactus exhibit is extraordinary.

Scenic walk with great views from lookout.. This is an excellent way to spend a few hours walking around the cove up to the lookout for photos, then back through the gardens.
Well worth it. Awesome views of Harbour Bridge and Opera House.

Absolutely georgeous. Walked all the way from the Opera House, through the botanical gardens to Hyde Park and then back to the Governor's House after lunch at the top of the Sydney Tower. Beautiful Saturday morning. Lots of joggers. Seems like there is always a prevailing breeze off the water from the East. Never saw a piece of litter anywhere. Impeccably manicured...


More

Nice easy short walk. The walk from the Opera House to the Gardens is ridiculously close and enjoyable. So active with people walking and jogging! Beautiful gardens and to have the Sydney Harbour in the back ground it was really pretty.

Fantastic views. We started our walk at the Anzac Memorial (visit its worthwhile and very poignant) down past the Cathedral and entered the Botanic gardens after passing the Andrew Boy Charlton pool. Its a great walk as you view the navy base across the water, great photo opportunities at Mrs MaQuaries chair. Just on from here was the open air cinema screen....


More
Just love it. This area is absolutely beautiful and is everything you see on tv about a visit to Sydney harbour. Best place to be for the new years eve fireworks if you can brave the crowds

Definitely do this!. Yes, just stroll along and really enjoy the views and the relaxing atmosphere. Perhaps take a picnic and sit on the grass, let your children run about if you have any!
We really loved this walk

Sydney attractions. The Opera House is of course well know for its architecture and the orchestra. The orchestra is on summer break, couldn't get to actually experience the hall. The Botanic Garden is huge, well designed, and many but not all the plants are labeled.

Well worth the time and sweat. The walk from behind the Opera House out to Mrs. Macquarie's Seat looked an awfully long way in the heat and on tired legs after five days exploring Sydney, mostly on foot, but it was well worth it. I didn't do justice to the Botanic Gardens but they look a great place to picnic, have fun with the kids, or find a shady spot to read or admire the view or make friends with the inquisitive ibis who patrol the area. The coastal path is wide and someone must do a great clean-up job as it was remarkably litter-free considering the swarms of tourists who had the same idea as I. Vistas out to sea or back to the city are magnificent and there's plenty of artwork to admire, from the traditional to the ultra modern; enough to satisfy the most eclectic of tastes. Along with the water traffic, the open-air cinema, specimen trees and fellow travellers, there are plenty of distractions along the way. I even got to see a wedding ceremony taking place. Seats are placed at convenient intervals although most of them were already occupied. The area was originally laid out and landscaped along the lines of popular taste in Victorian England and it retains much of this old world charm. Personally I would have appreciated some identification labelling on the trees. Progress wasn't that fast due to the amount of visitors wanting their photo taken with the iconic landmarks of Sydney in the background as a memento of the day. At my destination there was a mobile food and drink van, strategically placed out of site over a rise, which served ice cold drinks and a more than passable toasted sandwich. If you want a photo of Mrs. Macquarie's seat without someone sitting on it, be prepared to wait until it's free. I have to wonder what Elizabeth Macquarie would make of her view today; I suspect she would be well satisfied.
wow. one of the worlds most iconic buildings. you can actually touch the roof. how good is that.fantastic gardens

A pleasant stroll away form the crowds. The Opera House is easily recognised as one of Sydney's great landmarks. Not surprisingly, the crowds there are busy and noisy in keeping with any well known tourist site. However, a very leisurely half stoll takes you to the stunning Bonatical Gardens, where you can also see Government House, to an area away from the hustle and bustle. We spent about 3 hours in the Botanical Gargens and really enjoyed it.

Awesome Botanic Gardens. This is a great walk around the edge of Sydney Harbour with plenty of places to sit, have a picnic ride a bike or go for a run. The gardens are just beautiful with several paths in different directions, it is certainly a great place to relax.

It was smaller than I expected!. But what a beautiful building...and in fairness, get closer to it and it's bigger. Funny that! Truly a lovely area to explore, and the gardens are just great for a picnic, fantastic views and plenty of facilities. Definitely worth a visit.
Lovely gardens, fantastic views. This was a lovely walk which offered stunning views of the harbour. The gardens are beautiful as well.

Awesome. It was great to walk through the gardens on our way to the Opera house. There is many nice views of the harbor and the parliament house before you get to the Opera House. It was about a 15 min walk.
Fantastic. I love walking and of course I did it! The best time is in the morning or at sunset so you can admire all the beautiful colours of the botanic garden.

Walk along a quite park. Its a nice walk from the opera house down to the botanic garden. Not the best or longest of walks. You go through a big park and can choose to settle down, read a book or sit by the water. If you are into walks, check out the other coastal walks the city has

Must go in Sydney. After a nice walk across the Botanic Garden (very beautiful sites and lots of birds) you end up at the Opera House.
If you have time, take the guided tour, it was very good. Not too long, nice information, good knowledge about the Opera House history.
Nice and calm right next to the city. The park is right next to the city and when you walk around it you don't think there is a city a few streets away.

Opera House always in view. We came through the Botanic Gardens from Hyde Park and then traveled up to Mrs Macquarie's point. From there, we walked to the Opera House, enjoying being along the water and approaching the Opera House from a different angle. We did this on the first day, and I am so glad that we did. It was a wonderful way to start our stay in Sydney as it was much calmer than being on the busy streets.

Not a must do if your time is limited. I'm quite surprised that this is currently the #3 attraction on TA for Sydney. From the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens is a fairly short stroll through a public park and presumably people living in or visiting the city enjoy the relative tranquility. There was quite a bit of maintenance work going on when we visited and not much in the way of colourful plants.The view looking back to Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House from Mrs Macquaries Chair was an alternative angle to the scene.You can exit the park to the city at other points rather than return the same route.I wouldn't put it on a must-do list if your time is limited although you could skip the walk and pay for a tourist "train" to make it quicker.
Aussie Icon. The Opera House is an icon and must see. The Botanical gardens are huge, beautiful, surrounded by the harbour and free.
A great way to start the day..... This is really a glorious walk with many sights to take in along the way. Put on some comfortable shoes and just do it!

A Peaceful Path to the CBD. If you are tired of the crowds and traffic, the walk from the Opera House to the Royal Botanic Gardens then on into the CBD is a wonderful way to get back into the heart of the city. It takes a little longer, but you feel relaxed when you return to a center city hotel.

Beautiful Gardens. The gardens are so beautiful with such a variety of plants and flowers. The Opera House was rather disappointing. Looks like its passed its sell by date with the colour of the stone work & didn't expect it to be split into several buildings.
A Must Do Once in Sydney!. Try to see the Australian Ballet, a Bell Shakespeare Theatre Company production or the Sydney Symphonic Orchestra. A twist on old tales. Excellent!!!

Beautiful walk. Beautiful walk in central Sydney. There is some construction along the harbor, so you cannot get all the great views that you might want; however, the walk is still fantastic The gardens are beautiful, but I especially like the bird life (cockatoos; ibis).

Most magnificent view of the harbour alongside the greenery. I was overwhelmed by the walk at Botanical Gardens as I stayed just a few minutes away from this place. It was a daily relaxation for me to just walk alongside the water with the greenery on the other side. My photos were magnificent, the background was outstanding. I got to know Sydney is one of the best cities in the world and also impressed with the cleaniless during my visit. Left me to believe that I should bring my family in my next visit. MOreso this visit was completely free. Awesome..

Wonderful thing to do while in Sydney. I think this is a must if you like beautiful gardens set on the most stunning harbour in the world. How could you NOT go there and enjoy this walk ??There are a couple of cafes in the Gardens themselves.
Great walk. Just a great walk. Beautiful city, beautiful gardens. You may not fancy the old flora but you still won't be disappointed ; ) What else can I say...

Beautiful walk. The walk from the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House is something to do if you are not in a hurry and can stop along the way to just sit and reflect on the beautiful scenery. There are several benches along the way to do just that.
Realaxing and green area!. Don´t miss this walk! It´s a relaxing area and you can just have a time on a blanket with picknic :)

Beautiful views. We loved this walk and the views it offered more than the garden itself. Make sure to go all the way to Mrs. Macquaries Chair to get some great photos with the Opera House and Harbour Bridge in the background!

really a stroll between two tourist points. yup its great, never thought of it as a separate thing in its own right, see the opera house and then walk round the back to the Botanic Gardens, great views of the harbour, does what it says on the tin

Opera House and Gardens Precinct. For a precinct that is marketed as a world class attraction, the co-location of a hi-tech tented 'side show' adjacent to the Sydney Opera House is simply hard to believe. And walking through into the RBG which is now a construction site along the foreshore, overseas visitors must be wondering what is so special about this location. As a local, I was embarrassed, and left wondering what impressions were left for overseas visitors to Australia.

A millon dollar view at every turn.. On a not too hot day and when it is not raining this has to be one of the best walks in the world. We once did it from Woolloomooloo to the Opera House when we were due at the opera and we arrived out of breath after the gate was locked. Fortunately work was going on at the side and a quick dash up into the Domain and out a side gate got us to the opera just on time. That was some years ago and I see some changes at the gates that may allow late walkers egress! We walked in the opposite direction this time and through the Botanics to Woolloomooloo and it was wonderful The harbour sights are always fascinating and some (though not all....) of the joggers add to the beauty of the scenery so it is worth a dawdle to take all this in.

Beautiful, relaxing and stress free. My wife and kids first time in Sydney, my favourite walk in the city - Hyde Park, Domain, look out points, the Botanical Gardens and finally CQ made for a fantastic expereince. My seventh visit over the last 20 years and it never fails to impress.

Love the Botanical Gardens. The Gardens are a beautiful oasis of calm in the middle of the frantic City, a perfect spot for a walk or a run. Lovely stretch alongside the Harbour which is scenic and with lovely breezes.

A stroll in the Park. Most tourists would do this walk, it takes in the Opera House and continues on into the Botanically Gardens which are worth a visit, if the walk is too much for you they have a little train you can sit on and be taken around the gardens and listen to the driver's commentary.

Beautiful Sydney. Brilliant to walk or burn a few calories. I regularly run between the Opera House and Potts Point on the Botanic Garden Walk. The paths are very well maintained and are designed for the sedate or more energetic minded. Trees are abundant as is seating and maintained grassed areas. Worth the visit.
Botanic gardens are nice and admission is free. fun time with the family, give it at least 3 Hours to see and enjoy the botanical gardens. Its only 10 min walk to the Opera house
Wonderful Walk in the Australian Summer. The herb garden is very large and fragrant on the way to the Opera House. This botanical garden is immense and could take an entire day to view.

Perfect. Staying at Simpsons of Potts Point offered this lovely walk in order to get to the ferry at circular quay. The smells, the sounds and the visual impact of the botanical gardens was a real treat.
avoid lunchtime. one of the best ways to view the opera house but you best avoid the lunchtime joggers as they come out in their hundreds!
Easy to do walk. Short and easy to complete, but with plenty to see and do along the way. Probably worth doing the walk in reverse unless you're planning to visit the art gallery at the end

It's a wonderful walk.. You get to see the Sydney harbour and it is a very well constructed pathway to enjoy. You get to see the Opera house and also the beautiful botanical gardens all situated right on the foreshores. What a lovely city !

Photo check and your done. Okay, let's be honest, you have to go and take a snap shot of the iconic opera house. However, take a tour, watch a show and grab coffee? Umm yeah...you could probably skip that. You can catch a show anywhere. Use that time to explore other sights in the city!
Beautiful!. A lovely walk which affords a constant view of the wonder that is the Sydney Harbor and its activities. Bilss.
Beautiful day for a walk. I walked from the Art Gallery through the gardens ,.The weather was perfect, it is just lovely there. Many rainforest plants, harbour views.

Views. This is a great walk and the views of both The Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge are fantastic. Having done the walk go up to a coffee van by Mrs McQuaries seat!, the lady was full of good information of what to see and do!
Beautiful view along the water. You can see the Opera House and Darling Harbour Bridge from the Botanic Gardens. It's a nice spot to enjoy the skyline of Sydney.
Amazing. Absolutely beautiful. Take a leisurely stroll along the pathways, many roller bladders and picnickers enjoying their lunch break. A must see!

Try to go earlier or later in the day. as it is obviously very busy around there. Walk around the harbour to get different views of the opera house. The Botanic Gardens Walk is extremely peaceful and nice for some down time.

Lovely walk to the garden!. The garden is really nice with a beautiful path to trail on. theres a nice lake just to sit beside and enjoy the view. You can see all sorts of flowers, and trees. most importantly, nice place for relaxing!

Another view of the harbour and the famous Opera House. Another pleasant walk See the Opera House close up have a drink at the Opera Bar and the take a walk in the Botanic gardens a beautiful green space in the city

Not only a walk, also great for a run. Royal Botanic Graden is such a relaxing place for tourists. Enjoyed my run in the mornings, looking at various trees, taking some beautiful photos of the opera house and sydney harbor.

Lovely walk. Great area to walk. Many paths. If you want to enter the Opera House you have to pay for a tour. No need to go in, as the outside grounds are lovely. Lots of picture taking points. Great view of the harbor and bridge. U can see the walkers taking the bridge tour also.,

a stroll. we strolled from The Opera House, through the Botanic Gardens up to the Point then back through to the city.Be careful if you are doing this at lunch time as it seems most of the office workers put on their running shoes and jog, there are hundreds of them and some of them are just rude rushing past some of the time I felt that I was about to be pushed over.
A different view. You can't visit Sydney and not walk through the Botanic Gardens, not as lush as Melbourne, but lovely views across the harbour and lovely gardens around the Governors House.

The Opera House and Botanic Garden. Lots of eateries outside - the Botanic Gardens great for walking, lots of wild birds, free entrance, from Circular Quay and to visit the Government House, if you are lucky enough to be there on a day when it is open to the public.

Amazing views.. Amazing views of the iconic sydney harbour including the bridge and the opera house. The botanical gardens are beautiful. Wide, even path makes it suitable for everyone. Great for a bit of peace in the big city.

Seaside walk well worth the time. The seawall walk from the fantastic Sydney Opera House around to the Botanic Garden was a great way to spend the better part of an afternoon. The views from around the bay back to the Sydney Harbour bridge were fantastic and there were a great many wonderful photo opportunities.
A lovely short walk. From the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens is a lovely short walk. It's so pretty, easily accessible, and free. Delightful after the theater.

Great Walk. A wonderful walk from the Opera House along the foreshore of the Botanic Gardens. The view of the Harbour is amazing and the gardens are beautiful and peaceful. An enjoyable walk for people of all ages.

Stunning gardens. Go to the toilet before starting this walk, because it is a long way between toilet stops! It's a good flat walk around the Opera House, once inside the gardens the path does rise, but the gardens are simply stunning and there is so much to see and it is such a big place that you really need to allocate time to amble along the paths. Take a lunch and lie in the lush grass while looking out at the harbour, or visit the café within the park (also the location of the toilets). Government House also resides within in the park, so you can deviate for a photo opportunity or tour.

Do the walk. You can wonder around the gardens for hours. Walk alone the water and see all the great historic sites near by. The mint, the barracks, the Cathedral, the war memorial. Great walk for a sunny day and it is FREE.

A must for weary travellers. We often walk around here while visiting Sydney and it is never disappointing - the walk is relaxed and on the level and the mix of sea air - seaside and gardens - and with a great coffee shop in the gardens, makes it a very pleasant diversion from the hustle and bustle of the city

A Stroll In The Park. The walk is all about the views and relaxing, start at the Opera House and wind your way through the Botanic Gardens where you have so much space and unlike many gardens you are encouraged to explore, picnic on the grass and touch the plants.There are great views over the harbour and city and free water to top up your bottle and even a swimming pool so take your cozzy. Easy to spend half a day enjoying the Gardens and plenty of things to see.
great walk. Great walk. Relaxing, pretty and fun. You'll enjoy the Opera House and the Gardens very much. Two things you cannot miss while in Sydney.
wow. Fantastic views of Sydney habour and the garden is just so beautiful. I would definitely do this walk again!

jog it, walk it, push-chair it. As you can see from my ravings about the harbour, this walk is one way of enjoying the views (for free).There is space to walk side by side and chat to your friends. It is flat and the surface is smooth so you could rollerblade if you had to.Go and see what the fruitbats have done to the foliage in the Gardens

Great walk.. There is an entrance to the Botanic Garden right at the stairs to the Opera House. Walk along the lower harbor edge of the Garden to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair and then up past the swimming pool and exit by Mrs. Macquarie's bush walk into Wooloomoo and get a meat pie at Harry's Cafe de Wheels.
awesom scenic beauty.... dont have enough words nor i am a good with words...just visit the beautiful place in australia called sydney n u will fall in love with this city and people..
Relaxation at its best. We spent two days walking round the bottanical gardens and just sitting soaking up the atmosphere. Pity it's the other side of the world from us or we'd be there each week.

Nice walk but the scenic beach walks are better. Decided to do this simply because of the great tripadvisor reviews, however found this to be quite ordinary and was quite accustomed to the views of the Opera House and bridge from various other points which were all equally good - Blues point reserve, Milsons point, Kirribilli, Taronga Zoo ... all have great views.

Good Walk. You will find plenty of spots for taking snaps.
There are toilets and drinking water services and a very lovely path for strollers ( if u have a toddler like me)
The botanic garden has plenty of variety of trees and plants and would really appreciate the collection if you are tree/ plant lover.
A good way to see the Opera House. Took the relaxing walk and viewed the Opera House and Harbour bridge from Macquiarie's Point. I agree that it is the most beautiful harbour in the world.

Nice surpise in the inner city. This sounds a bit dreary to do - but try it. Its so beautiful and its surprising to see such a beautiful and HUGE park in the middle of some of the best real estate in the world.

Lovely walk and great park. The Oprah house is Such a lovely view from all angles. The walk into the park is great. As you make your way to mrs Macquarie's chair the view becomes better and better. The cleaned best maintained park I have ever seen. Lovely just chilling watching the world go by. must see.

loved it. The weather just made it all much easier. It was little bit too hot so the shade in botanic garden was nice welcome. When you get to the edge of garden there is amazing view of Opera house and the bridge.
Must see. Guided tour was informative. You shouldn't miss this icon of Sydney. Gift shop has some nice souvenirs that aren't outrageously priced.

Easy walk. There is a lot of maintenance work going on both the Opera House and the sea wall in the gardens so it's a little bit of a mess. This should not detract from the fact that it was a delightful walk on the (very sunny) day we did it. There is a motorised pseudo train for families with small children which goes round part of the gardens.The gardens has a small cafe and a shop which sells an assortment of touristy goods.As well as containing a very impressive array of plants, trees, shrubs etc., there are also a couple of ponds, one of which contains some large very large eels and mullet. A wide variety of birds also call this place home.It's a great place to walk off the excesses of an over indulgent holiday, whilst looking at some magnificent plants.
The inside is also beautiful. A must-see when in Sydney - take a stroll around the outside and enjoy the views of the harbour and the Bridge.

Set along the Sydney harbour coastline. It is always a lovely stroll along the Sydney harbour watching the ferries coming and going, watching a cruise ship load and unload in the harbour with the Sydney harbour bridge in the background and enjoying the amazing architecture of the Opera House and then continuing along the pathway into the Botanic Gardens which is where Gov House is situated and there are paths leading in all directions to view the scenery or just loll about of the lawns watching the boats bobbing about on the water.

Beautiful. Really lovely walk to the opera house, people using as a park is great to see. Lots of people just sitting enjoying the views, pitty it started to rain when we were walking through. Worth a visit

Beautiful scenic walkway.. We were lucky to do this walk on a really sunny day, so we enjoyed it a lot. Walking along the sea next to the botanical gardens with the view of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour was awesome. This is a great place to get some nice photographs as well.If you visit the Botanical Gardens you´ll probably end up walking parts of this walkway anyway. We also walked around the turn, but it´s not much to see on the other side a part from some military ships.And btw, beware of a lot of joggers! I´ve never seen so many joggers at one time.

BEAUTIFUL!!!!!. The whole area is beautiful and everything an easy walk. The gardens are right next to the high rise buildings, the iconic Sydney Opera House and the beautiful waterfront. The gardens are very well maintained and imaculate. Well worth a visit when exploring Sydney city.

Beautiful. You see the opera house on tv and then being able to see up close along with the harbour bridge is awesome. The botanic gardens are beautiful but the cafe is expensive so take food and drinks with you.

A relaxing treat in the middle of Sydney. One can't help but be taken in by the vast array of beautifully maintained gardens, crammed full of exotic species. Birdlife gives each area its special touch. A reasonable cafe is situated in the grounds, and serves a decent coffee and snack at a reasonable price. Only criticism would be the lack of clear signage when leaving one side of the gardens to get to the other!

Perfect for a picnic lunch. The other reviews are so true. A lovely walk with lots of photo opportunities. Try collecting some picnic food from one of the supermarkets (Google Coles and Woolworths) or from David Jones food hall or even a take away. There's lots of nice shady spots to sit and enjoy the food and views. No charges too - it's all free. No issues if you have a stroller, pram etc. Closest train stations for Opera House (Northern end) is Circular Quay and Southern end is St James.

Sydney Opera House. Very impressive structure in a prime location. It can be viewed from the harbor and near the structure itself. We took a tour and learned first hand about the various sections of the Opera House and what transpires in each area. Then we watched a magnificent play afterward. A wide selecton of performances are offered throughout the year. It is a must see if one is in Sydney. The circular quay walk is a pleasant walk and well worth doing.
Opera house. Great place to visit on your trip to Sydney and a focal point for other sites easy to get to transport

Can't beat the view of the Opera House. This is a classic Sydney Walk around the harbour and through the gardens, you can see both the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. The Gardens have lots of paths you can take to explore. Walk all the way through to Mrs Macquaries Chair for a great picture opportunity of the Opera House.

Iconic. The qunitessential Sydney walk - circular quay and opera house splendour, delightful botanical gardens (although you have to deviate from the main route), alongside the glorious harbour and on to Mrs Macquarie's Chair for a perfect spot to watch the water from.Every viistor and local Sydney sider should do this walk!
A beautiful walk/running trail. This was a beautiful walk/running trail. I looked forward to this route every morning during my stay in Sydney.
Always pleasant to walk by. Always walk past on the way to Opera House and so glad to have huge botanical garden next to CBD.

Beautiful Park. The walk through the Royal Botanic Gardens to the Opera House is great. The Gardens are beautiful and if you walk over to Mrs Macquaries Chair, you can get amazing photos of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. I love that the Garden encourages you to sit in the grass and enjoy the scenery. I love being able to see the lorikeets, cockatoos and other native birds in their natural habitat.
Brilliant. Perfect view .. Not that much crowded which i thought to be. Must see and do it . you will see different thing from natures to human made things.

A lovely way to spend the afternoon. Great way to get some exercise, learn about Aussie plant life, and soak up the charm of this city- with its joggers and Bon vivants enjoying the afternoon sun. The ideal thing to do after a tour of the opera house. Makes one feel one isn't a tourist.
Botanic Gardens. Beautiful gardens in the heart of the city, a great place to have a quiet relaxing walk.Saw a wedding being held in an area just off the main pathway.Superb location.

peaceful and not dull. there are constructions right now nearby the opera house but the walk itself is free and therefore as soon as you enter it becomes green, lush, more quiet and really interesting - there are numerous paths to stroll along - pick one from the many information plaques and just enjoy it! meet the birds and hug a tree :-)
Beautiful walk with lots to see. One of the best places to see the Sydney skyline and the way the gardens are set is beautiful. Also the chance to see parrots!

Sydney Opera House and Botanical gardens. Took the Darling Harbor to Quay ferry which brings you to the Opera House. Beautiful views of the Harbor as you walk around the Opera House and then the Botanical gardens are next to the Opera House. Lovely gardens.

Easy to walk round. This will give you all the picture you need. Have a seat and watch the comings and goings of the ferry commuters who keep a busy feeling about this area. The botanical gardens are free and an oasis of calm.

A great way to see the city and its people. Tourists and locals hang out around the Opera House and the Botanic Gardens. Don't just go see the outside of the Opera House, plan ahead and get some tickets to a concert for your trip. We did this and it was a good experience and we had great seats! After the concert, we walked through the RBGs and they are beautiful and extensive! What a treat compared to the snow that we left behind. I'd say plan about 3 hours in the gardens to sit, relax, and enjoy.

Relaxing walk.. The walk was a beautiful way to get from the Opera House to the Royal Gardens. The Gardens are beautiful and you also have a view of the City's skyline. Nice and quiet break from the high energy level of the Harbor area.

relaxing in the city. Seeing the famous opera house was so exiting, this famous image was finally in front of me. And what a surprise to discover so close to me the green surface of the botanic gardens. They contain amazing old trees full of stories. A lazy afternoon just walking around, enjoying this beautiful greenery and the good weather... What else!
Australia. Opera house is spectacular and when the sun shines it gleams, walking up the steps to go in is amazing you don't realise how big it is, marvellous experience a memory I will never forget.

A walk in the Garden. I visited Sydney 10 years ago when there was more bird life in the botanical gardens, this time it was a little disappointing. However the first view of the iconic opera house is one of the most impressive views in the world.

Botanic Gardens is a Dreamlike Experience. Walking through the Botanical Gardens is a wonderful experience when you are in Sydney. The layout and garden are so beautiful and peaceful. A great escape from the busy city.

Mind the repair works.. What a great walk with fabulous views from Mrs MacQuairies Point. In late November there were a lot of sea wall works ongoing, which of course detracts a little. Amazed at all the Aussies out jogging in the mid day sun.
Nice walk. Nice walk with lots to see very enjoyable. Well kept area very clean. Well worth a trip i would recommend this.

Wild Coakatoos in the Garden. The botanic gardens abut the Opera House, running east to Woolamooloo and south to the business and shopping area. They are a peaceful respite in a busy city, and are popular with the winged wildlife. We saw several cockatoos flying free from tree to tree.

Lovely place to stroll. Botanics Garden encourages you to "walk on the grass" - what a wonderful sentiment.
Very pretty and a peaceful oasis in a prime urban location.
Great walk through the park. Some of the best pictures of the Opera House we took right from the park. Walk along the edge of the water and it provides awesome viewpoints.

Enjoy the view. Probably the best place in Sydney to take visitors. Sydney Harbour is alive with a constant flow of traffic from little tug boats to mega cruise ships. After a long lunch at Doyles and a walk around the Opera House we took our visitors on this spectacular walk. They were amazed at the beauty of the gardens and fabulous Sydney Harbour
Pretty place to hang out. Lots of families and groups of friends hanging out on Sundays. Would make a good running venue. Great views and well maintained gardens for relaxing stroll
Beautiful. A lovely relaxing way to reach the gardens after seeing the iconic opera house a truly delightful,walk to the next attraction

Roll over the lawn and hug the trees. Totally enjoyed the breeze (from the sea) and rolling over the lawn. Had a book in hand and sat down under a huge tree. (I totally felt like been hugged by the tree) Had a wonder surprise when a colouful feather just landed on my feet. I went around hugging the big trees and feel their bark.Tiring after the walk, I took a short nap on the warm fuzzy lawn where I indulge in the smell of Mother Nature.It is a wonderful experience and I will go there again!
Beautiful views and birds galore. We saw flocks of cockatoos, ibis, myriad parrots in many colors, great foliage, and stunning views of the opera house and harbour

Just lovely. Wind down and just enjoy the lovely walk from the Opera House to the Botanical Gardens or vice versa. Locals - pls take your overseas visitors on this on a beautiful Sydney day and they won't forget it in a long time.
Memorable and pleasant. For an historic site this is worth the visit and be sure to walk around the lovely botanic gardens and art gallery afterwards

An Oasis in a Metropolis. This is a great activity whether you have just stepped off the plane and need to begin fighting jet-lag, or if you need a break from the pressures of the downtown area. My only advice is don't rush it. Take some time to practice your photography skills, as you'll be pressed to find greater beauty in the area.
Fantastic Park. Wel worth visiting with stunning views of the harbour and the opera house.The Gardens themselves are really nice.

A nice walk before your show starts. Its a fair distance between the Circular Quay central area to the Opera House, it's quite nice to take the time to walk to the Botanics Garden and have a walk around. We went there in between time before our show starts in the evening, quite a nice view and a few attractions to notice in the Botanics Garden. One thing to note is the gate for the garden closes quite early though, they shuts off at around 5.30pm, so do go there a little earlier, I think once you are in, you are able to stay in there a little after the gate closing time, the exit gate should be open all the time, just that the gate to enter has a time limit (we didn't try though, so.. no guarantee =P, well we didn't see any staff of management the whole time there)
Fantastic venue. We were lucky enough to be able to see Mandy Patinkin and Nathan Gunn perform in the Opera House. What a marvelous venue (and a great performance).

Where else in the World!. One can witness grandeur in building and botanic architecture in 1 hour of a stroll. Where else in the world could one enjoy the splendor of Sydney harbor together with brilliant human creativity?

Two lovely attractions together!. We managed to visit the Opera House late afternoon and booked the last tour at 5 pm. While waiting for that tour, we went over to the Botanic Gardens, and were fortunate to catch the last tram at 4.30pm. It was a wonderful value for money ride, as given the short time we have before the opera house tour started, we managed to have a very comfortable ride through the beautiful grounds of Botanic Gardens, without working up a sweat. Having three children with us means we would not be able to walk long or far, so the tram was just nice for us, to savour the cool wind, as well as to enjoy the scenic landscape of both the gardens as well as the harbour area. My children absoulutely loved it. I would strongly recommend the tram ride for families with young children. If time allows, you can always get off at various stops to enjoy the garden. Last tram leaves at 4.30 though. For us, it was a great two in one fun, given that we only reached the area at 4.10pm. After the tram, we were just in time to go for our tour at the Opera House, which itself is a architectural beauty.
Easy walk with great views. The views of the bridge and opera house on this walk are well worth it. The botanic gardens are also well worth a visit.

A great walk!. If you have the time and the weather is good do not miss taking this walk. The Gardens grounds should not be missed, and the views to the Opera House and the Harbor Bridge are not to be missed.

Wonderful walk Great Views. We loved the walk along the waterfront with the great views. There was something new to discover around every corner! We were a group of five adults and we all loved this walk!
just beautiful. nothing to dislike and everything to like....beautifully done bot it is the setting on the harbour and opera house that makes this place different from other gardens

A Relax Walk. Many travellers are taken by coach to the Botanic Garden. They just take photos of the Opera House lying opposite of the harbour. Yes, they can take good photos there. But the best way to enjoy the Opera House and the Garden is to take the walk along the waterfront. It is just amazingly beautiful, calm and relax. Don't waste your opportunity to enjoy a healthy and wonderful experience in Sydney.

Lady Martin's Chair at the Botanical Gardens. If you want to sit and relax while taking in the view & the busy boating traffic on Sydney Harbour,take a packed lunch and sit on the many benches provide ,or on the grass.You can stroll along the garden's pathways surrounded by unusual flora with those Latin botanical names! The Botanical Gardens is a great place to enjoy a quiet time while you are visiting Sydney.

A timeless stroll. When you walk from the Circular Quay past the Opera House and around Farm Cove through the Botanical Gardens its almost like walking back in time. You start your walk at East Circular Quay and you pass the bustling shops, eateries and boutiques of a very modern city, then you pass by the beautiful sails of the Sydney Opera House. You continue on and see where Queen Elizabeth first set foot on Australian soil, following this beautiful walk takes you by the sea wall to the foot of The Royal Botanic Gardens. These are always a pleasure to explore with various displays and exhibitions. Refreshments are also available.Finally resting at Lady Macquarie's chair, a bench like carving that was provided so Mrs Macquarie could reflect by the harbour when her husband governed a young colony. The view of the Opera House and Harbour bridge from her is unsurpassable. There is an observation deck where you can get that fantastic photo of these two icons. There is also refreshments available and some tables and chairs to rest at while enjoying this fabulous view.Of course there is more to see from this point too. You can look down the harbour towards Taronga Park Zoo and directly across at Admiralty House and Kirribilli House.It's only a 3 kilometre stroll, you can do it at your own pace and take in some of the most beautiful scenery Sydney has to offer. A must do when you visit Sydney!

The Best landmark in Australia. You can spend a day just walking and viewing the sites of the Opera House access inside the opera house also.Just walking the steps is magnificent but there are lifts available.Botanic gardens are a few minutes walk from the Opera House steps well worth a walk through the gardens and respite break a the lovely Cafe within the gardens.

Great Place to Walk, Jog, or Picnic. I never miss an opportunity to visit the Gardens when I'm in Sydney. I love walking through the park and being near the water. The fresh air and fragrant gardens really put you in touch with Sydney's beauty and coastal setting!

Well worth a visit. We did a very lovely walk from Hyde Park through The Botanic Gardens to the Opera House. So much more interesting than taking the train! Lots of Trees, Scenery and an Art Gallery to visit too

Beautiful walk. I love flowers and saw them in abundance on this walk as well as several birds up close and personal. We walked down through Hyde Park to the botanic gardens and then to the opera house. On our way back through the botanic gardens we stopped at a very nice restaurant in the palm gardens for lunch. There are many separate formal gardens on this walk and you pass by some nice monuments as well

Beautiful walk in Sydney. It is a totally free but beautiful place to see some of the best sights in Sydney. Just walk through the delightful gardens and then you can do the tour of the iconic Opera House to find out about the design and construct of this outstanding building.

Although i. Although it was raining when we first walked through the gardens, the sun came out by our 3rd day visiting Sydney and it was so lovely! Everything is green there with a few lovely fountains and gloriously green grass to sit and relax on in between tourist trips. As a really big park it has endless little spots to explore with a quaint cafe and shop hidden among the trees. So glad we took the time to enjoy it!

Walking around the opera house. This iconic structure has to be seen while you are in Sydney. Multiple ways to see it, including from the ferries as well as you can walk right around it - the walk through the botanical gardens is a great way to get views of the Opera House as well as see the gardens themselves.

Beautiful. This is a must if you are visiting Sydney. The Opera House and Botanic Gardens are right on the Harbour. Walking from the Opera House to the Gardens you can take in the beautiful view of the sparkling water and watch the ferries and sailboats go by. The Gardens are so lovely and peaceful with places to get food and drinks.

Get the best view of the Opera House!. The Botanic Gardens are beautiful and scenic as you can walk along the harbor from the Opera House around to the Australian Naval Yard. The best photos of the Opera House may be from the point of the Botanic Gardens. There's on-street parking, but walking is much better!
great view. you should do it the other way round but is is a fantasitc walk ,the botanic garden is worthwile a visit by its own

A Beautiful Walk. We walked from the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens - it is an easy walk and well marked. We were a little disappointed that the trail next to the Harbor was under construction, but that was only a minor disappointment. The trees are unbelievable and I loved that the park felt so informal.
Such enjoyment from a walk.. The scenery along this walk is the best in the world and the gardens have lovely plants and a great cafe. Then stop by for a visit in the Opera house.
Peaceful. What a lovely walk beautiful well kept gardens . And the trees !!!!! Amazing , loved this place away from the hustle and bustle of crowds
Beautiful Walk. the gardens are a must see and the approach to the Opera house from this angle is gre\at . you also walk past the Government house
So relaxing. It is a must to wander the opera house for court and walk the botanical gardens. The succulent garden with it metal sculptured background is ever changing.
The Classic Sydney walk. The Botanical Gardens are really lovely, and the walk ends at the Opera House. And I saw a kookaburra. Need I say more?

Beautifully landscaped. Please take time to enjoy the walk from/to the Opera House thru the Botanic Gardens. We have made this walk on all 8 of our Sydney trips, and it is so beautiful and relaxing. Don't miss it!

I was a little spooked but it was good. I already new that I would encounter different types of birds, but I QUICKLY learned that some of the animals in OZ make the most interesting sounds. and when you walk through the gardens as the sun is setting you really do feel like your in a secret garden... A little spooky if like me you're walking alone but SOOOO worth the small moments of paranoia haha

Relax in a busy city. Located right next to Sydney harbour the Opera House and a walk through Botanic Gardens is a must when you visit Sydney. The Gardens allow some picturesque views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.
Walkers Dream!. The Botanical Gardens and walk to Opera House is so gorgeous...the public art, beautiful birds, trees, harbor and Opera House are just breath taking...never tired of any of it!!

A must do for the tourist. Stunning views as you walk the sparkling foreshore of these beautiful gardens full of magnificent old trees and beautiful flowers and with stunning views of Sydney Harbour, the Opera House and the Bridge. Have a coffee under the great Morton Bay Fig or better still book for lunch in the restaurant above set in the trees.

Early morning or Late evening. Get yourself out and about in one of the worlds best city botanical gardens and then stroll around to one of the most iconic landmarks of the 20th century, all whilst taking in the vista's of Sydney Harbour.
Beautiful. The flowers and trees were blooming. What I liked the most was each specimen was labeled. Wear comfortable shoes and take a wind breaker.

Afternoon Stroll. Take this walk and enjoy both the Gardens and Australian plant variety,the scenic views of the harbour and houses all along the coast. Very relaxing lush green surroundings, you forget for an hour or so that you are in a big city. Lots of places to sit and enjoy the world going by.
Take the time to enjoy the view.. Get up close to some of their best views in Sydney. A great way to experience Sydney and enjoy done exercise too.
brilliant. Best place to go and chill out. So quiet and tranquil. I love the opera house. Great place for a decent coffee too.

A Must-do for any visitor to Sydney. We enjoyed the walk - had to dodge the hordes of office-workers having work-outs and jogs and power-walks along the same route-and they are (mostly..) VERY rude Sydneysiders. We managed fantastic photos. Seen a great variety of birds, a possum and even a tree-kangaroo !. Views are to die for. The Botanical Garden with it's population of Bats is very interesting . I found the gardens needed some serious tending in places. Also some rubbish laying around. A good experience though. Try it !

Great Early Morning Walk Option. I did this walk a couple of times when I stayed in Sydney on business earlier in the year. One morning was a pea soup fog and it almost obscured the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The next day was fine. A great way to start the day!

Another great walk. Beautiful views and walk. Note that the Government House is only open Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. It is free but they close, as we found out without notice for private events. The grounds stay open.

Short Walk to an Awesome Garden. Two great sights next to each other. After the spectacular view of the opera house and lounging at the Opera Bar with a view of the Harbour Bridge, we made our way to the Royal Botanical Gardens,took around 5min. if you pass the side of the opera house.Such a great garden to chill in, lovely place to have a picture, to bring the kids or your pets. Interesting things to see here with a great view.
Very pleasant walk.. We walked from the CBD to the gardens, to Mrs. MacQuarrie's Chair and on the the Opera House and Circular Key. There are many great views.

Lovely, no matter the weather. Spent the day walking around downtown and ended up looping around here. Weather went from windy and a little bit of rain to lovely and sunny and quite warm. No matter the weather, it's a lovely stretch of waterfront.

Recommended. Must go after visiting the Opera House.Very easy walk and the scenic view is along the coastline to Mrs Macquaries Chair is cool. Return duration will take you about an hour ( speed dependent of course )Great view of the sunset too if you're going in the evening.TIP :Just take note that closing hours.If you missed this, the park will be closed and you have to walk at the outer perimeter of the park and it's quite a distance to get back to Circular Quay. maybe 15mins more.

A relaxing afternoon of people watching. In April the flowers are in full bloom, and the area is just relaxing and wonderful. Grab a coffee in the coffee shop, and sit on a bench and enjoy the view of the harbor, the joggers, and people relaxing on their lunch hour. You can spend all day in the botanical gardens walking around and this walk is worth the exercise.

Explore thoroughly. Beautiful if you explore the full gardens. The first time I went I only explored the waterfront, but you need to fully walk in to the gardens to get the full effect. There was a flower garden in spring I particularly liked

Great stroll for taking in the sights. This walk is gentle and gradually takes you to a vantage point at Mrs Macquaries Chair where you can take in views of the Opera House and Harbour. The Botanic Gardens itself is a great place for children to run around and let off steam. Fun for all!

very nice. very nice walk nive café At the end of the tour, they shouldn't charge $40 for a touchedup photo they took at the beginning of it. This is worth it $10 max, together with a 3 mins video cd, etc. They could make more money because everybody could buy it and the price would be honest

Scenic walk to the gardens. We started at the Opera House and ended at the Royal Botanic Garden's Mrs Macquarie's chair. It's really scenic along the way with great views of the Opera House, Harbour bridge and clear water. It's a pretty long walk but take your time to enjoy the scenery and the many pretty trees, plants and birds. We came in the early evening and was able to see the sunset which was great!Take note of the closing hours of the gardens as we exited slightly late and couldn't walk the shortcut out through the gardens, and had to walk a longer way back to circular quay.

Opera House ,and Gardens. I think the trouble is you see so many photos of the Opera house it either grabs you or does not ! You will need a good pair of legs to climb the steps and also for walking round the Botanic Gardens

really nice gardens. the view around the opera house is great and the gardens are lovely. If you can manage time go to the government house as well. It's only open certain days though - Fri-Sun and there is a limited spaces on tours so you need to get tickets.

Opera House to Gardens and ohh what a view!. This wasn't my first visit to Sydney, but it was my first trip purely for leisure and staying at the Shangri La meant the walk started long before we left the hotel.The weather decided to contribute and we were gifted with a clear sunny crisp Saturday morning, with the ferry's doing brisk service and a fleet of sails behind the Opera House to make a picture perfect horizon. The walk itself is easy and level most of the way, but for anyone with less puff a stop at one of the many bistros or restaurants provides a refreshing breather. One criticism however, the Opera Kitchen on the lower level of the Opera House is one to miss. The food is uninspiring at best and there is no shade on the upper area, the table without a view did nothing to offset the dismal atmosphere. However onwards to the gardens and Ohh was it worth it! The tree embalmed elevated lookout to the bridge and bustle left us breathless. A veritable oasis for one to watch the world go by. It is easy to see why people flock to Sydney on days like this...

nice walk. you can start from the botanic gardens instead to see the opera house and bridge from the distance and then get closer and closer !botanic gardens are nice and big, with path well indicated
Gorgeous. It's our home city but never get to walk in early morning and it was wonderful. You can walk along harbour or take other oaths. Meet other locals, tourists and see amazing scenery

Iconic Walk. The Opera House is such an iconic piece of architecture, interesting from every angle. With my European heritage, I'd call the Botanic Garden a big park, but it's not really important, it's lovely place to walk in, with views over the parts of the Sydney harbour, beautiful trees, bushes and rocks. Very nice shop to buy quality gifts. When I was the first time, there were so many yellow crested cacatoos, it was incredible. It was a pity they were gone when my daughter came from Europe but she still loved the place.
Amazing views. Gorgeous gardens.. The opera house really is stunning. The gardens are beautifully maintained. A quiet oasis in the heart of Sydney.

Pretty view and walk. I spent a lot of time in the botanic gardens while in Sydney. I loved sitting up my Mrs. Macqaurie's chair and reading looking over the harbour. it is quite busy with runners during lunch hour however. I found that walking over the construction bridge from the opera house at that time to be crowded with people trying to get by one another.

pleasantly surprised. visited the opera house and harbor bridge while staying at potts point, so decided to take a stroll back through the botanical gardens since it was a beautiful day. the garden was well maintained and as it was spring, most of the flowers were in bloom. particularly loved the tulips.

Lovely walk. A leisurely walk from the opera house, through the botanical garden, over to Mrs. Macquarie's chair is lovely - and you are rewarded with wonderful views of Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera house.
Iconic and worth the effort. You see the Opera House in nearly every photo of Sydney, and even after multiple visits I still enjoy this walk and make sure to include it as part of my trip.
The Design. What I like best about this building is the overall design of it. It lives up to it's expectations. If you don't do nothing else, I highly recommend this on your to-do-list.

Building works at start of walk. Well worth the walk to see the Opera House and the Botanic Gardens give great views. Suggest if it is really hot to go on the train from the Opera House entrance to the Gardens.

Not to be missed.. You can walk along the water or up into the botanic gardens, which stretch for many acres into Sydney. The view from every angle is worth photographing, especially the views of the Opera House. The park's fountains and statuary are very interesting and, in most cases, lovely. I spent hours on this walk and barely scratched the surface of the place. Don's pass it by--it's one of the best features of Sydney.

Must see. The walk to Opera house and then Botanic Gardens is so stress free. Especially when bright sky but a little wind only, so relaxing. Recommend tourists not in rush do this walk, very relaxing.

Magic walk. The walk around the edge of Sydney Harbour from Circular Quay, past the Opera House, Farm Cove and into the Botanic Gardens is one of the best walks in Australia.It is completely level, although can be very busy with office workers exercising at lunch time.This is where European settlement in Australia started in 1788, so has a huge significance.The Harbour is stunning and the Gardens magnificent. If you have time, continue up through the Gardens to the NSW Art Gallery. Free entry and fabulous.

Very relaxing. If you want a relaxing stroll, where you can take your time and enjoy the views, this is the walk for you. Although it sometimes gets a bit congested on the walkway, it is ell worth doing.

a pleasant walk with nice plants and birds and sculptures. we had a walk from the opera house through the botanic gardens, which were free. Quite pleasant but not the best botanic garden that we have visited. if you go on the right day you get access to the government house, we were unlucky so we could only walk around the outside of the house. a nice place for a picnic and there is a tearoom too. you may even see local school kids doing their sports lesson in the park.
Great walk. Interesting variety of old trees. In October the walk way in two locations was being repaired however should be finished soon.

The picture post card views. The walk up from the opera house through the botanic gardens is just lovely with views of the harbour and the lovely governors house. Take a stroll and take in the view whist sitting in the cool shade under one of the lovely trees. Relax and enjoy.

Great!. For those of you who like to bird watch or take pictures of flowers and trees, this is the place. Compared to North America, the sounds of the birds, the colourful lorakeets flying around, and different types of trees are a feast for the senses.

Beautiful views, lovely well set out gardens.. Loved it all nothing to dislike. There were some unusual tree formations, lots of fruit bats squawking and spectacular views. Definitely a place to visit.
Botanic Gardens. Beautiful and good for hiking, walking, biking and people watching. There were quite a few stairs so it may be hard for the handicapped.
Nice Views. Nice walk with great views of the opera house and harbour bridge which you can get all in one photo. Quite a long walk if you also decide to walk back into the city.

Highly recommended for everyone. So much to see and do during, before and after your walk and not too far to walk. I really love to see the loveliest part of Sydney with all the icons but also the Conservatorium then onto the Art Gallery in the Domain and finish off in the city for a lovely day out.

Relaxing environment in a big vibrant city. Stunning views on this walk from the iconic Opera House to the beautiful Botanic Gardens. An easy walk with cement paths. When looking at the map when we returned to the hotel we were amazed how much ground we covered. We took our time so we could take photos and found a food stand and sat down on a bench with a view of the bridge and water to have our water and snack. Very enjoyable.

Awesome. On a nice summers day this is one of the most beautiful walks. I usually start at the Botanic Gardens and finish at the Opera House.Then once you hit Circular Quay there are plenty of places to eat or have a drink.A must if you visit Sydney, You won't be disappointed .

Beautiful. A must do walk to appreciate the beauty of the Harbour and the Gardens. We did this walk as a last minute thing on our final day in Sydney and wish we'd done it earlier. Fantastic photo opportunities.

Scenery Plus. This is a slightly uphill but nevertheless easy 1km walk from Sdney Harbour to next to the Sydney CBD. You will be rewarded with stunning scenery of Sydney Harbour including the Harbour Bridge.

Scenic. Brilliant. Always something new to see. Views which always vary. The Botanic Gardens frequently have special exhibitions of rare plants. Enjoy a relaxing coffee and possible visit the Art Gallery afterwards.

Opera house and botanical gardens. Amazing place the opera house couldn't get over how lovely it was and when it was lite up at night it was stunning and the gardens what a beautiful place we had lunch in the cafe in the gardens and it was corgeous.

heart of Sydney. you can't pass by Sydney without walking along the opera house, walk along the coastal side until you reach the botanical garden.The bad news is that the botanical garden charges fees for a visit 6$.

nice experience. What a wonderful peaceful walk, where you can take in the Views of the bridge and harbour. The walk is on the flat right around the coastline with great views and much to see and learn. Beautiful views of the Harbour Bridge, a spectacular arrangement of flora and fauna.its such a nice way to relax after being in the bustle of Sydney all day.Everyone should do this walk!
Great Sydney Icon. has to be the most picturesque walkway in the world. The most unusual opera house in the world set on the shore of the prettiest harbour in the world.

Beautiful harbour and park views. Just strolling along taking in the sights and sounds was wonderful. Lots of people around on the day that we did this.. but it was still great with wonderful Sydney weather which was fabulous for some very clear and good photographs. Thanks Sydney for turning it on !!!!

I did think I wanted to do a tour of the Opera House. I am so glad that we took the time to do the Tour of the Opera House. I learned so much about it and think it is a "must see". Take the time to do this. It is very interesting and the history of it is incredible.
Beautiful gardens. All I can say is that the walk was beautiful. The gardens area is huge. The trees there are magnificent. A great place to walk through when going to the Opera house.
Nice. Nice walk nothing overwhelming but the view. Great peaceful place to take a nap. If you need a little peace and quiet away from the Harbor crowd then this is a good option. Easy walking paths.

Sydney's Garden of Eden. The Walk from the Opera House through the Botanic Gardens is one of Sydney's very best. You don't need to be an arborist to appreciate the huge effort that goes into maintaining and developing this park. The walkway to Mrs Macquarie's Chair is subject to repairs at the moment so allow yourself to leave the waterside and be drawn into the gardens.
Quiet Beauty. The Botanical Gardens is a must if you enjoy the outdoors and seeing the amazing aray of plant life in Australia. We were fortunate to see a couple get married - what a place to pick!

Gardens walk. Pleasant walk back to Campbell St. taking 30 minutes, while views of the harbour, gardens and old buildings such as Parliament, Museum, Premiers house and gardens caused us to pause at times.

Best view of Sydney Harbour. Get off the train at Martin Place, take the Macquarie Street exit, cut through Sydney Hospital and then walk the loop therough the Domain and past NSW Art Gallery Andrew (Boy) Charleton Pool, Lady Macquarie Chair, Farm Cove and around the front of the Opera House.Excellent, free and memorable.Finish at Opera Kitchen on the Lower Concourse for a cold beer.

What an amazing city. This place is really amazing.. Sydney.. Been leaving here for 3 years and still finding out that I only know little pieces of how beautiful it is..
A must see

Beautiful!. I loved sydney!I lived here for a year and I never got bored of seeing the Opera house and the harbour. When ever I had a spare day or hours I would always just walk here! You can never get bored if it!I would recommend having a tour of the opera house- its not as pretty as the outside - but worth doing.

Worth the effort, lots of photo opportunities. This is one of those great sydney things to do that is free and enjoyable. Its a spot many like on new years eve and you can see why. It has a nice cool breeze with great views of the harbour, the harbour bridge and the opera house. You can take a break on the grass in the botancial gardens and eat lunch like the locals do.
Great easy walk along the waterfront. Can be very warm on a sunny day, so remember a hat to avoid getting sunburnt. Plenty of seats to stop at and admire the view along the way.
It is a must!. This is one of the Greats Walks in Australia. I love everything about it. The Views the Location. Only one Toilets on it is out of the way.

My most favourite outing in Sydney - and it's all free!. Whenever I am in Sydney I make sure I find the time to run from Woolloomooloo Finger Wharf to the Opera House via Mrs MacQuarie's chair. I would recommend jumping in a taxi from your city hotel and being dropped off at Harry's Pie Van. Then walk passed the swanky apartments opposite the restaurants of Finger Wharf. The path from here is not completely obvious but there are steps that lead up to a harbourside Olympic Pool. The path follows the cliff around passed Mrs Mac's chair and around the headland to reveal one of the most spectacular views in the World. The stunning harbour in all its glory, with the Opera House and Harbour Bridge all "in frame". The path is bordered by the beautiful Botannical Gardens on one side and the Harbour on the other. Photo opportunities galore. End your adventure with a walk around the front of the Opera House and a cool drink at Opera Bar.
worth a walk. It is huge. I got tired and walked out from the other end without visiting many areas. It is not as compact as i expected.
Beautitful setting. The walk to the gardens and the gardens themselves are well worth it. One of the best and authentic attractions of Sidney.

Wonderful....!!. Loved the greenery and the view. We went there in the morning and there were so many people who were jogging. It was a delight to go to this botanical garden which is facing Sydney harbour.

Sunset or early morning walk. Nice for a leisurely stroll, best done with family/companion to provide more interest along the way. I did it in reverse, from the gardens to the Opera House. I'd rank it round the middle among my many solo walks around Sydney, behind Circular Quay-Opera House/Woolloomoolloo-Art Museum/Bondi-Bronte/St. Mary's cathedral-Sydney Hospital. I'd recommend Rushcutters Bay and Surry Hills beside this walk. Government House was a highlight of this walk for me, the tour and its gardens. Other points of interest, the bats in the gardens and strolling down Macquarie Rd.
botanic gardens. Very interesting botanic gardens and great views over the harbour. Botanic gardens must be one of the best I've seen.
Worth the effort for the views. Not a major walk, but the gardens are beautiful. The views of the harbour are superb and there is a pleasant cafe en-route.
Serene walk. We actually did the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House. The Opera House's architecture is so unique and pretty and the Botanic Gardens were so serene.
A must. I walked from the Gardens to the Opera House after a 23 hour flight. Plenty of things to see and places to stop. Definitiely worth the walk. I just want to go back!
Beautiful and scenic. Another must to do when in Sydney. Buy an ice cream and enjoy the walk, the nature is wonderful. Do attend the outdoor cinema if you get the chance, it's superb and really fun!

Great. The royal botanic garden are a "must see" place. The trees are fantastic, the grass is weel cared. If you have enough time, you can sit on the grass and relax. There is a great view frim the Garden towards the Opera House.
Peaceful and Beautiful. This is a great walk and the botanic gardens are superb, as is the amazing view of the harbour and heads.
