You will see exotic birds, beautiful plants and have to pinch yourself tto make sure you are really among all this beauty. Remember that the gates to the gardens close at 6:30 PM.
New Years in Sydney. Great place to spend it if you get in early enough! View was fantastic and a great crowd of people - families, groups and couples. Can bring your own picnic!
Not to be missed. Easy stroll from the hustle and bustle if circular quay and the opera house to the relaxed gardens. Recommended for a complete change of pace.

You cant Not ... but oddly disappointed. We went early, to beat the crowds ... but still lots of people there, The Opera house is beautiful but closed to visitors, and there was building work going on to the grounds, so we werent given a free reign around the house. The botanical gardens were beautiful too, but again, it felt like a coach load of tourists were always just in front of us. Don't expect a peaceful walk unless you get off the beaten track i think would be my advice.

Wow.. How can there be so much so close? From two of the most recognisable icons in the world through to the great Botanical gardens, this is a walk worth doing and doing well. Take your time, sit and think of the history.
Make way for the Joggers!. Great Views of the Gardens and Opera House.Spoilt March 2013 by the Scaffold and building works outside the Opera House. Sit and Chill and hug a few trees
One of the best strolls in Sydney - not to be missed. The Opera House is iconic, but so many people don't take the time to explore the Botanic Gardens. It's a shame when it's free!

Improved, Sydney Opera House. The restaurant's on the Forecourt area are vastly improved and not as expensive as I had expected, having worked there in the 1990's. We stopped by for a bite before Carmen performance at Mrs Macquarie's Chair venue. The vibe was electric. So many people around. Just fantastic. Keep in mind that the Gardens close at either 6 or 6.30pm. You do get locked out. Beware, as the gardens are vast.
Lovely views. This is a pleasant walk with wonderful views of the north shore and Opera House. It's not a long walk (10-20 mins depending on your pace).

A must do.. Take a tour of the Opera House as the exterior is only half the story, then afterward wander through the botanic gardens and experience the lavish and well maintained gardens, and they are free to all.
From the green belt to a cultural icon.. A great way to enter the city. We didn't like the construction area at the Opera House with some steep steps to climb over.

special place. we took the opera tour. it is over 1200 steps but if you are able it is worth while. ask for senior rate and hope the orchestra is practicing as was for us. do buy the picture since in includes a DVD of the opera house.

Love Sydney Harbour!. The best way to experience the Harbour and surrounding parklands! We sat at Lady Macquarie's Chair after our walk and picnicked our way through a lazy Friday afternoon. Add to your 'To Do' list if you are visiting Sydney!
Walk this way. Great walk in the morning with harbour and bird life. Terrible if there's a special event in the Gardens with all the rubbish commercial activity blocking your way
Don't miss. Took a long leisurely walk around the Gardens and then went to a Sunday afternoon Opera "best hits". Wonderful.

Wonderful walk. Before our show at the Sydney Opera House, we spent a few hours wandering the gardens. It was a delightful walk and gives you some great views of the opera house and the Sydney Harbor Bridge. We were there at the end of their summer, so there weren't as many flowers or plants in full bloom to see, but it's a great way to spend an hour or two and take in some great views. There are some cafe's and restaurants in the garden, but we caught them between lunch and dinner and weren't able to stop in, but their menus had some delicious items!

Fantastic views,. A walk in lovely gardens where you are invited to walk on the grass and hug the trees! Views over the Opera House and Harbour Bridge as a bonus and the comings and goings of the ferries in the harbour. Wonderful place.

The Botanic Garden is a very spacious area were one can really relax, take a walk or just laze around.. There are a lot of huge endemic trees and all around are beautiful flowers.There is also a mini train or a carriage where one can ride around the garden. But for me walking and communing with nature was best.I have several pictures taken here.

FREE and nice exercise with great views. The Opera House to the Botanic Gardens Walk is free. Gorgeous place to take pictures all over the place. Tons of places to eat all along the harbour.Playgrounds for the children at the Botanic Gardens and tons of greenery for the adults in the large Botanic Gardens, including a cactus garden and a rose garden. Beautiful huge trees like the ones seen in the movie, "Lord of the Rings". Too bad the Greenhouse was closed.I didn't take the Opera House tour, but visitors often do that too.

A Must-See. Both the Opera House and the Botanic Gardens are world-class, and a must-see when you are in Sydney. Just walk around the Opera House and enjoy the views of the harbor. Go inside if it is open and enjoy the interior and perhaps a drink at the bar in the lobby. The Botanic Gardens is among the best in the world, with extraordinary landscaping, easy walking paths, and labeled plants. A very peaceful respite from your busy day in the City!

Walks. Western Australian Gallery was excellent. We found it as we ventured through the Botanical Gardens on our way to the Opera House. Everywhere is so well maintained. Don't know how they all cope with the heat!

Exhilarating , Mrs Macquaries Chair,the area provided great views of the Opera house and Harbour Bridge .. Liked everything , disliked ........leaving......It was only the first week of the holiday , but already seemed like four . My stay in Sydney was far too brief , but New Zealand was waiting .

well worth doing. You can't visit Sydney without visiting the Opera House and attending a concert in the main auditorium was one of the highlights of our trip. The botanic gardens are an oasis of peace and quiet in this busy city and are well worth visiting. If you are there at the week-end you can take a conducted tour of the Governors House. Well worth doing.

Classic Sydney. You haven't been to Sydney properly unless you've done this. A classic for locals and tourists alike. Go and do it again if it's been a while... Seeing Sydney's skyscrapers soaring over the treetops is just spectacular.

Excellent and you have to go. You cannot go without having your picture taken in front of the Opera House as it is Iconic. You get great views of the harbour bridge as well and there is quite a lot going on.

Not worth your time. These gardens are nothing special. We thought it would be a pretty walk, but it's your typical gardens. I wouldn't waste time here if you only have a couple of days. At one point you do get a good view of the opera house and harbour bridge, but you can do that from a lot of other locations.

Beautiful Botanical. I took my visitor to the Gardens as she is very keen on flora and fauna and she was absolutely delighted with the experience. We walked the Gardens for several hours and attended most of the displays. My favourite was the cactus area, hers the herb garden, We finished with the walk from Mrs Maquarie's Chair to the Opera House. It was a hot day so quite exhausting.

A Must Do. For me, there is nothing more enjoyable than a walk through the Botanic Gardens starting from the Opera House and hugging Farm Cove, heading up to Mrs Macquaries chair and past the Andrew Charlton Pool. On a summer evening, be sure to check out a movie - they set up an enormous screen in Farm Cove and the experience is magic.

Keep walking.... If you're coming from the Harbour Bridge end make sure you keep walking around the opera house. My husband took our older children up the steps of the opera house while I walked around the other side with the baby in the pram. He was then meant to catch up with me.... however he looked (obviously a blokes look) and thought you couldn't get through... The path does become a lot more narrow as you walk towards the botanical gardens. It is still a great walk with many good photo opportunities of the opera house.
Beautiful and relaxing walk. Well presented and an easy walk sweeping Sydney Harbour. Worth the effort if you have a few hours to spare.

Great "Free" thing to do while in Sydney. Very relaxing scenic walk, which was even interesting for me and I am a local! There is lots of signage to educate you about locations and tree species. Beautiful gardens, with ponds, areas with shade, benches and there is a cafe in the middle of the gardens if you don't bring your own picnic, however I think a picnic is the best thing to do.
Love the view. Took the Hop of/hop off bus. I do recommend that bus. Opera house was fantastic. Took the tour and well worth it.

Unsurpassed beauty. Sydney Harbour is one of the show places of the world. The Botanical Gardens is a huge and magnificently maintained site and one can spend a full day wandering through the huge variety of plants, ferns and trees. The walk from the Opera House should be a leisurely meander through the gardens, ending up at "Lady Macquarie's Chair". Take a picnic lunch to enjoy on the manicured lawns.

Great Views. The Botanic Gardens are beautiful for either a walk round or to have a picnic. Some really good views of the Opera House from a different angle from the gardens. If you don't want to walk around the gardens they do have a little train at a cost of $A8 that will take you so far to give you a feel for what is there. The Opera House itself is my favouite building, you can have a tour around inside and out which is worth doing. There is also some nice little bars and resturants around the Opera House where you can sit and have a drink and take in the spectacular views.
Dont miss out. If your in Sydeny it would be rude not to go and see the famous Opera House, its areal speticle and if only to say you were there, its a must see.
Not to be missed.. Lovely part of Sydney, just walking and taking in the atmosphere around the city, with the skyline in the background. Perfect.
Great views. After taking a walk around the Opera House and then walking up to the Botanic Gardens with spectacular views over Circulary Quay and the Harbour is certainly worth the time.
lovely. The Royal Botanic Gardens is one of the prettiest I have visited! The walk from the gardens to the Opera House is great, just watch out for all the runners and bikers;)

A pleasant walk. I actually walked this in reverse, coming from King's Cross thru the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House and waterfront. The gardens are very beautiful, with many exotic plants and lots of wild birds walking around. There are lovely views of Sydney Harbour and then you come up behind the Opera House and to the waterfront. Peaceful, serene, beautiful - it's all of these. Do not miss it.
Two just have to do while in Sydney. Entry to Botanic Gardens is free and Tour of Opera House is for 1 hour and excellent value for money. Optional extra are the souvenir photos (Aus $40).
A Good Walk. We walked from the Opera House to Mrs McQuerries seat whih takes you through the botanic gardens. It is a very pleassant walk and offers stunning views of the bridge and Opera House.
opera house. When we where in the Opera House area it difficult to get from the Opera House to the Botanical gardens 7/3/13
Must see. Famous building - on the "have to see" list when visiting Sydney. Lots of lovely restaurants and pubs nearby.
Spectacular. You need to allow 4-5 hours to get around here, best for me was the herb garden. We saw 7 weddings in the gardens when we came. Beautiful

Lovely scenery. This filled up an entire morning, and the scenery was well worth the walk! We started at the Botanical Gardens and finished at the Opera House, with a visit to Mrs Macquiries chair, and the view was amazing from all spots.
I rained. It rained but with a couple of cheap umbreallas bought at Paddy's Haymarket, we had an enjoyable walk down to Circular Quay.

A dream come true. What else can I say?! It is the Sydney Opera House after all. Definately the main attraction in all of Australia aside from the Great Barrier Reef. Proud to say that I'm fortunate enough to have gone there.

Outstanding!. The walk around from the Opera House is a bit long, but worth every minute of it. The views are magnificent. Make sure to go up into the gardens. Some of the old trees are just magnificent. This is a wonderful part of Sydney.
wonderful views. It was wonderful to be allowed to sit on the grass and have my lunch. Great views and beautiful gardens.
Opra House walk. Fantastic piece of architecture...real atmosphere here. Botanic gardens border on the Opera House steps...beautiful
Interesting to see all the Plants. Beautiful area within Sydney, so many birds Lots of lovely tropical plants and great views of the Bridge and Opera House.
Amazing Gardens. I have never seen so many unusual trees. could not stop taking pictures. Walked for hours and enjoyed every minute

Good View. We entered the Royal Botanic Garden from the entrance near the Government House and walked back to the Opera house through this walk. It offers a great view of the Opera house, the icon of Sydney.
Lovely walk. Lovely walk along to the Botanic Gardens... great views, great breeze, fantastic birds so a great location for photography.

Lovely walk. I spent whole morning to walk from Opera House then to the Botanic gardens that is lovely walk with beautiful sky, peaceful place and lovely picnic in Botanic garden.
Took some photoes with lovely flowers, plants and animals around you. You might think you are in the natural forest not in the garden.

A peaceful walk.. Despite the fact that there is alot of work going on around the Opera House this walk is well worth it. Greta views out across the bay then into the gardens. Lovely sculptures are interspersed with plants in the borders. This is a really good breathing space very close to the busy city.
Nice walk. We walked here on the way to the fireworks. It was a very comfortable and lovely walk with all the trees n birds. lovely park

Relaxing. An oasis of calm and tranquility. With some new sculpters to look at, plent of seating for those very hot afternoons. The Cafe area could be better, what we call a greasy spoon area. Go for the views and some peace and quiet.

Stupendous. The most beautiful opera house in the world, I am sure. The performance was imaginative, the singers were good, but the fabulous thing is the architecture. Be sure to take the 1-hour tour.

Great Harbor View. The gardens give a great view over the harbor with comfortable seats and beautiful well maintained gardens, that are not to formal. Good areas to play ball games or to sit down and read a book, shade from trees if you want it. Or you can stroll through the many paths great place to chill.

Beatiful even in the rain. We walked around the Opera House and on to the Botanical Gardens. A lot of the trees are signed, so you can learn about them. The paths wander through large expanses of grass with Ibis and mynah birds, and passed beautiful mature trees, herb gardens and lotus flower ponds. You can walk all the way to the Sydney Art Gallery with both modern and classical exhibitions( worth and hour or two) and a cafe, or to the old Hospital buildings and Il Porcino to give you good luck, the St Mary's Cathedral and across Hyde Park to David Jones, and the Sydney Library with free wi-fi.

Toured Governor's House/Botanic Gardens and jogging/walking trail around to Opera House. What a lovely couple of hours to spend. We didn't go inside the Governor's house because we would've had to wait another 30 minutes. But we looked around outside and of course the Botanical Gardens surrounding it. There's a nice trail that goes entirely around the harbor. From the botanical gardens, walk left on the trail and it takes you to the back side of the Opera House and the Quay beyond that. Lovely!

Nice. Nice walk, although there is a lot of construction right now which sort of ruins the views etc. Double check the hours of the botanical garden if you are planning an early morning or evening walk.

One of the best ways to see the Harbour.. Aside from the Manly Ferry, this walk is probably the other best way to see the iconic Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Walking from Mrs Macquaries Chair to the Opera House offers sweeping views of Circular Quay amongst the atmosphere of the lovely Botanic Gardens. An easy flat walk. We were hurrying for the ferry and did it in under 20 mins.
Garden glory. Walk at the waters edge while viewing the display of native Autralian plants and exotics. See the many varieites of birds that call the gardens home

what an iconic building. this is one of the most iconic buildings in the world and a must see building located on sydney harbour foreshore its white roof resembles and upside down boat and so it should as its right on the harbour
Circle Quay to the gardens. Excellent views and a great way to get a feel for Sydney. The parks are well used and simple a beautiful walk.
Beautiful. Wish I had been less hungover for this walk! Really fantastic setting and there is opportunity to walk for miles or hop on the "train" if the walk gets too much.

Brilliant on a sunday morning. I did this walk backwards though and I think it was so much better, because at the end of it, you can see the Opera House and its surroundings opening up right before your eyes. After which you can choose one of the many river side restaurants to sit down at for lunch.

Sydney's treasures. Great places to visit. Leave plenty of time to achieve both these places. I guess everyone has their own view of what they expect here and hopefully a trip will fulfill those expectations.
Wow!. Personal tour of Opera House by staff memebr with breakfast in the cast/crew dining room. It doesn't get any better thasn this. All arranged personally by Alanah.
A beatiful view!. This was a very attractive and different way to see the harbour if you like plants and views! Botanic gardens an absolute delight

Sydney. Please go to the Gardens. Beautiful plants and so relaxing. The walk is simple and you get to see the locals taking care of their health. Plants are amazing, so it is ashamed that they allowed a condo to separate the Rock area and ferry locations from the Gardens. Money talks even in such a wonderful country.

Great first thing to do if your staying in the city :). I love botanic gardens all over the world whilst I have been travelling and this one is great and perfect scenic walk as you walk toward the opera house too :) I loved it definately a must if you are in the city of Sydney :)
Beautiful Panoramic Views!. What a great way to see the Harbour and the Botanic Gardens with the Opera House as a beautiful backdrop! It's a very easy walk and enjoyable by all.
Well manicured gardens. The Botanic gardens are very well maintained and it is well worth taking your time to walk round and see the various trees, plants and views. Great views over the harbour.
A gardners dream. If you love to garden this is a must. Great gardens, great sculptures and great people watching. Take your time look in the nooks and cranny to find the real jewels!
Opera. Neat building with great architectural design. Views from all sides. Right on the Harbor and waterways. Worth seeing.

Enjoyable walk with beautiful views. This is an easy walk right near the Sydney Opera House. You can stroll through the gardens and get beautiful views of the harbour. It was not crowded at all when we visited the first week of February. You could spend 30 minutes to an hour there.Just look for signs when you are near the Opera House. You will be sure to enjoy your time there!
Stunning!. Possibly one of the most beautiful city parks in the world, a city highlight and unlike much in Sydney, it's free!
Relaxing walk. Lots to see. Gardens very nice and Government House rather grand if a little odd! Some interesting species and people as well!

Great Architecture. The building itself is an architectural gem. However, it is just a building. When we went it was all closed up and we couldn't go inside. There were construction works close by that made taking a good photo difficult and all in all it is just a building. I would maybe gave a different opinion if I had been inside or even watched a show there...but I didn't.

Opera House. We just did the Opera house tour, very interesting go at the end of the day as we did and I don't know if they did it on all the tours but we got taken through the backstage and saw where all the sets are moved around..also if over 60 here ask for senior rates as they give them to overseas seniors as well.
What a View. What more can you say about this place. Just a great place. We have never got fed up of the changing views when you walk around.

Lovely walk - great views. Nice flat walk on a warm sunny day and a great way to get your bearings on a first trip to the city. There is so much going on from watching the constant ferries cross the harbour to the ever fit aussies who just seem to keep on running and then of course the views of the Opera House with the Harbour Bridge behind it - a must for any travellers album!

Beautiful views of the city and a relaxing walk. We didn't go specifically along the water as an attraction we just noticed the path one day and started walking. It's about a 30/40 minute walk if your strolling along and taking pictures. We started at the Sydney opera house and walked down to the botanical gardens, then around to the rocky edge. In the evening it was lovely with the opera house all lit up. And there was even an outdoor cinema at the time with a massive screen that came out of the water. If I went again I would double check booking a place at it because it seemed such a nice idea.

Walk with views. Take a stroll around the harbour on this path and you can enjoy some of the best views in Sydney! The morning and late afternoon is the best time to do it. Add in a coffe at one of the cafes near the Opera House and you have a magic way to spend a couple hours.

Serene. Went on summer but had a very cool breeze and there was no heat or humid. Some construction at that area now. But Botanic Gardens Walk was good as its by the beach side and the trees at the gardens was rather unique for me.

My all time favorite walk...any day!. I always started this walk from Hyde Park, check out the fountain then cross the road to peek inside the St. Mary Catheral. Before turning into the Botantic Gardens, one cannot walk past the Art Gallery without a quick or long visit. Once you step inside the Botanic Gardens one simply do what the sign tell you to do: hug the trees, walk on the grass, gaze upon the lily, sip coffee, even get marry on the lawn...endless.

Botanic Gardens to Opera House Walk. The walk is best undertaken in the opposite direction starting at the Governors house and Botanic Gardens and heading towards the Opera House. That way you will be facing some of the best views, rather than walking away from them. A little sunshine helps. Look out for the "fruit bats" or "flying foxes" in the gardens.
Takes little time and no cost. Well worth the effort if you're looking to get out of the bustle of the city and catch your breath. Great views - very pleasant.
Seeing it all. The walk from the operal house to the botanic gardens gives the traveler a wonderful view of the heart of Sydney. It is a must.
great walk. a great walk and fantastic views of the harbour and opera house a nice very easy walk suitable for all ages and wheel chair friendly
Pleasant Walk. Good walk through the Botanical Gardens. Be sure to walk out to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair which is carved into the rock and gives a good view of the Opera House.

The loveliest walk ever. You definitely have to do this if you go to Sydney is like the number 1 attraction.
I even got to see a wedding while I was walking there, the gardens are beautiful and you will love every single corner of this beatiful gardens
Beautiful walk. A beautiful walk with views of the harbour an absolute must see during your stay in sydney. Take your time and stop in at the cafe well worth it
a taste of wildlife.. a gentle walk round the waterfront from opera house to botanic gardens.worth a walk round this free attractions some interesting plants and trees and birdlife .quite pretty!
majestic. Liked everything about it , was so great to see the beautiful design of every part of the building. Tour guide was the best , she new her business.

Walked it a dozen times I never tire of it.. Sydney is a walkers city, start at MOMA at Circluar quay and do the modern art thing, walk around the opera house and up into the gardens and finish at the Art gallery of New South Wales (which is free & fab) it has a great cool air conditioned cafe for a drink or lunch and is a more traditional State/National Gallery. You can walk to Martin Place station from the Gallery. I do this walk after a few days in Sydney for work.

A beautiful walk any time of the day. You walk past Sydney Opera House into the gate and then walk towards Mrs Macquarie's Chair. On one side you have a sea wall and Sydney Harbour, often a sparkling blue sea. On the other side of you will be greenery, the fresh scents of herbs and plants, lorrikeets and cockatoos flying beside you and ibis crossing the path in front of you. You will see faces from all over the world sharing this glorious spot with you and hearing so many languages, including Strine. Enjoy.

Great views. A relaxing walk that offers good opportunities to take pictures of the Harbor and Opera House. It is less crowded than the street approach and Botanic gardens offer a good spot to stop and relax for a bit

All your classic tourist snaps in one go. Pick a late afternoon or a clear morning and walk this - it will take longer than you think so allow plenty of time. The water in the harbour is amazingly clean, and the city looming up over the trees is fab. Look out for the Morton Bay Figs - amazing trees. And watch out for flying foxes - do not pet! (they sleep all day anyway).

Priceless View of Sydney. Whenever I go to Sydney, I always spare my time to go to The Botanic Garden and walk through to the Opera House to take pictures. For people who love photography, this place will give you loads of objects to capture! The last time I went there, i tried something different.. I did an early morning run from Mrs Macquarie's Point to Sydney Harbour's port. Love the feeling of breathing in fresh morning breeze and smell of the ocean..One of my favorite spot in Sydney!

wonderful views. The Botanic gardens are well worth a visit in there own right but the views as you walk from the top of the government house down towards the Opera House are fantastic and makes this short walk a must

The Best Panorama View of Sydney. It is a fantastic walk path all Sydney beginners like me should try at least once. It is completely free to enjoy the magnificent view. I also tried Manly ferry, but I liked this walk better for photo shooting of the view! As you walk, not only enjoying the view of the harbor, you can explore the Botanic Garden as well.
Great walk. We walked from Potts point to the opera house, taking this route. If you enjoy walking don't miss this.

Views!. We walked from our hotel in the Rocks, past the Circular Quay, to the Opera House and then the Botanical Gardens. We're active retirerees and if we can do it, so can you! Seeing the Opera House up close was interesting and we got some good zoom pictures of the roof tiles. The Botanical Gardens are so peaceful and there is a cafe if you need a break.
Amazing Views!~ Stunning Harbour. A beautiful walk. The views are beautiful & the harbour is stunning. Opera House is an amazing building & the bonus is views of the beautiful Sydney Harbour Bridge.
On eof Sydney's highlights. I didn't think much of the Opera House tour as it was overpriced and disappointing, but the Botanic Gardens are one of Sydney's highlights.
Nice walk. Nice way to pass an hour or 2, very plesent and relaxing. You may almost forget your in city. There is also a cafe providing hot and cold drinks, needed on the hotter days.

Opportunity to See Opera House from All Sides. In Sept 2012 a friend and I visited Sydney and many of it's treasures. The Opera House interior was spectacular; what a pleasure to see the play, 'South Pacific'. Have a pre-theater dinner on the outside patio with a view of the Harbour Bridge and all of Sydney Harbour. The Royal Botanic Gardens walk on a beautiful September day provided us with views of the seldom-seen back side of the Opera House. Walk all the way over to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair, then head back toward the Opera House and you'll see great photo opportunities (see my photos). The interior of the Gardens was lovely and well worth a visit. If you take a ferry to Manly Beach or a whale-watching cruise, you will pass by all the beauty of the Opera House on the water, and the Gardens walk, so go back another day and walk it. Highly recommended.

Meriton Serviced Apartment, 528 Kent Sreet.. We walked from the hotel & entered through the front entrance of The Botanic Garden. We walked through the Tropical Gardens & ended @ the Opera House, walked to Circular Quays & then torrential rains came & cut our visit short.
Great place.. A stroll along the waters edge in Sydney on a lovely warm summers day, you just can't beat it. The views to the bridge and opera house are all there.
views. A no miss part of your stay in Sydney, giving fine views of the Harbour and City, and Bridge. Being reconstructed in part when we were there but one can still do it even if signage is weak.
Beautiful!. We absolutely loved the botanical gardens...such a peaceful, colorful, surprising place. We loved the signs that said "Please walk on the grass"
Take this route: it's very nice!. just wondering around in such a nice park, getting the skyline in the back of the tree's; a must see!
Wonderful free gardens. Loved those gardens. You can take food and eat among,the magnificent plants. You CAN walk on the grass! Try the open air cinema on the far side for a special night out.
Great scenic walk. Great views, lovely gardens, great photos you can take capturing both the opera house and the harbour bridge
Nice walk. Do not forget you sun shades and sunscreen as usual. You can make wonderful pictures from this walk! a lot of people during the peak season.

Gorgeous walk when the sun is out. This walk is really beautiful, starting from the Iconic Opera house and continue with the harbour on your left hand side.
With a large grassed area with opera house views makes for a great spot for a picnic on a weekend.Great for tourists and photo taking with a gorgeous backdrop! But also a jog.

Must visit. Must see. Even if you just see it for 5 minutes, make sure to get to the Opera House. It's iconic, huge, and still a bit controversial. I went during the day, saw it from a Harbour Cruise (I'd recommend saving your money and just take the Ferry from Quay to Watsons Bay, Manly Beach, or Darling Harbour), saw it at night. Very cool. With that said, been there, done that. I don't feel the need to return. The gardens are lovely. there's a little greenhouse with really beautiful flowers. didn't get to go to the parliament house, but it's pretty form the outside. i agree, there are lots of joggers, even in the middle of the weekday. does anyone work?

Beautiful walk but watch out for obsessive joggers. LOvey walk and great views. A pity that so man y Sydney office workers use this for their obsessive running. They dont slow down for anybody so dont find yourself knocked over by a sweaty nine to fiver.
Great place to picnic. Wonderful place to picnic on a hot day. Views worth a million dollars! Such a vast variety of trees, plants etc. Amazing place to spend an afternoon. Love the bats too

Favourite spot in entire of sydney. this whole are is called the farmer's cove. and its lovely, no traffice fresh air and u have an amazing view of the bridge and the opera house at the same time
there are chairs to sit on and clean grass.
tonnes of joggers

Peaceful oasis in a busy city. Lovely walking paths, beautiful trees, fabulous views. The train doesn't run late enough in the afternoon so make sure you get there earlier if you want to take it - we missed out.
Nice walk. From the opera house the are numerous very nice tracks through the parks and the botanic garden. Do not miss this opportunity to see the opera house from different viewing angles.
Don't miss it. If you have enough time, please enjoy the garden and the view from there. Try the "chuchu train" for a 20 minutes trip in the garden.
The thing to do in Sydney. The Botanic Gardens walk is great way to spend the afternoon. Gardens were well kept and pathways easy to follow. Views of the water add to the ambiance.
Nice walk. Nice walk...check it out if you have time. Allows for unique views of opera house adjacent to the garden where you can relax, pack a lunch and chilll out
A must. For any tourist or local it's a must, this walk is so beautiful through the botanic gardens with the views across the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, great photo op if you're a tourist.

beautiful. It is lovely to have this great & spacious public park so near the harbour. We took lots of walks here. I'd avoid the overpriced restaurants near the Opera House, but do walk in the botanical gardens. Plants & trees are labeled, so it's a learning experience.

A nice walk but nothing exciting. This is a nice walk if you have a few hours to spare or need to relax after running around Sydney. We used the time to unwind after visiting Circular Quay as we made our way to Harry's Cafe de Wheels for lunch.

fantastic walk. we love to walk around the opera, the breeze is nice and cool; the gardens are superb and so clean; and unlike for instance paris, you are invited to walk and sit on the lawns; make sure you have a water bottle, sunblock and a cap if it is summer because it can get real hot! but worth it without restriction!!
well worth the walk. Its a wonderful and manageable walk across from the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens with great views of the Harbour

Opera House Botanic gardens walk. A pleasant stroll at any time of the day (as long as it's not raining) Nice flat surface makes this easy for people with low mobility or in wheelchairs. There is a large lake nearby in the botanic gardens where you might be able to view birds seagulls, ibises, waterhen, occasionally swans or sulpher crested cockatoos etc. Bats (flying foxes) roost in some of the nearby trees during the day, and take flight at dusk making a wonderful sight. Best to view them at a safe distance though as they may carry a virus that can be transferred to humans if they scratch or bite you. There's a kiosk and restaurant in the Botanic Gardens. Kiosk is shabby, restaurant is overpriced in my opinion. The Botanic gardens Giftshop is well worth a look though, as they usually stock an interesting range of giftware, and were stocking "bush tucker" native Australian jams such as lilli pilli jam and native lime marmalade. Deliscious! A bronze statue of a mare guarding her foal along the foreshore walk is one of my favourite pieces of art in this city.

absolutly fantastic. if you love nature you will defineatly want to visit sydney botanic gardens, its just amazing seeing nature and its in the city so its not far to go there from Opera house, myself and my Bf we walked nearly the whole city

Great for a walk or run. It has to be one of the most beautiful places for a walk or run in Sydney. You are able to see the Opera House and the Harbour bridge from different angles. Also, you are able to walk through a beautiful garden with amaizing trees. If you want to go for a picnic with a view then this is the place. If you want to purchase food or drinks for the picnic then you should get it at Circular Quay as there are no shops on the way.

A packed two days in Sydney. Able to walk to the Opera House from the Hotel, 20mins..Great. Followed through with a ride on the Choo Choo train around the Botanic Gardens, hopping off to check out Mrs Macquaries Chair. Just lovely.

Take in the Sea Air, there is a photo at every turn.. The sailing was just beautiful to watch, we had a picnic Luncheon on the grass, restful even with the amount of people that were there.The bats were the only off putting things. Interesting that they in such a high traffic area of the gardens.

Nice and pleasent place to take a walk. I liked the place, very nice place to take a walk or jog. you can find a lot of people doing the same here, their is a train for kids and adults, good one if you are lazy and still want to see the beauty of the place take seat in this tiny train which runs on road on tyres and not track.

Superb. While travelling I am used to walking long distances, that is the best way to see and absorb the sights and attractions. This is absolutely a must do in Sydney, the Botanic Gardens are well cared for.

What a delight. The Botanic Gardens give a great space so close to the city. The opportunity to get up close to indigenous plants within sight of the city. This with the walk down to the harbour and the Opera House makes a great walk and great space.

sightseeing-must. the walk is easy, not crowded and it combines those 2 magnificent sights - i guess the opera house is well known to everybody but the botanical garden was new to me. i love surprises, here you find i indigenous and worldwide plants , each marked and explained, paths to stroll or to rush to work, benches to sit, lawns to sit, and it seems a never ending-garden, and it is right in the center of sydney - i love surprises!

opera house tour. we took the regular tour which lasted about an hour it was very interesting and informative, the guide was good and took time to answer questions. there are several tours you can take including an early morning backstage tour,
A large building site not good. Opera house looks grubby and is large building site, wait till they have finished it will look much etter
Cars.... The walk between the opera house and the botanic gardens is not per sé very nice- but as soon as you enter the botanic gardens you will love it!
Great views. While at Opera House take a walk to Botanic garden. It's ecellent for families or solo walk or run in the morning and fantastic views at the same time
A Magic Spot.. A must for anyone visiting Sydney - easy access and not taxing. The views are superb as are the Gardens. Relax and tsake in the beauty of the city and its harbour.
Super. Super experience! Beautifully preserved and a treat for the eyes. Undoubtedly Sydney is one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

Very scenic and great photo ops. Saw beautiful birds and scenic plants. Great walk from the garden, along the water to the Opera House. A scenic, free activity in Sydney. Good activity for tourists or for a date. You could pack a picnic lunch.
An easy walk with excellent views. As you meander through the botanic gardens you would never guess that you were in the centre of a major city - so relaxing with some superb views

Very busy and horrible bridge to walk over. I wouldn't really describe this as an activity as it's very short to walk from the opera house over to the botanic gardens, but once you are there you can walk around the beautiful gardens for miles. Around the opera house is obviously a very busy area, but you are quickly through the crowds and up over the scaffolding bridge. Once you get to the botanics there is a higher path, or lower path close to the water, and you can do a loop around the whole gardens. There is a map just as you enter the gardens, with printed maps for you to take around so take a look and see what takes your fancy. We were told by friends who had been before that during the day you can see all the fruit bats sleeping in the trees, but after looking up every tree we could find we couldn't see any, when we asked a gardener we were told that every day during the early hours people go down and make lots of noise to scare the bats away as they were damaging the trees! It's a shame really as I would have liked to see them! However we did see them all at night flying over centennial park when we were at the moonlight cinema which was amazing!

Just do it. The section from Circular Quay to the Opera House is a ghastly mess of tourist traps. You can spend days wandering the Gardens, there is an excellent food place for food on the go, about 120 species of birds have been see there, but try to get around to Mrs, Macquarie's Chair for the harbour views. Avoid on December 31 and January 26, because it will be crowded on those days.

A great way to spend an afternoon. This is a wonderful walk. We did it twice on this visit, once walking from Woolloomooloo round past Mrs Macquaries Chair, taking in the classic view of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, and once in the other direction from the Opera House.
must have. I nice view on opera house and harbour bridge and the best place to see a giant crowd watching the new years fireworks!

Must-do. We walked around the opera house (had lunch in the nearby Rocks neighbourhood) and then walked back through the Botanic Gardens. Very large gardens with lots to look at, a cafe, washrooms and gift shop in the middle, and lots of places to stop and rest. We ended up walking to the edge, then through Hyde Park and back to our hotel. Glad we made the effort.

Wonderful stroll. Rented and apartment in Wooloomooloo and walked this a few times - wonderful stroll with great views at every turn - hard to be on a mission to get somewhere in a hurry because you just want to take your time!

Small walk Big scenary. Its a very relaxing places, while enjoying the view in front of Opera House turn to the left you can find such a beautiful scenary of Botanic Garden, there is many nice historic statue of Australia History, trees and flower, best place for relax and exercise our feet, do it then you will feel it ;)

ver relaxing. This is a great way to get a different view of the opera house and the bridge. It was amazing how many runners were also using the park as well. I certainly advise bringing some water with you!

an enjoyable short walk for all. it's a short walk and very sustainable. you will be walking in a long beautiful garden, the most famous one in Sydney. the walk suits all ages and can be sunny in some areas and shady in others. suitable for picnics, alcohol free zone.
good. the walk from opera house to botanical gardens is great and beautiful.Walk across the gardens from opera house upto the corner to have a great view of the opera hosue and sydney bridge.

A must for any traveller to Sydney. I would like to do this as part of a longer walk 1-2 times per week because its fabulous. HOwever, the gates to the gardens don't open before 7am so early morning walkers can't enjoy this walk, only can be done during the day. For any traveller to Sydney it is a must and if you live in Sydney, its a great way to unwind and enjoy the beautiful sights of Sydney and the botanical gardens - away from downtown. It only a relatively short walk from downtown and you can walk through the gardens entering at Macquarie Street to join this walk. Would highly recommend any person living in or visiting Sydney to enjoy this walk. The Opera House area is undergoing some renovations at present, but due to be finalised by mid year 2013. Still able to access the walk around the Opera House, just a bit of an eye saw at construction site. Don't let that put you off!

Go early, take it all in!. Early was great, not too hot, not crowded, an excellent opportunity to take pictures, to enjoy the views and take it all in. The Opera House is the main attraction as you start off, but you soon realize that the botanical garden shines on its own. This is a walk that you will always remember.

Lovely walk in the heart of the city. On a sunny day in Sydney, there's nothing quite like being around the harbour, admiring the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge views this walk affords you. Head out to Mrs Macquarie's Chair and rest a while. There's a lovely cafe at the Boy Charlton Pool if you need to refuel or the cafeteria inside the Art Gallery of NSW.

Construction works spoil the view a bit. The construction works at the opera house mean the view is spoiled a bit, but there's no loss of access. I think you have to look around a bit for level access, but it is there.
A favourite. Do this walk every year at least. A beautiful relaxing walk with stunning views. A must if you are in Sydney

Beautiful Gardens!. Absolutely walk the path through the Botanic Gardens in Sydney. It's a great way to see part of the city and the gardens are beautiful. The entire city is gorgeous and this is just another example of the wonderful time you can have outdoors. Lots of food, etc. nearby and not a difficult walk. Recommended!

Scenic and safe. We took in an evening show and walked back to our hotel near Hyde park via this walkway. It was very safe and you got a good view of the city. We did it again the following during daylight and really enjoyed seeing the plants. Do this if you are near!

Wonderful way to spend an afternoon. Opera House is a must, pictures can't compare to seeing it close up - just beautiful. Botanical gardens are a nice way to get Opera House and very much enjoyed meandering the gardens.

Beautiful area for a run. I visited Sydney for business and would run from Hyde Park down to the Botanic Gardens and along the waterfront. It's very scenic and It has to be one of the best places to run
Peace and Solitude, in a Bustling City. The perfect antidote to shopping and bopping in Sydney's stylish streets. Positively the best way to get to the Art Gallery!

Great walk. I did this walk at 7am and enjoyed sharing the pathway with local walkers and joggers getting a good start to their morning.
The walk is well signed posted and pathways are even and wide. A very relaxing start to the day.
Nice walk along the water. This is a beautiful walk. Excellant for taking photos of the Oprea House. The gardens was very nice, wish we had spent more time there.

A romantic stroll.... This is the best place to take that special someone with you. With picturesque ocean views, the gentle ocean breeze being blown across the terrace, to the lush greenery surrounding the breathtaking landscape of the Botanical Gardens, the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens Walk is a wonderful way to spend a sunny and cool afternoon.

Great walk. The views are amazing! The Opera House is a world class icon but the botanical gardens are frequently over looked. It's a great garden sitting on one of the most beautiful harbors in the world. The cactus and succulent garden is one of the best I have seen. I also enjoyed the Fern Pavilion, it was a cool haven on a stinking hot day. It's a great walk and we finished up with drinks and oysters on the wharf just past the Opera House...awesome!

One of the most amazing walks you can do.. This is a fabulous walk around the harbourside in Sydney. I challenge you to find another walk around the world that offers such amazing scenery in such a small location.
Not too far but pleasant scenery. This is a fairly easy walk and can be done at your own pace - just make sure it's a nice day and you're wearing a hat and sunscreen!
An wonderful afternoon. A wonderful afternoon with wonderful scenery and then amazing gardens. Some wonderful flora and fauna.
A spectacular walk. From the towering sails of the opera house to the colorful parrots of the botanical garden, we had a lovely walk.

Beautiful gardens. I loved spending time in the gardens, having walked from Circular Quay and sometimes continuing on past the gardens around the harbour for great views looking back at the cityscape.

Wonderful walk with wonderful views. We always make a point of walking from Circular Quay to the Opera House and then up through the Botanic Gardens to the NSW Museum. This time we had both a Cuppa in the gardens and lunch in the Pavillian on the way.Highly recommended for your Sydney visit.
Botanic Gardens Walk. An expansive, beautiful, well-kept park, right behind the Opera House, with a long walkway throughout. Lots of birds to
Favourite walk. Love doing this walk, I do it as often as I can. It really is the prettiest walk, especially on a sunny day.

Walking Opera House to Botanic Gardens. Really beautiful and FREE! Great way to relax for the afternoon or even the whole day. The Botanic Gardens are BIG! Wear comfy shoes and bring a snack or plan to end at one of the restaurants along the harbour.

Just come here!. I have always been amazed by botanical gardens but this one, not only the arrangements and selections made it stand out, the walk along the coastal line just add that touch of whimsical on a late autumn arvo. Best anytime of the year. Just ignore the newly marrieds!

Fun to do as a jog/run - see the Gardens. This is an easy run/jog that kills multiple birds wiht one stone. You get to see the opera house up close, you get to see the Botanical Gardens (which I don't think require a separat, focused trip) you can run by Lady Macquaries chairs, see the harbor view etc, and get some exercise! then you can come out the other side of the Gardens, away from the harbor, and you are in the city

Essential Sydney Tourist-Fare. It's free, and it's just one of those things you have to do when you come to Sydney. I've spent whole days just walking through the gardens and admiring the hard work put into them. As a nature lover, I'd recommend it to anyone who even remotely appreciates plants and harbour views. If you're the stingy type, bring a packed lunch as your options for eating out in this area are limited to the $$-$$$$$ price range
Must do. the opera house is huge but a beautiful iconic structure and then within 50 paces you are in an oasis of greenery with superb views

Great place for a run. My morning run in Sydney took in the Botanic Gardens and it was a great start to the day. Relax and stroll around or put on your running shoes - and yes there are plenty of people exercising there so they dont give you strange looks!

Botanic Gardens to Opera House. Fantastic walk. Sadly, like so many other destinations in Australia, there is a lack of easily accessible food, drinks, and snacks. The cafe in the Botanic Gardens has very limited hours. The Gardens would be perfect for food vans and carts. The Opera House has a marvellous home made 'ice pop' stall (flavours such as banana, lime and roast coconut, or lemon, cucumber and mint) which is almost worth the walk in itself. The Opera House could do with more info. plaques: it has an interesting history, including the original competition for the design.

pleasant walk. the opera house is a fascinating scructure and is awe-inspiring to see and walk around. then you head towards the Botanic gardens from there. the botanic garden is huge and is right on the foreshore. the array of plants and trees will amaze you. there is a restaurant in the middle of it serving burgers/chips or gourmet sandwiches etc. there is a tropical garden to explore. it is indoors and the temperature is quite high and humid. I love the big array of tropical plants. there is a small fee to enter. There is a free little train to catch around the whole area if you don't feel like walking. It is a great place for a picnic or meeting friends. It is a very pleasant day out there.

don't miss this walk if you have the energy!. It was a nice sunny day warm day when we walked around the Opera house to the Botanic Gardens, after we were done with the Opera House tour.The tour took us about two hours and we enjoyed taking pictures, watching the birds, wandering around the trees and stairing to the joggers and other lovers around the harbour. This walk makes you forget about the congested hectic city and sniff the fresh air and appreciate every single tree which gives us, humans the meaning of life!.. what an experience!
Opera House.. Take a tour, they are frequently advertised on the internet, catch an opera or Orchestral performance. This is a must when you visit Sydney. A one off architectural feat...

A chunk of heaven. everyone knows that Sydney is like a busy city, but thankfully there is still a great place to get fresh air and enjoy the fantastic Sydney sky line. Try to go there just before the dusk! very very pretty view to enjoy! dont forget your camera

Never get sick of this place. Love wandering around the gardens the sights and sounds of Sydney never gets old. last time I went my husand and I caught the train a nd hopped off at Government House.......great day out in Sydney.
Very Enjoyable. Just a lovely walk in the early evening. Very enjoyable, we had a great time strolling around the Opera House and the Gardens. At this time of year, the Gardens looked beautiful.
The City's Oasis. It's rare in a big city to find peace and quiet at its heart. Approaching dusk is the best time to find a spot for a sky gaze. If bats are your thing, there's plenty here!

Opera House is amazing in person. Loved seeing the Opera House up close. Walk along the path to the Botanic Gardens and you'll be able to get some great pictures of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.
Wandering the Gardens. This is a great walk beside the harbour and then up through the gardens you don't feel like you are in a city of 4 million people at all.
Refreshing. This place is really a magic area in the middle of Sydney, you really feel like in the country side of Australia.

Opera House and Botanic Walk. The Sydney Opera House is stunning but I admit we did not go for a tour. We walked the Botanic gardens and saw beautiful flora and fauna. We even saw some very colorful parrots. We had great weather and I would recommend the walk. It was a great way to spend a day.

Lovely California type stroll. Lovely flat promenade stroll from the bottom of the Royal Botannic Gardens along to the Sydney Opera House. Personally I wandered down through the gardens, chatted with some guys playing frisbee and joined in with them for a while, walked along the waterfront, and then discovered the bonus of free wifi + blessed shade beneath the eaves of the Opera House :)
can;t miss this opera house. you can't miss this opera house when you visit sydney,they play a lot of famous opera in the world over this place.,place must be visit,find out when you in sydney
Walk the CBD. Walking in the city center doesn't get better than this. The harbor, the gardens and all that makes Sydney special. You can do a serious walk or a leisurely stroll.

Lovely Walk. We enjoyed a day touring the Opera House and then walking from there to the Royal Botanical Gardens. Being from the northern hemisphere, we saw trees in the garden unlike any we've ever seen before. We also saw cockatoo, ibis and other unique birds. We enjoyed the garden so much, we returned the next day.

Peaceful city escape. Take a walk around Farm Cove (Sydney's original home base) and then relax on the grass of the gardens and enjoy the view of the Harbour and the Opera House - you'll know you are in Sydney t hen.

Relaxed change of pace. If you need a breather from the hustle and bustle of Sydney harbour, take a walk from the Opera House along the walkway to the Botanic Gardens with a view from Macquarie's point. Continue to Wooloomooloo wharf and end it with a mushy pea/meat pie at Harry's Cafe de wheels.

Lovely walk. Lovely walk along the water with the gardens to the opposite side. This is highly recommended to get over to Mrs. Macquarie's chair because the view from there is incredible. If you have extra time and want to take a stroll, you can't go wrong with this.

Lovely walk, wear comfortable shoes.. Not much shade so if it's a hot day take sunscreen and hats along with water. There is a cafe in the gardens and a food van at Lady Macquarie's Chair if you need a coffee or snack.

Get away form the city.. What a great place to get aay from the noise of the city! Lots of wide open spaces and some amazing trees. One tree is full of bats, careful when walking under as you can end up being a target..... There are cafe facilities as well and the old governors house is worth investigating. For budding photographers there are some great garden -building shots. A real oasis from the city, rounded off by a visit to one of the ost iconic Sydney buildings, the opera house. Perfect to chill out.

Must see, must experience. Walking through Sydney's Botanic Gardens allows you to imagine what the beginnings of Sydney must have been like. That is for the more privileged who landed here. While a visit to Sydney's iconic Opera House invites you to understand Australia trying to stamp it's very own unique images on the world. Try and catch a show, opera or event at the Opera House to truly imbibe your senses with what it has to offer. Perched on the amazing Sydney Harbour, you won't go home without a smile on your face and plenty of photo opportunities.

Doing the tourist bit!. This is probably the must do thing when in Sydney. It was a lovely day and very busy but not crowded at all. Some great views of the Opera House and Bridge which are of course so iconic. The cafe in the botanical gardens made a great place to get out of the sun and the cakes were super.
Great Views. Sydney Opera House and the Bridge together in the iconic view. Pleasent stroll along the waterfront with some great diversions into the gardens.

Beautiful!!. Very serene and peaceful. A feast for the eyes. The Opera house and botanical garden were my favorite spots in Sydney. The garden is huge but the walk from Opera house to the main pond in the lower garden is an absolute must!

Watch out for joggers. A beautiful serene aspect and worthy of an hour just contemplating the universe...if you can avoid lunchtime, do, the joggers are a complete nuisance, befouling the atmosphere with carbon dioxide and body fluids. They are also extremely bolshy and will rudely push yoou out of their way if you dare to get in the way....ought to be banned, THEY are the cause of climate change with all that hot air and bluster.

The best things in life are free.. This is a lovely walk. It's not too long or difficult so it really is more of a stroll. It wasn't over crowded either. The views are absolutely fantastic and entry into the Botanic gardens are free. If you want to feel like you are in holiday and that you are in Sydney there is nothing better or cheaper than this walk.
Tranquil beauty. The walk from the Opera house through the Botanic gardens is a walk through heaven....Lush green lawns,great picnic spots,flowers in bloom showing Sydney at it's best!!
Train Trip. Despite the works being undertaken at the Opera House and in the Gardens, enjoyed the visit. The small train made the travelling easier with good information during the trip.

Pleasant morning walk. Sydney's greatest asset is its harbour. From the City, walk North to Circular Quay, then around the Opera House... from there you can stroll between the harbour and the Botanic Gardens right aroung to Mrs Macquarie's Chair... a great way to start the day. On the way back, cut through the gardens, which are beautiful

Worth the walk!. Sydney has many walks that are very attractive, this is one of them! Soak in the glorious Sydney weather and the picturesque harbour as you walk along the harbour. The gardens are delightful with many spots to pause and enjoy the moment! Walk all the city and watch out for the Boy Charlton swimming pool, an absolute find in a busy city!

Lovely. This is a very pleasant walk by works of art (sculptures), beautifully maintained gardens and an occasional visit by a unique bird. Some may be bored, but if you slow down there is a lot to see. It's a good place to unwind.

Best walk in a metropolitan environment. Once inside the Botanic gardens its hard to believe you are in a major city. The harbour runs along one side of the gardens so there are great views over the water. We were staying in Potts Point and so had to walk through the Garden from North to South to arrive at the Opera House and Circular Quay. What a fabulous stroll with views down to the Opera House and across the harbour.

Easy Walk. Rather than take a bus or taxi it's worth walking. The Gardens are Beautiful and you get the bet view of the Opera House from a distance. If you want to have a photo at the same spot as Oprah overlooking the Opera House this is where you have to be. The bird life in Australia is great and you will see some fascinating birds along your way - is it's getting dark you might see a bat or two but you wouldn't want to be walking around the gardens as it gets dark, so settle for some cockotoos.

Stretch those leg's and get that camera snapping!. perfect opportunity, to take in the beauty that is Sydney, with it's iconic skyline, and attractions this walk provides you with perfect opportunities to take some amazing photo's with a leisurely walk, it's not too strenuous and can take as long or short a time as you require.

Our first Sydney experience!. Our cruise ship docked in Woolloomooloo Bay (it later moved to the cruise ship dock in Circular Quay) - so this gave us a chance to walk through the Royal Botanic Gardens to the Opera House. What a great way to see Sydney for the first time - lots of flowers and unique plants (and birds as well). Very nice place to visit.
A beautiful walk. Surprisingly peaceful despite the proximity of a bustling city. Lovely views over the water, of course, and some beautiful plantings.
Great Views. A place you can relax and enjoy your picnic lunch. Buy your food at the quay or bring from home, sit and relax in the quietness of the gardens then complete your walk back to the Quay.

Beautiful walk despite the construction. The bottom half of Opera house is under construction(Dec 2012), but it's still a lovely walk from it to the Botanic gardens. Look for the rainbow colored Lorikeets esp on the hibiscus tree that's about halfway along, esp if it's flowering(small pink flowers on a tall tree). The ficus tree is pretty amazing as well. Around the corner you can get a great view of the harbour bridge and the opera house.

A pleasant walk. At this time December '12 there is a lot of renovations going on at the base of the Opera House, but the walk from the Botanial Gardens to that point is always a pleasure. The walk is used a lot by joggers and walkers, and there are a few seats for resting if required.

Worth the walk.. Actually walked from Darling Harbour thru the Botanic Gardens and to the Opera House.Long walk to counter the excellent food in the many restaurants.Opera House and Gardens well worth a visit.

A must do !. Not to be missed, a great place to spend a day - recommend free tour of Government House , beautiful place with fantastic gardens. Loved the wild parrots in the gardens. Finished up at Harrys cafe , near to Naval dockyard for pie and mushy peas.
nice views. a nice walk to absorb the breathtaking views of the Opera House, the Harbour and the botanical garden.

Botanic gardens. Whilst staying at Potts Point, this makes a very pleasant and easy walk or stroll through the gardens and around to the Opera House.
Lots of places to picnic or just relax in the sunshine and the added bonus of seeing the Opera House at the end of it with great bars and cafes.

Take a relaxing stroll in pleasant surroundings.... This is a lovely walk - and you are encouraged to walk on the grass :) If you have time sit on the grass and take in the views. Stroll through the gardens and enjoy the beautiful water plants, and water features. If you don't feel up to walking, we noted there is a "train" ride you can take, every half hour.
Great way to spend an afternoon. This was the very first thing we did when we got to Sydney. Fantastic views on the Opera house and bridge.You HAVE to do this when visiting!
Botanic Gardens walk. Lovely walk you could be anywhere so quiet, you would never know you were in the middle of a city. Impressive plants and flora
Brilliant. you need to look at this close up to appreciate the work that has gone into it,lovely area on the harbour and well worth a visit.

Very attractive. The grounds around the Opera House & Botanical gardens are beautifully kept. A lovely safe area to wander, sit with a picnic, let the children run and play. The Gardens are wonderful to see.

So beautiful garden. Locals find this garden as their home.The botanical garden has lots kinds of plants and flowers and only looking at those made me relaxed.Sydney has amazing seas but alsothe richness in green lets me chill.
A must do when in Sydney. The Opera House is something that needs to be viewed from all angles and the Botanic Gardens are splendid.

Opera House-Botanical Gardens. Do not miss. The Opera House is magnificent and the Botanical Gardens are wonderful. Great perspectives on Sydney, the harbour combined with flora and wildlife that is just very special.

Opera House. The Opera House stands proud on the harbour. It's a brilliant piece of architecture. There are daily tours available and the Opera House is surrounded by Restaurants/eating houses which cover all tastes. Beware it's very expensive to eat around the Opera House, but there are lots of other places just a short walk away which are slightly cheaper. We saw a play by the Sydney Drama group, which was brilliant. Called 'Signs of Life' Opera House is a must to visit!!

a pleasure. This a great way to see the city. When the weather is good (which is often the case), the walkfrom the Circular Quay, around the Opera House, on to the Botanical Garden, is one of the bestrelaxing things to do in Sydney. In the garden, there are lots of plants, trees, shrubs as well as all kindsof birds (all or most native to Australia). There are also lots of beautiful views.

Botanic gardens Sydney and opera house. I love the botanical gardens they are free and they provide a welcome respite from the traffic and noise of Sydney .there are also guided tours but I haven't managed to get on one yet. The opera house just been round it so far including jogging around . It's worth doing the tour inside but that's another thing on my list to do.

The walk in Sydney you have to do. It's free, the walk is easy with the gardens on ons side and the sea on the other, the views are some of the best you can get, great photo opportunities especially as you get reach the point and look back at the opera house and the bridge together.I make time for this walk every time I go to Sydney.

Gorgeous Spring morning. I got up at 5.30 am and walked with my camera down to Circular Quay to take some shots of the pre morning rush state of this wonderful harbour. The sun was just rising as I arrived at the ferry landings and I could not stop clicking. Moving on down the quay to the iconic Sydney Opera House, the sun was glinting across the water to make the perfect early morning scene.
A lovely afternoon walk. This is a nice walk with lots to enjoy and lots of places just to sit and look. Views of the opera house a good for photos.

Do as the do. Ever since I was a young girl I have enjoyed this walk. For tourists it's a must. Around lunchtime the CBD officeworkers can be seen jogging and on the weekend family's are out for a stroll. Anytime of the year you can go and soak up the ambience.
lots to look at. Beautiful scenary and lots to look at during walk as well as restaurants to sit and take it all in and shops to pick up those special souveniers
Fabulous. Just spend some relax time in the garden. Take your picknic and some wine. During sommer lots of outside events.

A day in the green. The sights of the harbour from the Operah house were very good, the gardens are close by and enjoyed seeing all the different types of plants and scolptures. Give yourself a day for this
Running around the gardens. Nice area for a run. Lots of paths and (at 6:30 in the morning) not too many other folk ... but enough other runners to feel 'at home'. Nice sights as you run.

A family favourite. Whenever we are in Sydney we love to do this walk, although we start at the far side entrance to the Gardens and walk to the bridge via the opera house. The gardens are magnificant and the sea wall walk is something I will never tire of. the atmosphere is just superb.

Awesome Walk. Well I would recommend for those who loves nature and green space. The Opera House to the Botanic Garden is not much a walk, but the view is amazing and it gives you an amazing chance to relax while in Sydney

Even nicer the other way around. We did it the other way around, from Kings Cross to the Botanic Garden and from there to the Opera House. The moment when you can finally see the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge is just great. A really nice walk with lots of picture opportunities

Great views, flora and fauna. I have done this walk several times, and would consider it a must-do for able-bodied tourists. Along the way you are rewarded with great views back to the city and harbour, and a fabulous array of flora and fauna. Very good for keen photographers.
oustanding photo setting. Indeed the place to visit in Sydney, no doubt, one of the best settings for photography. Spent at least half a day to experience and feel this site. Majestic opera house

If you only have time for one walk, make it this one.. Walking around the Sydney Opera House and then onto the Botanic Gardens must be one of the best walks in the world. The views are wonderful and it is very pleasant to get away from the crowds and wander in the gardens after the crush of Circular Quay. It is an easy stroll for those who don't want too much exertion, but you can also stride out energetically in a power walk - it's up to you. (You can avoid lots of steps by going around the outside of the Opera House - the views are best that way too.) The walk can be as short or as long as you want to make it - and you can cut back through the gardens to the city if you don't want to go back via the Opera House.

A great 'walkabout' route. This iconic building is fab outside but mainly concrete inside -- such a contrast. Then turn left and lose yourself in the open space of the Botanic Gardens with the weird ibis birds pecking here and there.

great views. brilliant views from opera house with excellent views of the harbour there is a lot of steps up but well worth the view could have looked at harbour all day.we loved the gardens there was lots of different plants and flowers to see all area were kept well it was very peaceful to walk around and lots of seats to admire the views
Beautiful gardens. Well worth the 4 hours we spent walking around the beautiful gardens and walks. Visit Government House just up the hill from the opera house. All free.

Strolling through Australian History. This would have to be one of the best walks in Sydney. The views of the Opera House are stunning. But it's when you reach the Botanic Gardens that the best views can be seen

Beautiful Architecture and Great Tour!. Who could not be impressed with the stunning architecture of this iconic momunment that helps define Sydney and its magnificent harbor? My wife and several friends took a tour of the interior of the opera house and raved about the quality of the tour, as well as the beauty of the interior of the opera house!

A Must. I went to see the Australian Ballet at the Opera House. I was sat next to a gentleman who saw the origional production in 1964. This was my first ballet and the Opera House is simply an amazing venue. Well worth arriving a couple of hours early to dine downstairs/eat outside with the choice of sushi, chinese, burgers and drinks. Live Music takes place at the bar after the show and views of the bridge all lit up at night. Take flat shoes if walking to nearby hotels and get dressed up!

Nice path to walk. We walked this path following our tour of the Opera House - the gardens are beautiful, well maintained and if you walk right around the park to the other side you get great views (and pictures) of both the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.

lovely area. visited the Opera House first and then took the short walk from the Opera house to the Botanic Gardens which is only a short distsnce away,very pleasant walk and is a lovely area to explore, the gardens have some huge amazing trees and beautiful flowers too, a lovely place to sit and relax
Colorful Birds & beautiful plants ... lots to enjoy. Look up and you will often see the most colorful tropical birds ever! We were there when the Jacarandas were in bloom and it was a real treat.

The botanical gardens. The botanic gardens are a lovely place for a respite from the rigours of shopping at the Queen Victoria building or the Strand icons in themselves, and an easy walk on the east of the city. You also have wonderful views of the harbour and the Opera House. Across the road the garden continues and leads to the Sydney Art Gallery which often houses interesting exhibitions and has also a good representation of Australian paintings. Loved it all.
amazing. i did this the other way round but still was amazing to get some great views of the opera house and chill in the botanic gardens

A beautiful and peaceful stroll in the middle of a busy capital city. I have completed this walk about 3 times now and each time I have selected a different path. The gardens are very well maintained. To be able to stroll thru delightful gardens and then look to you right and see highrise city buildings just a stones throw away is quite unusual. I like to walk to the Opera house via the city streets and then meander back to my hotel thru the gardens. The gardens are very big and covering them all in one visit would be ambitious.
Just like paradise. A terrific way to spend a leisurely morning in a resstful and ideolic setting.Flowers Fauna Vistas and interesting peoplw watching....just plain perfect!
Must do if you visit Sydney. Take a picnic basket with you and have a nice lunch in the park. The view is amazing. Worth to spend your afternoon.
Opera house tour. Fantastic building design, the tour was great and worth doing, you cant really take photos inside, except lobby area and a couple of other places the guide will point out.
Take your time. Take some time to soak in the views, find a good bench or spot in the grass and relax. Some great picnic spots here.
Views to die for. A little oasis in the middle of the city. Popular with locals and tourists alike. Great harbour, Opera House and Harbour Bridge vistas
Relaxing Morning Walk. Beautiful gardens, a great walk in the mornings. Not very crowded except by the waterfront. Great view of the opera house and bridge plus the city skyline.

Fantastic and Iconic. We walked from Circular Quay around past the Opera House and as far as Mrs Mcquarrie's Chair then back again through the gardens. Some of the trees are astounding, not too strong a word, seriously. As for the photo opportunities well there are no more iconic sights in the world than the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge as seen from the Botanic Gardens.Add this to your Bucket List NOW!

Peaceful Sydney. The short walk from the opera house through the botanic gardens and up to NSW art gallery is a beautiful peaceful way to get away from it all in the middle of the city. The botanic gardens are beautifully kept and worth spending time to explore the planting. The volunteers do a lot of the work here and are a source of much information. The gate at the top of the gardens leads almost straight to NSW Art Gallery with its interesting collection in a lovely building. I joined a guided tour at 2.00 pm which took us through the best of the Australian paintings. A witty informative commentary gave me a much better understanding of Australian art.
Lovely Day out.. Easy to walk and the peaceful feeling of harbour and gardens was just lovely To be able to experience the harbour and its activity against the gardens was breath taking.

Beautiful walk with great views!. My son & I "tripped over" the Botanical Gardens Walk, almost by accident. We visited The Opera House and wanted to go to an event the Australian Navy was having on Nov 4. The shortest walk from The Opera House to the Navy Pier is via the Botanical Gardens. The views of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge were simply stunning. We went on a cloudy morning, I can imagine the views would have even been better on a clear day or near sun set.
Beautiful walk - fabulous scenery. Lovely walk by the water front - well worth doing - great views of the Opera House and bay. Lots of photo opportunites!

Amazing. Of course the Opera House is an amazing sight, however many times you see it. Check out the concerts, we went to one in the morning and had a free coffee and biscuits. Botanical Gardens are just great to wander around. We had seen the bats here 10 years ago, but couldn't find them here this time.
Beautiful - take your time, and ENJOY. Notice the Fruit Bats, and come back at sunset to see them leave. Enjoy at least one event at the Opera House.
Beautiful walk. Nice walk in an old established park. If you walk on you can reach woollamolloo. Flat or slopes s up to you. A highlight of Sydney

Relaxing, Beautiful, just a nice way to spend the morning. Yes, you can walk around the Opera House, stand on the steps, admire it from ferries, get your photos! Two main attractions sitting right next to each other! Perfect!. The veiw's great, very relaxing, easy to walk around. You can spend the whole day looking around and sit down and relax. Or, if you are a busy traveller, also to walk through to the art gallery via botanic garden which is also very nice. Stop at Harry Meat pies wagon for lunch! The hotdogs are awesome!
Wonderful views. Lovely to get out of the high rises and into some green grass and great areas The gardens and ponds have some wonderful Australia plants
Nice entertainment. Get a cheaper ticket at the opera house if you go and as the desk for last minute tickets. There is a free guided walking tour every day in the botanic garden.
beautiful. such a breath taking view of the most beautiful building i have ever seen , its awesome, i spent hours looking all around the whole building april 2011

The Sydney the sydney siders used to enjoy. What I love about this walk is that it is along the sand stone walled waterfront of the harbour. An easy walk which takes you eventually to Lady Macquarie's Chair. There are some pleasant places to have tea or coffee in the Botanical Gardens. One of my favourite walks!
Best views. One of the best walks in the world. The view when you round the corner to the Opera House is spectacular.
Great Views of the Bridge. It deserves a post as a must do if you have 3 days in Sydney. I would suggest walking back through the Botanical Garden

Very nice first impression of Sidney. First thing I did when arriving was to walk to the Sydney Opera House designed by Utzon. Then I walked on into the Botanic gardens. I probably spent a good 1.5 - 2 hours on the walk simply because it was so beautiful and varied. The botanic gardens also have different sections, which are worth checking out
Always a pleasure. If you have only a short time in Sydney you really have to do the Opera house and the Botanic gardens.They are a must do!
