Short walk, fabulous views. Very short walk from the Opera House to the gardens. The gardens are litterally right behind the Opera House. Loved walking all the way around the Opera House (which actually consists of three separate buildings, who knew?!)

Simply stunning. If I was a tourist I would make this a must see. Do early in morning or late in day to catch sunrise or sunset. Great views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. All my visitors say this walk and view is the best

Excellent walk.. We walked the perimeter of the gardens to the Opera House. It was a very clean and easy walk. We were dissapointed maintenance was happening and we couldnt have photos on the steps in front of the opera house but we understand maintenance has to happen.

Worth the walk. The botanical garden is beautiful. You will come across an area about half way through where the bats have taken up residence. They are ruining some of the plants because they are so abundant and active, even during the day. We watched these bats jockeying for position, mating, flying, squawking and just plain entertaining us. We walked the entire way to Mrs. Macquarie's chair. Unexpectedly we came upon the dress rehearsal of the opera which was being set up on the bay. You never know what fun and pleasant things may happen when you go for a long walk. So just go do it. You'll be glad you did. Stop and smell the flowers, too.

Great way to spend an afternoon. Walking through the botanic gardens to the opera house is just so beautiful and the best way to spend an afternoon. Watching the Harbour is glorious. Easy walk for most people.
Beautiful scenery & BIRDS!. Got a real kick out of watching, and trying to film the Rainbow Lorikeets swarming a Norfolk Island Hibiscus.
CHECK OUT THE BATS!!!!. Loved this gorgeous garden and the fruit bats living in the trees--2 million of them that migrate out at sunset--stellar to watch!
The symbol of sydney!. I visited the opera house, both externally and internally. It has a magic atmosphere,,, and everything is so special.
A Must See. The beautiful stroll through the Opera House and down through the Botanic Gardens is a perfect afternoon in Sydney!

Beautiful views. We walked through the Gardens to the Opera House. It is a beautiful walk - the Gardens are well kept and the walk is very easy. The views of the Opera House and Harbour were terrific.

iconic Sydney. The gardens are extensive and open and perfect for a stroll. Pack a lunch, book and blanket and stay awhile. It's great nature and people watching. There's very little more impressive than the Opera house up close. Take your camera and examine every angle.

Shows mad prices.. The opera house i only saw from the out side it looks fab think its one of them things you just have to see. Looked to go to a opera there there were 2 shows that we could have saw but the cheapest tickets were left were 200 dollars each. oww these were not the dearest either. maybe if we had booked them earlier check awhile in advance of your visit.

My Favorite Memory of Sydney. This walk was so worth the time. I walked from the Gardens to the Opera House, through trees filled with peeping cockatoos, we almost thought we got lost then ended up with tears in my eyes at the steps of Mrs. Macquarie's chair (look up the love story, it is beautiful)...then we walked to the Opera House after observing bats in botanical garden trees and I sang to a Kookabura who let me come within maybe a foot of him to take his picture...ever listening to me sing "Kookabura sits in the old gum tree..." This was a magical day in the rain for me...I hope you can all experience the wonder Australia has to offer...and enjoy the little things which are sometimes the most beautiful...

Architecture and nature. Being at the opera house is goosebumpy, it's a must to go and visit. Specially during the night since the bars and restaurants offer great service and food, this combined with the view of the spectacular Harbour bridge is breath taking.

nice gardens. its a short walk to the opera. the gardens and the park is mythical.
its a beautiful walk.you also have the harbour on one side and the gardens on the other. i recommend this walk as a must.
NOT MANY OTHERS PLACES LIKE THIS IN THE WORLD. An easy level walk with one of the most spectacular harbour views in the world. Adjacent to the Royal Botanic gardens.

Great to explore with family. The Botanic Gardens are great when you have small children who need to burn off some steam. The garden is beautiful with great views of the bay. It's great to be able to sit and have a picnic while the kids burn of some energy.
A wonderful walk, to take in all aspects of Sydney. Walking through the Botantical Gardens, and see the vast range of plans , on the other side is the art gallery

An iconic building!. There is little that can be said about the Opera House other than superlatives. What an achievement. The only down-side is the apartment buildings which stretch from the East side of Circular Queue right to the boundary of the Opera House. This building which sits majestically on the point has been lost from view from the city behind these buildings of low architectural merit.
Fantastic at sunset. Enjoy the sunset behind the opera house from Mrs Macquarie's Chair

Best of Sydney. Lovely to stroll around the harbour and through the gardens. Art Gallery of NSW is located on the far side away from the city; lots of artwork to admire with free entry (apart from special exhibitions).
Beautiful Sydney Harbour. My family and I live in Sydney and it was great to get out and enjoy the beauty of Sydney Harbour. Must family thing to do!

Beautiful!. I loved the beauty, views and everything! The fleet steps were fun along with the history of the area. Many, many people were out exercising and enjoying the beautiful day. The Opera House is under renovation while they fortify the area to protect it from the water.
Beautiful!. I loved my walks through this area. Absolutely beautiful!
Camera a must. This is the route that provides you with the opportunity to take the iconic photo with yourself in the foreground, don't miss it

Beautiful and good exercise too!. Sydney is a great city for walkers - lots of variety and easy accessibility. This walk in particular is scenic and gives you some structure. You can take a train to Circular Quay and walk from there, and the Botanic Garden is a real gem in Sydney. The Royal Botanic Garden website is a great reference both for your visit and for the walk. There are free tours available.

Crisp and clean. We did this walk a few times in the evenings and the air was crisp and clean, and strangely peaceful given that the hustle and bustle of the city was so nearby. Very well maintained, something they obviously take pride in.
Gardens. A beautiful walk . Run or walk this and take in the sights . Lush green grass.
The walk of History. From one of the best know icons of Australia to the histiorial gradens in Syndey the view from start to finish is inspireing.

A beautiful walk. I highly recommended spending a day walking around Sydney Harbour, including walking from the Operat House to the Botanical Gardens. Just beautiful. Lots of photo opportunities - hard to put the camera down.

Very beautiful. For being in the middle of the city, the Gardens was a pleasant experience. Plenty of flowers, tree and green open space to relax and enjoy a little bit of country in the middle of the city. Do plan accordingly as the place is huge and takes a good day to walk around and enjoy. You do not want to miss the nice walk
Peaceful. Botanic gardens are a great oasis to get away from the noise for a while
Another must.... You have to visit and take in the scenery, get some brilliant pictures, take in the views and sit under it at the cafe looking up at the bridge...perfect.
An entertaining joy. A brilliant walk in fine weather with so much to make one pause reach for a camera and say AHHHHH well worth the effort involved.

:). The walk goes along the water in the Botanic Gdns and you can see parts of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge peek trough just above the trees, before you come around the corner and get the Opera in full view. As I´m a fan of the botanic Gardens as well as the Opera House, one of my favourite places to stroll in the City.

the best place for a morning/afternoon stroll. start at the opera house, follow the cove, up ti Mrs. Macquarie Chair, then down to the Art Gallery of NSW (including Lunch) back to the Opera House through the Botanic Gardens - the Best possible days in Sdyeny

I would walk the other way though!. A wonderful way to see the Bridge and the Opera House from a different angle. I would start at the Botanic Gardens and walk to the Opera House - there's lots of good bars and places to eat that aren't expensive. Magic on a beautiful day.
Opera House walk. This is a must do thing if the weather is dry. Clean, scenic and just a lovely way to walk around a HUGE city like Sydney

An oasis of calm. Great way to spend some time away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Although the CBD is on your doorstep you feel as if it is a million miles away. The gardens are beautiful and extensive and provide a shady and picteresque escape from the hot sun.
Well worth the effort. Great views across the Harbour and of the Opera House, Botanic Gardens well worth a visit, a pleasant green space in a busy City.On a nice day take a picnic!

Fantastic photo opportunities. So many places to get the perfect opera house & bridge photos from! The gardens are quite amazing and a lovely place to spend a day walking, taking in the views and enjoying Sydney sunshine.

sydney botanic gardens. I never tire of this walk. I lived in Wooloomooloo many year ago and if I visit Sydney this always a priority. Start at the Sydney Art Gallery (also a must in Sydney) and follow road across the bridge then to the right for a full walk around the harbour or to the left for a more direct route through the botanic gardens.
Beautiful and FREE. It was a lovely walk along the water with many beautiful gardens even in May. It must be even more gorgeous in the spring/summer!
We Do it on Sundays. Not much to Say really, Its a stunning walk, Pack a Picnic ( wine) and enjoy the natural beauty, with a city scape backdrop.

One of the top walks in the world. Sure you can run or power walk this. Maybe strolling is bst to fully drink in the loveliness of the the Opera House the harbour the bridge behind and the Botaniccal ardens in front of you. TIP - Expect crowds at all the usual times so if a peaceful walk is what you are after then time it accordingly. Also consider going right around to Lady Maquaries Chair and if you are feeling in the mood maybe a dip at the Boy Charlton pool or enjoy time in the Art Gallery of NSWonly a short walk further around.

Nice walk before dinner. Excellent walk followed by a drink at the waterfront at Circular Quay. Excotic trees occupied by cockatoos and parrots. There are signs which explicitly say, please walk on the gras, have aseat and enjoy the gardens - what a lot of people do, whene there is nice wheather for a picnic - so bring your drinks and food and enjoy it.
Brilliant Botanic. This walk is wonderful. Beautiful views, refreshing revitalising, renewing.

If your not into architecture..... Speaking soley about the Opera House, it was pretty, and understand there is a huge history around it, still just a building :/ However, I went and used the toilet, and found that was more exciting to look at than the building it self.. Recommend going to the toilet at the Opera House!

One of the iconic buildings of the world. I lost count how many pics I took of the Sydney Opera House during our recent visit while docking there on our world cruise. Maybe 150-200? I saved about 10 of them as great memories. The building is just begging to be photographed. The adjacent Botanic Gardens are missed by most visitors and definitely worth a visit. We were there in February and visiting the Botanic Gardens at dusk will give you access to something you don't see every day--bats. Hundreds and perhaps thousands of bats. They like a particular type of tree (not sure of the species) of which there are several in the Botanic Gardens.
beautiful walk. a wee forest in the city - Sydney really is beautiful!

A lovely walk!. On a sunny day this is a lovely walk. You can view both the edge of the gardens & the beautiful harbour, the Conservatorium of music & Government house are in the background & you can veer off the path to enter the gardens.

Beautiful gardens!. On the water, which is beautiful and clear, not nasty like most harbours. The gardens are great, with nice representations of Australia, they are very clean, no homeless people, overall great, with great views
Serenity by the Harbour. Beautiful walk, beautiful gardens, beautiful weather, beautiful harbour! A must do for Australians and visitors alike!

Holiday Down Under. Took a tour through the Opera House. What a magnificent building. The person who designed this took it to another level of architecture. In the evening it lights up it was spectacular to see. We took a walk through the Botanic Gardens and were really impressed. A must see for anyone going to Sydney.
A lovely walk early morning in the sunshine. This was a brilliant walk, views of the harbour and Opera house, great for taking pics.
The world's most beautiful harbour. beautiful scenery, peaceful surroundings. Great for families and groups of friends to enjoy picnics in the beautiful gardens.

A really pleasant area. After seeing the Opera house, we strolled through the gardens back to our hotel. A peaceful sanctuary, with lots of interesting plants and trees. Plenty of flying fox bats roosting in the trees. A real highlight of the city - do not miss it.
Peace and quiet in the city !!. It's a lovely walk along beside the Harbour and then the peace as you the gardens is wonderful.

An enjoyable stroll through Sydney!!!. Had an enjoyable stroll through the Botanical Gardens and around the Opera House. A very relaxing atmosphere and when taken easily is not too stressful. Nice to walk close to the water, especially on a hot day. Plenty of sunscreen and liquid refreshment required.

botanic gardens. bring a picnic lunch and some bird food....the cockatoos and the lorakeets will eat outta ur hand....the harbour breezes are to die for....the plants are so many and so beautiful....dont forget to check out the sleeping fruit bats in the trees....
Worth it. This is short walk say 15 minutes, Level easy going with magnificent view of the Harbour - free of charge. Gates close on dusk.

World class gardens and wildlife. This is a must walk in Sydney..just a short distance from the opera house...by walking on toward Kings Cross the keen walker can find
his way on to the eastern suburbs a walkers paradise

A relaxing stroll. The Opera House sits on a manmade peninsula. At the back of there is a gate into the Botanic Gardens that remains open during daylight hours. If you want to avoid the madness that is any city centre - especially during the main commuter times, take a stroll through the beautifully laid out, manicured and discreetly-signed Botanic Gardens.A really pleasant way to while away an hour or so.

This walk's for the birds. But in a good way.. Astonishing. I'm not sure there are any open spaces in the world where you can see so many different species of birds. Australian Ibises, Blue Wrens, laughing Kookaburras and the magnificent albatross will keep your attention but you will be stopped in your tracks by trees full of fruit bats. Just hanging out in huge numbers as if they're growing from the branches.You can walk for ever if you have the energy but there's a hop on / hop off bus if you don't. Best idea is to find a place on the grass, lay down a blanket and eat the sandwiches your hotel kindly provided in your packed lunch. Just remember where you are. That tiny creature crawling up your right leg might just be a funnel web.
Lovely walk. This is just another wonderful walk that radiates out from Sydney Harbour - beautiful views, lovely gardens. Highly recommend!
Opera House of dreams. So unique so delightful to view from harbour and on site. Gardens looked beautiful also but did not do the complete walk through as time was limited for others in our party.

Botanic Gardens. This garden is huge and has beautiful views of the Sydney Harbor and the Opera House. It has white Macaws that fly through the trees and all kinds of unique plant life. There is lots of open space to sit and have a picnic and so many paths that lead to other parts of the garden. It's a very old garden and is just a gorgeous place to be.

a beautiful and leisurely walk. Well worth the walk after visitng the Opera House to take a stroll through the beautiful botanci gardens in Sydney, views back to and across the harbour are beautiful and there are some amazing specimens of native plants and trees, we enjoyed it so much we went back twice as the gardens are huge
Nice to go days or nights. BeautifuEl place to go for walking . Good resaurants

Keep going to Wooloomooloo. This is a really enjoyable walk at any time of the day. We did it a couple of times during our stay. The first time we just followed the route without deviation, noting other places of interest as we went. The second time took us much longer as we visted various other places along the way. Would suggest that you continue to follow the path to the Finger Wharf at Wooloomaloo and buy a pie at the world famous Harry de Wheels pie stall. One word of caution watch out for the joggers.

Great views. Any traveller would enjoy the walk and the sights of the harbour are spectacular. It is noted that the walk is not suited to the traveller who is not mobile and can exert some energy to mount the steps etc. Once in the gardens you can take your time enjoy the gardens and the harbour views

Opera to Botanic Gardens. This walk is very scenic providing excellent views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. One can choose to cover the entire walk by the river absorbing majestic architecture on one hand and lush greenery on the other.
Opera House. The Opera house is a must the tour just blew us away
The garden was breath taking. They had beautiful gardens every where, and alot of them were geared to family with children, swings, water park , etc.

Opera house to Gardens. This is a fantastic walk....... A relaxing activity in a busy city.
We took our time doing this walk and it was a lovely way to spend and afternoon or morning.
Watch out for the bats. They may have been moved on by now. You may see anything from the arrival of the Governor General to a wedding with plenty flora in between.

Beautiful and Scenic. A beautiful paved path beginning in the harbor at the steps of the Opera House follows the water into well maintained gardens. Plenty of benches for picnics as well as shaded areas for a after lunch nap. We even saw bats during the day. A romantic way to spend the afternoon while seeing he harbor.
Opera House Rocked!. I actually recorded some music for an upcoming CD of mine. KarlMessnerMusic dot com. Also, I saw "La Soiree" and it was very funny.

A beauty right in the centre of Sydney. What a joy to experience this outdoor space.We were fortunate to have a warm summers day for the walk. We were with family and it was a lovely casual walk through beautifully kept green areas, lots of flowers to fill our visual and aural zones.\ There's lots to see here with many monuments and sculptures scattered round every turn.If you like a nice friendly space in the centre of sydney, then this is a must see.
Good walk. Beautiful walk just listen to the birds and bats. Well maintained gardens. Stop off at the coffee shop
Simply a lovely walk and everyone who visits Sydney should take the time to walk thru.. If you're lucky enough to visit fri-sun also go to do the government house tour.

Easy Access from the CBD to Lush Gardens. This is a great area to leisurely walk or even take a run. Beautiful views and vantage points abound. The walk can serve as a romantic stroll at sunset with your partner, a relaxing day with the kids. I often see many execs enjoying a walk or eating their lunches on the grounds while taking in some sun and taking some time for themselves. It's a wonderful area to see tourist attractions and take a temporary retreat from the CBD, while still keeping within walking distance of the office, other tourist attractions, restaurants, etc.

Several plants and birds. You can take a three hour walking in the garden full of peaceful people that take a pic-nic on the grass or play with the children. If you come from Europe don t forget to read the name of plants because there you don t find it? I enjoyed relax on the Bench with stranges birds, kiwis?, that come closed to you with no fear.

favorite place. my husband and I spent an enjoyable few hours at the Bo Tan on our first day in Sydney. It was a great way to fight jet lag. We rode the train, but got off at each stop.. We found the tour guide / train drivers to vary quite a bit, most were informative, one not so much. The trees, sculptures, birds, and bats were impressive. I had printed out a list with descriptions of the sculptures in the garden (there are many, many) which were in our lost luggage. I wish the visitor center had the guides available. When you go be sure to find the bats!!! They are easy to locate and big and active.

Farm Bay. After the Opera House walk around Farm Bay for a scenic shot of the Opera House with the Bridge behind it.
Then go for an afternoon walk through the botanical gardens.
Amazing experience. The Botanic Garden is a lovely place in Sydney. What an amazing experience of the gardens and opera House together. Trees, flowers, sea, and Sydney views,

Very pleasant walk. Unusual vegetation.
Safe, encourages you to use the grass to walk on and explore the plants.
Lovely walk. Interesting to watch the people, lovely view of the harbour. Take a picnic and eat in the gardens.
Nice to see the bay. Nice to walk from Opera house to the botanic garden. You can see the bay and lot of boating activities. Nice to see the city view as well.

Look for reviews on the Royal Botanic Gardens. I loved feeding birdseed to the Cockatoos while looking at the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge. It made me feel like Snow White and was one of the highlights of my trip.
Loved it. On the day we arrived we went to see and Opera. Great experience.
Beautiful views, great vibe. Fantastic walk any time of the year. Plenty of joggers enjoying the esplanade.

A blessing to the people in Sydney. The Botanic Garden is a lovely place in Sydney, located in the middle of the city, it catered a wider variety of plants and animals. If you are tired of those tourist attractions, it is worth to spend maybe a couple hours or half a day relax yourself on one of the many Botanic Garden Walk. Relax and enjoy a healthy holiday~
A must see. We stayed at Wooloomooloo and walked the Botanical gardens daily. It is such a beautiful park and a lovely walk to the Opera House.
A nice walk. See the Opera House then a scenic walk along Sydney harbor to the Botanic gardens, a nice way to spend a morning.

A walk in the Heaven. On a nice sunny day, its like if you are walking in the paradise. What an amazing experience of the gardens and opera House together. Trees, flowers, sea, sydney views, relaxation, all is here. Just do it.
An easy walk. Great afternoon - an easy stroll to take in two excellent attractions

Opera's first view. It was out second day at Australia and we hadn't seen the Opera House until then.While walking trough the gardens, regarding local citizens exploring the paths and fascinated with the trees and views, we saw for the first time the view of Australia's most famous building. That was the moment where we have realized that Sydney is a huge postcard. Everywhere you look, you get fascinated.
Exercise whilst you sightsee. It does not feel like exercise when you do this walk lots to see and do enjoy

Fantastic walk from Opera house. Starting at the Opera House there is a really good walk all the wayround beside the sea, through the botanic gardens right down to the Art Gallery of NSW. Beautiful views and good level easy walk. Lots of viewing points and benches. There is also a little "train" if you are not a good walker. Within the botanic gardens themselves there are various specialist areas and also a cafe for light lunches and refreshments. If you continue walking all along the foreshore you will pass a pretty swiming pool (Andrew Boy Charlton) right on the foreshore so you can have a cooling dip or stop at the very pretty cafe here. If you continue walking to the end there is another cafe/restaurant here but it does get very busy. Just across the road from here is the Art Gallery of NSW - there is a very nice reasonably priced cafe here with an outside area, on the Lower Ground Floor - a good place for a break after your walk. Your can return through the Botanic Gardens by a different route to the Opera House or walk back through the city area.

Beautiful and very enjoyable. This walk is not only to see Sydney's amazing sites like the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, it leads you around the harbour with the clear water on your left side and the beautiful botannical gardens to your right. It is a very convenient park, just adjacent to the city and has plenty of space and grass to play around on and an element of australian bush near the end. Great place to spend some time.

Right next door to the Opera House and FREE!. Beautiful, right next door to the Opera House and FREE! So many beautiful exotic plants, tame cockatoos and Ibis. And don't miss the Flying Foxes! (Look up)
Great walk.. Could do this walk again and again. This is where a lot of history started.
Beautiful and Peaceful. This is where nature's beauty meets the grand city. Beautiful flowers, green grass, many different kinds of trees, all with the tall glass city in the distance.
Just beautiful. Another place to relax and walk around to take in the wonderful views and incredible gardens

Serenity amongst the hive of activity. When you step inot the gardens you feel as if you are in a peaceful place. People are playing with kids, laying on the grass napping or reading, sitting on a bench holding hands and talking. Peaceful. Beautiful.
fantastic view. The Opera House is a beautiful place to visit it was the first place I visited when I came to Australia it was really nice and it is great to see the Opera shows inside it
Nice stroll. Good to meander your way around the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House & vice versa.

A must for all first time Travellers to Sydney. The walk from the Opera House to the Botanical Gardens is a great way to mix with locals and tourists alike and get a real feel for the Sydney vibe. There are great views of the Harbour and Opera House, beautiful Gardens, and good for people watching. There are lots of joggers, families, people of all sorts enjoying excercising, laying on the grass, enjoying the best Sydney has to offer for free!
an excellent stroll. The Sydney Botanical Gardens are outstanding with a wide variety of plants. It is very well maintained and a treat to see.
lovely stroll. on a nice day take a picnic hamper you get the ocean the views and the gardens

If you have only 1 hour in Sydney, this is how you spend it.. The Opera House has the shape of several sails together. And when you approach it, you actually feel like you're walking towards a port, maybe a hundred years ago, in the golden age of seafaring. You get to Circular Quay and then walk to your right, passing by the Ferry piers and thru different shops and restaurants until you get to the promenade where the Opera House stands. Take pictures as you approach it. Walk around it. And get a drink in the bar, watching the harbour and the Bridge. After a while there, you can get inside for a quick visit. If you're lucky and there's a performance of your interest you may stay as well. Once you leave the Opera House, there's a lovely park adjacent to it: the Botanic Gardens. A very tranquil and relaxing spot that offers more beautiful views of Sydney Harbour.
nice building. we got a lot of pictures there at night it is also very nice , it is the most famous place there in australia

A must do when you visit Sydney. This walk is beautiful. You get wonderful views of the Opera house, Harbour bridge and the harbour, while walking amongst beautifully maintained gardens. There are many seats to stop and rest at. The path is level and easy. When you reach Lady macquarie's chair, you may want to climb up the rocky ledges. There is usually plenty of bird life on this walk. At sunset there are often flying foxes coming to the park. The park is shut at nightfall and opens at sunrise. Check this website for opening hours. http://www.rbgsyd.nsw.gov.au/welcome_to_bgt/royal_botanic_garden/your_visit/planning_your_visit#hou
Just glorious. Wonderful for a stroll with a special someone - great views, relaxing surrounds, beautiful

A world icon. No trip to Sydney is complete without a walk around the magnificent Opera House and through the Royal Botanic Gardens. Anyone interested in plants will be enthralled by the fantastic specimens found in the Gardens. Such a quiet, peaceful place just to hang out. Signs urge you to "please walk on the grass". We especially liked the Herb Garden with its huge sundial that keeps perfect time!

A great walk from the Opera House. You can see The Botanical Gardens from the steps of the Opera House. Beautiful grounds and manicured lawns. Very popular place for joggers and walkers, with an exceptional view over the harbour.
Time out. Gr8 walk, breath of fresh air from the city! especially in summer
Great part of Sydney. This area by the harbour is stunning and every visitor should take some time to see it.
An excellent walk. This is a must do in Sydney. The walk is quite flat and well paved. If you want to take in the inner harbour aspect do this walk.

Walking shoes. My daughters wedding was in the botanical gardens so we walked to the opera bar after the ceremony. Unfortunately I was wearing my wedding heels so I struggled but it is a nice walk with the correct shoes.

View the ducks. The Botanic Gardens are lovely, especially with children. There are lots of ducks for children to watch, a train to take you if you are tired, the gardens are so tranquil. I loved taking my grand daughter to run around on the grass and paths and watch the boats and people.

beautiful gardens. great way to spend a day walking the gardens. opera house nice have to pay for a tour. restaruants in this area very, very expensive 9 dollars for a bottle of water!!! eat elsewhere!
Fox Flying Bats. Walk into Japanese Garden and look up in tree canopy for huge Fox Flying Bats...fantastic sight!
Opera house. Beautifull building exactly what we expected the shape tells its own story and looks even better when viewed either from the bridge or the Manly ferry, many good restaurants on the pier

The Perfect Day.. We walked around the botanic gardens and then up to the Opera House, before stopping at Opera Bar for a few hours having drinks with the most spectacular backdrop of harbour bridge. Finish the day off at a restaurant in the rocks.

Peace, tranquility and killer views !. The best way to appreciate the triple delights of the Opera House, the harbour foreshore and the Botanic Gardens. Try and pick a nice, sunny day, and take your camera cause you're going to need it.
go to a concert!. Heard Beethoven's ninth (Chorale) symphony there. Great venue!
Gorgeous vistas. Not only are the stages at the Opera House first rate, but the views throughout the Botanic Gardens of it and the bridge are stunning.
Very Relaxing and Fulfilling. This yet another must SEE place in the world; I can spend days.
Great but don't get lost!. Great walk but don't forget to grab the free map when you enter the gardens as it is very easy to get a bit disorientated and lost if you are not familiar with Sydney.
Worth it!. Great walk! Impressive to see thousands of fox bats in the threes in the botanical gardens. All free and beautiful!
AN ICON. Brilliant it lived up to my expectations and though very crowded again expected

Beautiful gardens and a great building!. We enjoyed wandering through the gardens and finding Mrs. MacQuarries' seat on the harbour. The opera house is beautiful but you need to go to a performance to really enjoy it.

Both have the wow factor. The Opera house is iconic and should be viewed from as many different locations and angles as possible. Have a drink at one of the cafe/bars nearby. Fabulous.The botanical gardens offer tranquility, peace, beauty, nature and wildlife. Check out the flying foxes that roost in the trees near the tea rooms, especially near dusk. Buy some monkey nuts and feed the Cockatoos. They are such characters and provide amazing interaction.
Great. Fantastic building and beautiful gardens, a definite day out in Sydney.

Scenic and easy!. Its almost impossible to miss this walk if you are by the Opera House-you almost melt into the Gardens.Once you disappear into the Gardens,the city seems to disappear.It is very beautiful,very much like the Tulieries in Paris!
Saw Olivia Newton John. You have to be there to feel the greatness of the opera house. It is a true architectural wonder

Love our Opera House and gardens.. This is a must do thing in Sydney. The Opera House is in the most beautiful setting on the Harbour, and the walk from the gardens just stunning. It is beautiful in the day but even more so in the night with the twinkling lights all around the harbour shining on the water.

A lovely walk with beautiful views. We walked around the front of the Opera House on our very first morning in Australia and then across the road into the Royal Botanic Gardens - it was only about 8.30a.m. so it was pretty peaceful - just what we needed after nearly 24 hours on a plane! The gardens are really lovely (even though it was near the end of Summer, there were still lots of lovely flowers in bloom). It was also very well-kept and clean, no rubbish anywhere. We popped into the shop and used the toilets (also nice and clean and free!). We saw several gardeners weeding and cutting the grass, etc. It is obviously lovingly maintained. Well worth a pleasant stroll!
Fruit Bats!. Liked being able to see Fruit Bats in the trees during the day.

A lovely way to spend an afternoon. Whilst it was raining when I visited, it was still worth a walk. The gardens have some wonderful plants and the walks through the grounds are peaceful (bar the enthusiastic Navy guys who were training!!!).
Wonderful. After the impressive Bridge and Opera House, it was very enjoyable to stroll along the waterfront and appreciate the well laid out gardens.
Walk with great views. The views of the harbour , the beautiful gardens and the Opera House
Opera House Well Worth A Visit. The Botanic Gardens are beautiful and the Opera House is well worth a visit - take a tour if you have the time it is worth it.
Opera House exceeded all expectations. Great tour guide working with a world-class building in a unique location

Worth it, even if your feet are tired.. If you go from the Circular Quay (there is a lift that takes you up to one of the "entrances" to the Gardens and end at the Opera house it's mainly a downhill walk, and you end with the Opera House which is just a wonderful sight anyway!
Go to a performance at the Opera House. The Opera house is beautiful at intermission we went to the windows facing the water. It was lovely to see the view of the Harbour from inside the Opera House.

Flying Foxes in gardens. Watch out for hundreds of BATS!!! We were walking in gardens and heard screeching look up and the bats were either hanging or flying. Gardens beautiful enjoyed a rainey afternoon in Art Musuem
Walk all day. The bats within the botanic gardens were great to watch and the gardens are well looked after. The Opera House was great to walk around.
Colourful - Leisurly stroll. It was a busy Sunday and with lots of sunshine and good cheer

You must talk a little walk!. After the Opera House, the Botanic Garden Walk is well worth the effort. You will see flowers, trees, flying foxes, and many birds. It was the only Kookaburra bird I saw the entire trip! Flying foxes were also an animal/bird we have never seen before.

Stop reading and go. The Opera House. Iconic. Spectacular. Majestic.
Really, if you're visiting Sydney, you must go.
The walk is a wonderful and beautiful stroll after seeing The House. A fantastic garden and a great view any way you look!
Botanic Gardens. The flowers were lovey. We also saw some of the biggest spiders I have ever seen. The gardens were easy to find and a wonderful break from the hustle of downtown Sydney

Great Walk. The gardens are so big with so much to see, you can spend hours in here, which a lot of people do.
So many great views and you can go crazy with a camera

Take a train or walk...the choice is yours. Just inside the wrought iron gates of the Botanic Gardens, usually stands a small tourist "train" that you can use to take you around the gardens. It's not free, but worth it if you're already hot and tired. But to take a stroll along the edge of the water is just lovely. Workers come out here daily in their lunchtime to catch up on their regular jog, even in the summer months! Move further up among the trees and you will see birds of all colours sitting in the branches, especial white Parakeets, something one doesn't see here in UK. Even further on up you will find a self service open air cafeteria where you will probably be surrounded by even more birds, especially the odd tall legged and long curved beaked Ibis I think it is called. I had one "steal" my ice cream, so beware! There are many gardens within the Gardens where you can just sit and rest and enjoy the surroundings. Another must see. (visits prior to 2011)

Possibly the most beautiful urban walk in the World?. What can you say beautiful and iconic. Worth visiting at different times of the day to get the full atmosphere. Amazing at night – must visit the Opera Bar. Fantastic.
great walking experience. great walking experience a combination of great view and historic background
Pleasant stroll. Easy walk, and we had a sunny and warm - not hot - day. Lots of tours buy something you can do on your own. Nice ocean views as you walk along.

Fantastic stroll. The Botanic Gardens are indescribably beautiful...far exceeding my expectations and I had high expectations given I live next to King's Park in Perth. They are very different from one another but breathtaking.
Walking with a View. Fantastic Garden Walk along the waterfront of Sydney's most spectacular harbour. Finishing on the footsteps of the Opera House.
Connects the busy Opera House Area to the peaceful gardens. Walk around the waters edge and spot the wonderful birds in the trees
Iconic Opera House. You have seen the pictures - they do not compare with the reality - magnificent.

A walk in the park. Walking from The Opera House to the Botanic Garden is a wonderful way to see this part of Sydney. walking along the foreshore is both scenic and relaxing.. As you walk you get a small idea of the size of Sydney HArbour and a grand view of the Opera House.
Botanic Gardens. The path winds along the water in a beautiful setting.

A Haven in a Busy City.. Everything! The views, the flowers, including some native ones. The seats or grass to sit and rest. The cafe in the gardens to get a snack. Eat your own snack on the grass. The Government House in the grounds as well, open to the public. You may be lucky to see an outdoor concert sometimes. The Art Gallery is close to the end of the walk.

one of the most beautiful places in sydney. The Opera house to the Botanic Gardens Walk is a must do on any Sydney visit, especially if you are only in town for a couple of days, You will get a fanastic view of the harbour bridge, the opera house, and the harbour. The gardens are stunning,with a tranquil lake down towards the harbour. If you have time you could easily roam around for a couple of hours discovering the different themed gardens, restaurant and shop.
Great experience. The Opera House is beautiful and so are the gardens. I loved every part of it. There are tours that go inside the Opera House and even shows.

You've got to do the Opera House tour. We took the one-hour guided tour when we arrived in Sydney. (There is a nice discount for Senior Citizens, by the way). The guide was excellent, and the tour was what we expected. They took our photo when we first arrived, and at the end we purchased it in a portfolio that superimposed us in front of and inside the opera house, as well as a CD on the Opera House, which we haven't watched yet (No photos are allowed inside the Opera House). There were also some postcards with our picture, which we promptly mailed away to family in hopes they would arrive home before we did! The one thing I wish we would have known was that you can purchase performance tickets for the next day's show(s) at $50pp by showing your tour ticket. Unfortunately, we bought our tickets online before we left and paid $155pp. It would be worth it to take the tour every time you go to Sydney, if you want to attend a performance.
PERFECT LOCATION. Love the architecture and variety of entertainment at the Opera House. Great peace in the Botanical Gardens!
Stroll on the harbour. Beautiful to stroll along the waters edge with gardens on one side.Park benches along the walkway make for a resting spot to take in the view & vibe of the surroundings.
Most do. Of course you must visit the Opera house. Its an awesome structure and I enjoyed the history. We also enjoyed the gardens and wished we had more time to see all of it.
Lovely. A great place for a stroll and to see the wildlife. A lovely place to sit on a sunny day. The gardens are very pretty.
Relaxing Walk. Nice relaxing walk. If you are driving and need to park, best to drive up to Mrs Maquarie's Chair and find parking there. Super costly though at $7/ hr.
Amazing, but watch out for fruit bats.. Loved the views, the flowers and plants. Fruit bats were noisy and had the potential to be messy!
Always something going on. Saw the eels in the pond for the first time, they are up to 4 foot long, very exciting.

Wow. Took a tour and also took in an evening event. There were at least 4 or 5 other events going on in the Opera House and you would never had known it. This place is huge. Not a bad seat in the place. Tickets are very pricey.
Relaxing. We went there first time for team lunch... it was great atmosphere... later I went with my partner and friends, it's a place for relaxation...open your mind and let it fly...
Nice. Great walk around the Opera House and to end at the Botanic Gardens with a nice picnic lunch.
Pretty Walk. Lovely walk through the Botanic Gardens. Parrots flying everywhere and beautiful trees and plants.
Amazing views. Beautfiul walk - a little less crowded than elsewhere near the harbour.
Fantastic. The gardens are awesome - watch out for the birds who will try to steal your lunch whilst at the cafe!
Great Walk. This is a 'have to do' walk to any visiting Sydney. The view, the water is spectacular.
always a great place. Was able to take daughters and they were totally impressed as I am each time I visit,wonderful tours

Don't go at lunchtime. What a great stroll along the water and through the gardens.
Lunchtime is manic with literally hundreds of joggers fights for pavement space with tourists. Go before 12 or after 2.
Walk. Wonderful place for a walk and to appreciate a quiet spot in a busy city. Walk up to the Art Gallery to have a look- good spot for a coffee & some culture.

Escape in the middle of a cosmopolitan city. Wander from the Opera House through the Botanic Gardens and let the stress slip away. The gardens are lovely and tranquil, a great spot for a stroll, or to sit and eat lunch if you need to escape from your office. We're so lucky to have these gardens right in the middle of our city!

A very pleasant easy walk. This is an easy walk which gives a full view of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour and bridge. Meander along with families with children and strollers, stroll past the couples either sitting or walking the many pathways, or get fit and jog for the whole way.
well kept. Park was clean and tidy, beautiful flowers felt safe and well kept.
walked in the rain. Beautiful even in the rain. It is also free to enter and walk around. We saw cockatoos and parrots in the trees. Great for bird watchers.

Sydney Opera House & Botanical Gardens walk. Spectacular and iconic sites, which I have visited three times and would return to anytime. The notice board at the entrance to the gardens reads "Welcome... Please walk on the grass...We also invite you to smell the roses, hug the trees, talk to the birds and picnic on the lawns." How welcoming is that?! You will love the views and will take umpteen photos.

An architectural masterpiece and a place of refuge. The Opera House is striking and was probably what started the bulding designs for the city of Sydney. Lots of modern architecture while maintaining a lot of the city's historical buildings. The Botanic Gardens were ike an oasis in the city. One of the most intersting sights are the hundreds of flying foxes ( similar to bats) hanging in the trees. Also some pretty big spiders wth impressive webs.

Stretch your legs.. From the Opera House, which you should at least circumnavigate, it is a short stroll to the Northern entrance of the Boyanic gardens. Frpm here you can lie on the grass, walk the many and varied paths through the gardens, picnic or visit he cafe. There are ponds, statues and special features galore. In summer a stroll to the Andrew Boy Charlton swimming pool straight along the harbour path and over the point is an absolute must on a hot day. It is one of Sydneys best situated swimming pools.

stunning walk.....even in the rain. After going to the art gallery to see the Picasso exhibition I wandered through the Botanic Gardens down to the Opera house and loved it. The gardens have wonderful information about various parts of the garden and plants, and I found this to be very interesting.I love walking in gardens all over the world and I found this to be just as superb as gardens in Europe.

Great walk at sunrise. I was there in February, and would go out around 6:30am each morning and do this walk for about 50 minutes. Some walkers/joggers around, but zero crowds, so a very pleasant time of day to do this walk. Going up and down the steps of the Opera House is a great form of exercise and a lot of fun without any people around. Then, seeing the sunrise and the views of the Sydney city skyline and the Harbour Bridge from the gardens are picturesque that time of day.

Good walk. We walked from our hotel through the gardens to the Opera house The gardens are well maintained and informative Ibis walking about Black swans, Fox bats hanging in the trees. The park comes alive at lunch time with people running wore me out watching them. cafe in the park was reasonable

A great walk with superb scenery. The walk from Circular Quay down to the Opera House along the footpath by the harbour is just special and the gardens situated in the middle of this great city by the harbour are perfectly positioned to reflect the peace and tranquility of the beautiful gardens , the stunning scenery of the harbour and the bustle of a modern metropolis

Great walk but a few steps / hills. Wandering around Sydney is very relaxing & the short walk from the Opera house to the botanic gardens is very rewarding, though you do have to tackle a steep hill or flight of stairs.
Do it. Easy walk for a reasonably fit person, garden is big so be prepared to walk at least a mile or two.
Take this lovely stroll to the opera house.. Like the joggers, the views, the tourists and the seagulls along the way

Beautiful Gardens!. We walked from the Opera House to our hotel via the Botanic Gardens. The views are spectacular and the care given to these gardens is absolutely impeccable. Don't miss it if you enjoy peace and quiet in the midst of loud and busy!!
Scenic Pleasure. A great way to access the Botanic Gardens without stress and traffic.
The most beautiful way to see the Harbour on foot. Wide paths, many places to stop and enjoy the view. If you have littlies check out the mini train rides.

Is it really that big of a walk?. To be honest, I don't see how you can call this a walk since the Opera House is only like 100 meters away from the entrance to the Botanic Gardens?However as the Opera House is fantastic and the Botanic Gardens are as well, I guess the tiny bit in between must be called perfect as well ;)

Best of both. The Opera House is well worth a visit and afterwards, a stroll to the Botanic Gardens gives you the best of both. On a fine day, the harbour and city skyline are a beautiful backdrop to the gleaming white of the Opera House and the greenery and seclusion of the gardens. Those still feeling the need to walk can continue to the Art Gallery of New South Wales and then on to Hyde Park and St Mary's Cathedral, the gardens and parks all green oases in the busy city.
Walk. A very good walk around the foreshore of Sydney harbour and garden.
Scenic walk. Great little heart starter before brekky. So picturesque. A nice flat walk that would suit anyone
BEAUTIFUL. A must in Sydney, do not miss it. Beautiful view of the Jackson Bay and ideal for amateur photographers.

Great view across the Bay - Beautiful Grounds. After you have seen the Opera House It is definitely worth the time to walk through the gardens, and even better if come prepared with a picnic basket or roller blades!There are great views across the bay, beautiful parks and scenery, and then the beautiful Botanical Gardens.And its all free :)
A Sydney Must-do. If you have time during your stay this walk is really worth doing. Great views, not too stenuous. lovely gardens.

Nice Walk. This is a nice walk on a pleasant day. The gardens are beautiful with the views of the Opera House and the Bridge. We also walked to the Domain and saw an Opera in the Park. What a wonderful end to a fabulous day.
Sensational. Really recommend this walk to get a sense of what Sydney harbour is really like.Very relaxing and enjoyable.

Beautiful walk!. While visiting the Sydney Opera House, take the extra 30 minutes for a leisurely stroll from the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens along the Harbor....or be like we did and take the extra 3 hours (the Botanic Gardens are great, too).
Must Walk the Paved Path. Walk the path run excercise or to enjoy the views of the Bay! Paved path and scenic. Must loop the entire path and see the city from all views.

Best walk in Sydney. Just a wee stroll to see some of the best natural beauty you'll ever see. No mountains or gorges but everything else that makes a walk worthwhile: grand buildings (notably the Opera House), botanical wonders, bird and bat life, all against the backdrop of Sydney Harbour. Absolutely not to be missed.

Romantic Walk. A lovely quite Romantic walk from the Opera House through the Batonical gardens. With the sea on one side and lovely trees on the other.We found the large fruit bats near the Restaurant and Cafe hanging in the trees.Unfortunatly the cafe was closed, so you need to check times of opening if you plan to take a break.Maybe the little train ride would suit some people.This also had stopped running through the park at the time we went late afternoon after a shower of rain,More signs with more information would be helpfull.
views views views. great spot on the harbour with the bridge and the opera house as back drops
A must. If you can't get to a performance, do take the tour around the Opera House - it is fantastic inside.The Botanic Gardens also house Government House which has free tours on the 1/2 hour
Serene. Less hustle and bustle than the Opera House and Circular Quay and green, green, green. The cafe in the middle is a great escape on a hot Summer's day

Culture and nature. It is worthwhile to do a tour of the Opera House. It was informative without being tedious and they certainly took us through amazing places. Finished off with a walk through the gardens, stunning views and beautifully maintained. Recommended.
Free, iconic, awesome.. This walk shows Sydney's suberb location to great advantage. Get a coffee at the little cafe at the Oyster Bar, and make sure you walk to Mrs Macquarie's Chair.

Walk the Walk. We took this walk, at some risk from Joggers and bikers. There were so many of them. It was like being assailed by hoards of angry flies. We know that slow moving, dilitary tourists like us can be a pain in the butt, but at times we felt at risk of being knocked off our feet. Don't do the walk at lunch time. Let the joggers and bikers sweat off their frustrations before returning to their office blocks. Then, Walk this Walk. The views are great and the gardens beautiful.

An easy day with lots to see. The flowers and trees and birds in the garden will take your breath away. The walk is easy and the sounds of the birds for those unused to Australia are unforgettable. Lots of places to pucnic, run, stroll, while seeing the vegetation that is eye-popping.

Nice walk. Lovely walk from the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens. Takes about 5 mins from the Opera House. Botanic Gardens are large and very nicely laid out. Plenty of seating and look out for the hundreds of fruit bats hanging from the trees!
Beautiful walk. Take this walk and enjoy some amazing views of the harbor and the Opera House.
Botanic Garden Walk. A great and easy walk. Take time to look round the gardens, I saw bats in trees and amazing ducklings feeding
Pleasant walk. We did the walk from the opera house through the botanics. It's a pleasant stroll but not a "must-see", and I'd certainly not pay to do any organised tour.

Man-made gives way to Nature. After a tour of the Sydney Opera House, you're overwhelmed with architects and engineering. The gentle climb up the hill to the Botanic Gardens is framed by huge trees on one side, and Sydney Harbor on the other. Enjoy the views, look for flying foxes hanging in the trees, and don't be surprised when the white birds begging for a handout aren't seagulls, but cockatoos!
A_great_trip. A_great_first_view_of_the_opera_house...Great_surroundings_of_pounds_trees_flowers_etc..
Beautiful spot with stunning harbour views. We enjoyed our Saturday lunch at this restaurant. Right at the Opera House, overlooking the Bridge and Harbour.
Take a picnic. Nice flat, easy walk. Take one of the paths and explore the Botanic gardens. There is a cafe in there somewhere. Sit up on the hill in the shade on a hot day and chill out.

One of the best harbour side walks in Sydney. See the Opera House, and then take a lovely harbour side walk to the Botanical Gardens. There is a great cafe at the Boy Charlton pool on the east side of the gardens and, if you can make it to Wooloomooloo you can go to Harry's cafe de Wheels and enjoy a Veggie Tiger! Yum :)
Beautiful walk, worth doing.. I walked from the Botanical Gardens to the Opera house, Sydney at its best
Great Walk. Great walk with lots of pics to take. Nice views, and its free!
Lovely scenic short walk. Nice,flat, leisurely waterfront walk with wonderful tourist attractions either side.
Superb views. Relaxed with ever-changing views.Wonderful ibis. Places to sit. Fascinating trees and flowers.

Very scenic walk. Great insights into the history of the botanic garden, peaceful, scenic and fantastic botany. The sights along the walk are amazing. The harbour, the gardens and the opera house. Lovely

Beautiful walk and it's free!. It's an easy and beautiful walk through the gardens, along the water, to the Opera House and to Circular Quay. Great lawn areas for a picnic or an afternoon nap. Can't say anything more expect positive things about this walk. Go already!
Easy scenic walk. We loved the walk from the Opera House on the Harbour to and through the Royal Botanic Gardens. Very scenic.
Make time to do this. A terrific walk - the gardens are fabulous! Nice way to spend an afternoon.
Always a pleasure. Lots of bird life, and passers-by to amuse, plus stunning vistas
Go for a stroll. Great way to see Sydney, bring your camera! Go at night to get good pics!
Picturesque. Great to see some beautiful icons and enjoy all their is.
Awesome. This is one of the reasons we came to Australia in the first place to see this awesome sight

What an amazing view and its free!. We have taken this walk many times over the years and on a sunny day with the harbour on one side and the Botanical Gardens on the other, we think how lucky we are. A good place to go and sit and admire the view, have a snooze under a tree or a power walk for the energetic or just a stroll lookingt at the plants and trees.
A walk in the park. See Sydney by walking. The Botanic Gardens are beautiful!

Walk or jogg but go there !. Each time I spend a day or two in Sydney, I cannot do without taking an hour to walk from the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House. I prefer taking it that way to have the best view of the Opera House.

Good walk. Walk right round the Opera House, (surprisingly few people do) and you get a great view of the bridge and can then walk up to Mrs Maquaries chair and the Botanical Gardens. Another must do for the visitor to Sydney.

A beautiful walk, but mine is much longer track. It's a much.. Million Point - The Rock: From Millson Point Train Station walk south to get onto the Habour Bridge. Walk on the left side for Opera House from the bird eye view.The Rock - Circular Quay - Opera House: from the Rock, full of good restaurant. On Friday and weekend, the rock market is there on it's alley, tons of different suvinior and artisan. Walk along the Sydney Cove With the view of Opera House. Pass the Circular Quay to Operahouse. So many good ambient restaurants along the way.Opera House - Botanic Garden: a gorgeous greeny walk with a view of ferries, yatches, boats in a beautiful habour. You can stop by the government house. If you love roses, don't miss the Palace garden.Botanic Garden - Mrs Mcquarie's Point: Walk along the Farm Cove to Mrs Mcquarie's point. If you were there at dusk, watch the sunset behind the Opera House and Habour Bridge from the end of the peninsula. This point is popular spot for tourist to take a photo with opera house.Mrs Mcquarie's Point - Art Gallery of NSW: Walk east, pass Mrs Mcquarie's Chair, keep left into small walking track. The track will lead you to another side of the peninsula along the Wooloomooloo Bay. The track is peacefully laid along the water but still very greeny from the cliff with a view of Wooloomooloo Wharf and a navy base. It might be wet when high tide. You will pass swimming pool then get back to Mrs Mcquarie Rd. Walk straight to the Art Gallery of NSW.Art Gallery of NSW - St. Mary's Cathedral - Hyde Park - CBD: walking back to the city. You can stop by the gallery, cathedral and participate a seasonal event at Hyde Park. Across the Hyde Park is the shopping area or you can visit the Sydney tower for city sky view.All these might take a whole HAPPY DAY to finish but you will touch the real Sydney.
A good route to appreciate the lovely gardens.. Walking by the harbour and the gardens is a perfect walk to wind down.

The walk just gets better.. If you have a reason to go down to the Opera House, there is probably no better way to go than via the Bottanic Gardens. It's a bit like going for a stroll through a rural countryside, nice Forrest's, old buildings and then that magic Opera House on the imposing Harbour. Not to be missed.

Photo Op in all caps!. You can't help but say wow when you get the gate that looks over the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Its a stunning view that makes you fall in love with Sydney all over again!
Picturesque. enjoyable walk through the gardens with beautifl scenery.

Beautiful picturesque walk for free. My husband and I enjoyed strolling along the shore looking at the Opera House and then walking into the Botanical Gardens. The birds were fascinating, flowers were beautiful and we found many spots for great pictures. On the way back we stoped for Oysters along the Quay. Awesome day.
Beautiful. A must if visiting Sydney. You can walk up to the Art Gallery and have a look there or there is a nice cafe nearby at Lady Maquarie's chair

Substantial walk, but the beautiful views make it worthwhile.. If you are a super walker and happy to walk even longer, the ideal walk would be from Museum or St James train station through Hyde Park and continue in a straight line past Sydney Hospital (beautiful sandstone buildings), the State Library, past the Conservatorium of Music, to the Botanical Gardens to the Opera House and around Circular Quay. I would probably allow most of a day to do this walk and include lunch along the way and enjoy the scenery, though, depending on the pace, some people do this run in their lunch break. There is lots to see, in the first section of Hyde Park you will see parts of Kings Cross (East) and the shopping district (West). Once you have passed Hyde Park, Pitt Street Mall is West and has many shops and places to eat. Sydney Hospital and the State Library is near Martin Place and is more luxury shopping (think Tiffany's, Burberry etc.) and a business area. The Con is East if you continue in a straight line along Elizabeth Street and is quite unusual looking, as it resembles a castle which leads into the Botanical Gardens. Once at the Opera house, there is uninterrupted views of the harbour which is lovely and many of the ferries and boats can be seen from here. If you walk back along Circular Quay towards the train station, you can see the Harbour Bridge, Luna Park there are high quality, expensive eateries along this area also. Highly recommended for tourists who want to see a little bit of everything.
Stunning walk every day. Dont miss this easy walk around the harbor to the Botanical Garden beautifully lush and colorful. Stop to watch the bats rustling in the trees, it's as unique as it is eerie.

Well worth the time - great views. This is a wonderful walk. We spent about two hours walking along the gardens and the water to the opera house. You can go at your own pace (just don't get trampled by all the runners!) and take in all the wonderful views. Take time to look up in the trees. We saw lots of different birds, some of which are very colorful! There are many different varieties of trees to look at as well. And of course the water, boats, and the opera house. And all the views are free!

How to show off Sydney?. The Botanic Gardens and Sydney Opera House walk. I usually walk from the Art Gallery of NSW through the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House. This is a beautiful walk. you can take your time strolling through the gardens, looking at the magnificent exotic trees, beautiful blooms, have a picnic on the grass (you are allowed to walk/play/picnic on the grass) or have a meal or snack in the restaurant/cafe and continue your stroll toward the waters edge and the fantastic views of a busy Sydney Harbour and the white sails of The Sydney Opera House. It doesn't get much better than that.
Promenade on a Sunday afternoon. It's a delightful way to spend a Sunday afternoon, strolling along the foreshore, inhaling all the wonderful scents of the gardens in bloom.
Do not miss. A tour of the Opera house is a must. what a beautiful building and so much history

Stunning taste of Sydney. If you're in Sydney, you absolutely must visit the Royal Botanic Gardens and the Opera House. Both are standouts in a standout city. The short walk between the two sites is beautiful. Must do.

Nice walk and romantic (depending who you're with!). This is a lovely walk with good vantage points from which to see Sydney; the setting also makes it romantic if you're with someone special. My wife and I enjoy picnics so a favourite activity is to catch a ferry from Parramatta to the city, grab a coffee or gelato at Circular Quay, then walk up from the Quay to the Opera House and continue on (after some frolicking on the Opera House steps) to the Gardens. Bear in mind that there are some steep bits to the walk up to the Gardens and also in the Gardens themselves. However, there are plenty of benches and viewing spots to stop and rest along the way, so this walk is suited to most levels of fitness. DO take a bottle of water if it's hot, because there's not much shade til you get to the Gardens. Also, plan to spend at least an hour in the Gardens themselves, because there's a lot to see!
The best things in Sydney are free. and this is just another example...get out and about and you will see just how beautiful the harbour and surrounds are.
Short walk to Gardens. Lots of steps from Opera House to Gardens. But nice views everywhere.
Walk around Sydney. A beautiful city to discover on foot, plenty of interesting walks

Nice way to enjoy the sun and intro to sydney. Just arrived in Sydney? well do this first. Walk right around the gardens seeing the wonderfully kept plants and head towards Macquarie's chair for the classic view of the Opera house and Bridge. Their are drinking fountains around the park which are OK to drink from. Take a lunch and find a quiet spot - you can get right in amongst the bushes and find a private spot. Give yourself 1 - 1.5 hrs min to gently walk around and see everything while taking photos.

Where ealso would you be!!. This parkland and the walk are idealy situated right on the harbour eat of the Opera House and take in the spectacular views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House.On a sunnny day there is no better way to spend and hour or two that can be added to by packing a picinic lunch (or take away) and sitting on a blanket to enjoy the spectacular vistas. There is plenty of space for some exercise or a game with the kids and lots of opportunities for photo's. So enjoy!

“Beautiful, well-kept gardens”. Right by the harbour, the Botanic gardens are extensive and provide a serene area right in the city. There are often wonderful botanic art displays and some artwork on sale. The flying foxes spoil it a bit in the area they have taken over, but there is an excellent restaurant and gift shop and it;s a haven from the hustle of the business area.
Bliss!. Walking around Sydney Harbour with constant views of the Opera House and wandering around a very well kept Botanic Gardens is just great . finishing with the brillant NSWC Art Gallery.
Fantastic Views. We walked this on a lovely Sunny Sunday New Years Day morning. Does it get any better? Stunning views and just a fantastic walk

Definitely do this walk, and go to Mrs. McQuarry's Chair. The first time I went to Sydney I did not do this walk and the second time I did- THIS is where to get the most amazing views of the Opera House and Bridge together. And a nice walk- don't take a bus tour- walk it if you are able to.

Great Easy Walk. The walk from the Royal Botanic Gardens to the Opera House (or vice versa) is a pleasent amd easy walk. If you are at either, its worth visiting the other....I'd say these are the top 2 attractions in Sydney. The walk is easy, not very hilly, and is very pretty. You also get a great view of the Opera House from the gardens approach (far fewer people than coming the other way).
A lovely walk and it's FREE!!. Right by the harbour with beautiful trees and plants---you can get some lovely botanical art cards just off the main path. We took a picnic.
Best short walk in the world?. One of the great short walks of the world - great and changing views at every step
Lovely re-visit. Its a delightful walk along the harbour front from Woolloomooloo to the Opera House, well graded and of course, very scenic.

Funny cockatoos. We loved the walk from the Opera House through the Botanic Gardens and took a picnic with us. Sitting on perfectly manicured gardens overlooking Sydney Harbour was just perfect. We were joined very early on by some inquisitive sulphur crested cockatoos who attempted to be naughty & steal food but it was lots of fun-just make sure you don't feed them as it's not good for them. Fruit bats roost on the trees and all the plants/vegetation are perfectly maintained, an amazing place to kick back relax and enjoy the sunshine!

One of the great Sydney walks. There are two walks you must do if you visit Sydney - the Opera House / Botanic Garden walk, and the walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee. Both are spectacularly beautiful, and the view back to the Opera House from the path around the Botanic Gardens is worth the hike. Keep going tho past Lady Macquaries Chair and then hook back to the park via Boy Charlton's swimming pool - another Sydney landmark. The view over to Woolloomooloo is also beautiful. Round trip will take you about an hour, but it's one of the great walks of any city in the world.

Best views on a short easy walk. Sydney harbour is one of the most beautiful places and it is easily seen from every part of this short walk between the stunning architecture of the Opera House and the attractive landscaping of the Royal Botanical Gardens. You can extend this walk by going up to Mrs Macquarie's Chair and it'll still be a short, easy walk with a fabulous view.
Great walk. I would definitely recommend this walk. It has sensational views of Sydney harbour. The walk should take about 20 to 30 mins.
Chilled walk. We walked around the Botanic Gardens first then headed to the Opera House. Stunning views and loads of photo opportunities to be had (if you can just get people out of the way)

Wonderful walk and great place to run. I really enjoyed watching daily life take place surrounded by the Opera House, garden weddings and joggers out for their daily run. As I stroll through the gardens the fragrance is subtle and beautiful. Walking through the gardens you'll find that there are many places to sit and relax. Bring a beverage or bring your running shoes and take advantage of the space and beautiful views.
nice walk. I can highly recommend this walk for the views and the gardens. Don´t stop at the gardens but follow the shoreline to Mrs. Macquaries Chair for more stunning views.

Keep Fit Trail. One of the worlds best running tracks out to Lady Maquaries chair if you can dodge the weddings, the tourist train and photographers. Take your bathers & keep on going past the chair to Boy Charlton Pool - one of the best in Sydney. Then on to Wollamaloo for a pie floater at Harrys Cafe on Wheels & climb the stairs up to Potts Point for great views
Worth Doing. This is is a "must do" for the scenery and the peacefulness and the end delight of - depending on which way you walk - the Opera House or the gardens
Nice walk. Lovely walk but quiet long. Lots of joggers. Best place to get picture of both Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House together.
A beautiful spot. We did this walk a couple of times; our hotel was just on the edge of the park, so it was very convenient. It was well kept and a pleasure to visit.

Run or Walk ... your choice. I've run along here plenty of times to Mrs Macquarie's chair up to the Art Gallery and back again. I've strolled along here with a loved one and even had a picnic or two. Good fun fast or slow.

A must do for visitors. This is a really easy and enjoyable walk around the harbour, and provides great views. The Botanical Gardens are well worth while too, making this a nice way to spend a few hours in Sydney. There are numerous picnic spots too.

You will need the excercise!. This is one of my favourite walks in Sydney when I have been eating and drinking too much. I like to go later in the afternoon when it is cooler. Like all Botanical Gardens it has many different areas. I like the herb garden.
Fantastic views and atmosphere. A beautiful setting and well maintained by the parks team

Botanic Park near Intercontinental Hotel. Really lovely park well maintained and we walked there several times and from one area you get good photo shots of Opera House with the Bridge behind it, well worth walking there and not too far.

Enjoyed the bird life. We took a casual stroll through the gardens. Lovely large trees providing shade on a sunny day but more interesting were e inhabitants. Beautiful parrots had the children fascinated. Then of course the fruit bats hanging upside down.
Beautiful. We walked from our hotel through the gardens to the Opera House, and then out to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair. Very enjoyable, beautiful, and possible to find shade if it's very hot.

Excellent harbor views. This walk is great if you enjoy getting your daily exercise whilst seeing the sights. The Botanic Gardens are lovely & the walk takes you along the edge of Sydney Harbour where you get a fantasic view of the harbour bridge & Opera House. I highly recommend it to all visitors.

Missed the best. Unfortunately I missed the best of these gardens due to the events going on around Sydney before and after the NYE celebrations. And by the time I got the chance to visit it was dusk. But be sure to go visit this in the day time as I know by the sites I saw that the floral and grounds must just be beautiful in full sun. Next visit the Botanical gardens will be first on my list along with the ferry ride to Watsons Bay.

Great Place to Explore during Any Season. You can reach Circular Quay by bus, ferry, taxi or train.The walk around the quay to the Opera House is easy.A number of coffee shops.There are many walks in the gardens besides the one around the water to Mrs Macquarie's Chair.A map or pamphlet may be helpful.Take your camera and water.You can continue walking up to the Art Gallery of NSW in the Domain or return to the Opera House gate.----or-----(info)
Great Walk. We walked from Potts Point to the Opera House thru the botanical gardens. The park was very well maintained and it was very relaxing to walk thru.
Beautiful park. Amazing flowers and nice walk...not too strenuous.

Great Walk with great views. A fantastic and beautiful walk with great views of the city, the opera house and bridge. If you like this walk also go by ferry to Luna Park for what are the best views of the whole lot.If you also like exotic plants, flying foxes or just lying on the grass watching the world go by, this is the walk to do!

The WOW factor - a walk along the harbour from Walsh Bay to Macquaries Chair. Particularly at dusk - starting at Walsh Bay, follow the harbour through the Rocks, past Circular Quay and through Botanical Gardens (check the closing time) down to Macquarie Chair.Best spot for photos of the Opera House - just west of the bridge - looking east.
Impressive views. Lovely way to start day if in Sydney and staying in area. Very peaceful early in morning (except for joggers on path) before workers start to arrive.
Very pleasant. Walked to Mrs Macquerie's seat from the Opera House. Stopped frequently to sit on the benches and absorb the sights. Great views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge!
relaxed spot. A nice walk along the water, but during mid-daytime maybe a bit to overcrowded.Go there around six o clock.
lack of coffeine. very relaxed area in the middle of the city, well kept but is lucking more refresment facilities- bring your water and dont suppose u will get a coffee after 4pm
Pretty walk along the water. Great views of Opera House, Water, Bridge, and Sydney Harbour! Sight seers dream!
Beautiful walk on a sunny day!. The garden is huge! Make sure you get a map and explore every trails - much to see!

Best to enjoy as an event!. The gardens are extensive and take too long to walk around... Is better to allow cyclists. It is lovely to enjoy best with start of international triathlon series, a wedding, an event which you can participate in ie BRW corporate triathlon... This is best day of the year. Might be nice to read a book and relax...Bring cash may not be eftpos facilities in cages... The art gallery is nice... May be expensive for special exhibit $25pp

Iconic Walk. Starting with the Opera House and then wending our way through the botanic garden to the Mitchell Library was one of the highlights of a day in Sydney. Especially amusing in the gardens was the brass plaque under a wattle tree with the words to the Monty Python song about the wattle engraved thereon - totally unexpected and very funny!
Beautiful!. I probably would have given it an excellent rating had there not been so much construction around the beginning of the walk. But it was beautiful.

Beautiful walk. Scenic and peaceful walk - something to do by self or with others. Pick up a brochure at the entrance near the opera house and explore. Don't miss the flying foxes - they are something to see!

Great place to relax with view. Two main attractions sitting right next to each other. Great.The veiw's great, very relaxing, easy to walk around. You can spend the whole day looking around and sit down and relax. Or, if you are a busy traveller, also to walk throgh to the art gallery via botanic garden which is also very nice.
The best walk in Sydney. Easily the best Sunday stroll in Sydney. Amazing views and gorgeous gardens. Great for wedding photos too. An absolute must see!

Take the Opera House tour. Yes, you can walk around the Opera House, stand on the steps, admire it from ferries, but nothing prepares you for the experience inside this iconic building. It would be good if the tour price was cheaper for families as I think many don't take the tour due to the cost...throughout Sydney it was tiresome that family passes were for 2 adults and 2 kids but kids were up to age 11 or 12; and many families have older school age, sometimes even uni age kids with them. I loved wandering around the Botanic Gardens. Kids and hubby tolerated for mum's pleasure although they did kinda enjoy having a photo at Mrs Macquarie's chair.
The quickest way from Kings Cross . . .. The quickest route from Kings Cross and also the most scenic. Its a win all round situation.
Excellent. Love to do it again! Missed the firework - best time to go - Christmas - New Year.

Dodge the joggers. A beautiful walk along the water front, but beware of the CBD workers who are so healthy they run through their dinner hours, often with their Personal Trainers. Impressive, but watch out!
what a nice walk on any day. Take time to enjoy this walk there are many ways to and fro to take.
Pretty walk. Easy walk for seniors like us, Lovely scenerary, good toilets. Lovely view of the harbour and bridge.
Beautiful gardens. The gardens were just beautiful. Make sure you look up in the trees, you'll be surprised by what you see.....
A must do. The Botanic gardens had surprises at every turn and as I aproached the Opera House I took a little gasp, it was magnificent. I went on the tour inside, well worth it
Beautiful. Not sure why this is it's own "Attraction" The Opera House butts up against the Gardens, there's nothing special about this "Walk"
5 minutes walk to the Opera through nice garden!. the walk, the opera house, the garden the hop on hop of tourist bus, the ferry to Manly.

Iconic must see. This iconic building is a must see of course, but take a tour and learn about the history of it's creator. The setting of course is undeniably fantastic and if you're lucky enough to go to a concert there, all the better.The gardens are a peaceful tranquil place amidst the hustle of the city, with bats hanging from the tree it will lead toy to Finger Wharf, the best place in my opinion for a meal.

Iconic must see. This iconic building is a must see of course, but take a tour and learn about the history of it's creator. The setting of course is undeniably fantastic and if you're lucky enough to go to a concert there, all the better.The gardens are a peaceful tranquil place amidst the hustle of the city, with bats hanging from the tree it will lead toy to Finger Wharf, the best place in my opinion for a meal.
Beauitful. I loved this walk, its such a calming beauitful walk around
A must do - nice combination of 2 attractions. Just do it and enjoy it. You'll see the ships passing by and a part of the army's base...
Best City Walk. Both ends of the walk are world famous and the walk between them is just as beautiful. many times I have taken magnificent photographs on this walk.

A fantastic walk. Allow plenty of time as you will want to visit Governers house and the coffee shop.The toilets are poorly marked so plan ahead as the only one we could find was about 1 kilometer form the Opera entrance

A must when in Sydney. Always a pleasure to take a stroll around the botanic gardens and approaching it from the Opera House entrance enables you to take the 'train' around the gardens. This is a great way to get your bearings and see where you wish to explore in depth. Try Mrs Macquarie's Chair for size, and a snack in the restaurant. A great way to spend a few hours.
Superb!. It is absolutely beautiful! If you like natural beauty, don't miss this.
Wear good Shoes. A very pleasant stroll, but allow a few hours. Do it at the beginning of the day when you are fresh, not at the end of a long touring day.
Spectacular. Even though they were doing work on the Opera House it didn't lose any of its appeal
The Spring Flowers were just beginning to bloom - beautiful hyacinths, tulips etc looked divine. Get out in the fresh air and enjoy the lovely Botanical Gardens regardless of the weather.
